hello.description: Open palm waved side to side at shoulder height

goodbye.description: Hand waved palm facing away from body

thank.description: Hand moves from chin outward toward recipient

please.description: Open palm circled on chest area

eat.description: Fingers bunched together, moved to mouth repeatedly

drink.description: C-hand shape moved to mouth, tilting motion

sleep.description: Hand placed beside tilted head, eyes closed gesture

help.description: Flat hand supports fist of other hand, lifting motion

go.description: Index finger points and moves away from body

sit.description: Two fingers bent, placed on flat hand representing sitting

stand.description: Two fingers straight up on flat palm

walk.description: Two hands alternating forward stepping motion

happy.description: Open hands move upward with bright facial expression

sad.description: Open hands move downward with sad facial expression

angry.description: Claw hands pull down from face with angry expression

today.description: Flat hands move downward together in front of body

tomorrow.description: Flat hand moves forward and down from body

big.description: Hands spread wide apart to show large size

buy.description: Hand motion representing exchange of money

friend.description: Index fingers hook together representing friendship

good.description: Thumbs up gesture with positive expression

house.description: Hands form roof shape over head

speak.description: Index finger moves from mouth outward

toilet.description: T-hand shape shaken at side of body

exercise.description: Fists alternating up and down, mimicking physical activity

strong.description: Strong flexing motion with both arms

muscle.description: Flexing bicep with opposite hand indicating muscle

weight.description: Both hands gripping and lifting heavy object

lift.description: Both hands gripping and lifting upward motion

stretch.description: Arms extending and stretching in various directions

breathe.description: Hand on chest with inhaling and exhaling motion

rest.description: Hands placed together beside head indicating rest

back.description: Hand reaching over shoulder to indicate back

cool.description: Hands fanning and slowing down motion

bike.description: Hands gripping handlebars with pedaling motion

food.description: Fingers bunched together moving to mouth, representing eating

many.description: Hands opening and closing repeatedly showing abundance

more.description: Fingertips of both hands brought together repeatedly

time.description: Index finger tapping on wrist indicating watch/time

a.description: (As a Noun) The letter A in the two-handed manual alphabet.

abattoir.description: (As a Noun) A place where animals are killed for their meat. English = abattoir.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To kill animals and then cut them up for their meat. English = slaughter.

reduction.description: (As a Noun) The process of making something smaller. English = reduction.; (As a Noun) A short account of something, which gives the main points but not the details. English = summary.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) A shortened form of a word or phrase, e.g., Dr for Doctor, cm for centimeter, PM for Prime Minister. English = abbreviation.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

stomach.description: (As a Noun) The organ inside your body where food is digested; or the front part of your body below your waist. English = stomach, belly. Informal English = tummy. Medical or scientific English = abdomen.

stay.description: (As a Noun) The act of continuing to be somewhere without moving away.; (As a Noun) The act of being in a place, not moving away, and not moving at all.; (As a Noun) The act of suddenly stopping any movement and remaining still in one place. Idiomatic English = freezing.

possibility.description: (As a Noun) The opportunity for something to happen and the likelihood that it might happen. English = possibility.; (As a Noun) The ability of something to become a particular kind of thing or to do something. English = potential.; (As a Noun) The quality or skill that makes it possible for you to do something. English = ability.

able.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the possibility, skill or permission to do something. English = (be) able.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb (usually before it) to mean that the person or thing you are talking about has the possibility, skill or permission to do it. English = can, could, able to, may.

disappearance.description: (General Definition) Of some thing or process, to no longer be able to be seen or be detected because it has either gone somewhere else or because it has ceased to exist entirely, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in a given context.; (As a Noun) The act of becoming unable to be seen or experienced by going somewhere else, by changing in some way, or by becoming smaller and smaller or less and less. English = disappearance, vanishing.; (As a Noun) The end of existence of things of a particular type, especially species of animals, after they have become less and less common. English = extinction.

abomination.description: (As a Noun) An event which is very unsuccessful or unpleasant, especially one that is unexpected and which causes a lot of damage or suffering. English = disaster.; (As a Noun) Especially in religious contexts, something that is completely unacceptable to members of the religion. English = abomination.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A situation or experience which is very serious and unpleasant. English = (be) terrible, (be) dreadful.

aborigine.description: (As a Noun) A person who belongs to the indigenous population of Australia. English = Aborigine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to the indigenous population of Australia. English = (be) aboriginal.

abortion.description: (As a Noun) The ending of a pregnancy so that the foetus dies. English = abortion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To force the foetus out of the womb so that the pregnancy is ended and the foetus dies. English = abort, have an abortion.

about.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be close to a particular number but not exactly that number. English = (be) about, (be) approximate.; (As Modifier) Used after many verbs (especially 'talk', 'write' and 'think') and before a noun to mean that the topic of the activity is the following noun. English = about, concerning.

about-turn.description: (As a Noun) A complete change in attitude or opinion. English = about-turn, about-face.; (As a Noun) A complete change in circumstances. English = turn-around.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To completely change your attitude or opinion about something.

above.description: (General Definition) An area or a flat extended object located above another flat object or level area, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially the floors in a multi-storey building.; (As a Noun) The floor above the one you are on or the one you are talking about; upstairs one floor.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located above something. English = (be) above.

overseas.description: (As a Noun) Any place which is not in Australia but in other countries. English = overseas.; (As a Noun) A person who comes from another country. English = foreigner, alien.; (As a Noun) In Tasmania, the large or main part of the country of Australia, in contrast to the island of Tasmania itself. English = the mainland.

abscess.description: (As a Noun) An ABSCESS is a painful swelling containing pus.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ABSCESS. If you know a sign for ABSCESS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

abscond.description: (As a Noun) A successful and complete escape from somewhere.; (As a Noun) The complete and successful removal or theft of something from somewhere.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To run away from a place successfully so that you disappear completely and cannot be found. Idiomatic English = escape into thin air. Formal English = abscond.

absence.description: (As a Noun) The fact that someone is not at a place. English = absence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be not at a place, to be not there. English = (be) absent.

forgetfulness.description: (As a Noun) The action or habit of often forgetting things. English = forgetfulness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To often forget things. English = (be) forgetful, (be) absent-minded.

real.description: (As a Noun) All the facts about something, rather than things that are imagined or invented. English = truth.; (As a Noun) A piece of information that is true. English = fact.; (As a Noun) The world around us as it is rather than the way someone imagines it to be. English = reality.

absolute%20value.description: (As a Noun) A symbol (|x|) used in mathematics. It consists of upright lines placed on either side of a number (here shown as ‘x’).; (As a Noun) In mathematics, the value of x regardless of whether it is positive or negative, e.g., +3 and -3 have the same absolute value, which is 3, written as |3|. The absolute value of any number may be thought of as its distance from zero. English = absolute value.

copy.description: (As a Noun) Something that is made to look exactly the same as something else. English = copy.; (As a Noun) The copying of someone else's actions or behaviour. English = mimicry, imitation.; (As a Noun) The copying of the work of another student in an exam. English = cheating.

summary.description: (As a Noun) A short account of something that gives the main points, but not the details. English = summary, outline.; (As a Noun) The summary of the contents of a book, article, or speech. English = abstract.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a brief account of something, giving the main points but not all the details. English = summarise, outline.

stupid.description: (As a Noun) Behaviour which is not at all sensible. English = stupidity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being stupid. English = stupidity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being very stupid. English = idiocy.

sufficiency.description: (As a Noun) The amount of something that is as much as you need or want, or is as much as is necessary. English = sufficiency, adequacy.; (As a Noun) [Often with stress and a 'negative' facial expression] an amount of something that is more than you need or is more than is necessary. English = excess.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be as much of something that you need or want or you feel is necessary. English = (be) enough, (be) sufficient, (be) adequate.

abuse.description: (As a Noun) The cruel and violent treatment of someone. English = abuse.; (As a Noun) A physical attack on a person. English = assault.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To treat someone cruelly and violently. English = abuse.

university.description: (As a Noun) An educational institution where students study for degrees and where academic research is done. English = university.; (As a Noun) A stiff black cap with a flat, square top and a tassel hanging from it. It is sometimes worn on formal occasions by university students and teachers. English = mortarboard.; (As a Noun) A person who has successfully completed a degree course and received a certificate that shows this. English = graduate.

accelerator.description: (As a Noun) The pedal on which you press with your foot in order to make a vehicle go faster. English = accelerator.; (As a Noun) Driving with one's foot on the accelerator; driving at high speed. English = speeding.; (As a Noun) In mathematics and physics, the rate at which the speed of an object is increasing. English = acceleration.

acceptance.description: (As a Noun) The taking of something you have been offered; the agreement to an idea or the decision to follow advice. English = acceptance.; (As a Noun) The process of no longer complaining about a difficult or unpleasant situation because you get used to it and because you recognise that it cannot be changed. English = acceptance, resignation.; (As a Noun) The quality of being generally approved of and allowed to happen. English = acceptability.

access.description: (As a Noun) The opportunity or right to use or see something or someone. English = access.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) The ability to get into or use a building or service, especially if you have a disability. English = accessibility.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To succeed in getting into a building or using your right to use or see something or someone. English = access.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

access%20request%20form%20(arf).description: (As a Noun) An ACCESS REQUEST FORM (ARF) is the standard expression for a type of form connected to the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), or the administration of the scheme by the National Disability Insurance Authority (NDIA). People fill out the form so that NDIA can identify if a person is eligible to become a participant.; (Note) The following is a suggested sign for  ‘access request form’.  Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

accident.description: (As a Noun) Something unpleasant and unfortunate that happens and that often lead to injury or death. English = accident.

fluke.description: (As a Noun) Something good that happens accidentally rather than because of someone's skill or plan. English = fluke.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something good, to happen accidentally rather than because of someone's skill or plan.; (As Modifier) Used next to a verb to mean the action happens without plan or without the aid of someone's skill. English = accidentally, by chance.

accident%20(vehicle).description: (General Definition) Of an object, to move forward until it encounters a barrier of some sort which causes it to stop, or any thing, action or state which can be easily extrapolated from this given an appropriate context. Cited without context, most signers will think this sign means a car hitting an obstacle.; (As a Noun) An event in which a moving car or other vehicle hits a surface and is badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash (car), smash (car), accident (car), collision (car).; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a car or other moving vehicle, to hit something and be badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash, smash, have an accident.

familiarity.description: (As a Noun) The knowledge and experience you have of something because you have seen it or done it before. English = familiarity.; (As a Noun) The comfort you feel with an extreme climate (or anything 'new') because you have now experienced it for a long time and it doesn't bother or surprise you any more. English = acclimatisation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be familiar with something because you have seen it or done it before. English = (be) used to.

accommodation.description: (As a Noun) A room or building to stay in or live in. English = accommodation.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) A house where people can stay cheaply for a short time. English = hostel.; (As a Noun) A pupil who lives at school during term time; a person who is accommodated temporarily in a private home.  English = boarder; billet.

agreement.description: (As a Noun) The same opinion or idea about something shared between two or more people. English = agreement.; (As a Noun) A set time two or more people formally decide to meet and do something, especially when connected with work. English = appointment.; (As a Noun) A formal agreement between two or more people or governments to do a particular thing or to help each other. English = pact, accord.

arithmetic.description: (As a Noun) The part of mathematics that is concerned with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of numbers. English = arithmetic.; (As a Noun) Simple calculations in arithmetic. English = sums.; (As a Noun) Particular amounts of something expressed as numbers that are written down. English = figures.

accredited%20course.description: (As a Noun) In education, a course that has been developed and approved at a national level to meet training needs that are not included in a training package ('TP').

accumulation.description: (As a Noun) The increase in the mass or amount of something, especially money. English = accumulation, increase.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a mass or an amount of something (especially money), to get bigger or larger. English = accumulate, increase.

accuracy%20(correctness).description: (As a Noun) The quality of being in accordance with the facts or having no mistakes. English = correctness, rightness, accuracy.; (As a Noun) The fixing of something to remove the mistakes or to make it in accordance with the facts. English = correction.; (As a Noun) The moral justification or legal permission to do something. English = right.

accuracy%20(precision).description: (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean. English = spotlessness.; (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean, or not mixed with anything else and containing no harmful substances. English = purity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being easy to understand, see or hear, or of being obvious and impossible to be mistaken about. English = clarity.

accurate%20(correct).description: (As a Noun) The quality of being in accordance with the facts or having no mistakes. English = correctness, rightness, accuracy.; (As a Noun) The fixing of something to remove the mistakes or to make it in accordance with the facts. English = correction.; (As a Noun) The moral justification or legal permission to do something. English = right.

accurate%20(precise).description: (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean. English = spotlessness.; (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean, or not mixed with anything else and containing no harmful substances. English = purity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being easy to understand, see or hear, or of being obvious and impossible to be mistaken about. English = clarity.

blame.description: (As a Noun) The claim that someone is responsible for something bad happening. English = blame, accusation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say that someone is responsible for something bad happening. English = blame, accuse.

ache.description: (As a Noun) A dull steady pain in some part of your body. English = ache.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a dull steady pain in some part of your body. English = ache.

winner.description: (As a Noun) The person who wins a prize, race or competition. English = winner, victor.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To defeat the person or group you are fighting, playing against or arguing with. English = win, (be) victorious.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To succeed in doing something or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort. English = achieve.

success.description: (As a Noun) The act of doing something, or causing it to happen, especially after a lot of effort. English = success, achievement, victory; (As a Noun) The person who defeats or beats other people in a race or competition of some sort. English = winner, victor.; (As a Noun) Someone who does well at things. English = achiever.

recognition.description: (As a Noun) The experience of recognising someone or something. English = recognition, acknowledgment.; (As a Noun) The recognition of someone's work or effort and the expression of appreciation, gratitude or thanks for it. English = acknowledgment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To know who or what someone or something is because you have seen or heard about them before or because someone has described them to you. English = recognise.

acne.description: (As a Noun) A condition in which you have a lot of spots on your face and neck. It is common among teenagers. English = acne.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have acne.

experience.description: (As a Noun) Something that happens to you that you can feel physically but which has a particularly important psychological or intellectual impact. English = experience.; (As a Noun) Things that have happened to you or that you have done before in your life. English = experiences.; (As a Noun) The learning of a skill by watching and doing, especially  learning to speak or sign a language by being exposed and immersed in it as a child. English = acquisition.

acronym.description: (As a Noun) A word made from the first letters of the words in a phrase, especially when this is used as a name; eg. WHO (World Health Organisation). English = acronym.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term ACRONYM. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ACRONYM (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for ACRONYM used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

across.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move or travel from one side of a thing to the other side of a thing. English = go across, cross.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move or travel over something in a vehicle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go over something in a vehicle, especially a car, which you are not meant to drive over (such as a person or an animal). English = run over.

actor.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job is performing in plays or films. English = actor.; (As a Noun) The job of performing in plays or films. English = acting.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play the part of a character in a play or film. English = act, perform.

busy.description: (As a Noun) A situation in which lots of things are happening or being done. English = activity, action.; (As a Noun) Something that you do on a particular occasion. English = action.; (As a Noun) All the important and exciting things that happen in a situation, especially in a film. English = action.

activity.description: (As a Noun) A situation in which a lot of things are happening or being done. English = activity.; (As a Noun) Something that you spend time doing. English = activity.; (As a Noun) The things that a group does in order to achieve their aims, especially as part of a learning exercise. English = activity.

promise.description: (As a Noun) A statement which you make to someone in which you say that you will definitely do something or give them something. You believe this statement to be true. English = promise.; (As a Noun) The making of a true statement, particularly after having said things that were not true or at least not the whole truth. English = admission.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say to someone that you will definitely do something and that you are telling the truth when you say so. English = promise.

acupuncture.description: (General Definition) The action of being pinched or pricked with something small repeatedly and in different places, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly related to this, especially acupuncture.; (As a Noun) The treatment of a person's illness or pain by sticking small needles into their body. English = acupuncture.

acute.description: (As Modifier) An ACUTE illness is one that becomes severe very quickly but does not last very long.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ACUTE. If you know a sign for ACUTE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

change.description: (As a Noun) The act of becoming different. English = change.; (As a Noun) The act of making something be different. English = change, alteration, modification.; (As a Noun) A different set of clothes that you take with you in case you need to take off the clothes you are wearing and put them on.

addition.description: (As a Noun) Something which as been put in the same place as another thing; an extra amount of something. English = addition.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put something in the same place as another thing. English = add.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a thing, person or amount which is added to others of the same kind, often when it is not really needed. English = (be) extra, (be) additional.

habit.description: (As a Noun) Something you do often and regularly. English = habit.; (As a Noun) An action that someone has done many times before and finds difficult to stop, especially when this action is considered to be bad. English = habit.; (As a Noun) The condition of taking harmful drugs and being unable to stop taking them. English = addiction.

address.description: (As a Noun) The number of the house, the name of the street, and the town where you live or work. English = address.; (As a Noun) On a letter, envelope, or parcel to be posted, the writing on the front that says where it should go. English = address.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To write the destination on a letter, envelope, or parcel. English = address.

add%20up.description: (As a Noun) The number you get when you add several numbers together. English = total.; (As a Noun) An amount of money. English = sum.; (As a Noun) A simple calculation in arithmetic. English = sum.

adelaide.description: (As a Noun) A city in southern Australia, the capital of the state of South Australia, called Adelaide.

adenoids.description: (As a Noun) ADENOIDS are enlarged lymph nodes between throat and back of nose, can block nose, make it hard to breathe and speak.  This happens in children more than adults.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ADENOIDS. If you know a sign for ADENOIDS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

glue.description: (As a Noun) A sticky substance used for joining things together, especially one that needs to be licked first. English = glue, paste, adhesive.; (As a Noun) A small piece of paper or plastic, with writing or a picture on one side, which you can stick onto a surface. English = sticker, label.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To attach something to something else by using glue or another sticky substance, especially one that you lick first. English = stick, adhere, paste, glue.

follow.description: (As a Noun) The act of following closely behind someone.; (As a Noun) A person who supports the beliefs of another person. English = follower, adherent, disciple.; (As a Noun) The followers of Jesus Christ who went from place to place telling people about him and trying to persuade them to become Christians. English = apostle.

adhesive%20tape.description: (As a Noun) Sticky strips of plastic which you use for sticking things together. English = tape, adhesive tape.; (As a Noun) A strip of sticky material used for covering small cuts or sores on your body. English = band-aid. British English = plaster.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use sticky strips of plastic to stick things together. English = apply adhesive tape.

adjective.description: (As a Noun) A word or sign that is used to modify a noun, e.g.,  clever person, blue sky. English = adjective.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term ADJECTIVE. There is no commonly used Auslan sign for ADJECTIVE, some signers use the lexicalized fingerspelling shown in the video on the left, some signers use depicting signs once the topic is established. If you know a sign for ADJECTIVE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) Please go to "Reprt missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

postponement.description: (As a Noun) The act of arranging for an event to take place at a later time than was originally planned. English = postponement. Formal English = adjournment, deferment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To arrange for an event to take place at a later time than was originally planned. English = postpone, put off. Formal English = adjourn, defer.

ad%20lib.description: (As a Noun) A story or idea which is made up and not true. Its purpose is often dishonest. It is like a lie but it is not as bad or as serious. English = invention, concoction, contrivance.; (As a Noun) A situation or event that you think about or imagine, although it is unlikely to happen or be true. English = fantasy, make believe.; (As a Noun) A story or stories about imaginary people and events, especially when written down in books. English = fiction.

control.description: (As a Noun) The power and authority to do what you want or to make all the important decisions about how something is run; the ability to make something behave exactly as you want. English = control.; (As a Noun) Control you exercise over the direction that someone or something goes, especially horses. English = steering.; (As a Noun) A committee established to oversee the progress and direction of a project team. English = steering committee.

admission.description: (As a Noun) The recognition of an error or a mistake.; (As a Noun) The acknowledgment of an error or mistake, particularly when you are in the wrong. English = admission.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To recognise an error or mistake.

admit%20(let%20in).description: (As a Noun) A person who works in a cinema or theatre who shows people where to sit. English = usher (male or female), usherette (female only).; (As a Noun) Someone who is staying in your home or is at an occasion because you have invited them. English = guest.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To politely show someone where they should go often with a wave of the hand and letting them walk slightly in front of you. English = usher.

warning.description: (As a Noun) Something which is said, written or signed to tell people of a possible danger, problem, or other unpleasant thing that might happen. English = warning, caution.; (As a Noun) Stern or angry words or signs communicated to someone, particularly a child, because they have done something wrong or ignored an earlier warning. English = scolding.; (As a Noun) A warning or rebuke about someone's behaviour. Formal English = admonition.

adopt.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a child into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter. English = adopt (a child).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To eagerly take over something and make it your own because you want it or like it. English = seize upon, adopt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To grab onto something and keep it for yourself or close to yourself because you want it or like it.

adoption.description: (As a Noun) The process by which a child is taken into a family to which it is not biologically related and legally made a son or daughter of that family. English = adoption.; (As a Noun) A child who has been taken into a family to which it is not biologically related and legally made a son or daughter.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a child into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter. English = adopt.

adoration.description: (As a Noun) Something to which your interest and preference is usually directed; a thing of a particular type that you like most or best; a favourite thing.; (As a Noun) A feeling of love and admiration towards someone. English = adoration.; (As a Noun) Thoughts about someone or something you have all the time without being able to stop, or any actions or behaviour you cannot stop or control. English = obsession.

adult.description: (As a Noun) A mature, fully developed person who is no longer a child. English = adult.

affair.description: (As a Noun) A secret sexual relationship between two people who are not married to each other. English = affair.; (As a Noun) Of a married person, the act of having sex with someone that you are not married to. English = adultery. Formal English = fornication.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an affair.

adults.description: (As a Noun) People who are no longer children. English = adults.

advanced.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be at a level of study or skill where you already know the basic facts or techniques and are now doing more difficult work. English = (be) advanced.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go or move beyond the basic level in learning something or acquiring a skill. English = advance.

advantage.description: (As a Noun) Something that puts you in a better position than other people, or is likely to improve a situation. English = advantage, benefit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that gives or suggests the answer 'yes'. English = (be) positive.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To consider only the advantages and good aspects of a situation, rather than the disadvantages and bad aspects. English = (be) positive.

inequality.description: (As a Noun) The difference in size or amount of two or more things. English = inequality.; (As a Noun) The difference in social status, wealth, or opportunity between groups in a society. English = inequality.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two or more things, to be different in size, strength, or ability with each having more or less of one quality than the others. English = (be) unequal.

advantage%20(tennis).description: (As a Noun) In tennis, the first point scored after deuce, or the resulting state of the score. English = advantage.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In tennis, to score the first point after deuce.

advent.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something important, especially religious, to start or come into view, place or existence, especially from heaven to Earth. Formal English = advent.

adverb.description: (As a Noun) In grammar, an ADVERB is a type of word which modifies a verb, adding information about the action described by the verb, e.g., walk slowly, eat quickly.

advertisement.description: (As a Noun) An announcement in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster about something such as a product, event, or job vacancy. English = advertisement, commercial.; (As a Noun) Information or actions intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something. English = publicity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell people about something such as a product, an event, or a job, in newspapers, on television, or on posters in order to encourage them to buy the product. English = advertise.

counsellor.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job it is to give advice to people who need it. English = counsellor.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) The advice and help you receive from a counsellor, or the activity of giving people advice as part of your job. English = counselling.; (As a Noun) The information you give people when you tell them what you think they should do. English = advice.

advocate.description: (As a Noun) A person who publicly supports a particular action or plan, often on behalf of other people. English = advocate.; (As a Noun) The action of publicly supporting a particular action or plan, often on behalf of other people. English = advocacy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To support a particular action or plan publicly, often on behalf of other people. English = advocate.

exercise (physical).description: (As a Noun) Energetic movements which you do in order to become fit or remain healthy. English = exercise.; (As a Noun) Simple exercises that you do to keep fit and healthy. English = callisthenics.; (As a Noun) A form of exercise which increases the amount of oxygen in your blood, and which strengthens your heart and lungs. English = aerobics.

airplane.description: (As a Noun) A vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air. English = airplane, aeroplane, plane, aircraft, jet.; (As a Noun) A journey made by flying in an aeroplane. English = flight.; (As a Noun) The part of a country's military organisation that is concerned with fighting in the air. English = air force.

spray.description: (As a Noun) A liquid kept under pressure in a can or other container, which you can force out in very small drops. English = spray.; (As a Noun) A small can in which a liquid is kept under pressure. English = spray can,  aerosol.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a spray can or an aerosol. English = spray.

connection.description: (As a Noun) The thing that joins two things or people. English = connection, link.; (As a Noun) Of one group, a close connection with another group or close involvement with it. English = affiliation.; (As a Noun) A lock which is used for fastening two things or two parts of something together. It consists of a block of metal with a U-shaped bar attached to it. One end of the bar is released when it is unlocked with a key. English = padlock.

nod.description: (As a Noun) A statement in which you say something is true, usually by moving your head up an down. English = nod.; (As a Noun) A statement in which you say something is true, especially when it has been claimed to be not true of you. English = affirmation.; (As a Noun) The saying of yes to an offer. English = acceptance.

style.description: (As a Noun) The quality of being smart and elegant, or being sophisticated. English = style, class. sophistication.; (As a Noun) The state of having a lot of money and a high standard of living. English = affluence.; (As a Noun) The quality you have when people admire you because of your position in society or the high quality of your work. English = prestige.

riches.description: (As a Noun) Valuable possessions or large amounts of money. English = riches, wealth.; (As a Noun) A very large amount of money. English = fortune.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a lot of money or a lot of possessions. English = (be) rich, (be) wealthy, (be) well-off, (be) affluent.

afford.description: (As a Noun) The money you pay for a journey in a taxi, train, bus or aeroplane. English = fare.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give someone an amount of money, because you are buying something from them, or because you owe it to them. English = pay, pay for.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have enough money to be able to pay for something. English = afford.

afl%20(australian%20football%20league).description: (As a Noun) A team ball game played in Australia, called Australian rules football (AFL).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To prepare to kick or pass a ball in Australian rules football.

fear.description: (As a Noun) The feeling you have when you are worried and nervous about something, especially because you think it will harm you or do something very unpleasant. English = fear.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) A sudden feeling of fear. English = fright.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be worried and nervous about something, especially because you think it will harm you or do something very unpleasant. English = (be) scared, (be) frightened, (be) afraid; fear something.

africa.description: (As a Noun) A large continent south of Europe and south west of Asia. English = Africa.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be from or relate to Africa. English = (be) African.

after.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action happens during a period of time that follows the time of speaking or some other reference time. English = after.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning (or end) of a sentence to mean that the event of the sentence happens after an event or time that has already been described. English = afterwards.

cloud (dust).description: (As a Noun) A cloud of dust or steam caused by energetic activity. Often portrayed in cartoons with a drawing of a cloud of dust and a speech bubble with the word ‘kaboom!’ in it. English = dust cloud.; (As a Noun) A cloud of dust, steam or smoke caused by some activity, often with machines. English = cloud (dust), cloud (steam), cloud (smoke).; (As a Noun) Informal Auslan, good feelings remaining after a pleasurable or successful experience, especially having sex. English = afterglow.

afternoon.description: (As a Noun) The part of each day that begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock. English = afternoon.; (Note) You can use two signs to say ‘Good afternoon’: fist sign ‘good’, then sign ‘afternoon’.

since.description: (As Modifier) Used to modify a verb or sentence to mean that the action begins at the present time (or a time which is understood) and continues into the future (or after that time). English =  since, subsequently, afterwards, henceforth, thereafter.; (As Modifier) Used next to a time sign to mean from that time and into the future from that time. English = since, subsequently, afterwards, henceforth, thereafter.

after%20you.description: (Interactive) Used alone to mean to the person it is directed at that you think they are next to do something, when you are both waiting to do the same thing, but that you are after them. English = 'I'm after you!', 'You then me!'

again.description: (As a Noun) A performance of an act multiple times. English = repetition.; (As a Noun) The act of reading or studying something again in order to remember it better or learn it more thoroughly. English = revision, review.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do an action again. English = repeat.

against.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be in competition with another team. English = (be) against, versus.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To disagree with an idea, policy or system. English = (be) against, (be) opposed to, (be) in opposition to.

agape.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your mouth open very wide, often because you are very surprised by something. English = (be) agape, (be) flabbergasted.; (Interactive) Used alone to express your complete surprise at something happening.

age.description: (As a Noun) The period of time during which a person is old. English = old age.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person or thing, to become old. English = age.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to have lived for many years and to be no longer young. English = (be) old, (be) aged, (be) senior.

organisation.description: (As a Noun) 1. A group of people who do something together regularly in an organised way. English = organisation.; (As a Noun) A business or government organisation providing a specific service. English = agency×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) 1. Of skills, systems and techniques, to relate to organisations. English = (be) organisational.

agenda.description: (As a Noun) A list of the items that have to be discussed at a meeting. English = agenda.; (As a Noun) A number of events or things that come one after another in a particular way or at a particular time. English = sequence, order.; (As a Noun) Instructions for preparing any type of food. A recipe will have a list of ingredients, and describe the steps to prepare and combine them. English = recipe.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

ages.description: (Interactive) Used alone on meeting people to mean it has been a long time since you saw them last. English = 'I haven't seen you for ages!', 'It's been ages!', and so on.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action did not begin at the present time (or a time which is understood) and does not extend into the future (or after that time). English =  not since.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a time sign to mean the something will not happen from that time and into the future from that time. English = not since.

aggressive.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Someone is AGGRESSIVE if they behave angrily or violently toward other people.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term AGGRESSIVE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for AGGRESSIVE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for AGGRESSIVE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

past.description: (As a Noun) The period of time before the present. English = past.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go back in time to the past.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To belong to the past and no longer the present. English = former.

ago%20(long%20ago).description: (As a Noun) The side or part of something that is towards the rear or farthest from the front. It is normally not used or seen as much as the front. English = back.; (As a Noun) Thinking of the future as a time which is in front of you, used to point to that period of time which is before the present and thus ‘behind’ you. English = past.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in a direction which is the opposite direction to the one in which you normally face or in which you normally go when walking or driving. English = go backwards, back up, reverse.

suffer.description: (As a Noun) Serious pain which someone feels in their body or in their mind. English = suffering, torment.; (As a Noun) Great physical or mental pain. English = agony.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel serious pain in your body or in your mind. English = suffer, (be) tormented.

saccharine.description: (As a Noun) The taste of food or drink that contains an extreme amount of sugar, but is pleasant.; (As a Noun) The taste of food or drink that contains an extreme amount of sugar so that it is unpleasant. English = saccharine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the taste of food or drink that contains an extreme amount of sugar, but is pleasant. English = (be) very sweet.

ahead.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located in front of something else. English = (be) ahead.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move or go in front of something else; to go ahead of something else.

ahh.description: (Interactive) Used to acknowledge or draw attention to something, or to express surprise or disappointment. English = ahh

support.description: (As a Noun) The agreement you have with someone and the help you might give them; the money and things you give to someone to help them do something. English = support, backing.; (As a Noun) Things added to something else to make it stronger, especially soldiers which are sent to join an army in order to make it stronger. English = reinforcement, reinforcements.; (As a Noun) Money, equipment, or services that are provided to people in need. English = aid, assistance.

aim.description: (As a Noun) The clear idea of what you will do and the final result you want. English = aim, intention, objective, purpose.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) The place you are travelling to where you want to end your journey at. English = destination.; (As a Noun) A lot of time and effort you give to something because you believe in it or you think it is important. English = commitment, dedication.

aim%20(arrow).description: (As a Noun) A weapon for shooting arrows, consisting of a long piece of wood bent into a curve by a string attached to both its ends. English = bow.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To draw an arrow back in a bow ready to fire it.

air.description: (As a Noun) The mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe. English = air.; (As a Noun) Fresh air which has been allowed into a room or building, e.g., by open windows. English = ventilation.; (As a Noun) The layer of air or other gases around a planet. English = atmosphere.

air-conditioning.description: (As a Noun) A method of providing a building, room or vehicle with cool dry air. English = air-conditioning.; (As a Noun) A machine which keeps the air cool and dry in a room, building or vehicle. English = air-conditioner.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a room, building or vehicle, to be supplied with air which is cool and dry by means of a special machine called an air-conditioner. English = (be) air-conditioned.

air%20filter.description: (As a Noun) A device in a car for removing dust from the air going into an engine in order to protect the engine from damage. English = air filter.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for AIR FILTER for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for AIR FILTER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.; (Note) This suggested sign is a compound of AIR + FILTER + RADIATOR. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

air%20force.description: (As a Noun) A vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air. English = airplane, aeroplane, plane, aircraft, jet.; (As a Noun) A journey made by flying in an aeroplane. English = flight.; (As a Noun) The part of a country's military organisation that is concerned with fighting in the air. English = air force.

flight attendant.description: (As a Noun) A person who works on an aeroplane and who looks after the passengers, serving them food and drink, and helping them when they need it. English = flight attendant, flight steward, air-hostess.; (As a Noun) A type of tapered cap, commonly worn by female flight attendants (air-hostesses) in the past.

airport.description: (As a Noun) A place where aircraft land and take off, usually with a lot of buildings and facilities. English = airport.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an aeroplane, to move slowly along the runway before taking off or after landing. English = taxi.

wind (air).description: (As a Noun) A current of air moving across the earth's surface which you can feel blowing past your body, especially your face. English = wind.; (As a Noun) A gentle wind. English = breeze.; (As a Noun) A gust of wind.

bell.description: (As a Noun) A hollow metal object shaped like a cup which has a piece hanging inside it that hits the sides and makes a sound. English = bell.; (As a Noun) A device that makes a ringing sound and is used to give a signal or to attract people's attention. English = bell.; (As a Noun) An automatic device which warns you of danger, for example by ringing a bell. English = alarm.

alarm%20bell.description: (As a Noun) An automatic device that warns you of danger, for example by ringing a bell. English = alarm, alarm bell.; (As a Noun) A type of clock with a mechanism that can be set to ring, vibrate or flash a light at a certain time. Used for waking a person up. English = alarm clock×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an alarm, to make a loud noise by ringing (or by any other means) in order to warn people of some danger.

alarm%20clock%20(flashing).description: (As a Noun) A lamp attached to any device, such as a door-bell, alarm clock, or a machine, that you can set to flash to get your attention it it rings or if something happens. English = flashing alarm.; (As a Noun) A type of clock with a mechanism that can be set to ring, vibrate or flash a light at a certain time. Used for waking a person up. English = flashing alarm clock.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

alarm%20clock%20(ringing).description: (As a Noun) A hollow metal object shaped like a cup which has a piece hanging inside it that hits the sides and makes a sound. English = bell.; (As a Noun) A device that makes a ringing sound and is used to give a signal or to attract people's attention. English = bell.; (As a Noun) An automatic device which warns you of danger, for example by ringing a bell. English = alarm.

alarm%20clock%20(vibrating).description: (As a Noun) A type of clock with a mechanism that can be set to vibrate and flash a light at a certain time, especially to wake someone up. English = vibrating alarm clock.

alarm%20(flashing).description: (As a Noun) A lamp attached to any device, such as a door-bell, alarm clock, or a machine, that you can set to flash to get your attention it it rings or if something happens. English = flashing alarm.; (As a Noun) A type of clock with a mechanism that can be set to ring, vibrate or flash a light at a certain time. Used for waking a person up. English = flashing alarm clock.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

alarm%20(ringing).description: (As a Noun) An automatic device that warns you of danger, for example by ringing a bell. English = alarm, alarm bell.; (As a Noun) A type of clock with a mechanism that can be set to ring, vibrate or flash a light at a certain time. Used for waking a person up. English = alarm clock×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an alarm, to make a loud noise by ringing (or by any other means) in order to warn people of some danger.

alarm%20(siren).description: (As a Noun) A warning device which consists of a rapidly rotating and flashing light (usually red) attached inside buildings onto ceilings or walls, or on the top of emergency vehicles (fire, police, etc). It lights and spins when there is an alarm. English = visual alarm.; (As a Noun) A warning device which consists of a rapidly rotating and flashing light (usually red) and a long, loud, wailing noise. It is usually located on the top of emergency vehicles (fire, police, etc). English = siren.; (As a Noun) A warning device that makes a long, loud, wailing noise when there is an alarm. English = siren.

alcohol.description: (As a Noun) Drink such as beer, wine, and whisky that can make people drunk. English = alcohol.

alcoholic.description: (As a Noun) A person who is addicted to alcohol and continues drinking even though it makes them ill. English = alcoholic.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

alertness.description: (As a Noun) The state of being fully aware of something, or to be paying full attention to what is happening. English = alertness.; (As a Noun) A feeling of great surprise about something. English = astonishment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be fully aware of something, or to be paying full attention to what is happening. English = (be) alert, (be) wide-awake.

algebra.description: (As a Noun) A type of mathematics in which letters are used to represent possible quantities. English = algebra.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe something which is related to or involves algebra. English = algebraic.

get off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move off something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get off, step off, get out. Formal English = alight.

sameness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of two or more things, qualities, quantities or actions being exactly alike in some way. English = sameness, likeness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) For two or more things, qualities, quantities or actions to be exactly alike in some way. English = (be) the same, (be) alike.; (As a Verb or Adjective) For two things, qualities, quantities or actions to be exactly alike in some way. The sign is put between two nouns. English = (be) the same as, (be) like.

survivors.description: (As a Noun) Animals or humans who are still alive, as opposed to those who are now dead, e.g., after an illness, an accident or a disaster. English = the living, survivors.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something that is animate, to be living and not dead when you think it might have died (illness, accident, disaster). English = (be) alive, (be) living, survive.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something that is animate, to be living and not dead when you thought it was not a living thing at all, like an insect that looks like a twig. English = (be) alive, (be) living.

all.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be each and every one of a particular group, or to be the whole part of a particular thing. English = (be) all, (be) all of, (be) the whole of, (be) every, (be) every one of.

competition.description: (As a Noun) A situation in which two or more people, groups, organisations or businesses are trying to get something which not everyone can have. English = competition, rivalry.; (As a Noun) Someone you are competing with. English = competitor, rival.; (As a Noun) In a game or competition, the person who is playing against you; in politics, the political group or party that is not part of the government. English = opponent, opposition; opposition.

all%20(even).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To get one's revenge. Idiomatic English = get even.; (As a Verb or Adjective) When scoring the competitors or teams in a game, competition or match, to have one point each. English = (be) one all.; (Interactive) Used alone to express your pleasure at the fact that you have harmed or annoyed someone who has harmed or annoyed you. English = 'Now we're even!'

crocodile.description: (As a Noun) A large reptile with a long body, sharp teeth and big jaws. It lives in rivers and eats meat. English = crocodile.; (As a Noun) An animal similar to a crocodile that lives mainly in the southern United States. English = alligator.

all%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a team of players in cricket, for all the team members to be finished and out of the game. English = (be) all out.

permission.description: (As a Noun) Approval from someone to say that something can happen or that you can do something. English = permission.; (As a Noun) A piece of paper that gives you permission to do something. English = permit.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) Official power to approve something or the approval itself. English = authority.

all%20together.description: (As a Noun) A group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and their children. English = family.; (As Modifier) Of all things or people, to be in one place at one time; or of different actions or events, to take place all at one time. English = all together.; (As Modifier) Used between a verb sign and a following noun sign to mean that the action was done in the company of or by the means of that thing or person. English = together with.

almost.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that though the action expressed by the verb has not yet happened it certainly will begin before much more time has passed. English = soon.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action or state expressed by the verb is not complete, exact or total, or comes close to happening but does not quite happen or happen successfully. English = almost, nearly.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to an adjective to mean that the quality, condition or state expressed by the adjective is not complete, exact or total. English = almost, nearly.

alone.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb sign to mean the action was performed by one person alone, without any help or companionship. English = all alone, by oneself.

aloof.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stop doing something, especially being a member or participant in some organisation or activity. English = quit, withdraw, resign. Idiomatic English = drop out, pull out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not become involved in something. English = stay aloof, keep aloof, remain aloof.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To like to be alone and not talk much to other people. English = (be) aloof.

alpha.description: (As a Noun) The first letter of the Greek alphabet, written α in lower case, called “alpha”. It is used as a symbol in mathematics and scientific notation, often to mean to first in a series of items or categories. English = alpha.

alphabet.description: (As a Noun) The set of letters arranged in a fixed order which is used for writing the words of a language. English = alphabet.

already.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have prepared yourself or to have been prepared for something. English = (be) ready.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of fruit, to be fully grown and ready to eat. English = (be) ripe.; (As Modifier) Used to describe something that has happened before the present time, and which does not need to happen again, or which has happened earlier than you expected. English = already.

alright.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be satisfactory or acceptable. English = (be) alright, (be) all right, (be) fine, (be) okay.; (Interactive) Used alone to agree with someone. English = 'Yeah!', 'Alright!'

alsatian%20(dog).description: (As a Noun) A large, usually fierce dog that is often used to guard buildings or used by the police to help them find criminals. English = Alsatian, German shepherd.

also.description: (As a Noun) The second of two things; the second of a pair.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a signed sentence or next to a verb (action) sign to mean you want to say one more thing (which you then say) or that the action is the second of a pair of actions. English = also, in addition.

altar.description: (As a Noun) A holy table in a church or temple. English = altar.

alterations%20(clothing).description: (As a Noun) Changes made to an item of clothing (knitted or sewn) that involve taking the stitching apart in places and then rejoining it. English = alterations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make modifications to clothing (knitted or sewn) by taking the stitching apart in places and then by rejoining it. English = alter, make modifications.

alter%20(clothing).description: (As a Noun) Changes made to an item of clothing (knitted or sewn) that involve taking the stitching apart in places and then rejoining it. English = alterations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make modifications to clothing (knitted or sewn) by taking the stitching apart in places and then by rejoining it. English = alter, make modifications.

alternate.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) For one thing to regularly occur after the other. English = alternate.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To regularly do or use one thing and then the other. English = alternate.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of weather, to be likely to change many times from fair to foul. English = (be) changeable.

hold on (wait).description: (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone to stop doing something (which usually involves trying to get your attention) and to wait until you are ready to attend to them. English = 'Hold on!', 'Hang on!', 'Wait a sec!' and so on.; (As Modifier) Used to introduce a statement which contrasts with what you have just said. English = but, yet, though, although.; (As Modifier) Used alone to show the person you are talking to that you are thinking and about to say something. English = umm, err.

all together.description: (As a Noun) A group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and their children. English = family.; (As Modifier) Of all things or people, to be in one place at one time; or of different actions or events, to take place all at one time. English = all together.; (As Modifier) Used between a verb sign and a following noun sign to mean that the action was done in the company of or by the means of that thing or person. English = together with.

every.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence or next to a verb to mean that the action takes place all the time or on every possible occasion. English = always.; (As Modifier) Used immediately before a sign for any period of time. Together both signs are placed at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action in that sentence happens at all of the periods of time named. English = every (day, week, year, etc.).

alzheimer's.description: (As a Noun) ALZHEIMER'S is brain disorder that gives a person dementia (i.e. the person forgets lots of things, gets confused, angry etc.).; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ALZHEIMER'S. If you know a sign for ALZHEIMER'S used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

amateur.description: (As a Noun) Someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job. English = amateur.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be done as part of a hobby and not as a job. English = (be) amateur.

interest.description: (As a Noun) The desire you have to want to learn more about something; the attraction someone or something has for you because it is exciting or unusual. English = interest.; (As a Noun) The knowledge you have about the existence of something; the realisation that something is present or happening. English = awareness.; (As a Noun) What you feel when something surprises you very much. English = amazement.

amazing%20(exclamation).description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean you are amazed and disbelieving of what you have been told. English = 'Incredible!', 'Amazing!', 'Well, I'll be damned!', and so on.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean you are amazed at what has been said or done and that you think it stupid or foolish. English = 'Ridiculous!', 'Really?!', 'How could you (do that)?!', 'How dare you (do that)?!'

intention.description: (As a Noun) Something you plan or hope to achieve. English = aim, goal, objective, ambition.; (As a Noun) Something which you decide and plan to do. English = intention.; (As a Noun) The very strong desire to achieve or do something in your life. English = ambition.

amble%20(animal).description: (General Definition) The feet of an animal or the action of stepping forward using these feet, or any thing, any animal or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, especially a tiger.; (As a Noun) The foot or feet of an animal having claws and pads. English = paw, paws.; (As a Noun) A large, fierce animal that belongs to the cat family. They are orange-coloured with black stripes. English = tiger.

ambulance.description: (As a Noun) A vehicle for taking people to or from hospital. English = ambulance.; (As a Noun) An alarm or siren, usually attached to the top of a vehicle, that consists of a rotating and/or flashing light, with or without an audible alarm.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a visual alarm or siren, especially one on top of a vehicle such as an ambulance, to rotate and flash.

attack.description: (As a Noun) The situation in which someone tries to hurt or get power over someone else by using physical violence. English = attack.; (As a Noun) The situation in which a number of people attack a single person.; (As a Noun) The situation in which one group of people attacks another person or group of people after hiding and waiting for them. English = ambush.

amen.description: (Interactive) This sign is used by Christians at the end of a prayer. English = 'Amen.' [This is a temporary video. It will be replaced soon.]

amendments.description: (As a Noun) Changes made to something that has been written or said, especially the minutes or motions of a meeting. English = amendments.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make changes to something that has been written or said, especially the minutes or motions of a meeting. English = amend.

american%20indian.description: (As a Noun) A member of one of the tribes of people who were living in North America when Europeans arrived there. Informal English = Indian, red Indian. English = Native American. Formal English = Amerindian.

american%20(usa).description: (As a Noun) A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico. English = the United States of America (USA), America.; (As a Noun) A person who come from the United States of America. English = American.; (As a Verb or Adjective) 2. To belong, relate to or come from the United States of America. English = (be) American.

americas%20(north%20and%20south%20americ.description: (As a Noun) The continents located between the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, called North and South America, or simply The Americas.

america%20(usa).description: (As a Noun) A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico. English = the United States of America (USA), America.; (As a Noun) A person who come from the United States of America. English = American.; (As a Verb or Adjective) 2. To belong, relate to or come from the United States of America. English = (be) American.

amerindian.description: (As a Noun) A member of one of the tribes of people who were living in North America when Europeans arrived there. Informal English = Indian, red Indian. English = Native American. Formal English = Amerindian.

amnesia.description: (As a Noun) A partial or complete loss of memory. English = amnesia.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have no memory of an event when you or others think that you should remember.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not know about something or to be unaware of something through inattention.

in.description: (As a Noun) The side of a place, building, object or container where you are surrounded by it. You often get there by passing through an opening designed for this purpose. English = inside.; (As a Noun) An opening in an object or building which allows you to go from outside to inside and vice versa. English = entrance, entry.; (As a Noun) The things which are located inside an object. English = insides, contents.

amphetamine.description: (As a Noun) An illegal recreational drug which increases people's energy, makes them excited, and reduces their appetite. English = amphetamine. Informal English = speed.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take amphetamines through the nose.

amputation.description: (As a Noun) The removal by cutting, usually by a surgeon, of part or all of a limb (arm or leg). English = amputation.; (As a Noun) A person who has had part or all of a limb removed by having it cut off. English = amputee.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut off part or all of a limb (arm or leg). English = amputate.

amsterdam.description: (As a Noun) The capital city of the country of The Netherlands, called Amsterdam.

fun.description: (As a Noun) Activity which is enjoyable or amusing. English = fun, amusement.; (As a Noun) The quality of something being unusual, surprising, or puzzling. English = strangeness, queerness, weirdness, oddity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be amusing and to make you laugh. English = (be) funny, (be) humorous.

anaemia.description: (As a Noun) ANAEMIA is a medical condition in which there are too few red cells in your blood, causing you to feel tired and look pale.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ANAEMIA. If you know a sign for ANAEMIA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

face mask.description: (As a Noun) A device which is placed over the nose and mouth either to protect the breathing passages from dust, dirt or other irritants, or to channel particular gases, such as oxygen or an anaesthetic, to the lungs. English = face mask.; (As a Noun) A substance that stops you feeling pain in the whole of your body when you are unconscious. It is breathed in through a face mask. English = anaesthetic.; (As a Noun) A medical doctor trained to administer anesthesia (e.g. drugs) before, during, and after surgery. English = anaesthetist (British English), anesthesiologist (US English).

analgesic.description: (As a Noun) An ANALGESIC is a drug that relieves pain; i.e. painkiller drugs are 'analgesics'.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ANALGESIC. If you know a sign for ANALGESIC used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

research.description: (As a Noun) Work that involves studying something and trying to discover facts about it. English = research.; (As a Noun) An explanation or description that is the result of considering something. English = analysis.; (As a Noun) A person who does research. English = researcher.

ancestors.description: (General Definition) A series of people or events at intervals going back into the past, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context, especially ancestors and historical events.; (As a Noun) The people who are your parents, grandparents, great grandparents, and so on, long into the past. English = ancestors.; (As a Noun) The events and people of the past. English = history.

history.description: (As a Noun) The period of time long before the present; a period of time in the distant past; olden times; olden days.; (As a Noun) Events in the past. English = history.; (As a Noun) A subject studied in schools, colleges, and universities that deals with the past. English = history.

and.description: (As Modifier) Used to link two or more signs, groups of signs, clauses or sentences.  English = and.

and%20then.description: (As Modifier) Used to separate two stages in a story or narrative to clearly mark the transition from the one to the other. English = 'and then', 'after that happened.'

angel.description: (As a Noun) One of a number of spiritual beings that some people believe are God's messengers and servants in heaven. English = angel.; (As a Noun) A dead person who is officially recognised and honoured by the Christian church because his or her life was a perfect example of the way Christians should live. English = saint.; (As a Noun) A circle of light that is drawn in pictures round the heads of saints or angels to show that they are holy. English = halo.

anger.description: (As a Noun) A strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting. English = anger, annoyance.; (As a Noun) A statement in which you express your dissatisfaction with a particular situation. English = complaint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel a strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting. English = (be) angry, (be) cross, (be) annoyed.

angina.description: (As a Noun) ANGINA is severe pain in the chest and left arm, caused by heart disease.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ANGINA. If you know a sign for ANGINA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

angle.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics and geometry, the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. An angle is measured in degrees (which is written as a superscript zero after a number, e.g., 90° means "ninety degrees"). English = angle.; (As a Noun) The shape that is created where two lines or surfaces join together. English = angle.

tantrum.description: (As a Noun) A person who likes to throw temper tantrums.; (As a Noun) A noisy outburst of bad temper. English = tantrum, temper tantrum.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel or show strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting. English = (be) angry, (be) furious, (be) pissed off.

animal.description: (As a Noun) A living creature such as a dog, lion, or rabbit, rather than a bird, fish, reptile, insect, or human being. English = animal.; (As a Noun) Any living thing that is not a plant. English = animal.

celebration.description: (As a Noun) A special event that people organise to enjoy themselves because something pleasant has happened or because it is someone's birthday or anniversary. English = celebration.; (As a Noun) The action of making a loud noise with your voice or waving your arms about to show that you are very pleased about something. English = cheering.; (As a Noun) A date which is remembered or celebrated because a special event happened on that date in a previous year. English = anniversary.

submission (application).description: (General Definition) To put or place something at various places on a vertical surface starting at the top and working down towards the bottom, e.g., information on a form (sheet of paper or computer screen) or anything or any action that can be directly, indirectly or metaphorically associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A formal, written request for something, often a job, which is made by writing a letter or completing a form. English = application.; (As a Noun) A written proposal or application which can be sent to someone so that they can decide whether to accept it or not. English = submission.

announce.description: (As a Noun) A public statement which gives information about something that has happened or that will happen; or the act of telling people about such. English  = announcement, proclamation.; (As a Noun) A public announcement about something important, particularly from the government. Formal English = proclamation.; (As a Noun) Official information about something or some event. English = notification.

microphone.description: (As a Noun) [Usually made with mouth movement] a device for making sounds louder, especially a person's voice, or to record them on a tape recorder. English = microphone.; (As a Noun) A person whose job involves using a microphone to announce things or to record news for radio or television. English = announcer, radio journalist, television journalist.; (As a Noun) An amplified message played at a public place, such as a railway station, airport, shopping centre. English = announcement.

trouble.description: (As a Noun) Something which causes difficulties or problems in an intrusive way or in a way which makes you slightly angry, or is a difficulty or problem in itself. English = trouble, hassle, bother, irritation, nuisance, annoyance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cause or give difficulties or problems to someone in a way that makes them slightly angry. English = trouble, hassle, bother, irritate, annoy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make you feel slightly angry because it gives you problems or difficulties. English = (be) troublesome, (be) bothersome, (be) irritating, (be) annoying.

other.description: (As a Noun) A thing or a person which is one more thing or person in addition to the one you have just mentioned or have just been talking about, to make two in total. English = the one other.; (As a Noun) A thing or a person which is not one of the people or things that you have just mentioned or have just been talking about, but is additional. English = the other one.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a thing or a person which is one more thing or person in addition to the one you have just mentioned or have just been talking about to make two in total. English = another, one other; (be) another, (be) one other.

answer.description: (As a Noun) What you say or write back to someone who has asked you a question.
