fat.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a lot of flesh on your body. English = (be) fat. Polite English = (be) overweight.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be rather fat and round, especially of a young person or a child. English = (be) chubby.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very fat. Formal English = (be) obese.

throw.description: (As a Noun) The act of throwing something. English = throw.; (As a Noun) The act of flinging something. English = fling.; (As a Noun) The act of tossing something. English = toss.

vomit.description: (As a Noun) Partly digested food and drink that has come back up from someone's stomach and out through their mouth. English = vomit. Informal English = chunder.; (As a Noun) The act of ejecting food and drink from your stomach and out through your mouth, usually because you are ill. English = vomiting.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have food and drink come back from your stomach and out through your mouth, usually because you are ill. English = vomit, (be) sick. Idiomatic English = throw up. Informal English = chunder.

church.description: (As a Noun) A building in which Christians worship. English = church.; (As a Noun) A building used for the worship of a god or gods in some religions. English = temple.; (As a Noun) One of the groups of people within the Christian religion, for example Catholics. English = church, denomination, religion.

cigarette.description: (As a Noun) A small tube of paper containing tobacco which people smoke. English = cigarette.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smoke a cigarette. English = smoke, have a smoke.

cigarette%20lighter.description: (General Definition) The act of pressing down on a flick-switch with your thumb, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as a biro, stopwatch, or cigarette lighter.; (As a Noun) A small device which produces a flame that you can light a cigarette or pipe with. English = cigarette lighter.; (As a Noun) A pen with a retractable small metal ball at its tip. English = pen, biro.

cigarette%20(roll-your-own).description: (As a Noun) A hand-rolled cigarette. English = roll-your-own, rollie.; (As a Noun) Loose-leaf tobacco used for making roll-your-own cigarettes or for putting in pipes.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To roll your own cigarette, to hand roll a cigarette.

picture (movie).description: (As a Noun) Moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown in a cinema. English = picture, film, movie.; (As a Noun) A place where people go to watch films. English = cinema, pictures.

circle.description: (As a Noun) A shape consisting of a curved line completely surrounding an area. Every part of the line is the same distance from the centre of the area. English = circle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the shape of a circle. English = (be) circular.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To draw a circle around something or to move in a circular path around something. English = circle.

circumcision.description: (As a Noun) The operation in which the loose skin at the end of a man's or boy's penis is cut off for religious or medical reasons. English = circumcision.; (As a Noun) The penis of a man or boy in which the loose skin at the end has been cut off. English = circumcised penis.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut off the loose skin at the end of a boy's or man's penis for religious or medical reasons. English = circumcise.

circumference.description: (As a Noun) The edge of a circle, place or round object. English = circumference.; (As a Noun) The distance around the edge of a circle, place or round object. English = circumference..

circus.description: (As a Noun) A show performed in a large tent, with animals, clowns, and acrobats. English = circus.

quote.description: (As a Noun) A sentence or phrase from a book, film, poem, song, or play. English = quote, quotation.; (As a Noun) Punctuation marks that are used to show where something someone has said or a quotation begins and ends. English = quotation marks, inverted commas.; (As a Noun) The thing, person, or idea that is being discussed or written about. English = topic.

oath.description: (As a Noun) A formal promise, especially a promise to tell the truth in court often made by swearing on a Bible. English = oath.; (As a Noun) Your status as a person who legally belongs to a particular country. English = citizenship.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a formal promise, especially a promise to tell the truth in court by swearing on a Bible. English = swear an oath, swear.

city.description: (As a Noun) A large town, especially one that has tall buildings in the centre. English = city.

claim%20(demand).description: (As a Noun) The amount of money that you have to pay for a service or something you buy. English = charge, fee, price, cost.; (As a Noun) A firm request for something. English = demand.; (As a Noun) In economics, the degree or extent to which people want to buy something. English = demand.

claim%20(stake).description: (As a Noun) The creating or starting of a new building or organisation. English = foundation, establishment.; (As a Noun) A position or thing from which something can be developed or achieved; the main place from which you work; or the place from which the main part of an army is from. English = base, camp.; (As a Noun) The action or statement by which you say you have a right to something or interest in something. English = claim, stake.

climbing.description: (General Definition) Of a person, to go up, or up and over, some object by climbing. The weak hand usually shows what type of object the person climbs up or over (a horizontal flat surface, a vertical flat surface, a large round object, a thin vertical object, a large cylindrical vertical object, and so on).; (As a Noun) The activity of moving towards the top of something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, often with some effort or difficulty. English = climbing.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move towards the top of something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, often with some effort or difficulty. English = climb.

exact.description: (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean. English = spotlessness.; (As a Noun) The condition or state of being completely clean, or not mixed with anything else and containing no harmful substances. English = purity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being easy to understand, see or hear, or of being obvious and impossible to be mistaken about. English = clarity.

class.description: (As a Noun) A group of pupils or students who are taught together. English = class.; (As a Noun) A short period of teaching in a particular subject. English = class.

classifier.description: (As a Noun) A special class of signs in the grammar of sign languages which in some instances fulfil a similar function to the pronouns of English, and in others serve to describe or refer to objects in a unique visual-gestural way. English = classifier.

clay.description: (As a Noun) A mass of something soft, such as wet earth or wet flour, that you can squeeze or knead with your fingers.; (As a Noun) A substance found in the ground that is soft when it is wet and hard when it is dry. It is used to make things such as pots. English = clay.; (As a Noun) A mixture of flour and water, and sometimes also sugar and fat, which can be cooked to make bread, pastry, or biscuits. English = dough.

cleanness.description: (As a Noun) The state or condition of being free from dirt and unwanted substances. English = cleanness.; (As a Noun) The habit of keeping yourself and your surroundings clean. English = cleanliness.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to clean rooms and furniture inside a building. English = cleaner.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

cleaning.description: (As a Noun) The act of making something clean. English = cleaning.; (As a Noun) A person who cleans. English = cleaner.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something free from dirt and unwanted substances or marks. English = clean, wash, wash down.

clear.description: (As a Noun) A clear, fine day.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the weather, to have no mist, rain, or cloud. English = (be) clear, (be) fine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of mist or fog, to gradually disappear. English = clear, become fine.

obvious.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that is easily seen, noticed, or recognised. English = (be) obvious, (be) plain, (be) evident.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that you expect people to know already. English = (be) obvious, (be) clear.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean that you think what they have said is something that is easily see, noticed, or recognised. English = 'Obviously!', 'Plainly!', 'Evidently!'

clear%20(obvious).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that is easily seen, noticed, or recognised. English = (be) obvious, (be) plain, (be) evident.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that you expect people to know already. English = (be) obvious, (be) clear.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean that you think what they have said is something that is easily see, noticed, or recognised. English = 'Obviously!', 'Plainly!', 'Evidently!'

Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) Suggested sign #2×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

priest.description: (As a Noun) A member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church. English = priest, father, (Anglican only) vicar.; (As a Noun) The officially appointed leaders of the religious activities of a particular church or temple; a member of this group. English = clergy; minister.; (As a Noun) A white collar that is worn by priest and ministers of the Christian Church. Informal English = dog-collar.

clever.description: (As a Noun) The ability to understand or learn things easily or plan things well. English = cleverness, smartness, intelligence.; (As a Noun) The ability to use your experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions and judgements. Often thought to be a quality of older people. English = wisdom.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To understand or learn things easily or be able to plans things well. English = (be) clever, (be) smart, (be) intelligent.

clever%20(not%20clever).description: (As a Noun) The inability to understand or learn things easily or be unable to plans things well. English =  ignorance.; (As a Noun) The inability to use your experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions and judgements. English = inexperience, immaturity.; (As a Noun) A person who is unable to understand or learn things easily, or to use their experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions and judgements. English = simpleton, ignoramus.

person.description: (As a Noun) A man or a woman. English = person.; (As a Noun) A person in a film or play. English = character, role.; (As a Noun) A person or company that receives a service from a professional person or organisation. English = client.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

cliff.description: (General Definition) A high level surface that suddenly drops down, more or less vertically, at one end, such as the corner of a box or the end of a shelve, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a cliff.; (As a Noun) A high area of land which a very steep side, especially one next to the sea. English = cliff.

weather.description: (As a Noun) The condition of the atmosphere, for example whether it is raining, sunny, hot, or windy in an area at a particular time. English = weather.; (As a Noun) The general weather conditions that are typical of a place. English = climate.

climb.description: (As a Noun) The act of moving towards the top of something, like a tree, often with some effort or difficulty, and especially if you have to use your hands to help you. English = climb.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move towards the top of something, like a tree, often with some effort or difficulty, and especially if you have to use your hands to help you. English = climb, clamber.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To climb something very high or steep, such as a cliff or the outside of a building. English = scale.

clip.description: (As a Noun) A small device, usually made of metal or plastic, that is specially shaped for holding things together. English = clip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fasten a clip to something.

pliers.description: (General Definition) Any hand held device that is operated by squeezing on two levers, or any thing or any action which is indirectly or directly associated with this, such as pliers, secateurs, or clippers.; (As a Noun) A tool used for holding or pulling out things such as nails, or for bending or cutting wire. English = pliers.; (As a Noun) A gardening tool that looks like a pair of strong, heavy scissors and is used for cutting the stems of plants. English = secateurs.

clock.description: (As a Noun) An instrument, for example on a wall in a room or on the outside of a building, that shows you what time of day it is. English = clock.

close.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a future event or date, to gradually become nearer as time passes. English = approach. Idiomatic English = get closer, get nearer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two people, for one person to come very close to the other person so that they are looking each other in the eye.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of anything in general, to move into your field of vision or to come closer so that it can be better seen. English = appear.

close%20(automatic%20doors).description: (As a Noun) The closing of a set of automatic doors.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of automatic doors, to close.

close%20(book).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To close a book.

close%20call.description: (As a Noun) An event in which something bad, such as an accident or disaster, very nearly happened. Idiomatic English = close shave, close call.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an accident or disaster, to very nearly happen. Idiomatic English = (be) a close shave, (be) a close call, (be) close, (be) very close.; (Interactive) Used alone to express your perception that an accident or disaster very nearly happened. English = 'That was close!', 'That was a close shave!', 'That was a close call!'

close%20contact.description: (As a Noun) In relation to infectious diseases (especially COVID-19), a person who has been the same room or area as a person who has covid for period of time so that they are at a high risk of catching the infection. English = close contact.

closure.description: (As a Noun) The temporary shutting up of a business or factory at the end of a business day or period.; (As a Noun) The permanent shutting up of a business or factory. English = closure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of businesses, offices, shops, etc., to be in a period when work has stopped and there is no access to the premises. English = (be) closed, (be) shut.

close%20(door).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To close the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle by swinging a piece of wood, glass, or metal across the entrance; to close a door. English = close, shut.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To close the opening on any kind of object.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a door, to close or be closed.

close%20down.description: (As a Noun) The temporary shutting up of a business or factory at the end of a business day or period.; (As a Noun) The permanent shutting up of a business or factory. English = closure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of businesses, offices, shops, etc., to be in a period when work has stopped and there is no access to the premises. English = (be) closed, (be) shut.

close%20(drawer).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To close a drawer.

close%20(folder).description: (General Definition) Two flat surfaces in which one folds away from the other, such as a folder or an envelope, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To close a folder.

closeness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of a relationship with another person in which both people know each other very well and like each other. English = closeness.; (As a Noun) A reduction in the size of something.; (As a Noun) A reduction in the amount of time.

close%20shave.description: (As a Noun) An event in which something bad, such as an accident or disaster, very nearly happened. Idiomatic English = close shave, close call.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an accident or disaster, to very nearly happen. Idiomatic English = (be) a close shave, (be) a close call, (be) close, (be) very close.; (Interactive) Used alone to express your perception that an accident or disaster very nearly happened. English = 'That was close!', 'That was a close shave!', 'That was a close call!'

close%20(sliding-door).description: (General Definition) A flat surface the moves sideways in front of another flat surface or any thing or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, such as a sliding-door or a photographic slide.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a sliding door, to close.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a photographic slide, to be moved into position.

close%20(window).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To close a space in a wall or roof or in the side of a vehicle, often with glass in it so that light can pass through it and people can see through it; to close a window.

clot.description: (As a Noun) A CLOT is a sticky lump that forms when blood dries up or becomes thick.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for CLOT. If you know a sign for CLOT used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

cloth.description: (As a Noun) A substance which is used especially for making clothes and is made by weaving, knitting, or some other similar process. English = cloth, fabric, material.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To unfold cloth, fabric, or material.

clothes%20line.description: (As a Noun) A small wooden or plastic device which you use to fasten clothes to a clothes line. English = clothes peg, peg.; (As a Noun) A rope on which you hang washing so that it can dry. English = clothes line.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hang clothes up on a clothes line, to peg up clothes.

clothes%20peg.description: (As a Noun) A small wooden or plastic device which you use to fasten clothes to a clothes line. English = clothes peg, peg.; (As a Noun) A rope on which you hang washing so that it can dry. English = clothes line.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hang clothes up on a clothes line, to peg up clothes.

cloud.description: (As a Noun) A mass of water vapour that floats in the sky. It is usually white or grey and rain often falls from it. English = cloud, clouds.; (As a Noun) A day in which there are lots of clouds in the sky and the light is poor; an overcast day; a dull day.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have lots of clouds in the sky. English = (be) cloudy.

cloud%20(dust).description: (As a Noun) A cloud of dust or steam caused by energetic activity. Often portrayed in cartoons with a drawing of a cloud of dust and a speech bubble with the word ‘kaboom!’ in it. English = dust cloud.; (As a Noun) A cloud of dust, steam or smoke caused by some activity, often with machines. English = cloud (dust), cloud (steam), cloud (smoke).; (As a Noun) Informal Auslan, good feelings remaining after a pleasurable or successful experience, especially having sex. English = afterglow.

cloud%20(smoke).description: (As a Noun) A cloud of dust or steam caused by energetic activity. Often portrayed in cartoons with a drawing of a cloud of dust and a speech bubble with the word ‘kaboom!’ in it. English = dust cloud.; (As a Noun) A cloud of dust, steam or smoke caused by some activity, often with machines. English = cloud (dust), cloud (steam), cloud (smoke).; (As a Noun) Informal Auslan, good feelings remaining after a pleasurable or successful experience, especially having sex. English = afterglow.

cloud%20(steam).description: (As a Noun) A cloud of dust or steam caused by energetic activity. Often portrayed in cartoons with a drawing of a cloud of dust and a speech bubble with the word ‘kaboom!’ in it. English = dust cloud.; (As a Noun) A cloud of dust, steam or smoke caused by some activity, often with machines. English = cloud (dust), cloud (steam), cloud (smoke).; (As a Noun) Informal Auslan, good feelings remaining after a pleasurable or successful experience, especially having sex. English = afterglow.

clown.description: (As a Noun) A performer in a circus who wears funny clothes and bright make-up, often with a big red nose, and who does silly things in order to make people laugh. English = clown.

club.description: (As a Noun) A social club for people who are deaf; the deaf club.; (As a Noun) In Australia, any of a number of state based organisations that provide services to the deaf community (interpreting, welfare, community education, etc.); the deaf society.; (As a Noun) Any kind of social or sporting association. English = club.

club%20(hit).description: (General Definition) The action of holding something and using it to hit something or someone, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) Something that you hold in your hand and use to hit something or someone. English = baton, stick, club.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hit someone or something with an instrument such as a baton, stick or club. English = beat, strike, club.

club%20(rsl).description: (As a Noun) A machine used for gambling. You put in a coin and then pull a lever (on old machines) or press buttons (on new machines) to try and get particular patterns of symbols on a screen in order to win money. Australian English = poker machine, pokies.; (As a Noun) A place where poker machines can be found, usually a club, such as an RSL (Returned Serviceman's Club), a football club, or a worker's club. English = club.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gamble on a poker machine; to play a poker machine. Informal Australian English = play the pokies.

clubs.description: (As a Noun) One of four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more black symbols in the shape of a leaf with three rounded parts. English = clubs.

oblivious.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To not be aware of something or conscious of what is happening around you. English = (be) oblivious, (be) unaware.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have no knowledge, understanding or ability. English = (be) clueless.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a look or expression which suggests that you do not understand something or that you are not very intelligent. English = (be) vacant, have a vacant look.

teaching.description: (As a Noun) The work of a teacher or instructor. English = teaching, instruction.; (As a Noun) Helping students learn about various subjects in a school, college or university. English = education.; (As a Noun) Someone who helps a person or a group of people become better at a particular sport or subject. English = coach.

coarse.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a surface which is not smooth but rather has lots of little bumps and unevenness in it. English = (be) coarse, (be) rough.

silliness.description: (As a Noun) Behaviour which is foolish or childish. English = silliness.; (As a Noun) Language or behaviour which is rude and offensive. English = crudeness, grossness, coarseness.; (As a Noun) A serious and stupid mess, muddle or mistake. Vulgar English = fuckup.

coat%20(clothing).description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing with long sleeves which you wear over your other clothes when you go outside. English = coat.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on or wear a coat or jacket.

coat%20(cover%20surface).description: (General Definition) A flat object being placed on a surface and repeatedly turned over, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To add layers around a piece of food, typically vegetable or meat. English = coat, crumb×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ‘coat’ or ‘crumb’ (but signers can easily represent this visually using depicting signs in an appropriate context). This sign is a recommended for ‘crumb’ or ‘coat’. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.

coat-hanger.description: (As a Noun) A curved piece of wood, metal, or plastic that you hang a piece of clothing on. English = coat-hanger.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hang up on a coat hanger, or put away in a wardrobe.

persuasion.description: (As a Noun) The act of persuading someone to do something. English = persuasion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cause someone to do something by giving them good reasons and encouraging them to do it. English = persuade, coax.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To try very hard to persuade someone to do something. English = urge.

corn.description: (General Definition) Something long and thin, and perhaps cylindrical, which is rotated in front of the mouth, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as a bone which is nibbled and, especially, a cob of corn.; (As a Noun) A tall crop which produces yellow grains packed tightly on large spikes. English = corn.; (As a Noun) The yellow grain spikes of corn, especially when they have been harvested. English = cob of corn, corn cob.

cobra.description: (As a Noun) A kind of poisonous snake. English = cobra.

cola.description: (As a Noun) A brown, fizzy, non-alcoholic drink. English = cola.; (As a Noun) The name of a brown, fizzy, non-alcoholic cola drink, sold under the trademark of 'Coca-Cola', or 'Coke'.; (Note) Apologies for the poor quality of this video. It will be replaced as soon as possible.

cochlear.description: (As a Noun) A special device which is implanted into a division of the inner ear, called the cochlea, which can help deafened people regain auditory sensations. English = cochlear, cochlear implant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To insert or to have received a cochlear implant.

crest.description: (As a Noun) A tuft of feathers on the top of a bird's head. English = crest.; (As a Noun) A kind of parrot that has a crest on its head. English = cockatoo.; (As a Noun) The red growth that a cock (rooster) has on its head. English = cockscomb.

cockroach.description: (As a Noun) A large brown insect that is often found in dirty rooms. English = cockroach.

cocktail.description: (As a Noun) An alcoholic drink which contains several ingredients which are often shaken together. English = cocktail.

coconut.description: (As a Noun) A very large nut with a hairy shell, which has white flesh and milky juice inside it. English = coconut.

rubbish (waste).description: (As a Noun) Unwanted things or material that is left over when something has been used, for example because the valuable or useful part of it has been taken out. English = rubbish, garbage, trash, waste. Formal English = refuse.; (As a Noun) Something which is of very poor quality. English = rubbish.; (As a Noun) An idea or a statement which you think is foolish or wrong. English = codswallop. Informal English = rubbish, crap.

coefficient.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, a numerical or constant quantity placed before and multiplying the variable in an algebraic expression. English = coefficient.; (As a Noun) In physics, a multiplier or factor that measures a particular property. English = coefficient.

coercion.description: (As a Noun) The act or process of making someone do something they do not want to do. English = coercion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make someone do something, although they are very unwilling to. English = force, compel, coerce.

coffee%20beans.description: (As a Noun) A hot brown drink that you make by pouring boiling water onto the roasted and ground seeds of a tropical tree, or onto a powder. English = coffee.; (As a Noun) The roasted seeds or powder from which the drink is made. English = coffee, coffee beans.; (As a Noun) A cup of coffee.

coffee%20plunger.description: (General Definition) The act of pushing something down through a cylinder or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, particularly a coffee plunger.; (As a Noun) Coffee-making device in which infused ground coffee is pushed downwards in a plunger. English = coffee plunger.

coffin.description: (As a Noun) A box in which a dead body is buried or cremated. English = coffin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a dead body into a coffin and bury them. Formal English = inter.

cogitation.description: (As a Noun) Ideas that you have in your mind or the act of having an idea or ideas in your mind. English = thoughts, thinking. Formal English = cogitation, cogitations.; (As a Noun) The part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is right or wrong. English = conscience.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your mind to form opinions, ideas or images of something; to think at length, in depth or repeatedly.

cognitive.description: (As Modifier) COGNITIVE means relating to the mental process involved in knowing, learning, and understanding things.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COGNITIVE. If you know a sign for COGNITIVE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

cohesion.description: (As a Noun) The state in which all the parts of something fit together well and form a united whole, particularly when you are talking about writing that uses words and grammar to link different parts together so that the ideas or the story are clear and easy to understand. English = cohesion; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term COHESION. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COHESION (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for COHESION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

coin.description: (As a Noun) A small round piece of metal which is used as money. English = coin.; (As a Noun) A small, hard (often round) piece of medicine, which you swallow. English = tablet.

coincidence.description: (As a Noun) The fact that two or more things happen at the same time by chance. English = coincidence.; (As a Noun) The natural talent that some people have for finding interesting or valuable things by chance. English = serendipity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two or more things, to happen at the same time by chance. English = (be) coincidental, coincide.

colander.description: (General Definition) Any curved or flexible object with holes or made of mesh, such as a net, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a colander.; (As a Noun) A bowl-shaped container with holes in it in which you wash and drain food. English = colander.

cold.description: (As a Noun) The condition of something, especially the weather, when it has a very low temperature. English = cold, coldness.; (As a Noun) The coldest season of the year, between autumn and spring, when many trees and plants do not have any leaves. English = winter.; (As a Noun) A large container which is kept cool inside, usually by electricity, so that the food and drink in it stays fresh. English = refrigerator. Informal English = fridge.

cold%20(illness).description: (As a Noun) A condition in which your nose runs a lot, because of illness or allergy, and you are forced to use tissues or handkerchiefs to blow it a lot.; (As a Noun) A mild, common illness which makes you sneeze and blow your nose a lot and gives you a sore throat or a cough. English = cold.; (As a Noun) An illness which is like a bad cold. Not only do you sneeze a lot, have a runny nose, have a sore throat and a cough, but you are also weak and your muscles ache. English = flu, influenza.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

colic.description: (As a Noun) COLIC is an illness in which you get severe pains in your stomach and bowels. Babies especially suffer from colic.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COLIC. If you know a sign for COLIC used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

colitis.description: (As a Noun) COLITIS is an illness in which your colon becomes inflamed.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COLITIS. If you know a sign for COLITIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

cooperation.description: (As a Noun) The act of working or acting together with other people for a purpose. English = cooperation.; (As a Noun) The feeling of friendship people have when they are doing something together. English = fellowship, friendship, mateship.; (As a Noun) The same opinion or idea about something shared between several people. English = agreement, accord.

collapse.description: (As a Noun) The destruction of a building by the roof and walls falling down. English = collapse.; (As a Noun) The destruction of a tunnel or a cave by the ceiling and walls falling down. English = cave in.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the roof and walls of a building, to suddenly fall down. English = collapse.

collapse%20(faint).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To lose consciousness for a short time. English = faint, collapse.

collar.description: (As a Noun) The part of a shirt or coat which fits round the neck and is usually folded over. English = collar.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a shirt or coat, to have a collar. English = (be) collared.

collect.description: (As a Noun) The activity of bringing together things from different places. English = collection.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do. English = profit.; (As a Noun) The money you get for performing work or providing a service. English = earnings.

college.description: (As a Noun) An institution where students study after they have left school. English = college.; (As a Noun) The third type of education some people receive after primary and secondary school. English = tertiary education, higher education.; (As a Noun) A student residence at an Australian university. English = college.

collision%20(vehicle).description: (General Definition) Of an object, to move forward until it encounters a barrier of some sort which causes it to stop, or any thing, action or state which can be easily extrapolated from this given an appropriate context. Cited without context, most signers will think this sign means a car hitting an obstacle.; (As a Noun) An event in which a moving car or other vehicle hits a surface and is badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash (car), smash (car), accident (car), collision (car).; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a car or other moving vehicle, to hit something and be badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash, smash, have an accident.

colon%20(body%20part).description: (As a Noun) The COLON is the last part of the digestive system in the body.; (As a Noun) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COLON. If you know a sign for COLON used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

colonoscopy.description: (As a Noun) A COLONOSCOPY is when a small camera is passed through the anus to examine the colon and bowel.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COLONOSCOPY. If you know a sign for COLONOSCOPY used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

colon%20(punctuation%20mark).description: (As a Noun) A punctuation mark (:), which you can use in several ways. For example you can put it before a list of things or before reported speech. English = colon.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To write a colon.

colour.description: (As a Noun) The appearance of something that is a result of reflecting different types of light. Red, blue, and green are examples. English = colour, color.

colostomy%20bag.description: (As a Noun) A COLOSTOMY BAG is a bag that attaches to the stomach and collects body wastes (i.e. faeces).; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for COLOSTOMY BAG. If you know a sign for COLOSTOMY BAG used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

comb.description: (As a Noun) A flat piece of plastic or metal, which you use to tidy your hair. English = comb.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tidy your hair using a comb. English = comb.

come%20across.description: (As a Noun) The act of taking a child into your own family and making it legally your son or daughter. English = adoption.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something yours which is not properly yours (e.g., if you accidentally find it, tell yourself it is lost or discarded, and then decide to keep it). English = appropriate, scavenge, keep. Idiomatic English = come across, pocket.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a child into your own family and to make it legally your own son or daughter. English = adopt.

come%20back.description: (As a Noun) A journey where you go somewhere and then come back to the place where you started.; (As a Noun) A return journey.; (As a Noun) The coming or going back to a place that you had left sometime before. English = return.

come%20forward.description: (As a Noun) An action or movement that makes something, especially a person, stand out from the background or the crowd.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To step forward from a surface, to step out from a group or a crowd.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be easily noticeable from the rest of its kind, especially of a person in a crowd. Idiomatic English = stand out.

come%20here.description: (As a Noun) The act of calling or signalling someone to come closer to you. English = beckoning.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To ask someone to come over from where they are to where you are; to ask someone to come closer to you. English = beckon.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone to come over to where you are. English = 'Come here!'

come%20in%20(welcome).description: (As a Noun) The act of greeting someone in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere. English = welcome.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To greet someone in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere. English = to welcome.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be friendly and welcoming to guests and strangers. English = (be) welcoming, (be) hospitable.

come%20on%20(disbelief).description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to what the person you are talking to has said to express your disbelief that they have said this and that mean it seriously (i.e., they are not joking). English = “Come on!”, “You can’t be serious!” and so on.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to a reaction of doubt or disagreement from the person you are talking to regarding what you have just said because you think it is obvious and no one could possibly disagree with you. English = “Come on!”, “You can’t think otherwise!” and so on.

come%20on%20(encourage).description: (As a Noun) The act of greeting someone in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere. English = welcome.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To greet someone in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere. English = to welcome.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be friendly and welcoming to guests and strangers. English = (be) welcoming, (be) hospitable.

come%20up%20with.description: (As a Noun) A machine, system (or even idea) that has been thought of or made for the first time by someone. English = invention, discovery.; (As a Noun) A new thing or a new way of doing something. English = innovation.; (As a Noun) An excuse or an explanation for something which is made up and which may not be true at all but which is convenient for you or someone else. English = concoction.

comfortable.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be physically relaxed and at ease. English = (be) comfortable; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of furniture and clothing, to make you feel physically relaxed when you are using or wearing them. English = (be) comfortable.

comic%20book.description: (As a Noun) A magazine that contains stories told in pictures. English = comic, comic book.; (As a Noun) A humorous drawing or series of drawings in a newspaper or magazine. English = cartoon.; (As a Noun) A film in which all the characters and scenes are drawn rather than being real people or objects. English = cartoon.

comma.description: (As a Noun) The punctuation mark (,) which is used to separate parts of a sentence or items in a list. English = comma.

order (command).description: (As a Noun) The act of telling someone to do something with the expectation that they will obey you. English = order.; (As a Noun) The actual instruction or instructions you give to someone and which you expect them to follow. English = order, instruction.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell someone to do something with the expectation that they will obey you. English = order.

minister.description: (As a Noun) A person who is in charge of a particular government department. English = minister.; (As a Noun) Someone who occupies a very senior and important position in an organisation or business, particularly a leadership role. English = chief executive, CEO, president.; (As a Noun) The person in charge of a school or college. English = principal.

commandment.description: (As a Noun) One of ten rules of behaviour which, according to the Old Testament in the Bible, Christians believe God said people should obey. English = commandment.

commemoration.description: (As a Noun) The act of doing something special (like having a ceremony or associating an object with a person or event) to show that you remember or to help you remember. English = commemoration.; (As a Noun) An object which is associated with a person or an event in the which helps you remember that person or event; or an object which is associated with a holiday and helps you remember it. English = keepsake; souvenir, memento.; (As a Noun) The act of bringing something that has happened in the past back into your mind with the help of some object or ceremony which is connected with the event or person. English = recollection, remembrance.

saying.description: (As a Noun) Something that you say, write, or sign that gives your opinion of something or which gives an explanation of it. English = comment.; (As a Noun) The way someone goes about using words or signs to communicate a specific piece of information or a story. English = telling, rendition.; (As a Noun) The words or signs of another person which you accept as the reason or authority for you to do something. Informal English = say-so.

talk.description: (As a Noun) The act of saying things to someone (in speech or sign). English = talk.; (As a Noun) The things that someone says to someone (in speech or sign). English = comments, remarks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say things to someone (in speech or sign). English = talk.

obliged.description: (As a Noun) Something that you must do because you have promised to do it or because it is your duty to do it. English = obligation, commitment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel that you must do something because it is your duty or because you have promised to do it. English = (be) obliged, (be) committed.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make someone feel or promise that they must do something. English = oblige, commit.

committee.description: (As a Noun) A group of people who represent a larger group or organisation and who make decisions or plans for that group or organisation. English = committee.

common knowledge.description: (As a Noun) Things or facts which are known by everybody and not special in any way. English = common knowledge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be ordinary and not special in any way. English = (be) common.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very ordinary and so familiar and well-known that it has become uninteresting and boring. Idiomatic English = (be) old hat.

common%20knowledge.description: (As a Noun) Things or facts which are known by everybody and not special in any way. English = common knowledge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be ordinary and not special in any way. English = (be) common.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very ordinary and so familiar and well-known that it has become uninteresting and boring. Idiomatic English = (be) old hat.

communication.description: (As a Noun) The activity or process of giving information to other people or to other living things. English = communication.; (As a Noun) The systems and processes that are used to communicate or broadcast information, especially by means of electricity or radio waves. English = communications.; (As a Noun) The act of two or more people talking to each other. English = conversation.

communism.description: (As a Noun) The political  belief that the state should control the means of producing everything, and that there should be no private property. English = communism.; (As a Noun) A person who believes in communism. English = communist.; (As a Noun) A person who believes that there should be great changes in society and tries to bring about these changes. English = radical.

community.description: (As a Noun) The people who live in a particular area, or a particular group of people in society who are alike in some way. English = community.

community%20participation.description: (As a Noun) COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION means people getting involved in community, for example, going to work, shop, school or further education; using the public transport; see and talk to friends, family, colleagues, strangers, shop assistants and other professionals; volunter or join clubs and groups with others who share similar interests and where they feel like they can make a contribution and belong.

travelling.description: (As a Noun) The activity of moving back and forth between two or many different places, especially for pleasure. English = travelling.; (As a Noun) The journeys that someone makes to places a long way from their home. English = travels.; (As a Noun) A person who travels a long distance every day between home and place of work. English = commuter.

company.description: (As a Noun) A friend or visitor you have with you. English = company.; (As a Noun) Someone you spend time with or someone you are travelling with. English = companion.; (As a Noun) The good feeling you have when you have a friend or visitor with you who you enjoy being with. English = companionship.

company%20(business).description: (As a Noun) The name plate or plaque of a firm, company, business, practise or partnership on a wall or outside a business.; (As a Noun) A firm, company, business, practise or partnership, especially one that is identified by a name plate or plaque on a wall or outside a business. English = firm, company.; (As a Noun) A large building or group of buildings where machines are used to make goods in large quantities. English = factory.

comparison.description: (As a Noun) The consideration of two or more things together regarding their differences or similarities. English = comparison.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To consider two or more things together and discover the differences or similarities between them. English = compare×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

compass.description: (As a Noun) A hinged V-shaped instrument you use for drawing circles. English = compass, compasses, pair of compasses.; (As a Noun) The distance from the centre of a circle to its outside edge. English = radius.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To draw a circle using a hinged V-shaped instrument.

compassion.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of pity and sympathy for someone who is suffering. English = compassion.; (As a Noun) The feeling of compassion you have for someone so that you do not punish them or treat them as severely as you could. English = mercy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel pity and sympathy for someone who is suffering. English = (be) compassionate.

compensation.description: (As a Noun) Legal action and proceedings taken against someone, usually for money because they have harmed you in some way.; (As a Noun) Money which is paid to someone because they have been harmed in some way or have been injured. English = compensation.; (As a Noun) A formal accusation, made by the police, that someone has committed a crime. English = charge.

compete.description: (As a Noun) An event in which people or teams play against each other to test skills or knowledge or ability English = competition, contest.; (As a Noun) An event in which people or teams play against each other in a particular sport. English = match, race, game.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two individuals, groups of people or teams, to try and prove you are better than the other in some event. English = compete.

skill.description: (As a Noun) A combination of a natural and acquired ability (through education, experience or training) that enables you to do something well. English = skill, competence, proficiency. Informal English = know-how.; (As a Noun) Special skill or knowledge. English = expertise.; (As a Noun) In education, the ability to use skills and knowledge to the level required of a workplace, and to be able to apply these skills and knowledge to new situations or environments. English = competency.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

talent.description: (As a Noun) The natural ability to do something well. English = talent.; (As a Noun) A combination of a natural and acquired ability (through education, experience or training) to do something well. English = competence, skill.; (As a Noun) The ability to speak, write or sign a language easily and correctly. English = fluency.

fill.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a large amount of something into a container or area so that there is no more room to put any more into it. English = fill, fill up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) (Of a container or an area) to be unable to take any more of something because there is no more room left. English = (be) full.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be as much or as great as something can possibly be. English = (be) complete, (be) total.

complete (finish).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To totally finish doing, making, or producing something. English = complete, completely finish.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be totally finished with no more work to do or parts to add. English = (be) completed, (be) completely finished.; (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb (action) sign to mean the action has happened before the present time, and therefore does not need to happen again, or has happened earlier than you expected. English = already.

complete%20(finish).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To totally finish doing, making, or producing something. English = complete, completely finish.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be totally finished with no more work to do or parts to add. English = (be) completed, (be) completely finished.; (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb (action) sign to mean the action has happened before the present time, and therefore does not need to happen again, or has happened earlier than you expected. English = already.

complication.description: (As a Noun) A circumstance that makes a situation harder to deal with or understand. English = complication, complications.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have so many parts or aspects that it is difficult to understand or deal with. English = (be) complicated, (be) complex.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something more difficult to understand or deal with. English = complicate.

component.description: (General Definition) A thing or quantity which is of a defined and relatively small size, extent or duration or any thing or quality that can easily be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A single complete thing. English = unit.; (As a Noun) A single thing which is a part of a larger thing. English = unit, component.

understanding.description: (As a Noun) The act or state of having knowledge about what someone means when they communicate with you. English = understanding, comprehension.; (As a Noun) The act or state of having knowledge about what is happening and why it is happening, particularly when this involves the behaviour of other people. English = understanding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To know what someone means when they communicate with you. English = understand, comprehend.

depth.description: (As a Noun) The distance between the top and bottom surfaces of something. English = depth.; (As a Noun) The great intensity or seriousness of a situation, emotion, thought, etc. English = depth, profundity.; (As a Noun) The degree or amount to which something is serious or important. English = depth.

must.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an action, to have no choice or freedom regarding doing it. English = (be) compulsory.; (Interactive) Used alone as a response to a question from your addressee or even yourself as to the likelihood of something happening or being true to mean that you are sure it is true or that it has happened. English = 'It must be!', 'It has to be!', 'It must have happened!'; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that it is very important and necessary that the action happen; or that you want to do it and that you intend to do it very soon. English = must, have to.

computer.description: (General Definition) Of any two things, to rotate simultaneously and in the same direction, such as the two reels of an old-fashioned strip of film or computer tape, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) [Obsolete sign] an electronic machine that uses magnetic tape that can quickly make calculations, store, rearrange, and retrieve information, or control another machine. English = computer.; (As a Noun) Plastic tape made in long strips and covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information. English = magnetic tape (particularly computers); audio tape (sound only); video tape (pictures and sound).

computer%20disk.description: (General Definition) The action of putting a flat object inside a narrow opening, such as a card in an ATM, a disk in a computer, or a bank-book through a slot to a bank teller, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially posting.; (As a Noun) A large metal container in the street into which you post letters. English = postbox.; (As a Noun) A metal box at your front gate or a rectangular hole in your front door through which letters for you are delivered. English = letterbox.

conceal.description: (As a Noun) Something which is hidden.; (As a Noun) Something which is put aside to be used or attended to at a later time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something to one side and/or underneath something else so that it cannot be seen; to put something somewhere so that it cannot be seen or found. English = conceal, hide.

hide out.description: (As a Noun) A place where someone or something can be hidden, or where they are hiding. English = hiding place.; (As a Noun) A place where someone goes secretly because they do not want anyone to find them, for example if they are running away from the police. English = hide-out.; (As a Noun) The state of being hidden or the act of hiding something. English = concealment.

pregnancy.description: (As a Noun) The condition of being pregnant or the period of time during which a female is pregnant. English = pregnancy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a woman or female animal, to have a baby or babies developing in her body. English = (be) pregnant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a woman, to become pregnant. English = conceive.

concentration.description: (As a Noun) The act or condition of giving or directing your full attention to something. English = concentration.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give or direct your full attention to something. English = concentrate.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To keep your attention focussed on one issue rather than several issues; to keep to the point; to apply yourself to a task.

concentrate%20(intensify).description: (General Definition) Something being extracted and concentrated, or anything or any action that can be associated with this in context, such as a fuel pump.; (As a Noun) [Especially the two handed variant] the device in a vehicle that moves petrol from the petrol tank to the engine. English = fuel pump.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a substance out of another substance so that there is more of it than the other substance; or to take a weak sources of energy (light, heat, sound, etc.) and bring them together into a smaller space so that it is stronger and more intense. English = draw out, extract, concentrate.

concentrate%20(not%20concentrate).description: (As a Noun) A lack of attention to what is being said or done. English = inattention.; (As a Noun) Something that takes you attention away from something. English = distraction.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of someone, to be made by something or someone else to stop concentrating on what they are doing. English = (be) distracted

imagine.description: (As a Noun) The ability you have to form ideas and pictures of new or exciting things in your mind. English = imagination.; (As a Noun) The idea or picture you have of something in your mind. English = concept, conception, notion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think of something and to form a picture of it in your mind. English = imagine, picture, visualise, conceive, conceive of.

worry.description: (As a Noun) Thoughts or constant thinking about a problem that you have or about something unpleasant that might happen and the feeling of unhappiness and unease that this causes. English = worry, anxiety, concern.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To keep thinking about a problem or about something unpleasant that might happen. English = worry, fret; (be) worried, (be) anxious, (be) concerned, (be) fretful.

music.description: (As a Noun) Sounds that are put together in a pattern and performed by people who are singing or playing instruments. English = music.; (As a Noun) A large group of musicians who play a variety of different instruments together. English = orchestra.; (As a Noun) A person who stands in front of an orchestra, band or choir and direct its performance by waving their hands. English = conductor.

end.description: (As a Noun) The last part of an activity. English = end, close.; (As a Noun) The last part of a book or a film. English = end, ending.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something which is the last part of an activity, or the last part of a text (such as a book or a film). English = end, close.

invention.description: (As a Noun) A machine, system (or even idea) that has been thought of or made for the first time by someone. English = invention, discovery.; (As a Noun) A new thing or a new way of doing something. English = innovation.; (As a Noun) An excuse or an explanation for something which is made up and which may not be true at all but which is convenient for you or someone else. English = concoction.

condom.description: (As a Noun) A covering made of rubber which a man wears on his penis during sexual intercourse as a contraceptive or to prevent infection. English = condom.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on or be wearing a condom.

conduct%20(behaviour).description: (As a Noun) The way someone acts. English =  behaviour, conduct.; (As a Noun) The typical way that people, animals or even things act, function, or change. English = behaviour.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To act in a particular way. English = behave.

cone%20(ice-cream).description: (General Definition) A container of some sort with a semi-circular handle on the top of it, such as a basket or bucket, an object with a curved top or covering, such as a button mushroom or ice-cream, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this.

discussion.description: (As a Noun) A conversation between two people. English = dialogue.; (As a Noun) A conversation between two or more people. English = discussion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a conversation with one other person; to have a dialogue.

meeting.description: (As a Noun) An event at which people meet formally and discuss issues, make decisions or take votes. English = meeting.; (As a Noun) A large formal meeting at which discussions take place, especially one about a particular subject. English = conference.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hold a meeting or a conference.

telltale.description: (As a Noun) A person who reports the misdemeanours, true or fictitious, of their friends, peers, relatives, etc. English = telltale, informer, pimp. Informal English = dobber.; (As a Noun) A person who tells other people things that you did not want them to know. Informal English = blabbermouth, big mouth.; (As a Noun) Especially in the Catholic religion, a religious act in which you tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness. English = confession.

confession.description: (As a Noun) A religious act in which you tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness. English = confession.; (As a Noun) A small room in a church where Christians, especially Roman Catholics, go to confess their sins. English = confessional.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness. English = confess. Idiomatic English = make a confession.

confidence.description: (As a Noun) The feeling of being sure of your own abilities, qualities, or ideas. English = confidence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel sure of your own abilities, qualities, or ideas. English = (be) confident

confidence%20(lose%20confidence).description: (As a Noun) The feeling of losing confidence in yourself. English = discouragement.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To lose your confidence in yourself; to make someone feel that way. English = (be) discouraged; discourage.

privacy.description: (As a Noun) The ability to do things alone without other people seeing or disturbing you. English = privacy.; (As a Noun) The ability to keep information about yourself and stop other people making the information public. English = privacy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be for the use of one person or group only, rather than for the general public. English = (be) private.

cowboy.description: (As a Noun) A book or film about life in the west of America in the nineteenth century. The story usually involves a lot of fighting and shooting. crack.description: (As a Noun) A line that appears on the surface of something when it is slightly damaged. English = crack.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become damaged with lines appearing on the surface. English = crack, become cracked.

English = seizure.; (As a Noun) The worry and tenseness you feel because of difficulties in your life. English = stress.

crash%20(vehicle).description: (General Definition) Of an object, to move forward until it encounters a barrier of some sort which causes it to stop, or any thing, action or state which can be easily extrapolated from this given an appropriate context. crawl.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move forward on your hands, elbows and knees usually because there is not enough headroom to walk. English = crawl, slither.

crawl%20(swimming).description: (As a Noun) The sport or recreation in which people move through the water by making movements with your arms and legs. English = overarm, crawl, Australian crawl.

crazy.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To talk or behave in a very strange or foolish way. English = (be) crazy, Idiomatic English = (be) out of one's mind.

crazy%20about.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very enthusiastic about and interested in something. Idiomatic English = crazy about.

credit%20card.description: (As a Noun) A plastic card that you can use to allow you to buy goods on credit or to borrow money. English = credit card.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use or swipe a credit card.

river.description: (General Definition) Something long and relatively narrow with two clearly defined sides that meanders into the distance or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context, especially a watercourse.; (As a Noun) A large amount of fresh water flowing continuously in a long line across the land. creme%20brulee.description:
(As a Noun) A dessert of cream custard with a topping of caramelised sugar. English = creme brulee; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword CREME BRULEE. danger.description: (As a Noun) The possibility that someone may be harmed or killed. English = danger.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able or likely to hurt or harm you. English = (be) dangerous.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very unpleasant or shocking. English = (be) horrendous.

denmark.description: (As a Noun) A country in northern Europe, on a peninsula north of Germany. English = Denmark.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be from or relate to Denmark. English = Danish.

dark.description: (As a Noun) The lack of light in a place. English = dark, darkness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a place or the sky, to become darker, for example because it is nearly night. English = darken.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a place or situation, to lack light and to be difficult to see in. English = (be) dark.

sweetheart.description: (As a Noun) Someone you love romantically, a boyfriend or a girlfriend. This sign is especially used for young people. English = sweetheart.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a romantic couple, to be girlfriend and boyfriend. This sign is especially used for young people. English = (be) sweethearts.

dart.description: (As a Noun) A small, narrow object with a sharp point which can be thrown or shot. English = dart.; (As a Noun) A game in which you throw darts at a round board which has numbers on it. English = darts.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To throw a dart.

darwin.description: (As a Noun) The capital city of the Northern Territory of Australia, called Darwin.; (Note) You will notice are several signs for "Darwin" in this dictionary. Though all have been marked for use Australia wide, it has not been possible to get agreement on which one (if any) is actually preferred by the majority of deaf signers in the Northern Territory itself. Also, there may be significant differences between indigenous and non-indigenous groups. So if you are talking to someone from the Northern Territory try to follow their lead.

dash%20lights.description: (As a Noun) The lights in the dashboard of a vehicle which illuminate the gauges and accessories. English = dash lights.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for DASH LIGHTS for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic). This suggested sign is a compound of IGNITION and LIGHT. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

dash%20off%20(speed).description: (As a Noun) The process of something becoming unable to be seen and disappearing by moving away into the distance at speed.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To disappear by moving away into the distance at speed. Idomatic English = disappear from sight, vanish from sight.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place quickly or suddenly. Idiomatic English = dash off, zoom off.

day.description: (As a Noun) One of the twenty-four hour periods of time in a week. English = day.; (As a Noun) A day considered as the time between when it gets light and the time when it gets dark. English = daytime, day.; (As a Noun) The particular day on which something happens. This can be expressed as the name of the day in the week, or the number of the day in the month and the number of the year. English = date.

daughter.description: (As a Noun) The female child of someone. English = daughter.

delay.description: (As a Noun) The start of an event later than was expected. English = delay.; (As a Noun) An extension in the time it usually takes to do something. English = delay, prolongation.; (As a Noun) The act of taking your time and spending more time than is necessary to do something or go somewhere. English = dawdling.

sunrise.description: (As a Noun) The time in the morning when the sky begins to grow light and then the sun first appears in the sky. English = sunrise, dawn, daybreak.; (As a Noun) The colours and light that you see in the eastern part of the sky when the sun first appears. English = sunrise.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the sun or moon, to appear from below the horizon. English = rise.

day%20(all%20day%20long).description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sign phrase, or immediately next to a verb sign, to mean that the action took place all through the period of a day. English = all day long.

daydream.description: (As a Noun) A series of pleasant thoughts, especially about things you would like to happen. English = daydream.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a series of pleasant thoughts, especially about things you would like to happen. English = daydream.

day%20(one%20day%20later).description: (As a Noun) A period of time which is at least one full day (twenty four hours) after the time of speaking.; (As a Noun) A period of time which is at least one full day (twenty four hours) after a reference time already established in the past or future.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean the action takes place one full day (twenty four hours) after the time of speaking or the reference time. English = one day later, a day from now, in a day's time.

day%20student.description: (As a Noun) A journey to and from a place; a person who does such a journey in a day; a person who does such a journey every day to work and back. English = round trip, return journey; day tripper; commuter.; (As a Noun) The movement to and fro between two locations (such as laps in a swimming pool).; (As a Noun) A ticket to travel somewhere and then to come back. English = return ticket.

day%20(the%20next%20day).description: (As a Noun) A period of time which is at least one full day (twenty four hours) after the time of speaking.; (As a Noun) A period of time which is at least one full day (twenty four hours) after a reference time already established in the past or future.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean the action takes place one full day (twenty four hours) after the time of speaking or the reference time. English = one day later, a day from now, in a day's time.

day%20tripper.description: (As a Noun) A journey to and from a place; a person who does such a journey in a day; a person who does such a journey every day to work and back. English = round trip, return journey; day tripper; commuter.; (As a Noun) The movement to and fro between two locations (such as laps in a swimming pool).; (As a Noun) A ticket to travel somewhere and then to come back. English = return ticket.

shine (reflect).description: (As a Noun) The bright or glassy appearance of an object because light bounces off it into your eyes. English = shine, shininess.; (As a Noun) The process by which light is sent back or bounces off a surface, particularly when it produces a clear image of the observer or another object. English = reflection.; (As a Noun) A hard, shiny silver-colored metal. English = chrome, chromium.

death.description: (As a Noun) The end of the life of a person or an animal. English = death.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people, plants, and animals, to stop living. English = die.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people, plants, and animals, to die as a result of an accident or as a result of very hard conditions. English = perish.

dead%20end.description: (General Definition) Something going up close to or hitting a large flat object, such as a wall or obstacle, or any action or any object that can be directly or indirectly associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A physical object that a person or vehicle is unable to go over, go around or pass through; or a non-physical thing (such as a law, rule or policy) that stops someone doing something. English = barrier, obstacle.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) Something that prevents two people or groups of people from agreeing, communicating, or working with each other. English = barrier, obstacle.

dead%20heat.description: (As a Noun) The condition of two things being exactly alike in all respects. English = identity.; (As a Noun) In a match or competition, an equal score between two people or two teams so that nobody wins. English = draw, tie; deuce (in tennis).; (As a Noun) The result when two competitors in a race both cross the finishing line at exactly the same time. English = dead heat.

deadline.description: (As a Noun) A time or a date before which a particular task must be finished. English = deadline, cut off, end.; (As a Noun) The greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible or allowed. English = limit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the last child in the order of siblings in a family. English = (be) last-born.

deaf.description: (As a Noun) A person or people who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well, especially the sounds of speech. English = a deaf person, deaf people, the deaf.; (As a Noun) A person or people who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well, especially the sounds of speech, who use sign language to communicate and who form and identify as a community. English = a Deaf person, the deaf, the Deaf.; (As a Noun) The condition of being deaf. English = deafness.

deaf%20and%20dumb.description: (As a Noun) A person who is unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech) and who tends not to use speech to communicate. English = a deaf person. Archaic English = a deaf and dumb person, a deaf mute person.; (As a Noun) People who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech) and who tend not to use speech to communicate. English = deaf people. Archaic English = deaf and dumb people, deaf mute people.; (As a Noun) People who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech), who tend not to use speech but use sign language instead. They form and identify as a community. English = the deaf, the Deaf. Archaic English = the deaf and dumb.

deaf%20club.description: (As a Noun) A club where people who are deaf meet and socialise; a deaf club.; (Note) An old fashioned sign.

deafen.description: (As a Noun) The gradual loss of hearing that a person can experience through aging or illness, leading to almost complete deafness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gradually lose your hearing through aging or illness so that you become almost totally deaf. English = lose hearing, become deaf, deafen

deaf%20mute.description: (As a Noun) A person who is unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech) and who tends not to use speech to communicate. English = a deaf person. Archaic English = a deaf and dumb person, a deaf mute person.; (As a Noun) People who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech) and who tend not to use speech to communicate. English = deaf people. Archaic English = deaf and dumb people, deaf mute people.; (As a Noun) People who are unable to hear anything or unable to hear very well (especially the sounds of speech), who tend not to use speech but use sign language instead. They form and identify as a community. English = the deaf, the Deaf. Archaic English = the deaf and dumb.

deaf%20(profound).description: (As a Noun) The degree and type of deafness that means one is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in one’s better ear. English = profound deafness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe a person who is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in their better ear. English = profoundly deaf.

deal%20(cards).description: (As a Noun) The giving out of cards to the players in a game of cards. English = deal.; (As a Noun) The person who gives out cards to the players in a game of cards. English = dealer.; (As a Noun) Thin pieces of cardboard with numbers or pictures printed on them which are used to play various games. English = cards, playing cards.

deal%20with.description: (As a Noun) The responsibility for and actions involved in controlling an organisation, business, or system. English = management.; (As a Noun) The person or people responsible for controlling an organisation, business, or system. English = manager, management; (As a Noun) The plans for an event or meeting to happen. English = arrangement, arrangements.

dear%20(costly).description: (As a Noun) The large amount of money that something costs. English = large expense, great expense.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cost a lot of money. English = (be) expensive, (be) dear, (be) costly.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be worth a lot of money. English = (be) valuable, (be) precious.

dear%20me%20(exclamation).description: (As a Noun) Extreme sadness, especially because someone has died. English = grief.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel very sad about something that has happened, especially if it involves the death of someone. Often you cannot talk to other people and struggle to control your emotions. English = grieve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not complain about something, even though it may be painful; to suffer something in silence. Formal English = (be) stoic. Idiomatic English = put up with something.

debone.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To remove the bones from meat, fish or chicken. English = debone.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for ‘debone’ (but signers can easily represent this visually using depicting signs in an appropriate context). The following signs or sign expressions are recommended for ‘debone’. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

debrief.description: (As a Noun) A meeting in which a report is given by a participant or participants of something that just happened.
