false%20teeth.description: (As a Noun) Artificial teeth used by people who no longer have all their own teeth. English = false teeth, dentures.

family.description: (As a Noun) A group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and children. English = family.; (As a Noun) All the people you are related to, not just your parents or your children. English = relatives, relations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to or concern families in general. Formal English = (be) familial.

know well.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To recognise someone or something or know about them well because you have seen, heard, or experienced them before. English = know well, (be) well-known, (be) familiar with.; (Interactive) Used alone in reply to someone who tells you something that is well-known to you already or mentions to you someone well-known to you as if you did not know them.

familiar%20with.description: (As a Noun) The condition of two things being exactly alike in all respects. English = identity.; (As a Noun) In a match or competition, an equal score between two people or two teams so that nobody wins. English = draw, tie; deuce (in tennis).; (As a Noun) The result when two competitors in a race both cross the finishing line at exactly the same time. English = dead heat.

fan.description: (As a Noun) A flat object you hold in your hand and wave in order to move the air and make yourself cooler. English = fan.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hold a flat object in your hand and to wave it in order to move the air and make yourself cooler. English = fan, fan oneself.

fan%20belt.description: (General Definition) Any object that meets this general description (a circular or elliptical strip), or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a fan belt.; (As a Noun) A belt in a car engine that drives the fan which keeps the engine cool. English = fan belt.

pattern.description: (As a Noun) An arrangement of lines or shapes, especially a design in which the same shape is repeated at regular intervals over a surface. English =  pattern.; (As a Noun) A pattern of flowers. English = floral pattern.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have or be an arrangement of lines or shapes, especially one in which the same shape is repeated at regular intervals over a surface. English = (be) patterned.

fan%20(supporter).description: (As a Noun) A person who shouts out to show they like someone, especially a sports team, and wants them to do well or win. English = barracker, supporter, fan.; (As a Noun) Something that prevents people or things from being harmed or damaged. English = protection, defence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To shout out to show you like someone, especially a sports team, and want them to do well or win. English = barrack for, support, (be) a fan of.

far%20apart.description: (As a Noun) The movement of two or more things away from each other so that they are no longer connected. English = separation.; (As a Noun) Of a married or de facto couple, the act of living apart and deciding to end the relationship. English = separation. Idiomatic English = break up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move apart from each other and no longer be connected. English = separate.

farm.description: (As a Noun) An area of land consisting of fields and some buildings, which is used for growing crops or raising animals. English = farm.; (As a Noun) A farm vehicle with large rear wheels that is used for ploughing fields, sowing crops, and pulling trailers. English = tractor.; (As a Noun) A large farming tool with sharp blades which is attached to a tractor or an animal such as a horse. It is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seed are planted. English = plough.

fart.description: (As a Noun) The effect that something has on your nose, especially if the effect is unpleasant. English = smell, odour.; (As a Noun) The act of forcing air out of your body through your anus, or the resulting unpleasantly smelling expelled air. English = fart.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an effect on your nose, especially if the effect is unpleasant. English = smell, (be) smelly.

fashion.description: (As a Noun) The area of activity that involves styles of clothing and appearance. English = fashion.; (As a Noun) A style of clothing or way of behaving that is popular at a particular time. English = fashion.; (As a Noun) In stories, a special power that can make apparently impossible things happen. English = magic.

fast.description: (As a Noun) The moving, doing or happening of something very quickly. English = speed, rapidity.; (As a Noun) The act of moving very fast in a vehicle, usually a car, so that you are over the legal speed limit. English = speeding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do something, or happen with great speed or very quickly. English = (be) fast, go fast, rush, speed.

fasten.description: (General Definition) The action of bringing two strip-like objects together, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, such as splicing film together, joining streamers and, particularly, joining up the two ends of a belt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To join up the two ends of a belt, strap, or some other similar device, so that the two ends are fixed to each other. English = fasten, buckle.

fast%20forward.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To make the tape on a video cassette recorder or similar machine go forward quickly so that you can play a different part of the tape. English = fast forward.

father%20christmas.description: (As a Noun) The Christian festival on the 25th of December when the birth of Jesus Christ is celebrated. English = Christmas.; (As a Noun) An imaginary old man with a long white beard and a red coat. Young children believe that he brings them their presents at Christmas. English = Santa Claus, Father Christmas.; (Augmented Meaning) A very long bushy beard.

father%20(priest).description: (As a Noun) A member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church. English = priest, father, (Anglican only) vicar.; (As a Noun) The officially appointed leaders of the religious activities of a particular church or temple; a member of this group. English = clergy; minister.; (As a Noun) A white collar that is worn by priest and ministers of the Christian Church. Informal English = dog-collar.

tired.description: (As a Noun) The feeling that you want to rest and sleep. English = tiredness, weariness, fatigue.; (As a Noun) The feeling that you want to rest and sleep or stop doing something because you are very tired or because you have lost interest and enthusiasm. English = weariness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel that you want to rest and sleep. English = (be) tired.

fax%20machine.description: (As a Noun) A letter or a picture of which you cause a copy to be made in a different place by inserting it inside a machine that sends information electronically along a telephone line to another machine in that different place. English = fax, facsimile.; (As a Noun) A machine that sends or receives information electronically along a telephone line to or from another such machine and makes copies of letters and pictures. English = fax, fax machine, facsimile machine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cause a machine to send electronic information along a telephone line about a letter or picture you insert into it to another such machine that makes a copy of it. English = fax.

fed%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have consumed enough food or drink. English = (be) full, (be) full up, (be) sated.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be as much as you need or want of something. English = (be) enough, (be) sufficient; suffice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be bored or annoyed. English = (be) fed up.

feed.description: (As a Noun) The act of giving food to a baby or an animal or to a person who is unable to eat without help. English = feeding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give food to a baby or an animal or to a person who is unable to eat without help. English = feed.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To supply food to your family or your community. English = feed.

feedback.description: (As a Noun) Comments you get about something that you have done or made. English = feedback.

feed%20(fowl).description: (General Definition) The act of repeatedly scattering handfuls of something piled up or held on your other hand, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially sowing seeds or feeding fowl.; (As a Noun) The act of spreading seeds across the ground in order to plant them there. English = sowing.; (As a Noun) Food that is given to an animal, particularly the seeds given to birds and poultry. English = feed, chicken feed.

feel.description: (As a Noun) An emotion or attitude. English = feeling, sensation, emotion.; (As a Noun) The way that someone thinks and reacts to events. English = feelings.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To experience an emotion or a sensation. English = feel, sense.

impression.description: (As a Noun) The vague idea that something is probably the case, but without being sure. English = impression.; (As a Noun) Your emotions, attitudes or physical sensations that you experience. English = feelings.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think that something is probably the case, but without being sure. English = feel. Idiomatic English = have the impression.

foot.description: (As a Noun) The part of your body which is at the end of your leg and which you stand on. English = foot (singular), feet (plural).

felling%20(trees).description: (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees. English = felling.; (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees in order to sell the wood. English = logging.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut through the trunk of a tree with an axe so that it falls to the ground. English = chop down, fell.

fell%20(tree).description: (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees. English = felling.; (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees in order to sell the wood. English = logging.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut through the trunk of a tree with an axe so that it falls to the ground. English = chop down, fell.

lady.description: (As a Noun) A polite way of referring to an adult female human being (woman). English = lady.; (As a Noun) A woman who behaves in a polite, dignified, and graceful way; or a woman from a privileged background. English = lady.; (As a Noun) The translation equivalent of the formal title 'Lady' (the female equivalent of 'Sir'). English = Lady.

feminist.description: (As a Noun) A person who believes that women should have the same rights, power, and opportunities as men. English = feminist.; (As a Noun) The belief that women should have the same rights, power, and opportunities as men. English = feminism.

ferris%20wheel.description: (As a Noun) At a fair, a device which people ride for fun which is made of a large wheel rotating vertically with seats attached around its rim.  English = Ferris wheel.; (As a Noun) A large annual fair or show in any one of the state capitals of Australia in which there is a competitive display of farm produce and livestock and amusement rides. Australian English = show.

fetch.description: (As a Noun) A substantial sum of money that you get, receive or collect at one time, such as a superannuation payout, a redundancy package, or an inheritance.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that is paid as a large amount on a single occasion rather than as smaller amounts on several separate occasions. English = lump sum.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go and get something or someone and bring them to where you are. English = fetch, collect.

fever.description: (As a Noun) If you have a FEVER when you are ill, your body temperature is higher than usual (37.5 degrees Celsius) and your heart beats faster.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for FEVER. If you know a sign for FEVER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

few.description: (As a Noun) A small number of things or people. English = few.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the number of things or people, to be smaller than desirable or than was expected. English = (be) few.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb or in an phrase to mean that the action does not occur very often. English = rarely, seldom.

goalkeeper.description: (As a Noun) The player in a sports team, especially a soccer team, whose job is to guard the goal. English = goalkeeper. Informal English = goalie.; (As a Noun) In cricket, a player who is fielding (rather than bowling or keeping the wicket) or one who has particular skill at fielding. English = fielder.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To guard the goal in a game, especially soccer.

field%20glasses.description: (As a Noun) An instrument which is made up of two small telescopes joined together side by side, which you look through in order to see things which are a long way away. English = binoculars, field glasses.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look through binoculars, or to adjust them so that you can clearly see the thing you want to look at.

fifteen.description: (As a Noun) The number 15, between 14 and 16. English = fifteen.

fifth.description: (As Modifier) Of a sequence of numbers or things, the one which is between four (fourth) and six (sixth) in that sequence. English = fifth.

fifth%20(fraction).description: (As a Noun) One of five equal parts of an amount of something or an object. English = one fifth.

fifth%20(list).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be number 5 in a series of things; to be fifth.

fig.description: (As a Noun) A soft, sweet fruit full of tiny seeds. It grows on trees in hot countries. English = fig.

figure%20(body%20shape).description: (As a Noun) The appearance of the outside edges of a person, usually a woman. English = figure.; (As a Noun) The appearance of the outside edges of an object. English = figure, shape.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Particularly of women, to have an attractive figure. English = (be) shapely.

figure%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, a geometric form consisting of a combination of points, lines or planes, such as a line, triangle, square or sphere.; (As a Noun) Any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number. English = figure.

figure%20(number).description: (As a Noun) Any of the signs such as 'two', 'nine', 'eleven' or the written symbols such as 1, 3, 47. You use them to say how many things you are referring to or where something comes in a series. English = number, figure.; (As a Noun) The amount of something that you can measure or count. English = quantity, number.; (As a Noun) Any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number. English = figure.

figure%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about a mystery or a problem and solve it or understand it. English = work out, figure out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In an educational context (e.g., essay or exam), to make an examination and judgement of a situation or of a person's work or ideas. English = criticise. Formal English = critique.

figures%20(numbers).description: (As a Noun) The part of mathematics that is concerned with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of numbers. English = arithmetic.; (As a Noun) Simple calculations in arithmetic. English = sums.; (As a Noun) Particular amounts of something expressed as numbers that are written down. English = figures.

file.description: (As a Noun) A box or a folded piece of card in which someone keeps documents that belong together. English = file.; (As a Noun) The special arrangement of things that is made according to certain principles which puts one thing or type of thing first, another thing or type of thing second, and so on. English = order, sequence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a document away in its correct file; to sort documents; to put documents away in a filing cabinet. English = file.

philippines.description: (As a Noun) An island country on the western side of the Pacific Ocean in East Asia. English = the Philippines.; (As a Noun) A person from the Philippines. English = Filipino.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To come from or relate to the Philippines. English = (be) Filipino.

filler.description: (General Definition) The action of applying something to the surface of something, such as a liquid with a swab, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a filler.; (As a Noun) In car mechanics and panel beating, a substance used for filling cracks or holes, especially in car bodies. English = filler.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In car mechanics and panel beating, to fill a crack or hole in the body of a car with filler.

fill%20in.description: (General Definition) To put or place something at various places on a vertical surface starting at the top and working down towards the bottom, e.g., information on a form (sheet of paper or computer screen) or anything or any action that can be directly, indirectly or metaphorically associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A formal, written request for something, often a job, which is made by writing a letter or completing a form. English = application.; (As a Noun) A written proposal or application which can be sent to someone so that they can decide whether to accept it or not. English = submission.

filling%20(tooth).description: (As a Noun) A person who is qualified to treat people's teeth. English = dentist.; (As a Noun) A small amount of metal or plastic that a dentist puts in a hole in a tooth. English = filling.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a filling in a tooth.

fill%20out.description: (General Definition) To put or place something at various places on a vertical surface starting at the top and working down towards the bottom, e.g., information on a form (sheet of paper or computer screen) or anything or any action that can be directly, indirectly or metaphorically associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A formal, written request for something, often a job, which is made by writing a letter or completing a form. English = application.; (As a Noun) A written proposal or application which can be sent to someone so that they can decide whether to accept it or not. English = submission.

fill%20up.description: (General Definition) The action of the upper level of the contents of a cylindrical container, such as a cup, rising so that there is no more room to put any more into it, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a large amount of something, especially a liquid, into a cylindrical container so that there is no more room to put any more into it; to fill a cup, glass, mug, etc. English = fill, fill up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a cup or any cylindrical object, to be unable to take any more of a substance or, especially, a liquid . English = (be) full.

hero.description: (As a Noun) The main character in a book, play or film, who is admired or respected for their good qualities; someone who has done something brave or good. English = hero (male or female), heroine (female only).; (As a Noun) A famous actor, musician or sports player. English = star.

filter.description: (As a Noun) A device which is designed to remove particles from it. English = filter.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pass a substance through a device which is designed to remove particles from it. English = filter.

final.description: (As a Noun) The last game or contest in a competition or sporting event. English = final.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be last in a series of things or events. English = (be) final.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To complete all the arrangements for something. English = finalise.

last.description: (As a Noun) The thing or part that comes at the end of something. English = the last.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be at the end of something, such as a series of numbers. English = (be) last, (be) final.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the only thing that remains after all the others have gone. English = (be) last.

fin%20(dorsal%20fin).description: (As a Noun) A very large fish with sharp teeth. It sometimes attacks people. English = shark.; (As a Noun) A flat object that sticks out the back of some fish. It helps the fish swim and keep its balance. English = dorsal fin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) (Of fish with dorsal fins) to travel through water close to the surface with the dorsal fin sticking out of the water.

find%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To notice someone doing something wrong or doing something secretly. English = catch, discover. Idiomatic English = find out, catch out, spring.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be noticed by someone else doing something secretly or wrong. English = (be) discovered, (be) caught. Idiomatic English = (be) found out, (be) caught out, (be) sprung.

fine%20(ok).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be satisfactory or acceptable. English = (be) fine, (be) okay.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to a question about how you are going or if you have any problems to mean everything is alright. English = 'Fine, thanks!', 'Okay.'

fine%20(penalty).description: (General Definition) The act of striking something with a stick or stick-like object.; (As a Noun) The act of punishing a child or a student by hitting them, usually on the palm, with a cane. English = caning.; (As a Noun) The act of punishing someone. English = punishment.

finger.description: (As a Noun) One of the four long jointed parts at the end of your hand.

fingernail.description: (As a Noun) The thin hard areas on the ends of your fingers. English = fingernail.; (Note) Please do a keyword search for ‘body parts’ for more information about signs for body parts in Auslan.

flea.description: (As a Noun) A very small jumping insect that feeds on the blood of humans and animals. English = flea.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To kill a flea by crushing it between your finger or fingernails.

fingerprint.description: (As a Noun) A mark made by your finger that shows the lines on your skin. English = fingerprint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take someone's fingerprints by pressing their fingers on to an inky pad and then on to paper, so that you can see what their fingerprints look like. English = fingerprint.

fingerspelling.description: (As a Noun) A conventional use of handshapes (usually involving both hands) to form the letters of the alphabet with which to spell out words on the hands. English = fingerspelling.; (As a Noun) The correct order of letters in a word, represented by fingerspelling, writing or speaking. English = spelling.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a conventional arrangement of handshapes (usually involving both hands) to form the letters of the alphabet with which you can spell out words on your hands. English = fingerspell.

finish%20(cigarette).description: (As a Noun) The period of time it takes to smoke a cigarette down to the butt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smoke a cigarette down to the butt.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone to wait until you have finished your cigarette before you do something.

finish%20(drink).description: (As a Noun) The reduction in the level or amount of a liquid in a container, especially by drinking it empty.; (As a Noun) The time it takes to drink a container of liquid dry; the time it takes for you to finish your drink.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of liquid in a container, to be reduced in amount or lowered in level, especially so that it is emptied.

finish%20(not%20finish).description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb or adjective to mean the action or the quality does not happen or exist at the time specified or understood. English = not, don't, doesn't, didn't.

size.description: (As a Noun) The measure of bigness or smallness of a container of something. English = size.; (As a Noun) A set upper boundary beyond which a amount or size of something cannot go. English = limit.; (As a Noun) An official rule that limits what you can do or that limits the amount or size of something. English = restriction.

finland.description: (As a Noun) A country in northern Europe, between Sweden and Russia. English = Finland.

fire%20alarm.description: (As a Noun) A device fixed to the ceiling of a room which makes a loud noise (or causes lights to flash) if there is smoke in the air, to warn people. English = smoke alarm, smoke detector.

fire%20brigade.description: (As a Noun) The organisation that puts out fires. English = fire brigade.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to put out fires and to rescue people who are trapped, for example in burning buildings or cars. English = firefighter; (Note) The movement may also go in the opposite direction (from the front of the head to the back of the head) without any change in meaning.

fire%20extinguisher.description: (As a Noun) A FIRE EXTINGUISHER is a metal container with water or chemicals inside  which is used to stop a fire.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term FIRE EXTINGUISHER. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for FIRE EXTINGUISHER (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for FIRE EXTINGUISHER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

fire brigade.description: (As a Noun) The organisation that puts out fires. English = fire brigade.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to put out fires and to rescue people who are trapped, for example in burning buildings or cars. English = firefighter; (Note) The movement may also go in the opposite direction (from the front of the head to the back of the head) without any change in meaning.

fire%20(gun).description: (As a Noun) A weapon consisting mainly of a metal tube from which bullets are fired. English = gun.; (As a Noun) A kind of a gun that you hold in your hand. English = revolver, pistol.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a gun or a revolver. English = shoot, fire.

firefighter.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job is to put out fires and to rescue people who are trapped, for example in burning buildings or cars. English = firefighter, fireman.; (As a Noun) The organisation that puts out fires. English = fire brigade.

firm%20(business).description: (As a Noun) The name plate or plaque of a firm, company, business, practise or partnership on a wall or outside a business.; (As a Noun) A firm, company, business, practise or partnership, especially one that is identified by a name plate or plaque on a wall or outside a business. English = firm, company.; (As a Noun) A large building or group of buildings where machines are used to make goods in large quantities. English = factory.

firm%20(hard).description: (As a Noun) A substance which is hard and firm and remains the same shape whether it is in a container or not. English = solid.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a substance, to be hard and firm and to remain the same shape whether it is in a container or not. English = (be) solid.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a substance, to feel very firm when you touch it and not to be easily bent, cut, or broken. English = (be) hard, (be) rigid, (be) firm.

hardness.description: (As a Noun) The feeling of something that is not easily bent, cut or broken. English = hardness, firmness.; (As a Noun) A condition or way of life which is not easy, but severe and difficult. English = harshness.; (As a Noun) The lack of ease or problem you have in doing something. English = difficulty.

first.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the thing, person, event or period of time that happens or comes before all the others of the same kind. English = (be) first.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the first of a kind of thing to have ever existed, to be genuine and not a copy. English = (be) original.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be in a state or condition of having had nothing changed or altered since it was first created. English = (be) original.

first%20aid.description: (As a Noun) Simple medical treatment which is given as soon as possible to a person who is injured or who has suddenly become ill. English = first aid.

original.description: (As a Noun) A person, thing or event that comes before all the others of the same kind; the first thing. English = original.; (As a Noun) Of a group of siblings, the child who is the oldest. English = first-born.; (As a Noun) A thing of a particular type that you like most or best; a favourite thing.

first%20class.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very good, especially when compared to any one or anything else of its type. English = (be) outstanding, (be) exceptional.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be of very good quality and of a high social status. English = (be) high-class, (be) first class.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be particularly attractive and desirable. English = (be) sexy.

first%20(every%20first).description: (As a Noun) Each and every first unit of time in a cycle. Most commonly used for the first day of the month.; (As Modifier) Used in a sentence (immediately next to a verb, or at the beginning or end of the sentence) to mean that the action happens every first one of a unit of time which has already been established (day, week, month, semester, year, etc.) in a cycle.

first%20(list).description: (As a Noun) A person, thing or event that comes before all the others of the same kind; the first thing.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the person, thing or event that happens or comes before all the others of the same kind. English = (be) first.

first%20(of%20all).description: (As Modifier) You use this sign when you are about to mention a series of items, starting with the first; or when you are sequencing actions, events or ideas in a chronological or logical order. English = first of all.

first%20(of%20month).description: (As a Noun) The first day of the month.; (As a Noun) The first hour of a twelve hour cycle. English = one o'clock.

fish.description: (As a Noun) Creatures that live in water and have tails and fins. English = fish.; (As a Noun) The flesh of fish eaten as food. English = fish.; (As a Noun) Shellfish such as mussels, lobsters, crabs, and other sea creatures that you can eat. English = seafood.

fish%20and%20chips.description: (As a Noun) An Anglo-Australian fast food consisting of fish covered with batter and deep fried together with deep fried potato chips. English = fish and chips.

fishing.description: (As a Noun) The sport or hobby of catching fish. English = fishing.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To try to catch fish, either as a sport or for food.

fishing%20hook.description: (As a Noun) The condition of taking harmful drugs and being unable to stop taking them. English = addiction.; (As a Noun) A hook used for catching fish. English = fishing hook, hook.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be unable to stop taking a harmful drug. English = (be) addicted. Idiomatic English = (be) hooked on.

fishing%20rod.description: (As a Noun) A round device on a fishing-rod that you use to control the length of the fishing line. four-cylinder%20engine.description: (As a Noun) A car engine that has four pistons; a four-cylinder engine.

four-poster%20bed.description: (As a Noun) The wooden or metal frame that holds up a bed. English = bedframe.; (As a Noun) A piece of furniture that you lie on when you sleep. English = bed.; (As a Noun) A large old-fashioned bed that has a tall post at each corner and curtains that can be drawn around it. English = four-poster bed.

fours.description: (As a Noun) In lawn bowls, a competition in which there are four players on each team. English = fours.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a number or amount four times larger. English = quadruple.

fourteen.description: (As a Noun) The number 14, between 13 and 15. English = fourteen.

fourth.description: (As Modifier) Of a sequence of numbers or things, the one which is between three (third) and five (fifth) in that sequence. English = fourth.

fourth%20born.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a phrase to mean that what you are talking about is the fourth of four, or the fourth in a series. It is often used to relate siblings in a family to each other. English = fourthly, the fourth is, the fourth-born is.

fourth%20(every%20fourth).description: (As a Noun) Each and every week which is the fourth week in a cycle (usually of four weeks), or each and every unit of time which is the fourth unit in a cycle.; (As Modifier) Used in a sentence (immediately next to a verb, or at the beginning or end of the sentence) to mean that the action happens every fourth unit of time which has already been established (day, week, month, semester, year, etc.). Most commonly refers to weeks, i.e., every four weeks or monthly.

fourth%20(list).description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a phrase to mean that what you are talking about is the fourth of four, or the fourth in a series. It is often used to relate siblings in a family to each other. English = fourthly, the fourth is, the fourth-born is.

fourthly.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a phrase to mean that what you are talking about is the fourth of four, or the fourth in a series. It is often used to relate siblings in a family to each other. English = fourthly, the fourth is, the fourth-born is.

wolf.description: (As a Noun) A wild animal that looks like a dog with a long muzzle that kills and eats other animals. English = wolf.; (As a Noun) A wild animal that looks like a small dog with a long muzzle that kills and eats other animals. English = fox.; (As a Noun) That part of the face of many animals, such as dogs, wolves and foxes, that sticks out a long way and contains its nose and mouth. English = muzzle.

fraction.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, an exact division of a number. It is written with one number under another with a line separating them. Examples include 1/2 and 1/3. English = fraction.

fracture.description: (As a Noun) A FRACTURE is a slight crack or break in something, especially a bone. If something such as a bone is FRACTURED or FRACTURES, it gets a slight crack or break in it.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for FRACTURE. If you know a sign for FRACTURE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

fragrance.description: (As a Noun) A smell which is beautiful or lovely. English = fragrance, perfume, scent.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smell good or lovely, to have a sweet or pleasant smell. English = (be) fragrant, (be) scented, (be) perfumed.

weakling.description: (As a Noun) A person who is physically weak. English = weakling.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not have very much strength or energy. English = (be) weak, (be) frail.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be easily influenced by other people. English = (be) weak.

border.description: (General Definition) Any rectangular object with a border running around the edge, such as a window, door or picture frame, or any thing or any action that can be directly or indirectly associated with this sign in a given context.; (As a Noun) A strip or band around the edge of something. English = border.; (As a Noun) A hollow structure inside which you can fit something such as a window, door, or picture. English = frame.

france.description: (As a Noun) A country in Western Europe between Germany and Spain, and across the Channel from England. English = France.; (As a Noun) The language spoken in France as well as in some other countries such as Canada, Belgium and Switzerland. English = French.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be from or relate to France. English = (be) French

freckles.description: (As a Noun) Small, light brown spots on someone's skin, especially on their face. English = freckles.; (As a Noun) Small red spots, especially on your face. English = pimples, spots.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have small, light brown spots on your skin, especially on your face. English = have freckles, (be) freckled.

free.description: (As a Noun) The state of being able to say and do what you want to. English = freedom. Formal English = liberty.; (As a Noun) A person who has left his or her job and has stopped working altogether, usually because of age. English = retiree.; (As a Noun) The period of time after which a person who has left his or her job and has stopped working altogether, usually because of age. English = retirement.

free%20(available).description: (As a Noun) The state of being free to be used or obtained. English = availability.; (As a Noun) A job that is not being done by anyone and which people can apply for; a room at a hotel or guest house that is not occupied and is available for people to stay in. English = vacancy.; (As a Noun) Of a person, the state of not being busy so that you can do something or meet someone. English = availability.

free%20(liberate).description: (As a Noun) The setting free of a person or animal, especially a person from gaol. English = release, freeing, liberation.; (As a Noun) The escape of someone from bondage, or the saving of someone. Formal English = deliverance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To no longer be a prisoner or a slave, and to be unrestricted, uncontrolled, or unlimited in what you can do; of a person, to be released from gaol. English = (be) freed, (be) released, (be) liberated.

free (without cost).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be available to someone without them having to pay for it. English = (be) free.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be done willingly and because you choose to do it and not because you have been forced to do it. English = (be) voluntary.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action is done without any cost. English = freely.

free%20(voluntary).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be available to someone without them having to pay for it. English = (be) free.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be done willingly and because you choose to do it and not because you have been forced to do it. English = (be) voluntary.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action is done without any cost. English = freely.

free%20(without%20cost).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be available to someone without them having to pay for it. English = (be) free.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be done willingly and because you choose to do it and not because you have been forced to do it. English = (be) voluntary.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action is done without any cost. English = freely.

ice.description: (As a Noun) A solid which is only a solid and not a liquid because it is very cold and frozen.; (As a Noun) Water that is solid because it is very cold and frozen. English = ice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a liquid, to become solid because it is very cold, especially water turning to ice. English = freeze.

often.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence or, more usually, immediately next to a verb to mean that the action happens many times or much of the time. English = often, frequently.

purity.description: (As a Noun) Extreme purity, cleanliness and freshness.; (As a Noun) Total cleanliness and freedom from germs. English = sterility.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be extremely pure and clean, like it has never been used before. English = (be) pristine.

friday.description: (As a Noun) The last day of the working week, between Thursday and Saturday. English = Friday.

refrigerator.description: (As a Noun) A large container which is kept cool inside, usually by electricity, so that the food and drink in it stays fresh. English = refrigerator. Informal English = fridge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open and close the door on a refrigerator.

friendship%20ring.description: (As a Noun) A ring worn by a teenage couple to show that they are dating each other, are special friends, or have a romantic interest in each other. English = friendship ring.

goose pimples.description: (As a Noun) The condition of your skin when you are cold or scared. The hairs on your skin stand up so that it is covered with tiny bumps. English = goose pimples, goose bumps. British English = goose flesh.; (As a Noun) A sudden feeling of great excitement and pleasure. English = thrill. Literary English = frisson.; (As a Noun) A sudden feeling of fear. English = horrors, scare, terror. Idiomatic English = shivers down one's spine, cold shivers, cold sweat. Informal English = the creeps, the heebie-jeebies.

frog.description: (As a Noun) A small creature with smooth skin, big eyes, and long back legs which it uses for jumping. They often live near water. English = frog.

from.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be born at or have spent most your life in a place; to come come a place. English = (be) from.; (As Modifier) Used after some verbs (action signs) and before a sign of location or time to indicate where or when the action began. English = from, since.

from%20here%20to%20there.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action takes place from one specified point in time to another later specified point in time. English = from then to then.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action starts in one place and goes to another specified place. English = from here to there.; (As Modifier) Used next to a sign for an object, to mean the relative dimensions of the object start at one point and go to another point. English = from here to there.

from%20then%20on.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a greater amount or number of something than before. English = (be) more.; (As Modifier) Used after a verb sign to mean that the action happens to a greater extent or continues to happen. English = more, and so on.; (As Modifier) Used to introduce a piece of information which supports or emphasises the point you are making. English = what is more, moreover.

from%20then%20to%20then.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action takes place from one specified point in time to another later specified point in time. English = from then to then.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action starts in one place and goes to another specified place. English = from here to there.; (As Modifier) Used next to a sign for an object, to mean the relative dimensions of the object start at one point and go to another point. English = from here to there.

from-to.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action takes place from one specified point in time to another later specified point in time. English = from then to then.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence, or immediately next to a verb, to mean the action starts in one place and goes to another specified place. English = from here to there.; (As Modifier) Used next to a sign for an object, to mean the relative dimensions of the object start at one point and go to another point. English = from here to there.

front.description: (As a Noun) The part of something that faces you or faces forward, or that you normally see or use. English = front.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located in that part of a thing (classroom, theatre, car, etc) which is as far as you can go and still face the direction in which most people normally sit or in which the thing normally moves. English = (be) in the front.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a difficult situation or something unpleasant, to not avoid it but to accept it and try to cope with it. English = face, front up to.

front%20up%20to.description: (As a Noun) The part of something that faces you or faces forward, or that you normally see or use. English = front.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located in that part of a thing (classroom, theatre, car, etc) which is as far as you can go and still face the direction in which most people normally sit or in which the thing normally moves. English = (be) in the front.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a difficult situation or something unpleasant, to not avoid it but to accept it and try to cope with it. English = face, front up to.

fruit.description: (As a Noun) Something that grows on a tree or a bush and which contains seeds or a stone covered by a substance that you can eat. Examples include apples, oranges, grapes, and bananas. English = fruit.

saucepan.description: (General Definition) The action of holding on to something like a stick or a long handle and moving it back and forth repeatedly in front of you, such as poking a fire and, especially, holding and agitating a pan over a fire or stove.; (As a Noun) A deep metal cooking pot, usually with a long handle and a lid. English = saucepan.; (As a Noun) A flat shallow metal pan with a long handle in which you fry food. English = frying pan.

frying%20pan.description: (General Definition) The action of holding on to something like a stick or a long handle and moving it back and forth repeatedly in front of you, such as poking a fire and, especially, holding and agitating a pan over a fire or stove.; (As a Noun) A deep metal cooking pot, usually with a long handle and a lid. English = saucepan.; (As a Noun) A flat shallow metal pan with a long handle in which you fry food. English = frying pan.

fuck%20(sexual%20act).description: (As a Noun) A sexual act between two people, especially sex which involves penetration with a penis. A crude and silly sign which most signers find offensive and associate with sniggering adolescents. English = fuck.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have sex with someone, especially sex which involves penetration with a penis. A crude and silly sign which most signers find offensive and associate with sniggering adolescents. English = fuck.; (Note) This is considered by most Auslan signers to be a vulgar sign. If you do not want to appear ignorant or childish use one of the neutral signs listed in this dictionary for this sexual act. They can be found by searching for the keyword ‘intercourse’.

fuckup%20(stupid%20mistake).description: (As a Noun) Behaviour which is foolish or childish. English = silliness.; (As a Noun) Language or behaviour which is rude and offensive. English = crudeness, grossness, coarseness.; (As a Noun) A serious and stupid mess, muddle or mistake. Vulgar English = fuckup.

fuel%20hose.description: (General Definition) A combination of the Auslan sign PETROL + HOSEPIPE.; (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the hose that carries fuel from the fuel tank to the engine. English = fuel hose.; (Note) Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf

fuel%20line.description: (General Definition) A combination of the Auslan sign PETROL + HOSEPIPE.; (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the hose that carries fuel from the fuel tank to the engine. English = fuel hose.; (Note) Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf

fuel%20pump.description: (General Definition) A representation of somethng being injected into a round object, such as a fuel line or hose.; (As a Noun) The device in an engine that moves petrol from the petrol tank to the engine. English = fuel pump.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for FUEL PUMP for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for FUEL PUMP used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

fuel%20tank.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the container that holds fuel. English = fuel tank, petrol tank.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign PETROL and a depiction of a square or rectangular object, such as a container or tank. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

full-forward.description: (As a Noun) In Australian rule football, the central position on the forward line nearest to the goal which is being attacked. English = full-forward.; (As a Noun) The player occupying the central position on the forward line nearest to the goal which is being attacked. English = full-forward.

full%20(sated).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have consumed enough food or drink. English = (be) full, (be) full up, (be) sated.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be as much as you need or want of something. English = (be) enough, (be) sufficient; suffice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be bored or annoyed. English = (be) fed up.

full%20stop.description: (As a Noun) The dot (.) which you put as a punctuation mark at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation. English = full stop, period.; (As a Noun) The reason, purpose, or use of something. English = point.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a dot at the end of a sentence.

full-time.description: (As a Noun) The end of the match in some sports such as football, hockey, and rugby. English = full-time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of work or study, to take up the whole of each normal working week rather than just a part of it. English = (be) full-time.

vapour.description: (As a Noun) A mass of tiny drops of water, other liquids, or tiny particles in the air, which rise up from something. English = vapour.; (As a Noun) Gas and small bits of solid material that are sent into the air when something burns. English = smoke.; (As a Noun) A mass of tiny drops of water that rise up from very hot or boiling water. English = steam.

function%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, a relation or expression involving one or more variables. English = function.

funds.description: (As a Noun) The amount of money that is available for spending on something or is given by organisations or governments to be spent on something. English = funds, funding.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that the government gives to a person or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education, welfare, or home improvements. English = grant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To provide money to be spent on something. English = fund.

fund%20raise.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job is to travel around and collect donations of money from people (usually from their homes or place of employment), especially for an organisation of the deaf. English = collector.; (As a Noun) An organisation that raises money to help people who are ill, handicapped, or very poor. English = charity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel around and collect donations of money from people (usually from their homes or place of employment), especially for an organisation of the deaf. English = collect, fund raise.

fund%20raising.description: (As a Noun) The activity of bringing together things from different places. English = collection.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do. English = profit.; (As a Noun) The money you get for performing work or providing a service. English = earnings.

fur.description: (General Definition) The action of stroking something around your neck and shoulders, such as the large collar of a coat, a feather boa or a scarf, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially fur or a fur coat.; (As a Noun) The thick hair that grows on the bodies of many animals together with their skin that is used to make clothing or rugs. English = fur.; (As a Noun) An item of clothing made out of fur. English = fur, fur coat.

fussy.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be excessively nervous and concerned with details, or careful in choosing things; to be difficult to please and only like a small range of things. English = (be) fussy, (be) picky, (be) choosy.

future.description: (As a Noun) The period of time that will come after the present, or the things that will happen then. English = future.; (As Modifier) Used after time signs and/or at the beginning or end of a sentence to place the time frame (tense) of the actions in the future sometime.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence to tell someone that that is what you want or expect to happen from now on. English = in the future.

g.description: (As a Noun) The letter G in the two-handed manual alphabet.

gadabout.description: (As a Noun) A person who continually and restlessly goes out of the home to seek amusement and to socialise. English = gadabout.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go out and socialise a lot; to continually and restlessly seek amusement out of the home. English = gadabout.

gag%20(joke).description: (As a Noun) Something that is said or done to make you laugh, for example a funny story. English = joke, gag.; (As a Noun) A person who tells jokes. English = joker.; (As a Noun) In a pack of cards, a card which does not belong to any of the four suits. English = joker.

gale.description: (As a Noun) A very strong wind. English = gale.; (As a Noun) A very strong, sudden and short lived wind. English = gust.; (As a Noun) A very violent storm. Formal literary English = tempest.

gallaudet%20university.description: (As a Noun) An ASL sign for a university for the Deaf in Washington, D.C., USA, called Gallaudet University.

gallbladder.description: (As a Noun) Your GALLBLADDER is the organ in your body which contains bile and is next to your liver.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GALLBLADDER. If you know a sign for GALLBLADDER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

galloping.description: (As a Noun) The action of a horse running very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time in each stride. English = galloping.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a horse, to run very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time in each stride. English = gallop.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of any four legged animal, to run fast.

gaming%20card.description: (As a Noun) Thin pieces of cardboard with numbers or pictures printed on them which are used to play various games. English = card, gaming card, playing card.; (As a Noun) A pack or set of playing cards. English = deck of cards.; (As a Noun) A game played using cards; a card game; a game of cards.

gamma.description: (As a Noun) The third letter of the Greek alphabet, written γ in lower case, called “gamma”. It is used as a symbol in mathematics and scientific notation, often to mean the third in a series of items or categories. English = gamma.

ganache.description: (As a Noun) A rich icing or coating for cakes and sweets, made by melting chocolate with cream. English = ganache.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword GANACHE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GANACHE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for GANACHE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

jail.description: (As a Noun) A special place where people are kept locked up, usually because they have been found guilty of a crime. English = jail, gaol, prison.; (As a Noun) A person who is locked up in a prison. English = prisoner, inmate.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put someone into a special place where they are kept locked up, usually because they have been found guilty of a crime. English = jail, gaol, imprison.

garden.description: (As a Noun) A piece of land next to someone's house where they grow flowers, vegetables, or other plants, and which often includes a lawn. English = garden.; (As a Noun) A place like a park that has areas of plants, trees, and grass. English = garden, gardens.

garlic.description: (As a Noun) The small round white bulb of an onion-like plant. It has a very strong smell and taste and is used in cooking. English = garlic.; (As a Noun) Breath which smells bad, bad breath.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a strong or foul-smelling breath, to have bad breath.

garlic%20press.description: (As a Noun) A small device in which you place a clove of garlic and then press or squeeze it closed in order to crush it and force it out minced. English = garlic press.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To mince garlic into very small pieces using a garlic press. English = mince.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for MINCE GARLIC (but  signers can represent this visually using depicting signs in context). This suggested sign depicts holding two parts of a garlic press and pressing it together, then a depiction of something emerging from it in pieces. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.

sprinkle.description: (General Definition) The act of sprinkling something over a large flat object, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, for example sprinkling garnish on food.; (As a Noun) A small amount of food that has been scattered over a larger piece of food for flavour or decoration, especially topping on a pizza. English = garnish,  topping.; (As a Noun) A flat, round piece of dough covered with tomatoes, cheese, and other kinds of food, and then baked in an oven. English = pizza.

garter%20stitch.description: (As a Noun) In knitting, a simple, plain stitch. English = plain stitch, garter stitch.

petrol.description: (As a Noun) A liquid which is used as a fuel for motor vehicles. English = petrol.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fill up the fuel tank a motor vehicle with petrol.

gastroenteritis.description: (As a Noun) GASTROENTERITIS is an illness in which the lining of your stomach and intestines becomes swollen and painful.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GASTROENTERITIS. If you know a sign for GASTROENTERITIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

gauge.description: (As a Noun) An instrument such as a clock or meter that shows you the amount or measurement of something. English = dial, meter, gauge.; (As a Noun) On an instrument such as a clock, meter, or compass, the indicator which shows you the time, measurement or direction. English = dial, needle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a dial or gauge, to move to and fro, to oscillate.

homosexual.description: (As a Noun) A person who is sexually attracted to someone of the same sex. English = homosexual, gay man, gay person.; (As a Noun) Sexual attraction to persons of the same sex. English = homosexuality.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be sexually attracted to someone of the same sex. English = (be) gay, (be) homosexual.

gaze.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your visual attention fixed on one thing or area, and then to move your visual attention from that thing or area suddenly and completely to another area, usually requiring you to turn your head at the same time.

gear%20lever.description: (As a Noun) A car in which the gears are changed by hand. English = manual car.; (As a Noun) A transmission (gear changing mechanism) in a car which is operated by hand. English = manual transmission.; (As a Noun) The lever in a car that you use to change gears. English = gearshift, gear-stick, gear lever.

manual car.description: (As a Noun) A car in which the gears are changed by hand. English = manual car.; (As a Noun) A transmission (gear changing mechanism) in a car which is operated by hand. English = manual transmission.; (As a Noun) The lever in a car that you use to change gears. English = gearshift, gear-stick, gear lever.

twins.description: (As a Noun) Two people who have the same mother and were born on the same day. English = twins.; (As a Noun) A constellation and star sign of the Zodiac (the Twins). English = Gemini.

general.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that belongs or relates to the whole of something rather than to its details or parts. English = (be) general.

general%20practice.description: (As a Noun) A doctor, or the type of work of such a doctor, who treats people at a surgery or in their homes, not in a hospital, and who does not specialize in particular illnesses or methods of treatment. English = general practice, GP.

general%20practitioner.description: (As a Noun) A doctor, or the type of work of such a doctor, who treats people at a surgery or in their homes, not in a hospital, and who does not specialize in particular illnesses or methods of treatment. English = general practice, GP.

generous.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To give more of something, especially money, than is usual or expected; to be friendly, helpful, and willing to see the good qualities in people or things. English = (be) generous, (be) kind.

genie.description: (As a Noun) A magical being, in stories from Arabia and Persia, that obeys the orders of the person who controls it. It is often portrayed as hiding in a magic lantern that must be rubbed for it to come out. English = genie.

genius.description: (As a Noun) A person who has a very great natural ability and talent, especially for a particular subject or activity; a person who is very clever indeed. English = genius.; (As a Noun) A very great ability or skill in something. English = genius, intellect.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a very great natural ability and talent, especially for a particular subject or activity; to be very clever. English = (be) brilliant. Informal English = (be) brainy.

kindness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of being caring and helpful. English = kindness.; (As a Noun) The quality of being kind, mild, and pleasantly calm. English = gentleness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be caring and helpful. English = (be) kind.

gentleman.description: (As a Noun) A man who is well behaved, educated, and refined. English = gentleman.

kneel.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To bend your legs and lower your body until your knees are touching the ground. English = kneel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To bend your legs and lower your body, especially in church, as a sign of respect for someone or something. Formal English = genuflect.

geometry.description: (As a Noun) A mathematical science concerned with the measurement of lines, angles, curves, and shapes. English = geometry.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Something that invloves geometry or consists of regular shapes and lines. English = geometric, geometrical.

germ.description: (As a Noun) A GERM is a very small organism that causes disease.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GERM. If you know a sign for GERM used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

germany.description: (As a Noun) A country in central Europe, called Germany.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A person, thing, product or service that comes from Germany. English = (be) German.

german%20shepherd.description: (As a Noun) A large, usually fierce dog that is often used to guard buildings or used by the police to help them find criminals. English = Alsatian, German shepherd.

gestational%20diabetes.description: (As a Noun) Women who develop higher than normal blood sugar levels when they are pregnant are diagnosed with GESTATIONAL DIABETES.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GESTATIONAL DIABETES. If you know a sign for GESTATIONAL DIABETES used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

gesture.description: (As a Noun) A movement that you make with your hands or your head, which is not part of a sign language, to express emotion or to give information. English = gesture.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To express emotion or to give information using movements of your hands or your head which are not part of a sign language. English = gesture.

get.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) For something to come into your possession by you taking it or, especially, by someone giving it or sending it to you. English = get. Formal English = obtain, procure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be given something; to get something after it has been sent to you. English = receive.

get%20ahead.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or race, to be ahead of your rival. English = win, lead.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or ranking, to go from being last or well behind the leaders to being first or well in front of the others. English = overtake, catch up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In any endeavour, to be improve your position relative to where you were and relative to other people. English = get ahead.

get%20attention.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To get the attention of all the people around you, especially by tapping them on the shoulder and getting others to do likewise, in order to talk (sign) to them.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell those people in a group of deaf people who are already looking at you to tap their neighbours on the shoulder so that everyone is looking at you and you can talk to them all at once. English = 'Can I have everyone's attention?!'

get%20better.description: (As a Noun) The act of doing something, or causing it to happen, especially after a lot of effort. English = success.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of things or people, to get better over time. English = get better, improve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To manage to do something you have been trying to do, especially after a lot of effort. English = succeed, (be) successful.

get%20dressed.description: (As a Noun) The things that people wear, such as shirts, coats, trousers, and dresses. English = clothes, clothing. Formal English = garments.; (As a Noun) Clothes that people wear, especially on a formal occasion. Formal English = apparel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a piece of clothing or clothes on your body. English = wear (something), get dressed, clothe.

get%20even.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To get one's revenge. Idiomatic English = get even.; (As a Verb or Adjective) When scoring the competitors or teams in a game, competition or match, to have one point each. English = (be) one all.; (Interactive) Used alone to express your pleasure at the fact that you have harmed or annoyed someone who has harmed or annoyed you. English = 'Now we're even!'

get%20into.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after lying down, especially after sleeping in a bed. English = get up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after sitting. English = stand up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move onto something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get on, step on, get into. Formal English = board.

get%20into%20bed.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To get into bed, to get under the covers.; (Interactive) Used alone to suggest to your addressee that you both go to bed. English = 'Let's go to bed', 'Time to hit the sack', etc.

get%20lost.description: (Interactive) Used alone to express your frustration, irritation or anger with someone or something. You want them out of your life and to no longer bother or worry you. English = 'I'm glad its all over', 'Good riddance to that!'; (Interactive) Used alone to mean you want someone or something to stay away from you because you do not like them. Usually used talking about it (3rd person) rather than to it (2nd person) English = 'Get lost!', 'Rack off!', 'Piss off!' and so on.

get%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move off something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get off, step off, get out. Formal English = alight.

get%20on.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after lying down, especially after sleeping in a bed. English = get up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after sitting. English = stand up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move onto something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get on, step on, get into. Formal English = board.

get%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move off something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get off, step off, get out. Formal English = alight.

get%20ready.description: (As a Noun) All the arrangements and activity that is needed  to be ready for a future event. English = preparation, preparations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get yourself ready for an action or event that will happen soon. English = prepare, get ready, make ready.

get%20rid%20of.description: (As a Noun) The act of not accepting or not agreeing to a proposal or a request. English = rejection.; (As a Noun) Pieces of unwanted food which are thrown away or given to animals. English = scraps.; (As a Noun) A statement or condition that says someone does not have to obey, follow or perform a rule or duty. English = exemption.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

get%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after lying down, especially after sleeping in a bed. English = get up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up after sitting. English = stand up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move onto something, especially a form of transport such as a bus or train. English = get on, step on, get into. Formal English = board.

get%20worse.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Especially of some mental or physical condition (e.g. health), to get worse and worse. English = deteriorate. Idiomatic English = go down hill.

ghost.description: (As a Noun) A dead person you think you see behaving as if they were still alive. English = ghost.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a place where people believe a ghost appears regularly. English = (be) haunted.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a ghost, to appear in a place regularly. English = haunt.

tease.description: (As a Noun) The act of deliberately embarrassing someone, tricking them, or making fun of them, because this amuses you. English = teasing, ridicule.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately embarrass someone, trick them, or make fun of them, because this amuses you. English = tease, ridicule.

give.description: (As a Noun) Something that you give to someone as a present. English = gift.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To offer something to someone as a present; to hand something over to someone; to provide someone with something and let them keep it. English = give, hand over.

giggle.description: (As a Noun) A quiet laughing noise. English = giggle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make quiet laughing noises because you are amused or embarrassed. English = laugh; giggle.

giraffe.description: (General Definition) Long necked animal or person.; (As a Noun) An African animal with a very long neck, long legs, and dark patches on its yellowish body. English = giraffe.

girl.description: (As a Noun) A female child. English = girl.; (Note) Community feedback and evidence from the Auslan Corpus suggests that this northern dialect sign for ‘girl’ is still being used only by older signers. Most Auslan signers now use the other sign listed in Auslan Signbank for the keyword ‘girl’

girlfriend.description: (As a Noun) A girl or a woman with whom someone is having a romantic or sexual relationship. English = girlfriend.; (As a Noun) The female friend of a woman or a girl. English = girlfriend.

girl%20guide.description: (As a Noun) An organisation for girls which teaches them to become disciplined, practical, and self-sufficient. English = Girl Guides.; (As a Noun) A girl who belongs to the Girl Guides. English = girl guide.; (As a Noun) A junior member of the Girl Guides, usually aged between seven and ten years. English = brownie.

give%20back.description: (As a Noun) Things, especially clothing, which have been used by other people before you and which have been given to you for your use. Idiomatic English = hand-me-down.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the signer, to be given back something; of the addressee, to give something back to the signer. English = give back, return.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the signer, to be given or handed something by someone, to be provided with it or allowed to have it; to be given something.

give%20in.description: (General Definition) The action of throwing something up in the air, such as a ball, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as the action of throwing up your hands or arms as a gesture of 'giving up'.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stop doing or having something. English = give up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To admit that you cannot do something and stop trying to do it. English = give up.

give%20up.description: (General Definition) The action of throwing something up in the air, such as a ball, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as the action of throwing up your hands or arms as a gesture of 'giving up'.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stop doing or having something. English = give up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To admit that you cannot do something and stop trying to do it. English = give up.

give%20up%20(surrender).description: (As a Noun) The end of fighting or resisting when one side agrees that it has been beaten. English = surrender.; (As a Noun) A robbery during which the victims are threatened with weapons and told to hold their hands up in the air. English = hold-up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) You stop fighting or resisting someone and agree that you have been beaten. Often this is done by raising your hands in the air. English = surrender.

happiness.description: (As a Noun) Feeling of pleasure, often because something nice has happened. English = happiness, gladness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have feelings of pleasure, often because something nice has happened. English = (be) happy, (be) glad, (be) merry.; (Note) This is the sign you use in expressions like ‘Happy Birthday’, ‘Happy Christmas’, ‘Merry Christmas’ or ‘Happy New Year’, e.g., you sign ‘happy’ first, then you sign ‘birthday’.

glad%20to.description: (As a Noun) A strong desire and interest in doing something. English = keenness, eagerness, enthusiasm.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be enthusiastic and interested in what you are doing or will do, or to want to do something very much. English = (be) keen, (be) eager.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have interest in something. English = (be) interested in.

glance%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two objects, for one to pass very close by the other one (often slightly touching it) but continuing to move forward. English = skim over/past, glance by/off, scrape along/by; (As a Verb or Adjective) To try to deliberately hit one object with another, but to pass by without hitting, e.g., in snooker, for one ball to pass and just miss another ball. English = just miss.

glass%20(cup).description: (General Definition) To put one’s hand around any cylindrical object and hold it, especially a cup, or any (cylindrical) thing large or small, such as a pipe, tube, chimney, tower, but especially a cup itself, that can be easily associated with this in context. Without context suggesting otherwise, signers will assume you mean a cup or actions associated with a cup.; (As a Noun) A container made from glass which you can drink from. They do not have handles. English = glass.; (As a Noun) A small, round container, usually with a handle, from which you drink liquids such as tea and coffee. English = cup.

glasses.description: (As a Noun) Two lenses in a frame that some people wear in front of their eyes in order to help them to see better. English = glasses, spectacles.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wear glasses.

glass%20eye.description: (As a Noun) The parts of your eyes that are like white balls. English = eyeball.; (As a Noun) An artificial eyeball, made of glass, which is inserted into the eye socket. English = glass eye.

glass%20(material).description: (As a Noun) A flat sheet of glass in a window or a door. English = windowpane, pane, pane of glass; (As a Noun) A hard transparent substance that windows and bottles are made from. English = glass.

smooth.description: (As a Noun) A surface without any roughness, lumps, or holes; a smooth surface.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be without any roughness, lumps, or holes on a surface. English = (be) smooth.; (As a Verb or Adjective) [Especially with rounded lips and breathing in of air] of the surface of water, to be very smooth and shiny, like glass. English = glassy.

gleeful.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be full of joy and excitement, often because of someone else's foolishness or failure. English = (be) gleeful.; (Interactive) Often used alone to show that you are more than happy to do something for someone.; (Interactive) Often used alone ironically.

shiny.description: (As a Noun) An object, surface or fabric which reflects a lot of light and which is bright, such as something made with or of metal, glass or precious stones.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a surface, to reflect a lot of light and to be bright. English = (be) shiny, glisten, glitter, shine.

world.description: (As a Noun) The planet that we live on. English = world, earth.; (As a Noun) All the societies, institutions, and ways of life of people living on the planet. English = world.; (As a Noun) The life a person leads, the people they have contact with, and the things they experience. English = world.

globalisation.description: (As a Noun) The process by which business and organisations grow beyond national borders and spread throughout the world, bringing standardisation and uniformity where there was once diversity. Usually used to show disapproval. English = globalisation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Concerning or including the whole world. English = (be) global.

glory.description: (As a Noun) The fame and admiration that someone gets by achieving something. Usually used to describe a quality of God. English = glory.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To praise God. English = glorify.

glove.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing which covers your hand and wrist and has individual sections for each finger. English = glove.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on a glove.

gluten%20free.description: (As a Noun) Does not contain gluten, which is a substance commonly found in wheat and some other cereals, pasta, bread and pastries. English = gluten free.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword GLUTEN FREE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for GLUTEN FREE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for GLUTEN FREE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.
