lacrosse.description: (As a Noun) An outdoor game played between two teams of players. They use long sticks with nets at the end to catch and throw a small ball in order to try and score goals. English = lacrosse.

lactose%20intolerance.description: (As a Noun) LACTOSE INTOLERANCE means that a person cannot digest lactose, a type of sugar which is found in milk and which is sometimes added to food.; (As a Noun) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for LACTOSE INTOLERANCE. If you know a sign for LACTOSE INTOLERANCE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

lactose%20intolerant.description: (As a Noun) LACTOSE INTOLERANCE means that a person cannot digest lactose, a type of sugar which is found in milk and which is sometimes added to food.; (As a Noun) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for LACTOSE INTOLERANCE. If you know a sign for LACTOSE INTOLERANCE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

ladder.description: (As a Noun) A piece of equipment used for climbing up something such as a wall or a tree. It consists of two long pieces of wood, metal, or rope with steps fixed between them. English = ladder.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To climb up using a ladder.

sheep.description: (As a Noun) Someone who makes a living shearing sheep for sheep farmers. English = sheep shearer.; (As a Noun) The act of shearing a sheep. English = sheep shearing.; (As a Noun) A farm animal with a thick woolly coat. It is kept for its wool or for its meat. English = sheep.

lamp.description: (As a Noun) A device which produces light. It consists of a light bulb (usually covered by a lamp shade) at the end of a lamp stand. English = lamp.

landing.description: (As a Noun) The act of bringing an aeroplane down to the ground. English = landing.; (As a Noun) Of an aeroplane, the act of arriving at an airport after a journey in the air. English = landing, arrival.; (As a Noun) A place where aircraft land and take off, usually with a lot of buildings and facilities. English = airport.

lane.description: (As a Noun) A narrow street. English = lane.

language.description: (As a Noun) A system of communication which consists of a set of gestural signs or of sounds and written symbols which are used by the people of a particular country, community or society for talking or for writing. English = language.

round trip.description: (As a Noun) A journey to and from a place; a person who does such a journey in a day; a person who does such a journey every day to work and back. English = round trip, return journey; day tripper; commuter.; (As a Noun) The movement to and fro between two locations (such as laps in a swimming pool).; (As a Noun) A ticket to travel somewhere and then to come back. English = return ticket.

laptop%20computer.description: (General Definition) Any object with a flat hinged opening and closing lid, such as a container or case and especially a laptop computer, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially the action of opening and closing such an object.; (As a Noun) A computer that is portable and suitable for use while travelling. English = laptop, laptop computer.

last%20night.description: (As a Noun) The night of the day before today. English = last night, yesterday night.; (As a Noun) The night of the day before a particular day in the past. English = the previous night.; (As Modifier) Used before or after a sign sentence to say the action in the sentence happened during the night of the day before. If you are already talking about something that happened on a day before today,

last%20week.description: (As a Noun) The calendar week before the week of speaking. English = last week, one week ago.; (As a Noun) The calendar week before an already specified week in the past. English = the week before that, the previous week.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean the action took place the week before the week of speaking. English = last week, one week ago.

last%20year.description: (As a Noun) The year before this year; last year; yesteryear.; (As a Noun) The year before a given or particular other year; the previous year.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence or next to a verb to mean the action in that sentence took place one year before the current year, or one year before the year being talked about. English = last year, the previous year, the year before that.

latch%20onto.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a child into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter. English = adopt (a child).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To eagerly take over something and make it your own because you want it or like it. English = seize upon, adopt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To grab onto something and keep it for yourself or close to yourself because you want it or like it.

late.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen at the end of a period of time or at the end of a process; or to happen after the time that was arranged or expected. English = (be) late, (be) tardy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen such a long time after the time that was arranged or expected as to be no longer wanted, useful or relevant. English = (be) too late.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action happened near the end of a period of time, or a process; or that it happens after the time that was arranged or expected. English = late.

later.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be at a time that is after the one that you have been talking about or after the present. English = (be) later.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to place the time of action or happening after the one that you have been talking about or after the present one. English = later.

late%20(too%20late).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer possible or useful to do something because the right time for doing it has passed. English = too late.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do or make something happen without enough speed so that it cannot be done properly or within the period of time that it must happen or you want it to happen. English = too slow.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that someone's actions have happened so much after the arranged or expected time that it is no longer wanted, useful or relevant. English = 'Too late!', 'Forget it! It's too late!'

laugh%20(a%20lot).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be on the floor wriggling and kicking in excitement or pleasure like an infant. English = wriggle, writhe.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of any experience, to be extremely enjoyable and pleasant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of food, to have a very pleasant taste. English = (be) delicious.

laugh%20at.description: (As a Noun) A very loud laugh. English = guffaw.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To laugh very loudly, especially at someone in an unkind way. English = guffaw, laugh at.

launceston.description: (As a Noun) A city in the north of the Australian state of Tasmania, called Launceston.

launch%20(rocket).description: (As a Noun) A space vehicle that is shaped like a long tube; a missile containing explosive that drives itself through the air by sending out burning gas; a firework that quickly goes high into the air and then explodes. English = rocket.; (As a Noun) The launching of a rocket or missile. English = lift off.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send a rocket or missile into space. English = launch.

washing.description: (As a Noun) The act of cleaning something using soap and water. English = washing.; (As a Noun) The clothes that have been or are to be washed. English = the washing, the laundry.; (As a Noun) A room in a house or a hotel where clothes are washed. English = laundry.

laundry.description: (General Definition) The action of holding onto something in front of you and moving it up and down repeatedly, such as dunking clothes in water and rubbing them against a washboard or operating a hand held pump, or any thing or any action which can be easily associated with this when given enough context.; (As a Noun) A board or frame with corrugated metallic or other surface, on which clothes are scrubbed in the process of washing. English = washboard.; (As a Noun) A room in a house or hotel where clothes, sheets, and towels are washed; or a business that does this for people. English = laundry.

lava.description: (General Definition) Of a liquid, to flow or spurt out of a container or central location and then to flow out over the sides, such as boiling water in a pot or lava from a volcano, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A kind of rock which comes out of a volcano in the form of a very hot liquid, and which gradually cools and becomes solid. English = lava.

law.description: (As a Noun) The system of rules a society or government develops in order to deal with business agreements, social relationships, and crime. English = law.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to the law. English = (be) legal.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be allowed by the law. English = (be) legal.

lawn.description: (As a Noun) An area of grass that is kept cut short, found as part of a garden or park. English = lawn.

lawn%20bowls.description: (As a Noun) A game in which the players try to roll large wooden balls as near as possible to a small ball on a special lawn. English = bowls, lawn bowls.; (As a Noun) A game in which you roll a heavy ball down a long narrow track towards a group of wooden objects and try to knock down as many of them as possible. English = bowling.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To roll a ball in a game of bowls or bowling. English = bowl.

mower.description: (General Definition) Any contraption, usually with wheels on the underside, such as a trolley or pram, that you operate or use by holding on to handles and pushing it forward, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a lawn-mower.; (As a Noun) A machine for cutting grass. English = mower, lawn-mower.; (As a Noun) A small cart that you use to carry heavy things, for example shopping or luggage. English = trolley.

lbw%20(cricket).description: (As a Noun) In cricket,  the act of stopping with the leg or some other part of the body a pitched ball which would otherwise have hit the wicket, for which a batsman may be declared out. English = leg before wicket, lbw.

lead%20(competition).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or race, to be ahead of your rival. English = win, lead.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or ranking, to go from being last or well behind the leaders to being first or well in front of the others. English = overtake, catch up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In any endeavour, to be improve your position relative to where you were and relative to other people. English = get ahead.

move ahead.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be progressing more quickly than others. English = move ahead.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be ahead of others. English = (be) leading.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in the intended direction. English = go forward.

lean.description: (General Definition) The action of any long vertical object becoming less perpendicular, leaning over, toppling over or collapsing, or any particular object or action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that something is about to fall over and to get out of the way. English = 'Watch out!', 'Timber!'

lean%20over.description: (General Definition) The action of any long vertical object becoming less perpendicular, leaning over, toppling over or collapsing, or any particular object or action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that something is about to fall over and to get out of the way. English = 'Watch out!', 'Timber!'

lean%20(thin).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person or an animal, to have very little fat on its body. English = (be) thin, (be) skinny, (be) lean.; (As a Verb or Adjective) [With cheeks sucked in], to be very thin. English = (be) gaunt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of anything, to have a small distance between its two opposite surfaces. English = (be) thin, (be) narrow.

learn.description: (As a Noun) Knowledge about abstract or theoretical things that has been gained by being told about them or by reading and studying. English = learning.; (As a Noun) Knowledge about people and life that is acquired by your own personal experiences.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find out about something, especially abstract or theoretical knowledge, by being told about it or by reading and studying about it. English = learn.

learned%20(knowledgeable).description: (As a Noun) The act of enlightening or the state of being enlightened. English = enlightenment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To acquire more knowledge about something; to become better informed. Formal English = (be) enlightened.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make someone more aware and informed. English = enlighten.

learner.description: (As a Noun) A person who is learning how to do some practical skill such as driving a car or fixing a car in a 'hands-on' way (ie by practical experience). English = learner, trainee.; (As a Noun) Regular training or exercise in something which enables you to do it better. English = practice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To obtain knowledge of the facts or gain the skill to do something as a result of studying and especially training (ie through practical experience). English = learn.

learning.description: (As a Noun) Knowledge about abstract or theoretical things that has been gained by being told it or by reading and studying. English = learning.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find out about something, especially abstract or theoretical knowledge, by being told about it or by reading and studying about it. English = learn.

learn%20my%20lesson.description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to a question as to whether you have done or experienced something, or met someone, to mean that you have and that it was not a pleasant or memorable experience. You are glad that it is in the past and behind you.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that something unexpected or bad happened because of what you did and that you have learnt from this experience. Idiomatic English = "that'll teach me", "I've learnt my lesson!"

leather.description: (As a Noun) The specially treated skin of animals. It is used for making shoes, clothes, bags, and furniture. English = leather.

leave%20(go).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go out of a place, to leave a place.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go out of a place; to leave a place in order to go home.

leave%20(not%20take).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To allow or cause someone or something to remain behind and not come with you when you go to another place. English = leave, leave behind.

leave%20school.description: (As a Noun) The time when you finish your education and leave school.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To finish your education and leave school.

lecture.description: (As a Noun) A talk that someone gives in order to teach people about a particular subject. English = lecture.; (As a Noun) A person who talks to a group of people about a particular subject. English = speaker.; (As a Noun) A person who teaches at a university or college. English = lecturer.

table.description: (General Definition) You can use this sign to refer to a surface which is not sloping or curved and with no parts higher than any other, or any thing directly, indirectly or metaphorically associated with this. This sign is very general in its meaning and what it actually means at any time varies from context to context. However, it is most commonly associated with the things listed under 'as a noun', below.; (General Definition) You can use this sign to refer to any action directly, indirectly or metaphorically associated with moving your hands apart or across a surface. This sign is very general in its meaning and what it actually means at any time varies from context to context. However, it is most commonly associated with the actions or qualities listed under 'as a verb or adjective', below; (As a Noun) A flat piece of wood, metal, or glass, attached to a wall or the sides of a cupboard, used for keeping things on; a narrow, flat place along the bottom edge of a window or in the side of a mountain or cliff. English = shelf; ledge.

left%20arm.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = left.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is opposite the side with the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = left side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm opposite the one with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = left arm, left hand.

left%20hand.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = left.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is opposite the side with the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = left side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm opposite the one with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = left arm, left hand.

left%20handed.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use the opposite hand from most people in order to write, sign or do complicated actions. English = (be) left handed.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the steering wheel of a car located on the left side of the car. English = left hand drive.

left%20(leave).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have moved or travelled away from a place. English = gone, went, left, departed.

left%20(not%20right).description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = left.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is opposite the side with the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = left side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm opposite the one with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = left arm, left hand.

left%20or%20right.description: (Interactive) Used in response to a suggestion to do something in two different ways or a question about which of two ways of doing something to mean one is just as good as the other. English = either way.; (As Modifier) Used to modify a verb, especially a verb of movement, to say it could go in one of two possible directions or ways. English = either way, left or right, this way or that way.

remains.description: (As a Noun) The part of something that is still on a surface (such as a table) to be seen, or used or eaten or taken after everything else has been taken away, used or eaten. English = remains, remainder, rest.; (As a Noun) Any part of something that is left after the main part has been taken away, used or eaten. English = remainder.; (As a Noun) The amount to pay for something after a deposit has been paid. English = remainder, balance.

left%20side.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = left.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is opposite the side with the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = left side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm opposite the one with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = left arm, left hand.

left (not right).description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = left.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be one of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun sets is in this relative position (in the west); facing south, sunrise is in this position (in the east). English = (be) left.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in one of two opposite directions; namely, leftwards.

leg.description: (As a Noun) The long part of your body connected to your hip that has a foot at the end of it. You have two of them. English = leg.; (As a Noun) The top part of your legs, between your knees and your hips. English = thigh

legal.description: (As a Noun) The system of rules that a society or government develops in order to deal with business agreements, social relationships, and crime. An obsolete sign. English = law.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be related to the law or to be permitted by the law. An obsolete sign. English = (be) legal.

leg%20before%20wicket%20(cricket).description: (As a Noun) In cricket,  the act of stopping with the leg or some other part of the body a pitched ball which would otherwise have hit the wicket, for which a batsman may be declared out. English = leg before wicket, lbw.

lemon.description: (As a Noun) A bright yellow fruit with a sour juice. English = lemon.

lemonade.description: (As a Noun) A colourless sweet fizzy drink. English = lemonade.; (As a Noun) Any cold, non-alcoholic drink such as lemonade or fruit juice. English = soft drink.

lender.description: (As a Noun) A person or institution that allows people to have and use some of its money for a period of time before they pay it back. English = lender.; (As a Noun) A sum of money that you borrow from a lender. English = loan.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To allow someone to have something or use it for a period of time. English = lend, loan.

lesbian.description: (As a Noun) A woman who is sexually attracted to other women. English = lesbian.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to female homosexuality. English = (be) lesbian.

lesion.description: (As a Noun) A LESION is an injury or wound to someone's body.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for LESION. If you know a sign for LESION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

small.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something which is not large in physical size; or not as large in volume or amount; or not as wide. English = (be) small, (be) less, (be) narrow.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something become not as big in size; or in width; or in volume; or in intensity. English = make small, narrow, lessen, reduce, decrease.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be not as much in amount or degree as before or as something else. English = (be) less.

lesson.description: (As a Noun) A short period of time during which people are taught about a particular subject or taught how to do something. English = lesson; (As a Noun) At a school or college, the parts the day is divided into during which lessons are given. English = period.

let%20go.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To let go of something.

let%20know.description: (As a Noun) Facts, details and ideas which are communicated or received about something or someone. English = information.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To communicate facts, details and ideas about something or someone. English = make known, inform, let someone know.

why-not.description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to someone else's suggestion to do something to mean that you agree and can see no reason why you should not do it. English = 'Why not?'; (As Modifier) Used to introduce a suggestion to your partner to do something in a polite and friendly way. English = 'Why don't (you , we, etc.)..' 'Let's just do ....'; (As Modifier) Used in 'self-talk' (signing to oneself or telling someone else what you thought) to express the sudden arrival of a desire to do something especially since you could think of no good reason why not to do it. English = "Why don't I....?" "Why shouldn't I...? "Let me just...."

let's%20see.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a good look at something in order to get more information about it. English = examine.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's insistence that something is true or will happen to mean you do not agree but don't want to argue the point any further. English = 'We'll see.', 'That remains to be seen.', 'Let's wait and see' etc.; (As Modifier) Used to introduce a suggestion or idea. English = 'Let's see. How about...'.

letter%20box.description: (As a Noun) A large metal container in the street or against the wall of a post office into which you post letters. English = letter box.

letter%20opener.description: (As a Noun) An instrument, shaped like a knife, used for opening envelopes. English = letter opener.; (As a Noun) A letter which has been put into an envelope, sealed and sent through the mail. It may already be opened, but usually has not yet been.; (As a Noun) Letters that someone receives. English = correspondence.

letter%20(post).description: (As a Noun) A message written on a piece of paper and sent through the mail to someone. English = mail out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send a message written on a piece of paper through the mail to lots of different people; notify by mail or post.

letters.description: (As a Noun) Messages written on pieces of paper and sent through the mail. English = letters, mail, correspondence.; (As a Noun) One of the books in the New Testament which were originally written as letters to the early Christians by the apostles. English = Epistle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send or receive messages written on pieces of paper and sent through the mail; send or get mail; send or receive correspondence; notify by mail or post.

lettuce.description: (General Definition) A large spherically shaped object, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as a lettuce, cabbage, ball, globe and so on.; (As a Noun) A plant which looks like a ball of green leaves which is usually eaten in salads. English = lettuce.; (As a Noun) A vegetable which looks like a ball of green, pale green and white leaves which is often chopped up finely or shredded before it is cooked and eaten. English = cabbage.

level%20out.description: (General Definition) The action of levelling or covering an area of land or a piece of ground, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a grave.; (As a Noun) A place where a dead person is buried. English = grave.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cover over an area; to level out an area.

service.description: (As a Noun) Something provided to the public by a government department, organisation or system such as transport, information or help (material, monetary, or personal). English = service.; (As a Noun) The process of being looked after in a shop or a restaurant by finding you products or by taking your order and bringing you food and drinks. English = service.; (As a Noun) The cooperation and exchange of information between different organisations or between different sections of an organisation; or the person whose job is to provide such a service. English = liaison; liaison officer.

lie.description: (As a Noun) Something that someone says which they know is untrue. English = lie.; (As a Noun) A person who says things which they know are untrue; a person who tells lies. English = liar.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say something which you know is untrue. English = lie

licence.description: (As a Noun) An official document which gives you permission to do, use, or own something. English = licence, permit.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) A official document which gives you permission to drive a car. English = driver's licence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an official document which gives you permission to do, use, or own something. English = (be) licensed.

lick.description: (As a Noun) The act of moving your tongue across the surface of something. English = lick, licking.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move your tongue across the surface of something. English = lick.

lid.description: (As a Noun) The top of a box which can be raised when you want to open it and get at the contents or put things inside. English = lid.

lie%20down.description: (As a Noun) A short rest in which you lie down on a bed. English = lie-down, nap, snooze.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move into a horizontal position, usually in order to rest or sleep. English = lie down, recline.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be lying somewhere with your legs and arms out in a careless way. English = (be) sprawled out.

life.description: (As a Noun) The quality which people, animals, and plants have when they are not dead and which objects and substances do not have. English = life.; (As a Noun) The period of time during which someone is alive. English = life.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people, animals, and plants to have the quality of not being dead. English = (be) alive, (be) living.

lifesaver.description: (As a Noun) A person at a beach or swimming pool whose job is to rescue people when they are in danger of drowning. English = lifeguard. Australian English = lifesaver.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a lifesaver, to feed out a line attached to another lifesaver who is swimming out to save someone who is in danger of drowning.

lift%20(in%20a%20car).description: (As a Noun) A ride from one place to another in a car or truck which someone offers you for free. English = lift.; (As a Noun) A line of chairs that hang from a moving cable and carry people up or down a mountain or other steep slope. English = chairlift.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel seated in a vehicle, such as a train, car or bus; to ride in a train, car or bus.

lift%20off.description: (As a Noun) A space vehicle that is shaped like a long tube; a missile containing explosive that drives itself through the air by sending out burning gas; a firework that quickly goes high into the air and then explodes. English = rocket.; (As a Noun) The launching of a rocket or missile. English = lift off.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send a rocket or missile into space. English = launch.

lift%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something to another position by pushing it or carrying it upwards. English = lift, lift up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand up from a seating postion. English = stand up, get up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To increase the volume of noise being produced by something. English = turn up.

light%20bulb.description: (As a Noun) The glass part of an electric lamp, which gives out light when electricity passes through it. English = light bulb, bulb.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To remove a light bulb from a light socket.

lighten.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To become less dark in colour. English = lighten.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a building or room, to have a lot of natural light in it, for example because it has large windows. English = (be) light.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of colours, to be whitish and not strong or bright, as in 'light green' or 'pale green'. English = (be) light, (be) pale.

lightning.description: (As a Noun) The bright flashes of light in the sky, often forming long ragged lines, that you may see during a storm. English = lightning.; (As a Noun) Very bad weather with thunder and lightning and often with heavy rain and strong winds. English = storm.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of lightning, to form a flash and hit the ground (or some other object) violently and suddenly. English = strike.

light%20(start%20fire).description: (As a Noun) A small, thin stick of wood that produces a flame when you strike it against the side of a matchbox. English = match.; (As a Noun) A match or a cigarette lighter that can be used to start a cigarette burning. English = light.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To strike a match.

light%20up.description: (As a Noun) The brightness that lets you see things, and that comes from the sun, the moon, lamps, or fire. English = light.; (As a Noun) Anything that produces light, particularly an electric bulb. English = light, electric light.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To add brightness or light to a place by turning on anything that produces light, especially an electric bulb. English = light up, lighten, illuminate.

like.description: (As a Noun) The pleasure and satisfaction in doing or experiencing something. English = enjoyment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find something pleasant or attractive, or to approve of it. English = like.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find pleasure and satisfaction in doing or experiencing something. English = enjoy.

likeable.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be nice to look at and attractive in a delicate way. English = (be) pretty, (be) cute, (be) likeable.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find something or someone pleasant and attractive. English = like.

likeness.description: (As a Noun) The condition of being similar in appearance to something else. English = likeness, resemblance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two or more things, they have features that are like each other but not exactly the same. English = (be) like, (be) similar, resemble.

like%20(not%20like).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To find something unpleasant or unattractive, or to disapprove of it. English = dislike, not like.

limit.description: (As a Noun) A set upper boundary beyond which a amount or size of something cannot go. English = limit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To set the upper boundary beyond which a amount or size of something cannot go. English = limit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To reduce the number of things that people can have or do. English = limit.

limp.description: (As a Noun) A walk which is difficult or uneven because one of your legs or feet is hurt. English = limp.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To walk with difficulty or in an uneven way because one of your legs or feet is hurt. English = limp.

line.description: (As a Noun) A long thin mark on a surface or something that looks long and thin. English = line.; (As a Noun) A long stripe or mark on a surface. English = streak.; (As a Noun) A line drawn under a word in a written or typed text.

line%20(queue).description: (General Definition) A line of people or long upright objects, or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A line of people who are all waiting for something. English = queue, line.; (As a Noun) A barrier made of wood or wire supported by posts. English = fence.

goal umpire.description: (As a Noun) In Australian rules football, the person who signals if a goal or a behind has been scored. English = goal umpire.; (As a Noun) In soccer, the person who signals if the ball has gone out of the field and out of play. English = linesman.

lines%20of%20text.description: (As a Noun) A single unit of language that can be represented in writing, sign, fingerspelling, or speech. In English, a word has a space on either side of it when it is written. A word can usually have one or more meanings. English = word.; (As a Noun) Any document with writing or printing on it. English = text, lines of text.

line-umpire.description: (As a Noun) In soccer, an official on the sidelines who assists the referee or umpire in determining whether the ball is still in play. English = line umpire, linesman.

line%20up.description: (General Definition) A line of people or long upright objects, or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A line of people who are all waiting for something. English = queue, line.; (As a Noun) A barrier made of wood or wire supported by posts. English = fence.

linguistics.description: (As a Noun) The study of the way in which language works. English = linguistics.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of studies, developments, or ideas that relate to language or linguistics. English = (be) linguistic.

tiger.description: (General Definition) The feet of an animal or the action of stepping forward using these feet, or any thing, any animal or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, especially a tiger.; (As a Noun) The foot or feet of an animal having claws and pads. English = paw, paws.; (As a Noun) A large, fierce animal that belongs to the cat family. They are orange-coloured with black stripes. English = tiger.

lip.description: (As a Noun) The top and bottom edges of your mouth. English = lip, lips.

lip%20read.description: (As a Noun) A deaf person who has been educated without the benefit of sign language and who has been taught using a method which encourages the use of speech alone.; (As a Noun) A deaf person who can use speech quite well and who probably does not use sign language.; (As a Noun) The technique of decoding the sounds of a spoken language by watching the lips. English = lip reading, speech reading.

lip%20reading.description: (As a Noun) A deaf person who has been educated without the benefit of sign language and who has been taught using a method which encourages the use of speech alone.; (As a Noun) A deaf person who can use speech quite well and who probably does not use sign language.; (As a Noun) The technique of decoding the sounds of a spoken language by watching the lips. English = lip reading, speech reading.

lipstick.description: (As a Noun) A coloured substance which women put on their lips. English = lipstick.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on lipstick.

liquid%20paper.description: (General Definition) Taking something out of a small container with a small implement, such as a brush, and applying it to something, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially liquid paper or painting a car body.; (As a Noun) An opaque, usually white, liquid which you paint on errors in written or typed work in order to cover them. English = liquid paper, correction fluid.; (As a Noun) The act of painting over scratches and imperfections on an object or picture, especially the paintwork on the body of a car. English = touch up.

litre.description: (As a Noun) A metric unit of volume that is equal to a thousand cubic centimetres or 1.76 pints. English = litre, liter (US).

literacy.description: (As a Noun) The ability to read and write. English = reading and writing, literacy.

little.description: (As a Noun) Something which is small in size or amount.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something, to be small in size or amount. English = (be) little.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the number of things or people, to be smaller than desirable or than was expected. English = (be) few.

liturgy.description: (As a Noun) The religious services that are carried out in a set way in a Christian church. English = liturgy.; (As a Noun) A particular form of religious service. English = liturgy.

live%20(be%20alive).description: (As a Noun) The quality which people, animals, and plants have when they are not dead and which objects and substances do not have. English = life.; (As a Noun) The period of time during which someone is alive. English = life.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people, animals, and plants to have the quality of not being dead. English = (be) alive, (be) living.

liver.description: (As a Noun) Your LIVER is a large organ in your body which cleans your blood.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for LIVER. If you know a sign for LIVER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

live%20(reside).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your home in a particular place. English = live. Formal English = reside.

living%20(not%20dead).description: (As a Noun) Animals or humans who are still alive, as opposed to those who are now dead, e.g., after an illness, an accident or a disaster. English = the living, survivors.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something that is animate, to be living and not dead when you think it might have died (illness, accident, disaster). English = (be) alive, (be) living, survive.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something that is animate, to be living and not dead when you thought it was not a living thing at all, like an insect that looks like a twig. English = (be) alive, (be) living.

lizard.description: (As a Noun) A small animal with short legs, a long tail, and a rough dry skin. English = lizard.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a lizard, to flick out the tongue.

loading%20bay.description: (As a Noun) A raised flat surface along the side of which a vehicle can stop for the purposes of loading and unloading goods or passengers. English = platform, loading bay, parking bay.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pull up in a vehicle next to a platform.

lobby%20(advocate).description: (As a Noun) A group of people who try to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobby.; (As a Noun) The activity of trying to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobbying.; (As a Noun) A person who tries to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobbyist.

lobby (advocate).description: (As a Noun) A group of people who try to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobby.; (As a Noun) The activity of trying to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobbying.; (As a Noun) A person who tries to persuade a government or council that a particular thing should be done. English = lobbyist.

local%20area%20coordination.description: (General Definition) Local Area Coordination (LAC) are local organisations working in partnership with the NDIA, to help participants, their families and carers access the NDIS. LACs will help participants write and manage their plans and also connect participants to mainstream services and local and community-based supports.

whereabouts.description: (As a Noun) The place where a person or thing is. English = whereabouts, location.; (As Modifier) Used before a phrase or clause that specifies or refers to the place in which something is situated or happens. English = where, the place in which.; (As Question) Used at the beginning, end or at both the beginning and end of a sentence to ask a question about the place something is in, or is coming from, or is going to. English = where.

location%20(in%20signing%20space).description: (As a Noun) Two areas or locations, one to the right and one to the left.; (As a Noun) The location of a sign within the signing space. A technical sign used to discuss the grammar of Auslan.

lockdown.description: (As a Noun) A period of time in which the movement of people within or to an area is limited because of public health or safety reasons. English = lockdown.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To restrict for a period of time the movement of people within or to an area because of public health or safety reasons. English = lockdown.

lock (rugby).description: (As a Noun) In rugby, the forward who packs down in the third row of the scrum with his head between the two second rowers. English = lock, lock forward.

lock%20(rugby).description: (As a Noun) In rugby, the forward who packs down in the third row of the scrum with his head between the two second rowers. English = lock, lock forward.

lock%20up.description: (As a Noun) [Often the movement is repeated] the part of a door, a drawer, or a suitcase which you use to keep it shut and to prevent other people from opening it. To open it, you must first put a key in it and turn it. English = lock.; (As a Noun) [Often the movement is repeated] a specially shaped piece of metal which you place in a lock and turn in order to open or lock a door, a drawer, or a suitcase; a specially shaped piece of metal that you turn, for example to wind up a clock.  English = key.; (As a Noun) [Often the movement is repeated] the keyhole in the dashboard of a car in which you insert a key in order to start the engine. English = ignition.

train.description: (As a Noun) A number of carriages or trucks which are pulled by an engine (usually steam or diesel powered) along a railway line. English = train.; (As a Noun) The steam or diesel engine that pulls the carriages of a trail along. English = train engine, locomotive.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go or travel by train (usually steam or diesel powered).

logarithm.description: (As a Noun) A quantity representing the power to which a fixed number (the base) must to raised to produce a given number. English = logarithm.

logging%20(trees).description: (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees. English = felling.; (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees in order to sell the wood. English = logging.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut through the trunk of a tree with an axe so that it falls to the ground. English = chop down, fell.

logic.description: (As a Noun) A method of reasoning that involves a series of statements, each of which must be true if the statement before it is true. English = logic.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of conclusions, results or outcomes, to be the only one that can reasonably result from a particular set of facts or from a particular event. English = (be) logical.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be true according to the rules of logic. English = (be) logical.

log%20(trees).description: (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees. English = felling.; (As a Noun) The activity of cutting down trees in order to sell the wood. English = logging.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cut through the trunk of a tree with an axe so that it falls to the ground. English = chop down, fell.

london.description: (As a Noun) The capital city of the United Kingdom, located in England. English = London.

loneliness.description: (As a Noun) The feeling of unhappiness you have because you are alone or do not have any friends. English = loneliness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be unhappy because you are alone or do not have any friends. English = (be) lonely.

long%20ago.description: (As a Noun) A very long period of time.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb sign to mean the action took a long time.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence to place the action of the sentence a long time ago in the past. English = a long time ago, ages ago, long ago.

long%20hair.description: (As a Noun) Hair which is worn long.; (As a Noun) Hair which is straight.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have long hair.

long%20jump.description: (As a Noun) In athletics, a contest which involves jumping as far as you can from a marker which you run up to. English = long jump.

long%20sleeved.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing worn over your arms all the way down to the wrists which is attached at the shoulders to the rest of a garment. English = long sleeve shirt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wear a long sleeve shirt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a shirt, to have long sleeves. English = (be) long sleeved.

long%20sleeve%20shirt.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing worn over your arms all the way down to the wrists which is attached at the shoulders to the rest of a garment. English = long sleeve shirt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wear a long sleeve shirt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a shirt, to have long sleeves. English = (be) long sleeved.

long%20time.description: (As a Noun) A very long period of time.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb sign to mean the action took a long time.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence to place the action of the sentence a long time ago in the past. English = a long time ago, ages ago, long ago.

sentence.description: (As a Noun) A line of writing, a line of words, a line of text.; (As a Noun) A group of words which, when they are written down, begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop. English = sentence.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use or be made up of too many words, especially long, difficult or formal words. English = (be) long-winded, (be) wordy.

loo.description: (As a Noun) A small room with a toilet, especially a public one with several rooms and several toilets. English = toilet, lavatory. Informal English = loo. Euphemistic formal English = W.C.

look.description: (As a Noun) The act of turning your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, regard.; (As a Noun) A period of time during which you look at something and pay attention to what is happening. English = observation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, look at.

look%20after.description: (As a Noun) [Usually repeated] A person who regularly looks after a child or a person who is sick, elderly or has a disability. English = carer.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do whatever is necessary to keep someone or something safe. English = look after, take care of.

look%20at.description: (As a Noun) The act of turning your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, regard.; (As a Noun) A period of time during which you look at something and pay attention to what is happening. English = observation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, look at.

look%20back.description: (As a Noun) Thoughts about things that happened in the past. English = recollections.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about things that happened in the past. English = look back.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence to indicate that you are thinking about things that happened in the past. English = looking back. Formal English = on reflection.

look%20for.description: (As a Noun) An attempt to find something by looking for it. English = search.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To try to find something that you want but do not have, or that you did have but have lost, by looking carefully for it. English = look for, search. Formal English = seek.

look%20like.description: (As a Noun) The front of your head from your forehead to your chin. English = face.; (As a Noun) The way someone's face appears to other people and the degree to which it is thought to be pretty, handsome, or even ugly. English = looks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to have the same facial features as another person. English = look like, resemble.

look%20right%20through.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately look at someone as if they are not there in order to avoid acknowledging them or talking to them. English = snub, ignore. Idiomatic English = look right through (someone).

loose.description: (General Definition) The action of holding and shaking something in your hand, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially something that is loose.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something, to not be firmly held or fixed in place, so that it moves or wobbles. English = (be) loose.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make loose. English = loosen.

lord.description: (As a Noun) In the Christian Church, a name people use to refer to God and to Jesus Christ. English = Lord.

lorry%20driver.description: (As a Noun) A large vehicle, such as a bus, truck, lorry, or tractor which has a large, almost horizontal, steering wheel.; (As a Noun) A large motor vehicle that carries passengers from one place to another. English = bus.; (As a Noun) A large vehicle that is used to transport goods by road. English = truck, lorry.

los%20angeles.description: (As a Noun) A city in the American state of California, called Los Angeles.

loss.description: (As a Noun) The fact of no longer having something or of having less of it than you had before. English =  loss.; (As a Noun) In business or finances, a situation in which you earn or make less money than you spend on various activities. English = loss.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not know where something is because you cannot remember where you put it or because you have accidentally dropped it. English = lose.

lose%20erection.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a penis, to become flacid, soft or limp.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a man, to lose his erection at the end of a sexual encounter, or because of lack of sexual desire or some other reason.

lose%20hearing.description: (As a Noun) The gradual loss of hearing that a person can experience through aging or illness, leading to almost complete deafness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gradually lose your hearing through aging or illness so that you become almost totally deaf. English = lose hearing, become deaf, deafen

lot.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) For there to be a large amount or large number of something. English = (be) a lot of, (be) much, (be) many.

lotion.description: (As a Noun) A liquid you use on the skin of your hands. English = hand lotion, hand cream, moisturiser.; (As a Noun) A smooth thick substance that is put on sore skin or a wound to help it heal. English = ointment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To apply a hand lotion, hand cream, moisturiser or ointment to the skin.

loud.description: (As a Noun) A loud noise or sound, especially one that is at the lower end of the frequency spectrum (ie, very bass) because it is more likely to be felt by a deaf person, rather than actually heard.; (As a Verb or Adjective) For the level of a sound to be very high, for example the sound of thunder or the sound of your voice when you shout. English = (be) loud.

lounge.description: (As a Noun) The room in a house, hotel, or club where people sit and relax. English = lounge.; (As a Noun) The room in a house where people sit and relax. English = lounge room.

lounge%20chair.description: (As a Noun) A comfortable chair which has a support on each side for your arms. English = lounge chair, armchair.

lounge%20room.description: (As a Noun) The room in a house, hotel, or club where people sit and relax. English = lounge.; (As a Noun) The room in a house where people sit and relax. English = lounge room.

venetian blind.description: (As a Noun) A window covering made of thin horizontal strips of wood, plastic, or metal. The strips can be turned to a different angle in order to let in more or less light. English = Venetian blind.; (As a Noun) A door or window with flat, sloping pieces of wood or glass across its frame. English = louvred window, louvres, louvred door.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of louvres on a window, to be adjusted.

love.description: (Interactive) Used alone as a symbol of Deaf pride or as a public gesture expressing solidarity and friendship with the people you are addressing, often translated as 'I love you.'

love-bite.description: (As a Noun) A red mark left on the neck or face as a result of enthusiastic and passionate kissing and biting. English = love-bite.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give someone a love-bite.

lover.description: (As a Noun) Someone you are having a sexual relationship with but are not married to. English = lover.; (As a Noun) A very strong feeling of affection for someone who you are romantically or sexually attracted to. English = love.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fall in love with someone.

love%20(tennis%20score).description: (As a Noun) The number 0. English = zero, nought.; (As a Noun) In tennis, a score of zero. English = love.

lowness.description: (As a Noun) The measurement from the top to the bottom of a person or thing, especially when that distance is thought to be small or below the average. English = lowness; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people or things, to measure a small or below average distance from the top to the bottom. English = (be) short, (be) low.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become lower or shorter; or to move downwards to a lower location.

lower%20(flag).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To lower a flag on a flag pole.

lower%20limit.description: (As a Noun) The smallest amount or number of something that is possible or allowed. English = minimum, limit, lower limit.; (As a Noun) The furthest extent you can go downwards. English = the end of, the bottom of.; (As a Noun) The most central and important part of something from which it can be further developed. English = basis.

oil.description: (As a Noun) A smooth, sticky liquid that is used as a fuel and for lubricating machines. English = oil.; (As a Noun) Oil that you put on a part of a machine so that it moves smoothly. English = lubricant.; (As a Noun) The act of putting oil on a part of a machine to make it move smoothly. English = lubrication.

lucky%20(lucky%20you!).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To wish you had things or qualities that other people have. English = envy someone, (be) envious of someone.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to being told by someone that they have done something or got possession of something that you wish you did or had. English = 'Lucky you!', 'What luck!', 'Can you believe it?', 'How did that happen?', 'How lucky is that?'; (Interactive) Used alone to show strong agreement with what your addressee has just said or done. English = 'That's it!', 'You are so right!', 'Spot on!' and so on.

ridiculous.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To look or be foolish, silly or stupid. English = (be) ridiculous, (be) ludicrous.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean you are amazed at what has been said or done and that you think it stupid or foolish. English = 'Ridiculous!'

lump%20sum.description: (As a Noun) A substantial sum of money that you get, receive or collect at one time, such as a superannuation payout, a redundancy package, or an inheritance.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that is paid as a large amount on a single occasion rather than as smaller amounts on several separate occasions. English = lump sum.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go and get something or someone and bring them to where you are. English = fetch, collect.

luna%20park.description: (As a Noun) An large, popular amusement park in both Sydney and Melbourne, called Luna Park.

lunch.description: (As a Noun) The meal you have in the middle of the day. English = lunch.; (As a Noun) Two slices of bread with a layer of food between them. English = sandwich.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To eat the meal you have in the middle of the day; to eat lunch.

sex.description: (As a Noun) The physical activity which people and animals do with each other to produce offspring and/or to experience pleasure. English = sex.; (As a Noun) The ability to experience sexual feelings or the behaviour associated with sex. English = sexuality.; (As a Noun) A feeling of strong sexual desire for someone, especially when that involves little, if any, emotional engagement. Often used in a disapproving sense. English = lust.

lutheran.description: (As a Noun) A Christian who follow the teachings of Martin Luther and who have their own branch of the Christian church and their own kind of worship. English = Lutheran.; (As a Noun) The beliefs and practices of Lutherans. English = Lutheranism.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of or relating to the Protestant church first established by Martin Luther. English = (be) Lutheran.

m.description: (As a Noun) The letter 'm' in the one-handed manual alphabets.

machine.description: (As a Noun) A piece of equipment, especially one with turning wheels and cogs, which uses electricity or power from an engine. English = machine.; (As a Noun) A large building or group of buildings where machines are used to make things in large quantities. English = factory.; (As a Noun) The components of a machine or a collection of machines. English = machinery.

machine%20gun.description: (As a Noun) A gun which works automatically and which fires a lot of bullets very quickly one after the other. English = machine gun.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a machine gun; to shoot with a machine gun; to machine gun.

maggot.description: (As a Noun) A tiny creature that looks like a very small worm that grows from fly eggs. It is often found in rotting food. It turns into a fly later. English = maggot.

magic.description: (As a Noun) In fairy stories, the special power that can make apparently impossible things happen. For example, it can control events in nature or make people disappear. English = magic.; (As a Noun) The art or skill of performing tricks to entertain people, for example by seeming to make things appear and disappear.; (As a Noun) A man in a fairy story who has magic powers, or a person who performs tricks as a form of entertainment. English = magician.

beautiful.description: (As a Noun) The quality of being very good indeed. English = excellence.; (As a Noun) The quality of being extremely beautiful, pleasant, or satisfying.; (As a Noun) The quality of being very beautiful or impressive. English = magnificence.

magnitude%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the relative size of an object, or the size or length of a vector. English = magnitude.

maiden%20(cricket).description: (General Definition) In context, used to refer to any thing or any action named with an English word beginning with 'm' particularly if it has already been fully fingerspelt earlier in the conversation. It is commonly used for minute, month, metre, and maiden.; (As a Noun) An abbreviation used to stand for one of the sixty equal parts of an hour. English = minute.; (As a Noun) An abbreviation used to stand for one of the twelve periods of time that a year is divided into, for example January or February. English = month.

mail%20out.description: (As a Noun) Messages written on pieces of paper and sent through the mail to lots of different people. English = mail out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send out messages written on pieces of paper through the mail to lots of different people; send out mail; send out correspondence; notify by mail or post.

top.description: (As a Noun) The highest point, part or surface of something. English = top.; (As a Noun) The main thing in a particular situation.; (As a Noun) The largest or biggest part of a thing in a particular situation. English = majority.

maintenance.description: (As a Noun) MAINTENANCE is the process of keeping something in good condition by checking it and fixing it when necessary. For example, checking and fixing a machine, or checking and clearing emails.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term MAINTENANCE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for MAINTENANCE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for MAINTENANCE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

majority.description: (As a Noun) The part of something which is more than half of it. English = majority.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a large number of something, to be much more than half of something, to be nearly all of something. English = (be) most.

making.description: (As a Noun) The production or construction of something. English = making, manufacture, creation.; (As a Noun) The name of the company that manufactures a product or the particular name that company gives to its product. English = make, type.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To produce something or construct something. English = make, manufacture, create.

make%20do.description: (As a Noun) A person who constantly or repeatedly asks other people for things, food or money (especially cigarettes or drinks), rather than buying or getting them him or herself. He or she always takes advantage of other people to get or do things they want. English = user, cadger, scrounger. Informal Australian English = bludger.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To constantly or repeatedly ask other people for things, food or money (especially cigarettes or drinks), rather than buying or getting them yourself. To treat someone unfairly for your own benefit, to use someone, to make use of someone. English = take advantage of, scrounge, cadge. Informal Australian English = bludge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use something or someone at hand, even though the thing or the person is not what or who you wanted in the first place. English = make do.

make%20enquiries.description: (As a Noun) The process of informally asking a number of people questions in order to find out information about something. English = enquiry, inquiry.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say something to a number of people in the form of a question because you want to know something, or because you want them to do something. English = ask around, enquire, inquire.; (Augmented Meaning) This is actually a modified form of the sign ASK. The movement in an arc or spiral strongly suggests asking many people over a period of time in a deliberate way.

make%20known.description: (As a Noun) Facts, details and ideas which are communicated or received about something or someone. English = information.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To communicate facts, details and ideas about something or someone. English = make known, inform, let someone know.

make%20love.description: (As a Noun) The act of having sex. Formal English = sexual intercourse, copulation.; (As a Noun) The physical activity which people and animals do with each other to produce offspring and/or to experience pleasure. English = sex.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have sex. Formal English = have sexual intercourse, copulate. English = make love.

make%20official.description: (As a Noun) Formal acceptance of a document by the government or by someone in authority, especially if that is shown by a stamp or mark on it. English = certification, approval.; (As a Noun) Formal acceptance of a policy or action by the government or by someone in authority. English = approval.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a document, to be formally accepted by the government or by someone in authority, especially by having been stamped or marked in some way. English = (be) official, (be) certified, (be) approved.

make%20the%20bed.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To neatly arrange the sheets and covers of a bed. English = make the bed.

make%20up%20(invent).description: (As a Noun) A story or idea which is made up and not true. Its purpose is often dishonest. It is like a lie but it is not as bad or as serious. English = invention, concoction, contrivance.; (As a Noun) A situation or event that you think about or imagine, although it is unlikely to happen or be true. English = fantasy, make believe.; (As a Noun) A story or stories about imaginary people and events, especially when written down in books. English = fiction.

malaysia.description: (As a Noun) A country in south east Asia, between Thailand and Indonesia. English = Malaysia.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A person or thing from or relating to Malaysia. English = Malaysian.

man.description: (As a Noun) An adult male human being. English = man (singular), men (plural).; (As a Noun) An animal, like a man, that belongs to the sex that cannot have babies or lay eggs. English = male.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To belong to the sex that cannot have babies or lay eggs. English = (be) male.

spite.description: (As a Noun) Actions or language which are deliberately nasty, because you want to hurt or upset someone. English = spite, malice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately do something or say something nasty, because you want to hurt or upset someone. English = (be) spiteful, (be) malicious.

malignant.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) A MALIGNANT tumour or disease is out of control and likely to cause death.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for MALIGNANT. If you know a sign for MALIGNANT used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

mammogram.description: (As a Noun) A test used to check whether women have breast cancer, using x-rays. English = mammogram.

mandolin.description: (As a Noun) A kitchen tool that is used to cut or shred vegetables evenly and quickly. English = mandolin.; (Note) The following signs or sign expressions are suggested signs for 'mandolin'.  Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

lion.description: (As a Noun) A large wild animal of the cat family which is found in Africa. They have yellowish fur, and the males have long hair on their head and neck. English = lion.; (As a Noun) The long thick hair that grows on the head and neck of a male lion. English = mane, lion's mane.

manual%20car.description: (As a Noun) A car in which the gears are changed by hand. English = manual car.; (As a Noun) A transmission (gear changing mechanism) in a car which is operated by hand. English = manual transmission.; (As a Noun) The lever in a car that you use to change gears. English = gearshift, gear-stick, gear lever.

manual%20handling.description: (As a Noun) MANUAL HANDLING is the movement or carrying of things by a person themselves using their hands. For example, lifting, pushing or pulling something.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term MANUAL HANDLING. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for MANUAL HANDLING (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for MANUAL HANDLING used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

manual%20(instructions).description: (As a Noun) A MANUAL is Information about how to do something, usually printed as a book or in a folder.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term MANUAL. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for MANUAL (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for MANUAL used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

manual%20transmission.description: (As a Noun) A car in which the gears are changed by hand. English = manual car.; (As a Noun) A transmission (gear changing mechanism) in a car which is operated by hand. English = manual transmission.; (As a Noun) The lever in a car that you use to change gears. English = gearshift, gear-stick, gear lever.

maori.description: (As a Noun) An indigenous inhabitant of New Zealand, a country in the South Pacific Ocean, east of Australia. English = Maori.

marbles.description: (As a Noun) A children's game played with small balls made of coloured glass. You roll a ball along the ground and try to hit an opponent's ball with it. English = marbles.; (As a Noun) One of the small balls used by children in the game of marbles. English = marble.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play a game of marbles, to flick a marble with your thumb.

marble%20(toy).description: (As a Noun) A children's game played with small balls made of coloured glass. You roll a ball along the ground and try to hit an opponent's ball with it. English = marbles.; (As a Noun) One of the small balls used by children in the game of marbles. English = marble.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play a game of marbles, to flick a marble with your thumb.

march.description: (General Definition) Of a crowd of people or other things, to all move in one direction at the same time by design or spontaneously, but especially in an organised way as in a march or parade.; (As a Noun) Of soldiers, the action of walking together with quick regular steps, as a group. English = march.; (As a Noun) An occasion on which people, especially soldiers, march together in front of important people or the public. English = parade.

marijuana.description: (As a Noun) A type of drug which is smoked in cigarettes and which is illegal in most countries. English = marijuana. Informal English = pot, grass, weed, dope.; (As a Noun) A cigarette made of marijuana. Informal English = joint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a marijuana cigarette in your mouth, suck the smoke into your lungs and blow it out again. English = smoke marijuana, smoke a marijuana cigarette. Informal English = smoke dope, smoke pot, smoke a joint.

quantity.description: (As a Noun) An amount of something that you can measure or count. English = quantity, number.; (As a Noun) Any of the signs such as 'two', 'nine' or 'eleven', or the symbols such as 1, 2, or 47. You use them to say how many things you are referring to or where something comes in a series. English = number.; (As a Noun) A number a teacher or examiner gives your work to indicate how good or bad your work is. English = mark.

scratch.description: (As a Noun) A small mark on an object which spoils its appearance. English = scratch, mark.; (As a Noun) A small cut on your skin. English = scratch.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a small mark on an object which spoils its appearance. English = scratch, mark.

marketing.description: (As a Noun) The part of business which is concerned with the way a product is sold, for example, its price and the way it is advertised. English = marketing.; (As a Noun) A place, sometimes in the open air, where lots of different goods are bought and sold. English = market.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sell a product or service in an organised way or on a large scale. English = market.

marlin.description: (As a Noun) A large, powerful, game-fish that has its upper jaw elongated into a rounded spear. English = marlin.

marriage.description: (As a Noun) The act of getting married, or the relationship between two people who are married. English = marriage.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two people, to become each other's spouse (married partner) during a special ceremony. English = marry.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to have a spouse. English = (be) married, (be) wed.

marron.description: (As a Noun) A large freshwater crayfish of western Australia. English = marron.

pile.description: (General Definition) Something of this general shape (irregular and/or hemispherical) on a flat surface, such as a pile, heap or mound of some sort, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A mass of something in a heap which is higher in the middle with sloping sides and usually round. English = pile, heap, mound, mass.

massage.description: (As a Noun) The activity of rubbing and squeezing part of someone's body in order to make them relax or to stop their muscles from being painful. English = massage.; (As a Noun) Medical treatment which involves doing exercises or having part of your body massaged or warmed. English = physiotherapy.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is doing physiotherapy. English = physiotherapist.

mass%20(church%20service).description: (As a Noun) The activity of communicating to God, or a set of words which is used during a religious service; thanks to God made before a meal. English = prayer; grace.; (As a Noun) A religious ceremony in a church; a ceremony in some Christian churches during which people eat bread and drink wine in order to remember the last meal of Jesus Christ. English = service, church service; mass.; (As a Noun) An intense and emotional request for something, often made repeatedly. English = plea, entreaty.

mass%20(weight).description: (As a Noun) In physics, the amount of physical matter that an object contains. Technical and scientific English = mass.

masturbation.description: (As a Noun) Of a male, the act of stroking or rubbing your own genitals in order to get sexual pleasure. English = masturbation. Informal English = wanking.; (As a Noun) A person whose behaviour you think is selfish and egotistical. English = wanker.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a male, to stroke or rub your own genitals in order to get sexual pleasure. English = masturbate. Informal English = wank, jerk off.

match.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To decide that one thing is suitable for another, for example, that they have the same colour or design. English = match.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two things, to be similar to one another, to have similar qualities, or to be as good or equal to one another in speed, size, or quality. English = match, (be) matched.

match%20(matchstick).description: (As a Noun) A small, thin stick of wood that produces a flame when you strike it against the side of a matchbox. English = match.; (As a Noun) A match or a cigarette lighter that can be used to start a cigarette burning. English = light.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To strike a match.

material%20safety%20data%20sheet%20(msds.description: (As a Noun) A MSDS (or Material Safety Data Sheet) is a document that contains information about potential health problems from chemicals, or other substances, and the correct way for working with these substances.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEET or MSDS.

material%20(stuff).description: (As a Noun) Things you can have and use for a particular purpose, such as 'teaching resources' or 'mineral resources'. English = resources.; (As a Noun) A solid substance, especially one that you can make things from. English = material.; (As a Noun) A substance which is used especially for making clothes and is made by weaving, knitting, or some other similar process. English = fabric.

mathematics.description: (As a Noun) A subject which involves the study of numbers, quantities, or shapes. English = mathematics, maths.

matron.description: (As a Noun) In a hospital, a senior nurse who is usually in charge of all the nursing staff. English = matron.; (As a Noun) In a boarding school, a woman who looks after the health and hygiene of the children. English = matron.; (As a Noun) A female member of a religious community. English = nun.

matter%20(not%20matter).description: (Interactive) Used to try to reassure your addressee when they are worried or concerned about something. English = 'Never mind', 'Don't worry', 'It's not important', and so on.; (Interactive) Used in response to your addressee's questions expressing concern for you when you want them to stop worrying or tell them everything is okay.
