English = novelty.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be made or created recently; to be not owned or used by anyone else before; to be different from what you had, used, or experienced before; or to be only recently discovered. English = (be) new.

novelty.description: (As a Noun) Something which has been previously unseen because it is new, different and unusual. English = novelty.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have not seen or noticed something.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not notice something or not realise its importance. English = (be) unaware of, overlook.

now.description: (As a Noun) The present time of talking, writing or signing and not some other time. English = present.; (As a Noun) The day on which or during which you are speaking, writing or signing. English = today, this day.; (As a Noun) On the very day which has already been identified (in the future or in the past) on which other actions also happen. English = that day, on that day, on that very day.

no%20way%20(reject).description: (Interactive) Used alone to refuse an offer. English = 'No!', 'No thanks!'; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you think there is no possibility or likelihood of what is being discussed actually happening or being really true. English = 'No!', 'No, that's not right!', 'No way!', 'Absolutely not!'; (As Modifier) Used (i) immediately next to a verb or adjective to negate it, i.e., to mean that the action does not happen, or that something does not have that quality, or (ii) used at the end of a question-like sentence as a kind of answer, i.e., it makes the whole sentence negative. For example ME FRIGHTENED SPIDERS? NO-WAY (“I’m not frightened of spiders”). English = not, don't, doesn't, didn't.

no%20worries.description: (Interactive) Used alone to mean that some action or task is very easy to do and you don't mind doing it. Informal English = 'easy-peasy', 'no worries', 'no problems'.

nozzle.description: (As a Noun) A short tube, usually tapered, that fits into one end of an icing bag. Used for making lines and decorations with icing. English = nozzle.; (Note) The following are suggested signs or sign expressions for ‘nozzle’. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

nudge.description: (As a Noun) A gentle knock you give someone with your elbow. English = nudge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your elbow to push someone out of the way, especially in a crowd. English = elbow.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your elbow to jab someone nearby in the ribs as a friendly gesture and as a sign of friendship and complicity, like winking. English = nudge.

nude.description: (As a Noun) A person who does not wear clothes, especially because they believe it is a good thing not to wear clothes. They do this at home or at special outdoor clubs. English = nudist.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, not to be wearing any clothes. English = (be) nude.

number.description: (As a Noun) Any of the signs such as 'two', 'nine', or 'eleven', or the symbols such as 1, 3, 47 and so on. You use them to show how many things you are referring to or where something comes in a series. English = number, numeral.

number%20plate.description: (General Definition) A combination of the Auslan sign NUMBER and a representation of a flat rectangular object.; (As a Noun) A sign, usually attached to the front and back of a vehicle, showing its registration number. English = number plate.

numerator.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the number above the line in a fraction. It shows how many of the parts indicated by the denominator (the number under the line) are present. English = numerator.

nun.description: (As a Noun) A member of a female religious community. English = nun.; (As a Noun) A covering over the head and body which a nun wears. English = habit.

nurse%20(cradle).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To hold an infant or a sick person carefully in your arms. English = nurse, cradle.

nut.description: (As a Noun) A thing that grows on trees (or under the ground) that has a hard shell and firm insides that can be eaten. English = nut.; (As a Noun) A small oval-shaped nut that grows under the ground which is often eaten as a snack, especially roasted and salted. English = peanut.

nutrition.description: (As a Noun) NUTRITION is the measure of the nourishment or energy that is obtained from food, or the study of the proper amounts of food required to grow and stay healthy.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword NUTRITION. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for NUTRITION (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for NUTRITION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

nuts%20(crazy).description: (As a Noun) Behaviour which is unintelligent, ignorant, unfair, or illogical. English = foolishness, craziness, stupidity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To behave in a unintelligent, ignorant, unfair, or illogical way. English = (be) foolish, (be) stupid, (be) crazy, (be) silly, (be) nuts.

o.description: (As a Noun) The letter O in the one-handed manual alphabets.; (Note) Apologies for the poor quality of this video. It will be replaced as soon as possible.

obey.description: (As a Noun) The type of behaviour of someone who does what they are told to do, or who follows someone's commands or instructions. English = obedience.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do what you are told to by someone; to follow someone's command or instruction. English = obey.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be someone (or a trained animal) who does what they are told to do, or who follows commands and instructions. English = (be) obedient.

object%20(criticise).description: (As a Noun) The act of saying that you do not like or approve of something. English = objection.; (As a Noun) The expression of your disapproval of someone or something by saying what you think is wrong with them. English = criticism.; (As a Noun) The responsibility for causing something bad, or letting it happen. English = blame.

objection.description: (As a Noun) The act of saying that you do not like or approve of something. English = objection.; (As a Noun) The expression of your disapproval of someone or something by saying what you think is wrong with them. English = criticism.; (As a Noun) The responsibility for causing something bad, or letting it happen. English = blame.

objective%20(aim).description: (As a Noun) The clear idea of what you will do and the final result you want. English = aim, intention, objective, purpose.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) The place you are travelling to where you want to end your journey at. English = destination.; (As a Noun) A lot of time and effort you give to something because you believe in it or you think it is important. English = commitment, dedication.

objective%20(not%20biased).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Ideas and opinions are OBJECTIVE if they are based on facts, rather than feelings.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term OBJECTIVE as it is used in an educational or academic context, especially in instructions for assignments or for exam questions.; (Note) The other signs associated with the English keyword OBJECTIVE would not be used in this specific context. If you know a sign for OBJECTIVE that is used by you or other Auslan user (deaf person or interpreter) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

object%20(thing).description: (As a Noun) A sign used as a substitute for another sign when you do not want to be more precise, when you are referring to something that has already been mentioned, or when you are going to give more details. English = thing.; (As a Noun) A physical object, rather than plants, animals, or human beings. English = thing.; (As a Noun) Your clothes or your possessions. English = things.

observation.description: (As a Noun) The action or process of carefully watching someone or something, especially in order to learn something about it. English = observation.; (As a Noun) Something that you have learned by seeing or watching something and thinking about it. English = observation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look at or watch something closely, especially in order to learn something about it. English = observe.

obstacle.description: (General Definition) Something going up close to or hitting a large flat object, such as a wall or obstacle, or any action or any object that can be directly or indirectly associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A physical object that a person or vehicle is unable to go over, go around or pass through; or a non-physical thing (such as a law, rule or policy) that stops someone doing something. English = barrier, obstacle.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) Something that prevents two people or groups of people from agreeing, communicating, or working with each other. English = barrier, obstacle.

obstetrician.description: (As a Noun) An OBSTETRICIAN is a doctor who is trained to deal with childbirth and the care of pregnant women.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OBSTETRICIAN. If you know a sign for OBSTETRICIAN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

sea.description: (General Definition) Any surface that moves up and down gently or is gently curving in one or more directions, particularly used to refer to water (waves, wavy) or land (hills, hilly), or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in a given context.; (As a Noun) The large area of salty water that covers about three-quarters of the earths surface. English = sea.; (As a Noun) A large area of salty water. English = sea, ocean.

octopus.description: (As a Noun) A sea creature with eight tentacles (legs or arms) which it uses to catch food. English = octopus.

smell.description: (As a Noun) The effect that something has on your nose. English = smell.; (As a Noun) The effect that something has on your nose, especially when the effect is neutral or pleasant. English = fragrance, perfume.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an effect on your nose. English = smell.

oedema.description: (As a Noun) OEDEMA is too much fluid in tissues or body cavities, resulting in swelling.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OEDEMA. If you know a sign for OEDEMA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

oesophagus.description: (As a Noun) Your OESOPHAGUS is the part of your body that carries the food from the throat to the stomach.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OESOPHAGUS. If you know a sign for OESOPHAGUS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

of%20course.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be what happens or is the case because it is part of the usual processes of life and has little or nothing to do with changes made by humans. English = (be) natural.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a part of someone's personality without them acting or changing themselves in any way. English = (be) natural.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be usual and ordinary, and what people expect. English = (be) normal.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be off something (to be no longer on something).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get off something (to be no longer standing on something).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get up from something (to be no longer lying on or sitting on something).

offence.description: (As a Noun) The feeling of hurt, displeasure, or irritation. English = offence.; (As a Noun) The feeling of being easily upset, offended, or irritated. English = touchiness, sensitivity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To upset or embarrass someone. English = offend.

rude.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of words or behaviour, to be likely to embarrass or offend people, because they relate to sex or other bodily functions. English = (be) rude, (be) offensive.

offer.description: (As a Noun) A statement in which someone says they will or are willing to give someone something or do something for someone. English = offer.; (As a Noun) Something that is offered to a god as a sacrifice. English = offering.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To ask someone if they would like to have or use something. English = offer.

office%20worker.description: (As a Noun) A person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings; a person whose job in a club or other organisation involves keeping records and writing letters. English = secretary.; (As a Noun) A room or a part of a building where people work sitting at desks. English = office.; (As a Noun) A person who works in an office, bank, or law court, and whose job is to look after the records or accounts. English = clerk, office worker.

official.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something which is approved or has been decided by the government or by someone else in authority. English = official.

offload.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To attend to a problem by assigning it to someone else. English = offload.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get rid of a problem by giving it to someone else to solve. English = offload. Idiomatic English = to pass the buck.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be undecided about how to solve a problem or whom to ask help in solving it.

ogle%20at.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of someone or something, to be very interesting or attractive so that you cannot stop looking at them.

oh.description: (Interactive) Used to express a feeling, such as surprise or joy, in response to something someone has said. Usually used with hearing people who can sign and intended as a visual joke based on the English exclamation 'Oh!'. English = 'Oh, really!'

oh%20my%20god%20(exclamation).description: (As a Noun) Extreme sadness, especially because someone has died. English = grief.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel very sad about something that has happened, especially if it involves the death of someone. Often you cannot talk to other people and struggle to control your emotions. English = grieve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not complain about something, even though it may be painful; to suffer something in silence. Formal English = (be) stoic. Idiomatic English = put up with something.

oil%20can.description: (As a Noun) A smooth, sticky liquid that is used as a fuel and for lubricating machines. English = oil.; (As a Noun) Oil that you put on a part of a machine so that it moves smoothly. English = lubricant.; (As a Noun) The act of putting oil on a part of a machine to make it move smoothly. English = lubrication.

oil%20filter.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, a device that removes contaminants from the oil that is used in the engine, the transmission etc. English = oil filter.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign OIL and FILTER, or OIL and and the representation of turning a seal or lid on to a cylindrical object. Source of these recommended signs: Victorian College for the Deaf.

ointment.description: (As a Noun) A smooth thick substance that is put on sore skin or a wound to help it heal. English = ointment.

old-fashioned.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer considered appropriate in style or design, because it has been replaced by something that is more modern. English = (be) old-fashioned.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to believe in and behave according to the values and standards of the past. English = (be) old-fashioned.

old%20hat.description: (As a Noun) Things or facts which are known by everybody and not special in any way. English = common knowledge.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be ordinary and not special in any way. English = (be) common.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very ordinary and so familiar and well-known that it has become uninteresting and boring. Idiomatic English = (be) old hat.

olympic games.description: (As a Noun) A set of international sports competitions which take place every four years, each time in a different country. English = Olympic Games, Olympics.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to the Olympic games. English = (be) Olympic.

olympic%20games.description: (As a Noun) A set of international sports competitions which take place every four years, each time in a different country. English = Olympic Games, Olympics.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to the Olympic games. English = (be) Olympic.

ombudsman.description: (As a Noun) An OMBUDSMAN is a person who investigates and attempts to resolve complaints and problems, as between employees and an employer, or between a customer and a service provider.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term OMBUDSMAN. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OMBUDSMAN (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for OMBUDSMAN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

omega.description: (As a Noun) The last letter of the Greek alphabet, written Ω in upper case, called “omega”. It is used as a symbol in mathematics and scientific notation, often to mean the last in a series of items or categories. English = omega.

overlook.description: (As a Noun) A mistake which is the result of failing to see or be aware of, or failing to realise the importance of, a fact or a problem.; (As a Noun) Something which has not been included through a mistake or by being overlooked. English = omission.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fail to see or be aware of, or fail to realise the importance of, a fact or a problem. English = overlook, disregard, neglect.

once.description: (As Modifier) Used next to a verb to mean the action happens one time only, or one time within a particular period of time. English = once.

once%20more.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be one more of something; to be additional.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action is performed again for one more time. English = once more, one more time, once again.

one.description: (As a Noun) The number 1, between zero and two. English = one.

one%20more.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be one more of something; to be additional.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action is performed again for one more time. English = once more, one more time, once again.

one%20on%20one.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a teacher, to teach only one student at a time. English = tutor.; (As Modifier) Used to describe a situation in which one person teaches, instructs or advises another person about something without other people being present. English = one to one, one on one.

swimsuit.description: (As a Noun) A tight-fitting piece of clothing that a woman wears when she goes swimming. English = swimsuit, bathing suit, one-piece.

one%20thousand.description: (As a Noun) The number 1,000. English = one thousand, thousand.

one%20to%20one.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a teacher, to teach only one student at a time. English = tutor.; (As Modifier) Used to describe a situation in which one person teaches, instructs or advises another person about something without other people being present. English = one to one, one on one.

one%20way.description: (General Definition) The movement of some thing, usually upright and longer than it is wide, such as a person, away from the signer or starting point, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a one way trip.; (As a Noun) A movement (especially of a person or an upright entity) forward from its starting point.; (As a Noun) A journey or a trip out of or away from where you are now.

onion.description: (As a Noun) A small round vegetable. It is white with a brown, papery skin, and has a strong smell and taste. It can make your eyes water, as if you are crying, when you cut it. English = onion.

on%20purpose.description: (As a Noun) The determination to get what you want and to do things in your own way, often knowing you may hurt someone else. English = wilfulness.; (As a Noun) The strong determination that someone has to do exactly what they want and not to change their mind or be persuaded to do anything else. English = obstinacy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of actions, to be done with intention or with a plan, that is after having thought about it first. English = (be) deliberate, (be) intentional, (be) done on purpose.

opaque.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an object or substance, to be unable to see through it. English = (be) opaque.

open.description: (As a Noun) The first part of an activity. English = start, beginning.; (As a Noun) The first part of a book or a film. English = opening, beginning.; (As a Noun) The start of a large and important activity, or the official announcement of when a new product is made available to the public. English = opening, launch.

open%20(automatic%20doors).description: (General Definition) Two relatively narrow vertical flat surfaces that separate horizontally from each other or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A set of doors that slide open automatically. English = automatic doors.; (As a Noun) A set of doors that slide open. English = sliding doors.

open%20(book).description: (As a Noun) A number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. It contains information, stories, pictures, or poetry. English = book.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open a book.

open%20(door).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To open the entrance to a building, room, cupboard, or vehicle by swinging a piece of wood, glass, or metal across the entrance; to open a door. English = open.; (As a Verb or Adjective) About businesses, offices, shops, etc., to be in a period when work is happening and there is access to the premises. English = (be) open.

open%20(drawer).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To open a drawer.

open%20(folder).description: (General Definition) Two flat surfaces in which one folds away from the other, such as a folder or an envelope, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open a folder.

surprise.description: (As a Noun) An unexpected event. English = surprise.; (As a Noun) The feeling you have when something unexpected happens. English = surprise.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give someone a feeling of surprise; to be something that makes someone feel surprised. English = surprise; (be) surprising.

open-necked.description: (As a Noun) An open-necked shirt or blouse.; (As a Noun) The collar on an open-necked shirt or blouse.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wear an open-necked shirt or blouse.

open%20(sliding-door).description: (General Definition) A flat surface the moves sideways in front of another flat surface or any thing or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, such as a sliding-door or a photographic slide.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a sliding door, to open.

open%20(window).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To open a space in a wall or roof or in the side of a vehicle, often with glass in it so that light can pass through it and people can see through it; to open a window.

opera.description: (As a Noun) A musical entertainment that is like a play except that most of the words are sung. English = opera.; (As a Noun) A person whose job it is to sing the songs in an opera. English = opera singer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sing the songs from an opera.

opera%20singer.description: (As a Noun) A musical entertainment that is like a play except that most of the words are sung. English = opera.; (As a Noun) A person whose job it is to sing the songs in an opera. English = opera singer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sing the songs from an opera.

operation.description: (As a Noun) A form of treatment in a hospital in which a doctor cuts open a patient's body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part. English = operation, surgery.; (As a Noun) A doctor who cuts open a patient's body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part. English = surgeon.; (As a Noun) A mark on the skin that is left after a wound has healed. English = scar.

opportunity.description: (As a Noun) A situation in which it is possible for something to happen, especially a situation which is unexpected and beneficial. English = opportunity, chance.; (As a Noun) The arrival of someone somewhere, especially unexpectedly. English = appearance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take place without planning and unexpectedly. English = pop up, appear.

repression.description: (As a Noun) The use of force to restrict and control a person or a group of people, especially the people of a country. English = repression.; (As a Noun) The unfair or cruel treatment of a person or a group of people. English = oppression.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use force to restrict and control a person or a group of people, especially the people of a country. English = repress, keep under one's thumb.

optometrist.description: (As a Noun) Someone whose job involves testing people's eyesight or providing glasses and contact lenses. English = optician, optometrist.; (Note) This is a compound of EYE + DOCTOR. The sign for DOCTOR can be like it is shown here, or you could also fingerspell DR instead (i.e., EYE + DR).

lip reading.description: (As a Noun) A deaf person who has been educated without the benefit of sign language and who has been taught using a method which encourages the use of speech alone.; (As a Noun) A deaf person who can use speech quite well and who probably does not use sign language.; (As a Noun) The technique of decoding the sounds of a spoken language by watching the lips. English = lip reading, speech reading.

orange.description: (As a Noun) A round fruit that is juicy and sweet. It has a thick skin and is divided into sections inside. English = orange.; (As a Noun) A colour between red and yellow. English = orange.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a colour which is between red and yellow. English = (be) orange.

orange%20juice.description: (As a Noun) A drink made from squeezed oranges. English = orange juice.

orange%20squeezer.description: (As a Noun) A liquid that can be obtained from a fruit, such as an orange. English = juice.; (As a Noun) A special device with a raised centre and fluted sides on which you turn a piece of fruit to get the juice out of it. English = juicer, orange squeezer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To squeeze the juice out of a piece of fruit by turning it on a juicer or squeezer.

ordination.description: (As a Noun) The religious event in which someone is made a member of the Catholic clergy in a special ceremony. English = ordination.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be made a member of the Catholic clergy in a special religious ceremony. English = (be) ordained.

order%20(command).description: (As a Noun) The act of telling someone to do something with the expectation that they will obey you. English = order.; (As a Noun) The actual instruction or instructions you give to someone and which you expect them to follow. English = order, instruction.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell someone to do something with the expectation that they will obey you. English = order.

order%20(sequence).description: (As a Noun) A box or a folded piece of card in which someone keeps documents that belong together. English = file.; (As a Noun) The special arrangement of things that is made according to certain principles which puts one thing or type of thing first, another thing or type of thing second, and so on. English = order, sequence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a document away in its correct file; to sort documents; to put documents away in a filing cabinet. English = file.

order%20(tidy).description: (As a Noun) The condition when things are neat and arranged in an orderly way. English = tidiness, orderliness, neatness.; (As a Noun) Neat ordered piles of things regularly spaced. English = stacks.; (As a Noun) A group or stack of things which are neat or which all share some characteristic. English = category.

orientating.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a sign, to belong to a class of signs in which the orientation of the sign can be changed to show the relationship between two people or things and the action of the verb. English = (be) orientating.

orientation.description: (As a Noun) In sign languages, the direction of the palm and/or the fingers face during the production of a sign. English = orientation.

origin%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, a fixed point from which coordinates are measured. English = origin.

osteoporosis.description: (As a Noun) Osteoporosis is a condition in which your bones lose calcium and become more likely to break.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OSTEOPOROSIS. If you know a sign for OSTEOPOROSIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

otitis%20media.description: (As a Noun) OTITIS MEDIA is inflammation of the middle ear. This inflammation often begins with infections that cause sore throats, colds or other respiratory problems, and spreads to the middle ear. These can be caused by viruses or bacteria.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for OTITIS MEDIA. If you know a sign for OTITIS MEDIA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

ouch%20(exclamation).description: (As a Noun) Extreme sadness, especially because someone has died. English = grief.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel very sad about something that has happened, especially if it involves the death of someone. Often you cannot talk to other people and struggle to control your emotions. English = grieve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not complain about something, even though it may be painful; to suffer something in silence. Formal English = (be) stoic. Idiomatic English = put up with something.

ought%20(ought%20not).description: (Interactive) Used alone to mean you think that the action under discussion is not right, it is not good that it happens, or that you feel that it will not happen.; (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb (action) sign to mean that you think that it is not right or not good that the action happens, or that you feel that it will not happen. English = shouldn't, ought not to.; (As Modifier) You use this sign when you are suggesting that someone not do something.

ought%20to.description: (Interactive) Used alone to mean you think that the action under discussion is right, it is good that it happens, or that you feel that it will happen. English = 'It should...," "It ought to...,"; (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb to mean that you think that it is right or good that the action happens, or that you feel that it will happen. You use this sign when you are suggesting that someone do something. English = should, ought to.; (Augmented Meaning) If you make the sign with more stress (increasing the size and speed of the movement, and making it stop suddenly at the end) you 'harden the meaning' of this sign. It then means that you feel very strongly that it happens, or that you are ordering someone to do something. English = must, have to.

our.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used to mean something is owned or possessed by the signer and at least one other person. It is usually signed immediately next to the noun sign for the thing that is owned. English = our.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to mean something is owned or possessed by the signer and at least one other person. Used alone without saying what is possessed if it is clear from context or because someone has mentioned it before. English = ours.

ourselves.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used immediately before or after a verb, but usually after, to mean the signer and at least one other person do the action of the verb together, i.e., without the help of other people. English = ourselves.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used immediately before or after a verb, but usually after, to mean the action of the verb was done by the signer and at least one other person to the signer and the same other person or people, i.e., it makes the verb reflexive. English = ourselves.

out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In sports, to tell a player to leave the playing field because they have broken the rules of the game in some way. English = send off, dismiss.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In sports and games, to have done something which means you can no longer participate. English = (be) out.; (As Modifier) A Signed English sign for the English word 'out' used in all its senses.

out%20(extinguished).description: (As a Noun) The ending of the burning of a fire or the shining of a light; the turning off of a light; the putting out of a fire.; (As a Noun) The ending of some activity. English = finish.; (As a Noun) A period of time in which you stop doing what you are doing, for example to have a rest, before continuing again. English = pause.

perspective.description: (As a Noun) A particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experience. English = perspective, point of view, outlook.

out%20(sport).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In sports, to tell a player to leave the playing field because they have broken the rules of the game in some way. English = send off, dismiss.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In sports and games, to have done something which means you can no longer participate. English = (be) out.; (As Modifier) A Signed English sign for the English word 'out' used in all its senses.

oval.description: (As a Noun) A shape that is like a circle, but is wider in one direction than the other. English = oval.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an oval shape. English = (be) oval.

oval%20(sport).description: (As a Noun) A flat and round or elliptical area on which sporting activities take place. English = oval.

oven.description: (As a Noun) An oven is a cooker or part of a cooker that is like a box with a door. You put food inside in order to cook it. English = oven.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open an oven.

over.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel or move directly above something with a space between the thing moving and the surface. English = go over.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located directly above something with a space between the two things. English = (be) over, (be) above.; (As Modifier) Used after many verbs (especially 'talk', 'write' and 'think') and before a noun to mean that the topic of the activity is the following noun. English = about, concerning, pertaining to.

overalls.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing consisting of trousers and a top that are joined together in one piece, which people wear when they are working in order to keep their ordinary clothes clean. English = overalls, boiler suit.

over%20and%20over.description: (As a Noun) A performance of an act multiple times. English = repetition.; (As a Noun) The act of reading or studying something again in order to remember it better or learn it more thoroughly. English = revision, review.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do an action again. English = repeat.

overarm%20(swimming).description: (As a Noun) The sport or recreation in which people move through the water by making movements with your arms and legs. English = swimming.; (As a Noun) A short period of activity during which people move through the water by making movements with your arms and legs. English = swim.; (As a Noun) A style of swimming. English = overarm, crawl, Australian crawl.

over%20(cricket).description: (As a Noun) In cricket, the number of balls delivered between successive changes of bowlers. English = over.; (As a Noun) In cricket, the part of the game played between successive changes of bowlers. English = over.

overflow.description: (As a Noun) Too much water or liquid that goes over the side of a barrier or the edge of a container. English = overflow, spillage.; (As a Noun) A channel that carries away surplus water, as from a dam. English = spillway.; (As a Noun) Water that flows over the edge of a steep cliff and falls to the ground below. English = waterfall.

overhead-projector.description: (As a Noun) A machine that projects transparencies onto a screen or wall. English = overhead-projector.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make writing or pictures appear on a screen or wall, using an overhead projector. English = project.

overnight.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stay somewhere for all of one night; to stay overnight.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen or take place during all of one night, to happen overnight.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action happens during all of the night. English = overnight.

lead (competition).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or race, to be ahead of your rival. English = win, lead.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In a competition or ranking, to go from being last or well behind the leaders to being first or well in front of the others. English = overtake, catch up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In any endeavour, to be improve your position relative to where you were and relative to other people. English = get ahead.

overtake%20(in%20vehicle).description: (As a Noun) The act of passing someone in a vehicle because you are driving faster then they are. English = overtaking.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pass someone in a vehicle because you are driving faster then they are. English = overtake.

overtaking%20(in%20vehicle).description: (As a Noun) The act of passing someone in a vehicle because you are driving faster then they are. English = overtaking.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pass someone in a vehicle because you are driving faster then they are. English = overtake.

overtime.description: (As a Noun) Time that you spend at your job in addition to your normal working hours. English = overtime.; (As Modifier) Used after a verb (action) sign to mean the action takes place over several hours making it take longer than is usual. Idiomatic English = hour by hour, round the clock, around the clock.; (As Modifier) Used after the sign work to mean the work is in addition to your normal working hours. English = overtime.

overturn.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of moving vehicles, to turn onto the side or upside down. English = overturn.

overwhelm.description: (As a Noun) The state of being beaten in a battle, game, or contest. English = defeat.; (As a Noun) The cruel or unfair treatment of someone or a group of people. English = oppression.; (As a Noun) The prevention of something from continuing by an army or a government; keeping someone or a group of people under your control. English = suppression; subjugation.

owl.description: (As a Noun) A bird with a flat face and large eyes, which hunts small animals at night. English = owl.

oyster.description: (As a Noun) A large, flat shellfish that can be eaten. Some varieties produce pearls. English = oyster.

p.description: (As a Noun) In the American one-handed manual alphabet, the letter of the English alphabet written 'P' or 'P'.; (Note) Apologies for the poor quality of this video. It will be replaced as soon as possible.

pace%20about.description: (General Definition) To walk around in circles. or anything or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, e.g., wait.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something uninteresting or unimportant while you are waiting for something else to happen. English = wait, pace about. Idiomatic English = to mark time, to hang about, to kill time.

pacemaker.description: (As a Noun) A PACEMAKER is a device that is placed inside someone's body in order to help their heart beat in the right way.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PACEMAKER. If you know a sign for PACEMAKER used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

packet.description: (As a Noun) A small container in which a quantity of something is sold, they are usually small boxes made of thin cardboard. English = packet, pack.

packed%20(crowded).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a place, to be full of people, often so that it is difficult to move around. English = (be) crowded, (be) packed.

packer.description: (As a Noun) A person who removes things from the end of the process line in a factory and places them in packets or boxes. English = packer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put your belongings into a bag, because you are leaving a place or going on holiday. English = pack, pack up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To work as a packer in a process line in a factory.

pack%20(packet).description: (As a Noun) A small container in which a quantity of something is sold, they are usually small boxes made of thin cardboard. English = packet, pack.

pack%20up.description: (General Definition) To pick up things and put them into various different places, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a number of things into the place where they are normally kept, for example in a cupboard or drawer. English = put away, pack up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a number of things, such as work materials on a desk, into particular positions, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy. English = arrange.

room.description: (As a Noun) One of the separate sections in a house or other building, which has its own wall, ceiling, floor, and door. English = room.; (As a Noun) A defined area, inside or outside a building, often one which is surrounded by a fence or a wall.; (As a Noun) Any area of land which has been fenced in. English = paddock.

pager.description: (As a Noun) A small portable device which receives, but does not transmit, audible signals, used as a means of contacting or conveying instructions to the person carrying it. English = pager.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send or receive a signal on a pager. English = page, (be) paged.

page%20(use%20pager).description: (As a Noun) A small portable device which receives, but does not transmit, audible signals, used as a means of contacting or conveying instructions to the person carrying it. English = pager.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send or receive a signal on a pager. English = page, (be) paged.

paint.description: (As a Noun) A coloured liquid that you put onto a surface using a brush in order to protect the surface or to make it look nice. English = paint.; (As a Noun) A broad brush used for covering walls or surfaces with paint. English = paintbrush.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is painting the walls, doors, and other parts of buildings. English = painter.

pair.description: (As a Noun) Two things that are the same size and shape and are intended to be used together. English = pair.; (As a Noun) Two people who are standing or walking together or who have some kind of relationship with each other. English = pair.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people, to become grouped in pairs. English = pair up, form pairs, pair off.

pair%20up.description: (As a Noun) A long and enduring partnership, friendship, or romantic attachment, in which two people share many experiences and do much together.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two people, to meet and form a deep and strong relationship, usually loving and often sexual, that lasts for a long time. Idiomatic English = pair up with someone; share one's life with someone.

paleness.description: (As a Noun) A condition in which you have  a face which is lighter in colour than usual. English = paleness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to have a face which is lighter in colour than usual, because you are ill, frightened, or shocked. English = (be) pale, look pale.

palpitations.description: (As a Noun) When someone has PALPITATIONS, their heart beats very fast in an irregular way.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PALPITATIONS. If you know a sign for PALPITATIONS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

panel%20beater.description: (As a Noun) A person who beats sheet metal into particular shapes as part of making the bodywork of motor vehicles. English = panel beater.; (As a Noun) The job of a panel beater. English = panel beating.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To beat sheet metal into particular shapes as part of making the bodywork of motor vehicles.

panel%20beating.description: (As a Noun) A person who beats sheet metal into particular shapes as part of making the bodywork of motor vehicles. English = panel beater.; (As a Noun) The job of a panel beater. English = panel beating.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To beat sheet metal into particular shapes as part of making the bodywork of motor vehicles.

pane%20of%20glass.description: (As a Noun) A flat sheet of glass in a window or a door. English = windowpane, pane, pane of glass; (As a Noun) A hard transparent substance that windows and bottles are made from. English = glass.

panic.description: (As a Noun) A very strong feeling of anxiety or fear, especially one that makes you act without thinking carefully. English = panic.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To act without thinking carefully because you are very anxious or frightened. English = panic.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To react without thinking or with confusion to a situation because you are unprepared or surprised by it. Idiomatic English = (be) off one's guard, (be) caught unawares.

view.description: (As a Noun) Everything that you can see from a window or from a high place. English = view, panorama, vista.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look out at a view, to take in a view.

pantyhose.description: (As a Noun) Women's tights, similar in look and style to stockings. English = pantyhose, pantihose.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on or be wearing pantyhose.

pants.description: (As a Noun) Clothes you wear on your legs. English = pants, trousers.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wear pants or trousers.

paper.description: (As a Noun) Material that you write on or wrap things with. English = paper.; (As a Noun) A number of large sheets of folded paper on which news, advertisements, and other information is printed. Some are available everyday and others once a week. English = newspaper.

pap%20smear.description: (As a Noun) A PAP SMEAR is a medical test in which cells are taken from a woman's cervix and analysed to see if any cancer cells are present.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PAP SMEAR. If you know a sign for PAP SMEAR used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

parabola.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, a symmetrical open plane curve formed by the intersection of a cone with a plane parallel to it side. The path of a projectile under the influence of gravity follows a curve of this shape. English = parabola.

parachute.description: (As a Noun) A device which enables you to jump from an aircraft and float to the ground. It consists of a large circle of thin cloth attached to your body by strings. English = parachute.; (As a Noun) The sport or activity of jumping out of planes with a parachute. English = parachuting.; (As a Noun) A person who jumps out of planes using a parachute. English = parachutist.

parade.description: (As a Noun) A line of people or vehicles moving somewhere together, for example through the streets of a town, to celebrate a special day or event. English = parade.; (As a Noun) An occasion on which soldiers march together in front of important people or the public. English = parade.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a line of people or vehicles, to move somewhere together, for example through the streets of a town, to celebrate a special day or event. English = parade.

paragraph.description: (General Definition) Something relatively thick or large at the top of or on a vertical flat surface, such as a think line, border or title across a sheet of paper, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a paragraph.; (As a Noun) A section of a piece of writing which always begins on a new line. English = paragraph.

parallel.description: (As a Noun) Two lines, paths or long objects which are the same distance apart all along their length.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two lines, paths or long objects, to be the same distance apart all along their length. English = (be) parallel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two objects, to go or move along parallel paths.

paralysis.description: (As a Noun) The loss of feeling in your body or in part of it, especially the face, and to be unable to move it. English = paralysis.; (As a Noun) A sudden and severe illness which affects your brain, and which often kills people or causes them to be paralysed on one side of their body. English = stroke.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To lose feeling in your body or in part of it, especially the face, and to be unable to move it. English = (be) paralysed.

nurse.description: (As a Noun) A thing person or organisation connected with the care of sick or injured people, such as a nurse, hospital, or ambulance.; (As a Noun) Someone with medical training whose job it is to help people who are injured or sick. English = nurse, paramedic.; (As a Noun) A place where sick people are looked after by doctors and nurses. English = hospital.

parboil.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To boil food until it is partially cooked. English = parboil.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword PARBOIL. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PARBOIL (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for PARBOIL used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

parcel.description: (As a Noun) Something wrapped up in paper. English = parcel.; (As a Noun) Something you give to someone on special occasions, such as Christmas or on their birthday, which is usually wrapped up in fancy paper. English = present.; (As a Noun) A piece of paper or plastic which is used to cover and protect something. English = wrapping.

pardon%20me.description: (As a Noun) A feeling you have when you wish you had not done something. English = regret.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wish you had not done something, especially something which has caused someone pain or difficulties. English = regret, feel sorry.; (Interactive) Used alone as a way of apologising to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties. English = 'Sorry', 'I'm sorry' and so on.

parent.description: (As a Noun) Your mother or your father, or both. English = parent, parents.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To come from or relate to parents in general, or to come from or relate to one or both of the parents of a particular child, especially in the sense of caring and loving children. English = (be) parental.; (Note) Some younger signers accept this as an everyday Auslan sign, but the majority of deaf Auslan signers, especially older signers, use the other sign that matches the key word ‘parent that is also listed here in Signbank.

parents.description: (As a Noun) Your mum and your dad. English = parents.

parfait.description:
(As a Noun) A PARFAIT is a chilled dessert consisting of layers of different ingredients, often served in a tall glass (a parfait glass). Parfait may include layers of fruit, mousse, meringue, cream, ice-cream and jelly.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keywords PARFAIT. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PARFAIT for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).

If you know a sign for PARFAIT used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

paring%20knife.description: (As a Noun) A thin-bladed knife intended for coring and peeling fruit, as well as slicing small ingredients. Mostly used for detailed and controlled cutting. English = paring knife.; (Note) This suggested sign expression for ‘paring knife’ is recommended by DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.

car park.description: (As a Noun) An area or a building where people can leave their cars. English = car park, parking lot.; (As a Noun) An individual space for a car on the side of a road or within a car park. English = park, parking space.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To drive a car into a parking space and leave it there. English = park.

parking.description: (As a Noun) The activity of driving a vehicle into a position where it can stay for a period of time, and leaving it there. English = parking.; (As a Noun) An area of ground where people can leave their cars. English = parking lot.

parking%20bay.description: (As a Noun) A raised flat surface along the side of which a vehicle can stop for the purposes of loading and unloading goods or passengers. English = platform, loading bay, parking bay.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pull up in a vehicle next to a platform.

parking%20lot.description: (As a Noun) The activity of driving a vehicle into a position where it can stay for a period of time, and leaving it there. English = parking.; (As a Noun) An area of ground where people can leave their cars. English = parking lot.

park%20(playground).description: (As a Noun) A seat hanging by two ropes or chains from a metal frame or from a branch of a tree. park%20(vehicle).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To drive a vehicle into a position where it can stay for a period of time, and leave it there. English = park.

parramatta.description: (As a Noun) A suburb of Sydney, called Parramatta.

mean (stingy).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be very unwilling to spend money. English = (be) mean, (be) stingy. Formal English = (be) parsimonious

parsnip.description: (General Definition) A long tapering object or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A long, thick, pale cream vegetable that grows under the ground. English = parsnip.

participate.description: (As a Noun) Joining in or taking part in the NDIS. English = participation.; (As a Noun) A person who takes part in the NDIS. English = participant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To join in or take part in the NDIS. English = participate.

participation.description: (As a Noun) The action of taking part in some activity so that you do something with another person or other people. tip (end point).description: (General Definition) The end point or highest point of some tall thin object, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A specific item or a particular idea or subject.; (As a Noun) The end of something that is long and thin. partner.description: (As a Noun) The person you do something with like dancing, playing a game, or owning and running a business. English = partnership.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something with someone like dancing, playing a game, or owning and running a business. English = (be) partners.

part-time.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To work for only part of each day or week. English = (be) part-time.

party.description: (As a Noun) Activities in which you meet your friends and acquaintances, for example at parties, and relax and have a good time; social activities.; (As a Noun) A social event, often in someone's home, at which people enjoy themselves doing things such as eating, drinking, dancing, talking, or playing games. party%20(political).description: (As a Noun) A number of people or things which are together at one place at one time. English = group, class, team, unit.; (As a Noun) A group of pupils or students who are taught together. English = class.

pass.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go past someone or something without stopping; to pass by.

pass%20away.description: (As a Noun) The distance of an object above some other object when that is great; the length of the distance from the bottom to the top of some long, relatively thin, upright object. passenger.description: (As a Noun) A person who is travelling in a bus, boat, plane, car or other vehicle, but who is not the driver or a member of the crew. English = passenger.

timidity.description: (As a Noun) A fear or lack of confidence. English = timidity, passiveness.; (As a Noun) A movement away from a difficult or dangerous situation. pass%20out.description: (As a Noun) A short rest in which you lie down on a bed. pass%20(test).description: (As a Noun) A mark you get in an exam or test which means you have got an acceptable standard, usually by getting more than half of the answers right. pass%20the%20buck.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To attend to a problem by assigning it to someone else. Idiomatic English = to pass the buck.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be undecided about how to solve a problem or whom to ask help in solving it.

spaghetti.description: (As a Noun) A type of food made from pasta. It looks like long pieces of string and is usually served with a sauce. past%20(distant%20past).description: (As a Noun) The side or part of something that is towards the rear or farthest from the front. It is normally not used or seen as much as the front. English = go backwards, back up, reverse.

pastor.description: (As a Noun) A member of the Christian clergy, especially one who is not a member of the Catholic or Anglican churches. English = pastor.

dough.description: (As a Noun) A mixture of flour and water, and sometimes also sugar and fat, which can be cooked to make bread, pastry, or biscuits. pat.description: (General Definition) The action of tapping or hitting something with you hand, such as a part of your body, the back of your other hand or some other object, or any action or thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A light tap on something lightly, usually with your fingers. patch.description: (As a Noun) A piece of material which you use to cover a hole in something, especially clothing. English = patch.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To mend something, especially clothing, that has a hole in it by fastening a piece of material over the hole. English = patch.

street.description: (General Definition) Something long and relatively narrow with two clearly defined sides that goes into the distance or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context, especially a road or street.; (As a Noun) A route in a town or village, usually one with houses along it. It is usually paved. English = street, road.; (As a Noun) The direction to a particular place that is a long straight thin line of ground that has been marked by people or animals walking, or has been specifically constructed and paved, and/or has been marked with signs. English = way, path.

patient%20(calm).description: (As a Noun) The ability to stay calm and not get annoyed, for example when you are waiting for something. English = patience.; (As a Noun) The ability to bear a painful or difficult situation calmly and patiently. English = endurance.; (As a Noun) A state of quiet and peacefulness without excitement or stress. English = calmness.

pay.description: (As a Noun) The act of paying money to someone. English = payment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give an amount of money to someone because you are buying something or because you owe it to them. English = pay.

peach.description: (As a Noun) A soft, round, juicy fruit with sweet yellow flesh and pinky-orange skin. They grow in warm countries. English = peach.

people.description: (As a Noun) Men, women, and children in general. English = people.

pepper.description: (As a Noun) A hot tasting powder which is used to flavour food.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sprinkle pepper on food. English = pepper.

pepper-mill.description: (As a Noun) A small, hand-operated device used to crush peppercorns in order to flavour a dish. English = pepper-mill, pepper-grinder.; (As a Noun) Fresh black or green pepper that comes out of a pepper-mill.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a pepper-mill.

per cent.description: (As a Noun) A fraction of an amount expressed as a particular number of hundredths of that amount. English = percentage.; (As a Noun) A single unit of measurement when an amount is expressed as a percentage. English = per cent, percent (US).; (As a Noun) The symbol used to write percentages (%) which is pronounced "per cent" in English.

perimeter.description: (As a Noun) The outer edge or boundary of an area or object. In geometry, the continuous line forming the boundary of a closed object. English = perimeter.; (Note) This sign uses two P handshapes from the one-handed alphabet. It was originally borrowed from American Sign Language (ASL) for use in deaf education (mathematics and geometry) in Australia. It has become accepted and used by some Auslan signers, especially teachers of the deaf, their students, and interpreters.

period%20(full%20stop).description: (As a Noun) The dot (.) which you put as a punctuation mark at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation. period%20(lesson).description: (As a Noun) A short period of time during which people are taught about a particular subject or taught how to do something. English = lesson; (As a Noun) At a school or college, the parts the day is divided into during which lessons are given. English = period.

period%20(menstruation).description: (As a Noun) The period of time each month during which a fertile woman loses blood from her womb. period%20(time).description: (As a Noun) A defined or particular length of time. English = period.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to two signs specifying points in time (times, days, months, years, dates) to mean between these two times. English = from X, to Y; between X and Y.

permanence.description: (As a Noun) The condition of remaining the same for a long time. regularity.description: (As a Noun) The quality of happening often and usually with the same length of time and space between each occurrence. English = reliability.; (As a Noun) The quality of being in a situation or place all the time. English = permanency.

vertical.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stand or point straight up and down. English = (be) vertical.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In geometry, of a line, to intersect another line at right angles. English = (be) perpendicular.; (Note) Two of the variant signs use initialisation and were created for use in education. One uses the V handshape (for ‘vertical’) and one uses the P handshape (in the one-handed alphabet) for ‘perpendicular’. They have been accepted and used as Auslan signs by some deaf people, especially in educational contexts by teachers of the deaf, their students, and interpreters. However, the main sign and the other variant can also be used with both meanings.

puzzle.description: (As a Noun) Something that confuses you because you do not understand it. English = puzzle.; (As a Noun) The feeling of confusion you get when you do not understand something. English = puzzlement.; (As a Noun) A question, game, or toy which you have to think about carefully in order to answer it correctly or put it together properly. English = puzzle.

personal%20%20protective%20equipment%20(.description: (As a Noun) PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) is any equipment that helps to prevent injury when you are working. sweat.description: (As a Noun) The salty, colourless liquid that comes out in drops on the surface of your skin when you are hot or frightened. English = sweat. Formal English = perspiration.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a salty, colourless liquid, to come out in drops on the surface of your skin. English = sweat. Formal English = perspire.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be nervous or stressed by a particular situation.

perth.description: (As a Noun) The capital city of the Australian state of Western Australia, called Perth.

petition.description: (As a Noun) A document signed by a lot of people which asks a government or other official group to do something. English = petition.; (As a Noun) A formal written and signed request for a position in an organisation, such as a job or place at a college. English = application.; (As a Noun) A document with more than one signature on it.

scare.description: (As a Noun) A great fright. English = scare.; (As a Noun) A very great fear. English = terror.; (As a Noun) A very great feeling of anxiety or fear, especially one that makes you act without thinking carefully. English = panic.

petrol%20filter.description: (As a Noun) A device in a petrol powered engine through which petrol flows and particles and impurities are removed. English = petrol filter.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign PETROL + FILTER.

petrol%20gauge.description: (General Definition) Of anything that has some length, to become shorter starting from one end and moving towards the other end, or any thing or action associated with this, such as a progress bar or a power gauge.; (As a Noun) An indicator on a computer’s screen to show that a task is underway and how much of it is completed. petrol%20tank.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the container that holds fuel. petticoat.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing like a thin skirt, which is worn under a skirt or dress. English = petticoat.

pharisee.description: (As a Noun) A member of a group of Jews, mentioned in the Bible, that believed in strictly obeying the laws of Judaism. philosophy.description: (As a Noun) The study or creation of theories about basic things such as the nature of existence or how people should live; or a particular set of such ideas. mull over.description: (As a Noun) Activity in the mind. phonology.description: (As a Noun) In spoken language, the study of the speech sounds used to make the words. phooey.description: (Interactive) A gesture of rejection or dismissal made towards the person or thing that is rejected or dismissed, saying that it is not worth bothering about or is no longer important. photo.description: (As a Noun) A picture that is made by using a camera. English = photo, photography, picture.; (As a Noun) The art and skill of using a camera and producing photographs. photocopier.description: (As a Noun) A machine which quickly copies documents onto paper by photographing them. English = photocopier.; (As a Noun) A copy of a document made by using a photocopier. physics.description: (As a Noun) The scientific study of the forces and qualities such as heat, light, sound, pressure, gravity, and electricity, and the way that they affect objects. English = physics.

piano.description: (As a Noun) A musical instrument with a row of black and white keys. pick%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To pick up a bag, case, basket, suitcase, or luggage.

Idiomatic English = pick up, score.

picture%20(movie).description: (As a Noun) Moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown in a cinema or on television. English = pictures, film, films, movie, movies.; (As a Noun) A theatre where moving pictures are shown. English = cinema, movie theatre. Informal English = pictures.

picture%20(photo).description: (As a Noun) A picture that is made by using a camera. English = photo, photography, picture.; (As a Noun) The art and skill of using a camera and producing photographs. English = photography.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a camera to make a picture. English = photo, photograph.

pictures%20(cinema).description: (As a Noun) Moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown in a cinema. English = picture, film, movie.; (As a Noun) A place where people go to watch films. English = cinema, pictures.

picture%20(visualise).description: (As a Noun) The ability you have to form ideas and pictures of new or exciting things in your mind. English = imagination.; (As a Noun) The idea or picture you have of something in your mind. English = concept, conception, notion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think of something and to form a picture of it in your mind. English = imagine, picture, visualise, conceive, conceive of.

pie.description: (General Definition) The outline of a small round object, or any thing or any action that can be directly or indirectly associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) Meat, vegetables, or fruit which is baked in pastry, usually round. English = pie.; (As a Noun) Fruit which is baked into a pastry, which usually small round. English = tart.

part.description: (As a Noun) One of the pieces or areas that another thing consists of. English = part, piece, portion.

stumps (pylons).description: (As a Noun) The individual raised foundations upon which the floor of a house rests which may be either short, for a low set house, or quite long and tall, for a raised house (such as you find in the north of Australia). English = stumps, piers, pylons.; (As a Noun) The layers of bricks or concrete below the ground or on the ground that a building or other structure is built on. English = foundations.

pill.description: (As a Noun) A small piece or mass of medicine which you swallow, with or without chewing. English = tablet, pill.; (As a Noun) Something used for the treatment of an illness, especially pills or tablets. English = medication.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a tablet or pill.

pillow.description: (As a Noun) A rectangular cushion which you rest your head on when you are in bed. English = pillow.

pi%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) The sixteenth letter of the Greek alphabet, written as π in lower case, called 'pi'. It is used as a symbol in mathematics and scientific notation to mean the value of the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter. English = pi.

pin.description: (As a Noun) A very small, thin rod of metal with a point at one end. They can be stuck through things, for example two pieces of cloth, in order to fasten them together. English = pin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a pin to fasten something somewhere. English = pin.

pinafore.description: (As a Noun) A dress with no sleeves, which a woman or girl wears over a blouse or sweater. English = pinafore.

pinch.description: (As a Noun) The grabbing or squeezing of a part of someone's body between your thumb and first finger. English = pinch, tweak.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To squeeze a part of someone's body between your thumb and first finger. English = pinch, tweak.

pineapple.description: (As a Noun) A large oval fruit that grows in hot countries. It is sweet, juicy, and yellow inside and has a thick, brownish skin. English = pineapple.

pink.description: (As a Noun) The colour between red and white. English = pink.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be or become the colour between red and white. English = (be) pink.

pin%20up.description: (As a Noun) A written announcement which is put in a place, usually a wall or vertical surface, where it can be read by everyone. English = notice.; (As a Noun) Short nails with broad, fat tops, which you use for attaching papers to a wall or vertical surface. English = drawing pins, thumb tacks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put up a written announcement, usually on a wall or vertical surface, where it can be read by everyone.

spit.description: (As a Noun) An amount of the watery liquid produced in your mouth which has been forced out deliberately, either to clear your mouth or as an aggressive gesture towards someone else (showing hatred or disgust). English = spit, spittle.; (As a Noun) One of the small hard seeds found in a fruit such as an apple which you often have to spit out when eating the fruit. English = pip, pips, seed, seeds.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To force out some spittle from your mouth, either to clear your mouth or as an aggressive gesture towards someone else (showing hatred or disgust). English = spit, spit out.

pipe%20(smoking).description: (As a Noun) A object which is used for smoking tobacco. You put tobacco into the cup-shaped end, light it, and breathe in smoke through a narrow tube. English = pipe.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smoke a pipe.

pirate.description: (As a Noun) A sailor who attacks other ships and steals property from them. English = pirate.

pissed%20(drunk).description: (As a Noun) A person who often gets drunk. English = drunkard. Informal English = piss pot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have drunk so much alcohol that you cannot speak or sign clearly or behave sensibly. English = (be) drunk. Informal English = (be) pissed, (be) sloshed. Formal English = (be) inebriated.

pissed%20off.description: (As a Noun) A person who likes to throw temper tantrums.; (As a Noun) A noisy outburst of bad temper. English = tantrum, temper tantrum.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel or show strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting. English = (be) angry, (be) furious, (be) pissed off.

piss%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place, especially a room, suddenly and quickly because you do not want to be there any longer. English = get out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place where you are normally obliged to stay because of responsibilities (eg work or home) without regard to the consequences or without permission. You would do this because you are angry, irritated or irresponsible.; (As a Verb or Adjective) English = walk out. Informal English = nick off, bugger off.

piss%20pot.description: (As a Noun) A person who often gets drunk. English = drunkard. Informal English = piss pot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have drunk so much alcohol that you cannot speak or sign clearly or behave sensibly. English = (be) drunk. Informal English = (be) pissed, (be) sloshed. Formal English = (be) inebriated.

piston.description: (As a Noun) A cylinder or metal disc that is part of an engine. It slides up and down inside tubes and causes various parts of the engine to move. English = piston.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a piston, to go up and down inside a chamber or cylinder.

piston%20ring.description: (As a Noun) A circular object which goes around the top of a cylinder in an internal-combustion engine. English = piston ring.

sympathy.description: (As a Noun) The feeling you have for someone because they are unlucky or unfortunate and you feel sad for them. English = pity, sympathy, compassion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be unlucky and to make other people feel sorry for you. English = (be) poor, (be) unfortunate, (be) pitied.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel sorry for someone because they are unlucky or unfortunate. English = pity, sympathise, (be) sympathetic, (be) compassionate.

pity.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a very strong feeling of emotion about something that has happened (sadness, pity, sympathy, etc.) which physically makes you feel tense, as if you were about to cry, and unable to speak or communicate without showing this emotion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) English = pity, feel pity for, feel sorry for. Idiomatic English = have or get a lump in your throat.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be on the verge of an unhappy or unwanted display of emotion.

pizza.description: (As a Noun) A flat, round piece of dough covered with tomatoes, cheese, and other kinds of food, and then baked in an oven. English = pizza.

place%20(location).description: (As a Noun) A particular bit of some space (such as a room, building, city, country, or the world). English = part, area, district, region, place, locality.; (As a Noun) A particular subject or area of activity or interest. English = field.; (As a Noun) The place where a person or thing is located or to be found. English = whereabouts.

place%20(put).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something carefully into a particular place or position. English = put, place, put with care.

plain%20(flat%20area).description: (General Definition) A low surface which is everywhere the same distance from the ground and not sloping or curved and with no parts higher than any other, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially the ground itself or the floor of a room.; (As a Noun) That part of a room that you walk on. English = floor.; (As a Noun) The surface of the earth on which we walk and live. English = ground.

plainness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of having a surface which is entirely in one colour and has no pattern, design or writing. English = plainness, simplicity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being very simple in style. English = plainness, simplicity.; (As a Noun) A flavouring that comes from a plant and that can be put into ice cream and other sweet food. English = vanilla.

plain%20(obvious).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that is easily seen, noticed, or recognised. English = (be) obvious, (be) plain, (be) evident.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that you expect people to know already. English = (be) obvious, (be) clear.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean that you think what they have said is something that is easily see, noticed, or recognised. English = 'Obviously!', 'Plainly!', 'Evidently!'

plain%20stitch.description: (As a Noun) In knitting, a simple, plain stitch. English = plain stitch, garter stitch.

plain%20(undecorated).description: (As a Noun) The quality of having a surface which is entirely in one colour and has no pattern, design or writing. English = plainness, simplicity.; (As a Noun) The quality of being very simple in style. English = plainness, simplicity.; (As a Noun) A flavouring that comes from a plant and that can be put into ice cream and other sweet food. English = vanilla.

plane%20(shave).description: (As a Noun) A person whose job is making and repairing wooden things. English = carpenter.; (As a Noun) The skill or the work of a carpenter. English = carpentry, woodwork.; (As a Noun) A person who makes wooden window frames, door frames, and doors; the skill and work of such a person. English = joiner; joinery.
