plastic.description: (As a Noun) A material which is produced by a chemical process and which is used to make many objects. It is light in weight and does not break easily. English = plastic.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be made of plastic. English = (be) plastic.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able to be bent easily without breaking. English = (be) flexible.

plasticine.description: (General Definition) The action of rubbing something between your hands, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially plasticine.; (As a Noun) The trade name (trademark) for a soft coloured substance like clay which children use for making little models, called plasticine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To roll plasticine together between your hands; to play with plasticine.

plate.description: (General Definition) Outlining the shape of any flat round object, such as a dish, record or disk, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a plate.; (As a Noun) A round or circular, flat object of some sort. English = disk, disc.; (As a Noun) A round or oval flat dish that is used to hold food. English = plate.

platform.description: (As a Noun) A raised flat surface along the side of which a vehicle can stop for the purposes of loading and unloading goods or passengers. English = platform, loading bay, parking bay.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pull up in a vehicle next to a platform.

bill.description: (General Definition) The opening and closing of a mouth of a person or animal, such as a bill, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a platypus.; (As a Noun) The hard flat part of the mouth of a bird-like animal, such as a duck, which is wider and flatter than most bird's beaks. English = bill.; (As a Noun) An amphibious egg-laying mammal of Eastern Australia that has dense fur and a broad bill, tail and webbed feet. English = platypus.

play.description: (As a Noun) Time spent by children with toys or taking part in games or acting out imaginary situations and roles. English = play.; (As a Noun) A piece of theatre, performed or written. English = play.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of children, to spend time with toys, taking part in games or acting out imaginary situations and roles. English = play.

play%20football.description: (As a Noun) A code of football which originated in Australia and which is most popular in the southern and western states of Australia. It has its origins in Gaelic football. English = Australian Rules. Informal English = Aussie Rules.; (As a Noun) Any game in which a ball is kicked around a field for most of the match. For example, Australian Rules, Rugby Union, Rugby League, Soccer, and Gridiron. English = football.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play Australian Rules football.

swing.description: (As a Noun) A seat hanging by two ropes or chains from a metal frame or from a branch of a tree. You can sit on the seat and move forwards and backwards through the air. English = swing.; (As a Noun) A public area of land with grass and trees, often with a section with swings and other amusements for children, where people go to relax and enjoy themselves. English = park.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move backwards and forwards on a swing.

playing%20card.description: (As a Noun) Thin pieces of cardboard with numbers or pictures printed on them which are used to play various games. English = card, gaming card, playing card.; (As a Noun) A pack or set of playing cards. English = deck of cards.; (As a Noun) A game played using cards; a card game; a game of cards.

playpen.description: (As a Noun) A small structure which is designed for a baby or young child to play safely in. It has bars or a net around the sides and is open at the top. English = playpen.

playroom.description: (As a Noun) A room in a house or school for children to play in. English = playroom.

play%20tape.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To play the tape on a tape recorder or video so that it moves forward and you can see or hear what is on it. English = play tape.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move the tape on a tape recorder or video forward so that it goes to a place nearer the end where you want to be. English = wind forward.

playtime.description: (As a Noun) A period of time between lessons at school when children can play outside. English = playtime, recess.

pleased.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of happiness, satisfaction, or enjoyment. English = pleasure.; (As a Noun) The activity of enjoying yourself rather than working. English = pleasure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make someone feel happy and satisfied. English = please.

please%20oneself.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To do what you want to do without thinking too much of what other people want to do. English = please oneself.; (Interactive) Used alone to indicate to the person you are talking to that you do not mind or care whether the person does a particular thing or not. English = 'Please yourself', 'It's up to you!', 'It's your decision.'; (Interactive) Used alone with a slight disapproving facial expression to indicate to the person you are talking to that you will not say or do anything more to stop them doing something even though you do not approve. English = 'Suit yourself!'

please%20yourself.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To do what you want to do without thinking too much of what other people want to do. English = please oneself.; (Interactive) Used alone to indicate to the person you are talking to that you do not mind or care whether the person does a particular thing or not. English = 'Please yourself', 'It's up to you!', 'It's your decision.'; (Interactive) Used alone with a slight disapproving facial expression to indicate to the person you are talking to that you will not say or do anything more to stop them doing something even though you do not approve. English = 'Suit yourself!'

plough%20(mechanical).description: (As a Noun) An area of land consisting of fields and some buildings, which is used for growing crops or raising animals. English = farm.; (As a Noun) A farm vehicle with large rear wheels that is used for ploughing fields, sowing crops, and pulling trailers. English = tractor.; (As a Noun) A large farming tool with sharp blades which is attached to a tractor or an animal such as a horse. It is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seed are planted. English = plough.

plug.description: (As a Noun) A small plastic object with metal pieces which fit into the holes in a socket and connect the wire from a piece of electrical equipment to the electricity supply. English = plug.; (As a Noun) A place on a wall or on a piece of electrical equipment into which you can put a plug. English = socket.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To insert a plug into a socket. English = plug in.

plum.description: (As a Noun) A small sweet fruit with a smooth red or yellow skin and a stone in the middle. English = plum.; (Note) Some older signers may think of this sign as an invented sign (for Signed English in education) but for most younger signers it is just another Auslan sign.

plunger.description: (General Definition) The act of pushing something down through a cylinder or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, particularly a coffee plunger.; (As a Noun) Coffee-making device in which infused ground coffee is pushed downwards in a plunger. English = coffee plunger.

pneumonia.description: (As a Noun) PNEUMONIA is a serious disease which affects your lungs and makes breathing difficult.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PNEUMONIA. If you know a sign for PNEUMONIA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

pocket.description: (As a Noun) A small bag that is sewn into a piece of clothing, and that is used for carrying small things such as money or a handkerchief. English = pocket.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make it, get it, or do it. English = profit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take something without being entitled to it; to steal something. English = pocket.

poetry.description: (As a Noun) A form of literature in which language is carefully fashioned into a signed, spoken or written text in which the words or signs are arranged and selected for their meaning and their visual or sound quality, especially rhymes. English = poetry, poem.

point.description: (General Definition) The action of pointing with the index finger, or any thing the pointing action can be understood as pointing at, indicating or indexing, including any direction or movement in the direction of the vector of the pointing action.; (As a Noun) Extending one’s hand and index finger so that the tip of the index finger is directed to a particular (real or imaginary) location or to a particular (real or imaginary) thing which is, or could be construed to be, at that location. English = pointing, point.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To extend one’s hand and index finger so that the tip of the index finger is directed to a particular (real or imaginary) location or to a particular (real or imaginary) thing which is, or could be construed to be, at that location. English = point.

point%20(dot).description: (General Definition) Indicate by pointing, or mark with your finger, a small defined thing or location somewhere in space or on a surface, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A mark on a piece of paper or on a display screen (or any surface which can be drawn or written on) which is small, round and completely filled in. English = point, dot, spot.; (As a Noun) A mark in writing that is small, round and completely filled in which marks the end of a sentence. English = full stop, stop, period.

point%20(full%20stop).description: (As a Noun) The dot (.) which you put as a punctuation mark at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation. English = full stop, period.; (As a Noun) The reason, purpose, or use of something. English = point.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a dot at the end of a sentence.

point%20(geometry).description: (General Definition) Indicate by pointing, or mark with your finger, a small defined thing or location somewhere in space or on a surface, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A mark on a piece of paper or on a display screen (or any surface which can be drawn or written on) which is small, round and completely filled in. English = point, dot, spot.; (As a Noun) A mark in writing that is small, round and completely filled in which marks the end of a sentence. English = full stop, stop, period.

pointing%20(to%20body%20parts).description: (As a Pointing Sign) The video at this entry shows someone pointing to different parts of their body. Some of these body-parts have their own Auslan sign (and if you do a keyword search for them you will find a match).; (Note) Most body parts do not have special signs in Auslan and they are signed simply by pointing to them. However, some body parts both external (’eyebrows’) and internal (’heart’) have their own Auslan signs. You will find them by searching for the keyword. If a body part is inside you and has no sign, e.g. ‘liver’, then you can point to the general area where it is located, and then describe it (say what it does or show how it is shaped using depicting signs). You can also fingerspell the English word for it.; (Note) Pointing signs are used when the body part can be easily and appropriately pointed at, with due regard to the situation and the audience. For example, some sexual body parts should not be pointed to in polite/formal situations, in mixed groups, or in the presence of children. Some of them also have their own Auslan signs (and if you do a keyword search for the them you will find a match).

point%20of%20view.description: (As a Noun) A particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experience. English = perspective, point of view, outlook.

point%20(purpose).description: (As a Noun) The dot (.) which you put as a punctuation mark at the end of a sentence when it is not a question or an exclamation. English = full stop, period.; (As a Noun) The reason, purpose, or use of something. English = point.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a dot at the end of a sentence.

points%20(spark%20plugs).description: (As a Noun) In the electronics of engines, either of a pair of contacts tipped with tungsten or platinum that makes or breaks current flow. English = points.; (As a Noun) In a motor engine, a device, with points, which causes the electric sparks that ignite the fuel. English = spark plugs.

poison.description: (As a Noun) A substance that harms or kills people or animals if they swallow it or absorb it. English = poison.; (As a Noun) A person who gossips quite viciously.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To kill a person or to make them ill by means of poison. English = poison.

poker%20machine.description: (As a Noun) A machine used for gambling. You put in a coin and then pull a lever (on old machines) or press buttons (on new machines) to try and get particular patterns of symbols on a screen in order to win money. Australian English = poker machine, pokies.; (As a Noun) A place where poker machines can be found, usually a club, such as an RSL (Returned Serviceman's Club), a football club, or a worker's club. English = club.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gamble on a poker machine; to play a poker machine. Informal Australian English = play the pokies.

poker machine.description: (As a Noun) A machine used for gambling. You put in a coin and then pull a lever (on old machines) or press buttons (on new machines) to try and get particular patterns of symbols on a screen in order to win money. Australian English = poker machine, pokies.; (As a Noun) A place where poker machines can be found, usually a club, such as an RSL (Returned Serviceman's Club), a football club, or a worker's club. English = club.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gamble on a poker machine; to play a poker machine. Informal Australian English = play the pokies.

pole%20vault.description: (As a Noun) In athletics, a very long high jump which athletes make over a high bar, using a long, flexible pole to help lift themselves up. English = pole vault.

police.description: (As a Noun) The official organisation that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law. English = police.; (As a Noun) The men and women who are members of the police. English = police.; (As a Noun) A man or woman who is a member of the police force. English = police officer, policeman, policewoman.

police%20officer.description: (As a Noun) The official organisation that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law. English = police.; (As a Noun) The men and women who are members of the police. English = police.; (As a Noun) A man or woman who is a member of the police force. English = police officer, policeman, policewoman.

program.description: (As a Noun) A series of actions or events that are planned to be done as part of some task or as part of a computer's instructions, or shown or performed as part of some entertainment. English = program.; (As a Noun) A person whose job involves writing instructions (programs) for a computer. English = programmer.; (As a Noun) A large-scale attempt to do or achieve something, which is carefully planned and will take some time. English = project.

rubbing.description: (General Definition) To hold something in your hand and move it rigourously and repeatedly across a surface, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) The act of moving your hand backwards and forwards over something, while holding a cloth and pressing firmly. English = rubbing.; (As a Noun) The act of moving your hand backwards and forwards over something, while holding a cloth and pressing firmly, in order to make it clean; or to make it shine. English = washing, cleaning; polishing.

politics.description: (As a Noun) The actions or activities which people use to achieve power in a country, society, or organisation. English = politics.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is in politics, particularly a member of parliament. English = politician; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to politics; or to be interested in politics and hold strong beliefs about it. English = (be) political.

pollute.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To POLLUTE means to make water, air or land dirty and dangerous to live in or to use, especially with poisonous chemicals or sewage.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term POLLUTE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for POLLUTE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for POLLUTE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

skivvy.description: (As a Noun) An item of clothing worn on the torso that has a fold of material right round the top, through which the head and neck protrude, which is doubled over. The folded material goes right round the neck and covers part or most of a person's neck.; (As a Noun) English = skivvy, polo-necked or turtle-necked sweater or jumper.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A type of collar on a garment which consists of a fold of material right round the top, through which the head and neck protrude, which is doubled over and covers most of a person's neck. English = (be) turtle-necked, (be) polo-necked.

polynomial.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, an expression of more than two algebraic terms, especially the sum of several terms that contain different powers of the same variable or variables. English = polynomial.; (Note) This sign uses a P handshape from the one-handed alphabet. It was originally borrowed from American Sign Language (ASL) for use in deaf education (mathematics and geometry) in Australia. It has become accepted and used by some Auslan signers, especially teachers of the deaf, their students, and interpreters.

pong.description: (As a Noun) An offensive or strong smell. Informal English = pong.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a strong or offensive smell. English = stink. Informal English = pong.

poo.description: (As a Noun) Waste matter discharged from the intestines through the anus. Used especially when talking to children. English = poo, poo-poo.; (As a Noun) An unpleasant and strong smell; a foul smell. English = odour.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To discharge waste matter from the intestines through the anus. Used especially when talking to children. English = poo, do a poo.

popular.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the centre of everyone's attention; for all eyes to be on someone or something.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be someone or something which is enjoyed and liked by a lot of people. English = (be) popular.

pop%20up.description: (As a Noun) Something that happens unexpectedly or without warning.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen suddenly or as a surprise. English = (be) unexpected.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To appear in a place unexpectedly or to attend an event unexpectedly or without having been invited. Idiomatic English = show up, pop up.

pig.description: (As a Noun) A pink or black animal with short legs and not much hair on its skin. They are often kept on farms for their meat. English = pig.; (As a Noun) Meat from a pig which is eaten as a food, especially if it is fresh and not smoked or salted. English = pork.

portfolio.description: (As a Noun) In education, a selection of a student's work compiled over a period of time, usually for assessing performance or progress. English = portfolio; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term PORTFOLIO. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PORTFOLIO (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for PORTFOLIO used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

portrait.description: (As a Noun) A painting or drawing of someone. English = portrait.; (As a Noun) A person who paints or draws pictures of people. English = portrait painter.; (As a Noun) The art of painting or drawing portraits. English = portraiture.

portrait%20painter.description: (As a Noun) A painting or drawing of someone. English = portrait.; (As a Noun) A person who paints or draws pictures of people. English = portrait painter.; (As a Noun) The art of painting or drawing portraits. English = portraiture.

portugal.description: (As a Noun) A country in south western Europe, to the west of Spain. English = Portugal.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be from or relate to Portugal. English = (be) Portuguese.

possum.description: (General Definition) Something swinging or hanging from something long and thin, such as a monkey hanging from a branch, or any thing or action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a possum.; (As a Noun) A small animal which carries its young in a pouch on its body. It has thick fur and a long tail. English = possum.

stamp (postage).description: (As a Noun) A small piece of gummed paper which you stick on an envelope or parcel before you post it. English = stamp, postage stamp.; (As a Noun) The money that you pay for sending letters and parcels by post. English = postage.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To affix or stick a stamp to an envelope or parcel before you post it.

postage%20stamp.description: (As a Noun) A small piece of gummed paper which you stick on an envelope or parcel before you post it. English = stamp, postage stamp.; (As a Noun) The money that you pay for sending letters and parcels by post. English = postage.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To affix or stick a stamp to an envelope or parcel before you post it.

postbox.description: (General Definition) The action of putting a flat object inside a narrow opening, such as a card in an ATM, a disk in a computer, or a bank-book through a slot to a bank teller, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially posting.; (As a Noun) A large metal container in the street into which you post letters. English = postbox.; (As a Noun) A metal box at your front gate or a rectangular hole in your front door through which letters for you are delivered. English = letterbox.

post%20(letter).description: (General Definition) The action of putting a flat object inside a narrow opening, such as a card in an ATM, a disk in a computer, or a bank-book through a slot to a bank teller, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially posting.; (As a Noun) A large metal container in the street into which you post letters. English = postbox.; (As a Noun) A metal box at your front gate or a rectangular hole in your front door through which letters for you are delivered. English = letterbox.

post%20office.description: (As a Noun) A building where you can buy stamps, post letters and parcels, and use other services provided by the national postal service. English = post office.

potato.description: (As a Noun) A round white vegetable with a brown or red skin. It grows underground. English = potato.

potato%20chip.description: (As a Noun) A long, thin piece of potato fried in oil or fat. English = chip, potato chip.

pot%20(marijuana).description: (As a Noun) A type of drug which is smoked in cigarettes and which is illegal in most countries. English = marijuana. Informal English = pot, grass, weed, dope.; (As a Noun) A cigarette made of marijuana. Informal English = joint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a marijuana cigarette in your mouth, suck the smoke into your lungs and blow it out again. English = smoke marijuana, smoke a marijuana cigarette. Informal English = smoke dope, smoke pot, smoke a joint.

potter%20about.description: (As a Noun) The act of doing something that is very pleasant to do but not very important, especially something around the house. English = pottering.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something that is pleasant to do but not very important, especially something around the house. English = potter, potter about, mess about.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something in a very disorganised or casual way without really achieving very much but, nonetheless, enjoying yourself. British English = faff, faff about.

pouch.description: (General Definition) A pocket or bag which is worn or located at the front of the body, such as a pocket in an apron or a carpenter's tool bag, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a pouch.; (As a Noun) A flexible container like a small bag. English = pouch.; (As a Noun) A pocket of skin on some animals. Female kangaroos have them on their stomachs in which their babies grow. English = pouch.

pound.description: (General Definition) In context, this sign can refer to any thing or any action named by an English word beginning with 'L' particularly if it has already been fully fingerspelt in the conversation, especially litre and pound (symbols and abbreviations use 'L').; (As a Noun) A unit of money used in Australia until 1966 and still used in Britain. English = pound.; (As a Noun) A unit of weight used mainly in Britain, America, and other countries where English is spoken, and written using the abbreviation lb. English = pound.

pour%20from.description: (General Definition) The action of pouring a small amount of something out of a container, such as sauce, or any action or thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially cordial.; (As a Noun) A sweet drink made from fruit juice. English = cordial.

talcum powder.description: (As a Noun) A soft perfumed powder which people put on their bodies after they have had a bath or shower. English = talcum powder, talc, powder.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cover parts of your body with scented powder.

sand.description: (As a Noun) A powdery substance that consists of extremely small pieces of stone. Most deserts and beaches are covered in it. English = sand.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be covered of made up of sand. English = (be) sandy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look and feel like powder (something that consists of many tiny particles of a solid substance). English = powdery.

power%20(electricity).description: (As a Noun) A form of energy which is transmitted through wires that is used for heating and lighting, and to provide power for machines in houses and factories. English = electricity, power.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of various devices and machines, to depend on electricity as a source of power. English = (be) electric, (be) electrical.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a device, to have transistors, silicon chips, or valves which control and change the electric current passing through it. English = (be) electronic.

power%20gauge.description: (General Definition) Of anything that has some length, to become shorter starting from one end and moving towards the other end, or any thing or action associated with this, such as a progress bar or a power gauge.; (As a Noun) An indicator on a computer’s screen to show that a task is underway and how much of it is completed. English = progress bar, status bar.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of petrol in a vehicle, to become used up so that there is no more left; to run out of petrol.

power%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) The product obtained when a number is multiplied by itself a certain number of times. English = power.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To multiply a number by itself twice. English = cube X.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A number which is multiplied by itself twice. English = X cubed.

power%20of%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) The multiplication of a number (Y) by itself a certain number of times (X) is called "Y to the power of X". For example, 2 to the power of 4 equals 16. English = power of.; (Note) In discussing mathematics, you make this sign between two number signs. So "2 to the power of 4" is signed "TWO POWER-OF FOUR".

power%20steering%20hose.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the rubber tubes that connect different parts of the power steering system. English = power steering hose.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan signs ELECTRICITY + STEERING-WHEEL + HOSEPIPE.; (Note) Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf

power%20steering%20reservoir.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the part of the car that holds the fluid used in the power steering system. English = power steering reservoir.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign ELECTRICITY + JAR.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for POWER STEERING RESERVOIR for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for POWER STEERING RESERVOIR used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

power%20windows.description: (As a Noun) The passenger windows in a motor vehicle that operate on electric power. English = power windows.

ppe%20(personal%20protective%20equipment.description: (As a Noun) PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) is any equipment that helps to prevent injury when you are working. For example: gloves, helmet, goggles, boots.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT or PPE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

pragmatics.description:
(As a Noun) In linguistics, the study of the meaning of language in its context of use.
English = pragmatics; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term PRAGMATICS. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PRAGMATICS (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for PRAGMATICS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

prawn.description: (As a Noun) A small shellfish with a long tail and many legs. English = prawn. American English = shrimp.

preacher.description: (As a Noun) A person, usually a member of the clergy, who preaches sermons as part of a church service. English = preacher.; (As a Noun) A talk on a religious or moral subject during a church service; a talk which tries to persuade other people to accept a belief or to take a course of action. English = sermon.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give a talk on a religious or moral subject during a church service; to try to persuade other people to accept a belief or to take a course of action. English = preach.

prefect.description: (As a Noun) An older pupil at a school who does special duties and helps the teachers to control the younger pupils. English = prefect.; (As a Noun) A small piece of cloth, metal or paper that is worn on your chest and which has your name on it. English = name tag.

rather.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To like something better than other things, to want to do something more than other things. English = rather, prefer.

shock.description: (As a Noun) An experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = shock.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have an experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = (be) shocked.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make someone have an experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = shock.

premiers.description: (As a Noun) The winner of a rugby championship. Australian English = premiers.; (As a Noun) A championship competition held among a number of sports clubs. English = premiership.

preparation.description: (As a Noun) All the arrangements and activity that is needed  to be ready for a future event. English = preparation, preparations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get yourself ready for an action or event that will happen soon. English = prepare, get ready, make ready.

preplanning.description: (As a Noun) The activity of getting ready and planing an action before you are ready to start it in reality. English = preplanning.; (As a Noun) A provisional plan which is made before you are ready to make a final plan or to start an activity. English = preplan.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To plan beforehand. English = preplan.

preposition.description: (As a Noun) In grammar, a sign or word that comes before a noun or a pronoun, often expressing a relation of something else to that thing, e.g., ACTOR ON STAGE (The actor on the stage), CAT UNDER TABLE (The cat is under the table), BALL IN BOX (The ball is in the box). English = preposition.; (Note) Remember that the Auslan signs that can function like prepositions (e.g., ON, UNDER, IN, etc.) are often not used when they would be in a similar English sentence because it is also possible to show what you mean in Auslan. For example, instead of signing BALL ON TABLE you can also sign TABLE first, then make the sign BALL just above it. People will then understand that you mean ‘the ball is on the table’ or ‘the ball is on the top of the table’.

prescription.description: (As a Noun) A PRESCRIPTION is the piece of paper on which your doctor writes an order for medicine and which you give to a chemist or pharmacist to get the medicine.; (As a Noun) A PRESECRIPTION is a medicine which a doctor has told you to take.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PRESCRIPTION. If you know a sign for PRESCRIPTION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

presentation.description: (As a Noun) Something important or special which is given or handed over to someone.; (As a Noun) Something important or special which is given or handed over to someone because they have won something or because people want to show their appreciation. English = presentation, award.; (As a Noun) A lecture or a talk about something, or something that is performed in front of an audience. English = presentation.

present%20(award).description: (As a Noun) A formal event in which someone is given something such as a prize. English = presentation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To formally give someone something such as an award or prize. English = present, award.

present%20(gift).description: (As a Noun) Something that you give to someone, for example at Christmas or when you visit them. English = present, gift.

present%20(hand%20over).description: (As a Noun) Something important or special which is given or handed over to someone.; (As a Noun) Something important or special which is given or handed over to someone because they have won something or because people want to show their appreciation. English = presentation, award.; (As a Noun) A lecture or a talk about something, or something that is performed in front of an audience. English = presentation.

present%20(now).description: (As a Noun) The present time of talking, writing or signing and not some other time. English = present.; (As a Noun) The day on which or during which you are speaking, writing or signing. English = today, this day.; (As a Noun) On the very day which has already been identified (in the future or in the past) on which other actions also happen. English = that day, on that day, on that very day.

press.description: (As a Noun) The force that you produce when you press hard on something. English = pressure.; (As a Noun) The force that a quantity of gas or liquid has on a surface that it touches. English = pressure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To press down or apply pressure onto something with your thumb.

press%20down.description: (As a Noun) The force that you produce when you press hard on something. English = pressure.; (As a Noun) The force that a quantity of gas or liquid has on a surface that it touches. English = pressure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To press down or apply pressure onto something with your thumb.

pressure.description: (As a Noun) The force that you produce when you press hard on something. English = pressure.; (As a Noun) The force that a quantity of gas or liquid has on a surface that it touches. English = pressure.; (As a Noun) The feeling of worry and tenseness because of difficulties in your life. English = stress.

pressure%20cooker.description: (As a Noun) A large saucepan with a lid that fights tightly, in which you can cook food quickly using steam at high pressure. English = pressure cooker.

pretence.description: (As a Noun) The action of behaving in a way that is intended to make people believe that something is the case, although in fact it is not. English = pretence.; (As a Noun) Something that is made to look like something real. English = imitation, copy.; (As a Noun) An object, especially a work of art, which is made to appear real but which is not. English = fake.

pretty%20(more%20or%20less).description: (As a Noun) Uncertainty about what you should do. English = indecision.; (As a Noun) The constant changing of your opinions or feelings. English = vacillation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be unable to make up your mind about something. English = (be) indecisive.

previous.description: (As a Noun) The previous item on a list.; (Interactive) Used alone, especially in the context of chairing a meeting, to suggest or instruct people to return to the previous or an earlier item on the agenda.

previously.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action happened some time in the past before some other action. English =  before that, prior to that, in the past, previously.

previously%20(nothing%20previously).description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action did not occur at some time in the past before some other action. English =  nothing previously, not prior to that, not before that.

capture.description: (As a Noun) The catching of someone or something and making them a prisoner, especially after a struggle or in a war. English = capture.; (As a Noun) Work which you need to do on some activity which is late in order to make it complete or at least up to date. English = catching up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To catch someone or something and make them a prisoner, especially after a struggle or in a war. English = capture.

sting.description: (As a Noun) A sharp pain you feel caused by an insect or plant sticking something sharp into your skin. English = sting, prick.; (As a Noun) An insect that makes a buzzing noise as it flies and usually has a yellow-and-black striped body. It makes honey and lives in large groups. English = bee.; (As a Noun) A very small animal that has six legs, has wings and flies, and which can sting; a stinging insect.

prude.description: (As a Noun) A person who behaves very correctly and is easily shocked by anything rude or improper. Often used showing disapproval.; (As a Noun) A person who is easily shocked by things related to nudity or sex. English = prude.; (As a Noun) A person who has a very strict and severe attitude towards questions of morality. English = puritan.

prince.description: (As a Noun) A male member of a royal family, especially the son of the king or queen of a country. English = prince.

princess.description: (As a Noun) The female member of a royal family, usually the daughter of a king or queen or the wife of a prince. English = princess.

principal.description: (As a Noun) The person in charge of a school or college. English = principal.

policy.description: (As a Noun) A set of ideas or plans that is used as a basis for making decisions, especially in politics, economics, or business. English = policy.; (As a Noun) A document that shows the agreement that you have made with an insurance company. English = policy.; (As a Noun) A general belief that you have about the way you should behave which influences your behaviour; a general rule about how something should be done. English = principle.

print.description: (As a Noun) The letters, numbers or pictures on a page of a book or newspaper; a book or a magazine that has been published. English = print, printing; publication.; (As a Noun) A person or firm that prints books, newspapers, or leaflets. English = printer.; (As a Noun) A machine that is connected to a computer and that prints out information from the computer on paper. English = printer.

prior%20to.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that a sequence of actions happened in a series up to a time in the past, or will happen up to a time in the future.

prior%20to%20(not%20prior%20to).description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the action did not occur at some time in the past (or at a time which has already been mentioned) and did not happen up to the present (or another nominated time). English = nothing up to now/then, nothing before now/then, and so on.

private%20(army%20rank).description: (As a Noun) A soldier who has the lowest rank in an army. English = private.

probability%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the extent to which an event is likely to occcur, measured by the ratio of the favourable cases to the whole number of cases possible. English = probability.; (As Modifier) Used to indicate that something is possible or may be true, but you are not certain; to indicate that you are making a rough guess at a number or quantity, rather than stating it exactly. English = perhaps, maybe.; (As Modifier) Used to link a number of alternatives, to give another alternative, or to introduce a comment which corrects or modifies something you have just said. English = or.

put off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very slow to do something because you keep leaving it to another time. English = put off, procrastinate.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you'd rather not do something now, but will put it off to some other time in the future.

production.description: (As a Noun) The making of plays, films, programs, or records. English = production.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is organising plays, films, programs, or records. English =  producer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To organise a play, film, program, or record, and decide how it would be done. English = produce.

product%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) A quantity obtained by multiplying quantities together, or from an comparable algebraic operation. English = product.

professional.description: (As a Noun) Someone who has a job that requires special training and has a fairly high status, for example the job of a doctor or lawyer. English = professional.; (As a Noun) A type of job that requires special training and that has a fairly high status, for example the job of doctor or lawyer. English = profession.; (As a Noun) The skilful way in which someone does a job. English = professionalism.

profile.description: (As a Noun) The outline of your face as it is seen when someone is looking at you from the side. English = profile.

profit.description: (As a Noun) An amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make it, get it, or do it. English = profit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make money by being paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do. English = profit.

profound%20deafness.description: (As a Noun) The degree and type of deafness that means one is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in one’s better ear. English = profound deafness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe a person who is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in their better ear. English = profoundly deaf.

profoundly%20deaf.description: (As a Noun) The degree and type of deafness that means one is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in one’s better ear. English = profound deafness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe a person who is unable to hear any sound below 95 decibels in their better ear. English = profoundly deaf.

prognosis.description: (As a Noun) A PROGNOSIS is the forecast of the course of a disease.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PROGNOSIS. If you know a sign for PROGNOSIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you.

progress%20bar.description: (General Definition) Of anything that has some length, to become shorter starting from one end and moving towards the other end, or any thing or action associated with this, such as a progress bar or a power gauge.; (As a Noun) An indicator on a computer’s screen to show that a task is underway and how much of it is completed. English = progress bar, status bar.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of petrol in a vehicle, to become used up so that there is no more left; to run out of petrol.

project%20(a%20film).description: (As a Noun) Moving images that have been recorded so that they can be shown in a theatre or on television. English = film, films, movie, movies, picture, pictures. Informal English = flicks.; (As a Noun) A special theatre where films are shown. English = cinema, pictures.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a film appear on a screen or wall. English = project, show a film.

spool.description: (As a Noun) A round object onto which film can be wound, especially before it is put in a projector. English = spool, reel.; (As a Noun) A machine that turns a spool of film and projects the film onto a screen or wall. English = projector.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to work a projector, for example in a cinema. English = projectionist.

promiscuous.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have sex with many different people over a period of time. This sign is used to show disapproval. English = (be) promiscuous.

progress.description: (As a Noun) The process of gradually getting better or nearer to achieving something or completing something; an improvement in circumstances. English = progress.; (As a Noun) The movement from a less important to a more important job in an organisation. English = promotion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gradually get better or nearer to achieving something or completing something; to improve circumstances. English = progress.

prompter.description: (As a Noun) A person in a theatre whose job is to remind an actor of words that he or she has forgotten during a performance. English = prompter.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To remind an actor of the words he or she has forgotten during a performance, or of the time when they are meant to do something. English = prompt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To assist an interpreter by providing words or signs he or she does not know or missed during an interpretation. English = prompt.

pronoun.description: (As a Noun) In grammar, a word that is used to replace a noun or the name for someone that has already been mentioned. For example, in “Mary is having a birthday party on Friday. She will be 21.” the word ‘she’ is a pronoun; in “The birthday party will be on Friday. It will be a surprise.”, the word ‘it’ is a pronoun. In Auslan, you usually use pointing signs instead. English = pronoun; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term PRONOUN. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PRONOUN (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for PRONOUN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

propeller.description: (As a Noun) A device with blades which is attached to a boat or aircraft. The engine makes it spin round and causes the boat or aircraft to move. English = propeller.

prop-forward%20(rugby).description: (As a Noun) In rugby, either of the two forwards outermost in the front row of the scrum. English = prop, prop-forward.

prophecy.description: (As a Noun) A statement in which someone says something that they believe will happen, especially when this is part of religious inspiration. English = prophecy.; (As a Noun) A person who is believed to be chosen by God to say the things that God wants to tell people. English = prophet.; (As a Noun) A person who predicts that something will happen in the future. English = prophet.

proportion.description: (As a Noun) The size of the degree of difference between two things. English = proportion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two things (amounts, quantities, etc.), for one thing to remain the same fraction of the other even as the total amount may change. English = (be) proportional.

prop%20(rugby).description: (As a Noun) In rugby, either of the two forwards outermost in the front row of the scrum. English = prop, prop-forward.

prostitute.description: (As a Noun) A person, usually a woman, who has sex with men in exchange for money. English = prostitute.

provision.description: (As a Noun) The act of giving something, or making it available, to someone who needs it. English = provision.; (As a Noun) Supplies of food. English = provisions.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give to someone something which they want or need, or to make it available to them in some way. English = provide.

psychiatry.description: (As a Noun) The branch of medicine concerned with mental illness. English = psychiatry.; (As a Noun) A doctor who treats people suffering from mental illness. English = psychiatrist.

psychology.description: (As a Noun) The scientific study of the human mind and the reasons for people's behaviour. English = psychology.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) A person who studies the human mind and tries to explain why people behave in the way that they do. English = psychologist.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) Referring to people's mind and thoughts; relating to psychology. English = (be) psychological.

psychosis.description: (As a Noun) PSYCHOSIS is mental illness of a severe kind which can make people lose contact with reality.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for PSYCHOSIS. If you know a sign for PSYCHOSIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

pudding.description: (As a Noun) A cooked sweet food made with flour, fat, and eggs, and usually served hot and eaten at the end of a meal. English = pudding.; (As a Noun) Something sweet, such as fruit or a pudding, that you eat at the end of a meal. English = dessert, sweet.

vagina.description: (As a Noun) The outer part of a woman's sexual organ. English = vulva, (female) pudendum.; (As a Noun) The passage that connects a woman's outer sex organs to her womb. English = vagina.

puff%20pastry.description: (As a Noun) Puff pastry is very light and delicate. It has many thin layers, with fat inbetween them. When the pastry is baked, it puffs up.; (Note) The following signs or sign expressions are suggested for ‘puff pastry’. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

pull.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To hold something firmly and use force in order to move it towards you. English = pull.

pull%20apart.description: (General Definition) The act of pulling apart, opening or stretching something small and delicate, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.

pull%20beer.description: (As a Noun) A person who serves drinks in a bar or pub. English = bartender, barperson. Old-fashioned English = barman (male), barmaid (female).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To work behind a bar making and serving drinks, especially filling glasses with beer from taps.

pull%20down%20(demolish).description: (As a Noun) The act of knocking down a building, often because it is old or dangerous. English = demolition.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To knock down a building, often because it is old or dangerous. English = demolish. Idiomatic English = pull down.

pulley.description: (As a Noun) A device for lifting and lowering heavy objects. It consists of a wheel with a hollow rim which is fixed above the ground. You pass a rope over the rim, attach one end of the rope to the weight, and pull or gradually release the other end. English = pulley.; (As a Noun) A machine with pulleys for lifting heavy things. English = hoist.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a pulley or hoist.

pull%20out%20(quit).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stop doing something, especially being a member or participant in some organisation or activity. English = quit, withdraw, resign. Idiomatic English = drop out, pull out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not become involved in something. English = stay aloof, keep aloof, remain aloof.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To like to be alone and not talk much to other people. English = (be) aloof.

throb.description: (As a Noun) A series of strong beats or dull pains. English = throb.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in a series of strong beats; to sense dull pains at regular intervals. English = throb.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To contract and expand repeatedly with strong regular movement; to move with strong regular movements. English = pulsate.

pulse.description: (As a Noun) The regular beating of blood through your body, which you can feel when you touch particular parts of your body, especially your wrist. English = pulse.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel for or take (count) someone's pulse.

pump.description: (As a Noun) A hand held device for forcing air into the tyre of a bicycle. English = pump, bicycle pump.; (As a Noun) The act of forcing air into a bicycle tyre by using a hand held pump. English = pumping.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To force air into a bicycle tyre using a hand held pump. English = pump, pump up.

pumpkin.description: (As a Noun) A large, round, orange-coloured vegetable with a thick skin. English = pumpkin.

punch.description: (As a Noun) A hard blow (against someone or something) with your fist. English = punch.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hit someone with your fist. English = punch.

punctual.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen exactly at the time arranged. English = (be) punctual. Idiomatic English = (be) on time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen exactly on the hour.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a time sign specifying a particular time (6 o'clock, 9 o'clock, etc.) to mean that time exactly. English = precisely. Idiomatic English = on the dot.

pupil.description: (As a Noun) The small, round, black hole in the centre of your eye. English = pupil.

puppet%20(hand%20puppet).description: (As a Noun) A doll which you can move by putting your hand inside its body and moving your fingers. English = puppet, hand puppet, glove puppet.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a hand puppet.

puppet%20(string%20puppet).description: (As a Noun) A doll that you can move by pulling strings which are attached to it. English  = string puppet.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a string puppet move by pulling the strings which are attached to it.

purl%20(stitch).description: (As a Noun) A type of stitch found in knitting. It is the inversion of a normal, plain or garter stitch. English = purl.

purse.description: (General Definition) An object with a knob, button or appendage on top that is twisted, wound or manipulated in some way, such as a fastener on a bag, or any object or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, particularly a purse.; (As a Noun) A very small bag that people, usually women, keep their money in. English = purse.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open a purse.

push.description: (As a Noun) A forceful movement, usually made with your hands pressing against something, in order to move it or get it out of the way. English = push.; (As a Noun) A quick, violent movement against something, often using your hand, in order to move it or get it out of the way. English = shove.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To press against something with force, usually using your hands, in order to move it. English = push.

push%20aside.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To push something to one side.; (Interactive) Used alone in a discussion with someone to mean that you want to put one issue or topic to the side so that you can continue to discuss another related issue or topic. English = "let's forget about that for the moment", "putting that issue to the side" and so on.; (As Modifier) Used between two separate topics of discussion (at the end of the first or at the beginning of the second) to mean that you are ending the first topic and changing topics to a second one. English = moving on, on the other hand, putting that aside...

push%20down.description: (General Definition) A flat surface, a quantity of something, or the top of something which is and/or becomes lower, shorter or smaller, or any thing or any object that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) The height of something which is low or small.; (As a Noun) The state of getting worse and worse in condition (especially in illness), or to become more difficult or unpleasant. English = deterioration.

put.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something carefully into a particular place or position. English = put, place, put with care.

put%20away.description: (General Definition) To pick up things and put them into various different places, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a number of things into the place where they are normally kept, for example in a cupboard or drawer. English = put away, pack up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a number of things, such as work materials on a desk, into particular positions, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy. English = arrange.

put%20down.description: (As a Noun) The state of being beaten in a battle, game, or contest. English = defeat.; (As a Noun) The cruel or unfair treatment of someone or a group of people. English = oppression.; (As a Noun) The prevention of something from continuing by an army or a government; keeping someone or a group of people under your control. English = suppression; subjugation.

put%20into.description: (As a Noun) The act of putting one object inside another. English = insertion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put one object inside another, or to make it part of another object. English = insert, put into, fit into.

put%20off.description: (As a Noun) The moving of the arranged time for an event to another time later than was originally planned. English = postponement.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To arrange for an event to take place at another time later than was originally planned. English = postpone, defer, put off.

put%20out%20(extinguish).description: (As a Noun) The ending of the burning of a fire or the shining of a light; the turning off of a light; the putting out of a fire.; (As a Noun) The ending of some activity. English = finish.; (As a Noun) A period of time in which you stop doing what you are doing, for example to have a rest, before continuing again. English = pause.

put%20to%20one%20side.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To push something to one side.; (Interactive) Used alone in a discussion with someone to mean that you want to put one issue or topic to the side so that you can continue to discuss another related issue or topic. English = "let's forget about that for the moment", "putting that issue to the side" and so on.; (As Modifier) Used between two separate topics of discussion (at the end of the first or at the beginning of the second) to mean that you are ending the first topic and changing topics to a second one. English = moving on, on the other hand, putting that aside...

putty.description: (As a Noun) A surface which has been joined, repaired or had something attached to it with long sticky strips of plastic.; (As a Noun) A stiff paste used to fix glass panes into frames and to fill cracks or holes in woodwork. English = putty.; (As a Noun) A rectangular paper cover in which you send a letter or card to someone through the post which has been closed along its sticky edge or with the use of a long sticky strip of plastic. English = sealed envelope.

put%20up%20with.description: (As a Noun) The ability to stay calm and not get annoyed, for example when you are waiting for something. English = patience.; (As a Noun) The ability to bear a painful or difficult situation calmly and patiently. English = endurance.; (As a Noun) A state of quiet and peacefulness without excitement or stress. English = calmness.

pyramid.description: (As a Noun) The ancient stone buildings built over the tombs of dead kings and queens in Egypt. They have triangular walls that slope upwards and inwards to a single point. English = pyramid.; (As a Noun) A shape, object, or pile of things with a flat base and flat triangular sides that slope upwards and inwards to a point. English = pyramid.

q.description: (As a Noun) The letter Q in the two-handed manual alphabet.; (Note) Apologies for the poor quality of this video. It will be replaced as soon as possible.

quadratic.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, something that involves the operation of squaring, to terms of the second degree, or to equations or formulas that involve such terms. English = quadratic.

home isolation.description: (As a Noun) With reference to infectious diseases, especially COVID-19, the period of time a regulation or law which obliges anyone who has the infection or is a near- or direct-contact to isolate at home to avoid infecting others. English = home isolation, self-isolation, quarantine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) With reference to infectious diseases, especially COVID-19, to stay at home for a  period of time to avoid infecting others because a regulation or law obliges you to do so. English = home isolate, self-isolate, quarantine.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

quarrel.description: (As a Noun) A disagreement between two or more people, sometimes resulting in them shouting or signing angrily at each other. English = quarrel, argument, row.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two or more people, to have a disagreement, often resulting in them shouting or signing angrily at each other. English = argue, quarrel. Idiomatic English = have a row.

quarter.description: (As a Noun) One of four equal parts of an amount of something or an object. English = quarter.

quarter%20hour.description: (As a Noun) A period of fifteen minutes or one quarter of an hour.

queensland.description: (As a Noun) A state in north-eastern Australia, called Queensland.

queer.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe a sexual or gender identity that does not correspond to established ideas of sexuality and gender, especially heterosexual norms. English = queer.; (Note) Other suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) Other suggested sign #2×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

queer%20(strange).description: (As a Noun) Activity which is enjoyable or amusing. English = fun, amusement.; (As a Noun) The quality of something being unusual, surprising, or puzzling. English = strangeness, queerness, weirdness, oddity.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be amusing and to make you laugh. English = (be) funny, (be) humorous.

question mark.description: (As a Noun) A special punctuation mark which is put at the end of a written sentence. English = question mark, interrogation mark.; (As a Noun) Something you check by asking about it because you are no sure that it is correct. English = query.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your own or your addressee's previous comment to mean you wonder why such and such is the case. English = 'I wonder why?', 'Why's that?', and so on.

question.description: (As a Noun) Something you say, sign or write in order to get information from someone about something. English = question.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say, sign or write something to someone in order to get information from them about something. English = question, ask a question, pose a question.

question%20mark.description: (As a Noun) A special punctuation mark which is put at the end of a written sentence. English = question mark, interrogation mark.; (As a Noun) Something you check by asking about it because you are no sure that it is correct. English = query.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your own or your addressee's previous comment to mean you wonder why such and such is the case. English = 'I wonder why?', 'Why's that?', and so on.

questionnaire.description: (As a Noun) A written list of questions which are answered by a lot of people in order to provide information for a report. English = questionnaire.; (As a Noun) A detailed investigation of something, for example people's behaviour or opinions. English = survey.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do a questionnaire.

queue.description: (General Definition) A line of people or long upright objects, or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A line of people who are all waiting for something. English = queue, line.; (As a Noun) A barrier made of wood or wire supported by posts. English = fence.

quick.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To do or move with great speed. English = (be) quick, (be) sudden; rush.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To need to be done or dealt with as soon as possible. English = (be) urgent.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone to do something with greater speed, usually because you are waiting for them and/or there is not much time before something else happens. English = 'Quickly!', 'Hurry up!'

quince.description: (As a Noun) A hard fruit with an acid taste that is used for making jelly, marmalade, etc. English = quince.

quoits.description: (As a Noun) A game in which rings are thrown over a small post. English = quoits.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play quoits.

quotation%20marks.description: (As a Noun) A sentence or phrase from a book, film, poem, song, or play. English = quote, quotation.; (As a Noun) Punctuation marks that are used to show where something someone has said or a quotation begins and ends. English = quotation marks, inverted commas.; (As a Noun) The thing, person, or idea that is being discussed or written about. English = topic.

quotient.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the result obtained by dividing one quantity by another. English = quotient.

r.description: (As a Noun) The letter R in the one-handed alphabets.

horse racing.description: (As a Noun) A sport and entertainment in which horses race each other in groups and people place bets on which horse they think will win. English = horse racing, racing, races.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To race horses.

rack%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place, especially a room, suddenly and quickly because you do not want to be there any longer. English = get out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place where you are normally obliged to stay because of responsibilities (eg work or home) without regard to the consequences or without permission. You would do this because you are angry, irritated or irresponsible.; (As a Verb or Adjective) English = walk out. Informal English = nick off, bugger off.

radian.description: (As a Noun) In geometry, a unit of measjurement of angle equivalent to the that created at the centre of a circle by an arch equal in length to the radius. English = radian.

sun.description: (As a Noun) The ball of fire in the sky that the Earth goes round, and that gives us heat and light. English = sun.; (As a Noun) The light and heat that comes from the sun. English = sunshine, sun.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the weather, to have little or no clouds in the sky and to have plenty of sunshine. English = (be) sunny.

radiator%20(engine).description: (General Definition) Any object that meets this general description (upright, flat and thick), such as a tombstone, or any thing or any object directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a radiator in a car.; (As a Noun) The part of the engine in a car which is filled with water in order to cool the engine. English = radiator.

radio.description: (As a Noun) The piece of equipment you use when you listen to radio programs. The sounds are sent over a distance by transmitting electrical signals. English = radio.

radio%20journalist.description: (As a Noun) [Usually made with mouth movement] a device for making sounds louder, especially a person's voice, or to record them on a tape recorder. English = microphone.; (As a Noun) A person whose job involves using a microphone to announce things or to record news for radio or television. English = announcer, radio journalist, television journalist.; (As a Noun) An amplified message played at a public place, such as a railway station, airport, shopping centre. English = announcement.

railway%20station.description: (As a Noun) A building by a railway line where a train stops to pick up passengers and goods. English = station, railway station.; (As a Noun) A train whose engine is operated using steam as a means of power. English = steam train.; (As a Noun) Clouds of water vapour being emitted by an old fashioned steam train. English = steam.

rainbow.description: (As a Noun) An arc of different colours that you can sometimes see in the sky when it is raining. English = rainbow.

raise.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To lift up something from a surface.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get up from being on a surface; to get up from a seat and stand.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To get off something.

raise%20(flag).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To raise a flag on a flag pole.

raise%20(funds).description: (As a Noun) The activity of bringing together things from different places. English = collection.; (As a Noun) An amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do. English = profit.; (As a Noun) The money you get for performing work or providing a service. English = earnings.

upbringing.description: (As a Noun) The way your parents treated you and the things that they taught you while to grew up from a child to an adult. English = upbringing.; (As a Noun) The looking after of a child until it is grown up, and the attempt to teach it particular attitudes. English = raising, rearing.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look after a child until it is grown up, and try to teach it particular attitudes. English = bring up, raise, rear.

rake.description: (As a Noun) A garden tool consisting of a row of metal teeth attached to a long handle. English = rake.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move a rake across a surface in order to make it smooth and level. English = rake.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sweep up leaves or weeds using a rake. English = rake.

range%20(mountain).description: (As a Noun) An area of land that is not flat and has many areas with steep sides which are difficult to climb English = mountains.; (As a Noun) A row of mountains that were formed at the same time in the earth's history.  English = mountains, mountain range.; (As a Noun) An area of land that is not flat. It is uneven and has many areas that are high, but not as high as a mountain. English = hills.

rape.description: (As a Noun) The act of violently forcing someone to have sex with you when they do not want to. English = rape.; (As a Noun) A person, usually a man, who violently forces other people, usually women, to have sex with him when they do not want to. English = rapist.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To violently force someone to have sex with you when they do not want to. English = rape.

speed.description: (As a Noun) The moving, doing or happening of something very quickly. English = speed, rapidity.; (As a Noun) The act of moving very fast in a vehicle, usually a car, so that you are over the legal speed limit. English = speeding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do something, or happen with great speed or very quickly. English = (be) fast, go fast, rush, speed.

rat.description: (As a Noun) An animal with a long tail which looks like a large mouse. English = rat.

ratio.description: (As a Noun) A quantitative relationship between two numbers, amounts, or measurements, which shows how much greater one is than the other.  English = ratio.

sensible.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able to make good decisions and judgements based on reasons rather than emotions. English = (be) sensible.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action is done in a way that is based on reasons rather than emotions. English = sensibly.

shave (face).description: (As a Noun) The act of cutting hair from your face using a razor. English = shave.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a man, to cut the hair from his face using a razor. English = shave, have a shave.

reading.description: (As a Noun) The activity of looking at the written words or symbols on a page and understanding them. English = reading.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To look at the written words or symbols on a page and understand them. English = read.

ready%20(not%20ready).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Not to have prepared yourself in time for something. English = (be) not ready.; (Interactive) Used in response to a question about when something should happen or be done to mean that you think it should not be done now, although it will have to be done at a later time. English = 'Not yet.'; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action has not happened up to the present time, although it probably will happen. English = not yet.

realise.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To suddenly become aware of something, or understand something, especially after other people. English = realise.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you have suddenly become aware of or understand what your addressee has been talking about. English = 'Oh! I see!', 'Really, is that so?!' , and so on.

really%20(exclamation).description: (Interactive) Used alone to express amused surprise or disbelief at what someone has said or done. English = 'Go on!', 'Really?!', 'Come off it!', 'Get a load of that!', How could you do that!?'; (Interactive) Used alone to express jocular dismissal and mock irritation at what someone has said or done, especially when they think it is funny but you consider it to be typical of them. English = 'Typical!', 'There you go again!', 'Hah, hah! Very funny!'

rear-view%20mirror.description: (As a Noun) A mirror placed on the side, windscreen or other parts of a vehicle to allow the driver to see the area behind the vehicle. English = rear-vew mirror.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign MIRROR and then depicting the position of the mirror with a flat palm at eye level, and left and right sides. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

rebore.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To bore out the cylinders of an internal-combustion engine. English = rebore.

recall%20(remember).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To bring the thought and mental impression of something that happened in the past back into your mind now, at a later date. English = remember, recall, recollect.

recall%20(return).description: (As a Noun) An order to come towards you, to approach you, or to come inside. English = summons.; (As a Noun) An order to come and see someone, particularly an official order to appear in court. English = summons.; (As a Noun) Officially making people in a particular country join the army, navy, or air force. English = conscription, draft, call up.

recent.description: (As a Noun) Things that happened before or recently that help explain what caused an event or situation you are talking about now.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an event, to happen a short time ago in the past. English = (be) recent.; (As Modifier) Used after time signs and/or at the beginning or end of sign sentences to place the time frame in the recent past. English = recently, just a while ago, just then.

switchboard.description: (As a Noun) A place in a large office or business where all the telephone calls are connected. English = switchboard, switch.; (As a Noun) The place in an office, business, hotel, doctor's surgery, etc., where people go when they first arrive and where all the telephone calls are often also connected or dealt with. English = reception.; (As a Noun) In a hotel, office, or doctor's surgery, the person whose job is to deal with guests or clients when they first arrive, answer the telephone, and arrange reservations or appointments. English = receptionist.

reciprocal%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, an expression or function which is related to another expression or function so that their product is unity. English = reciprocal.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In mathematics, a quality or function, related to another quantity or function so that their product is unity. English = reciprocal.

think.description: (As a Noun) An idea that you have in your mind. English = thought.; (As a Noun) The organ inside your head that enables you to think and feel things such as heat and pain. English = brain.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your mind to form an opinion, idea or image of something. English = think.

look back.description: (As a Noun) Thoughts about things that happened in the past. English = recollections.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about things that happened in the past. English = look back.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sentence to indicate that you are thinking about things that happened in the past. English = looking back. Formal English = on reflection.

recommend.description: (As a Noun) A suggestion to someone that they should have something or use something, because it is good or useful. English = recommendation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To suggest to someone that they should have something or use something, because it is good or useful. English = recommend.

reconcile.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) In religious belief, to become friendly, as one, or at peace with God. Formal English = reconcile.

you know.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To know someone or something because you have seen or heard them before or because someone has described them to you.
