English = recognise.; (Interactive) Use alone to seek confirmation that your conversational partner knows who or what you are talking about.; (As Modifier) Used to introduce a topic of conversation, just before you name the person or the thing, as in "You know John, well....", "You know that new smoking law, well...".

change mind.description: (As a Noun) The act of changing a decision you have made or an opinion that you had. English = reconsideration. Idiomatic English = change of mind, second thoughts.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To change a decision you have made or an opinion that you had. English = reconsider. Idiomatic English = change one's mind, have second thoughts, think twice.

record%20(copy).description: (As a Noun) A copy of sounds, speech or pictures which is on a record, tape, video or computer disk and which can be played back and heard or seen again. English = recording.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a special machine to make a copy of sounds, speech or pictures that can be played back later and heard or seen again. English = record.

recording.description: (As a Noun) A copy of sounds, speech or pictures which is on a record, tape, video or computer disk and which can be played back and heard or seen again. English = recording.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a special machine to make a copy of sounds, speech or pictures that can be played back later and heard or seen again. English = record.

record%20(music).description: (General Definition) Outlining the shape of any flat round object, such as a dish, record or disk, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a plate.; (As a Noun) A round or circular, flat object of some sort. English = disk, disc.; (As a Noun) A round or oval flat dish that is used to hold food. English = plate.

recruit.description: (As a Noun) To request others to join you or to participate. English = recruit.

rectangle.description: (As a Noun) A four-sided shape whose angles are all right angles. Each side of the shape is the same length as the one opposite. It is like a square but the sides are longer in one direction. English = rectangle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the shape of a rectangle. English = (be) rectangular.

red.description: (As a Noun) The colour of blood or a ripe tomato. English = red.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be or have the colour of blood or of a ripe tomato. English = (be) red.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become the colour of blood or a ripe tomato. English = redden.

reduce%20(cooking).description:
(General Definition) The Auslan sign BOIL and the action of something that decreases in height.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Boil a liquid so that some the water evaporates. A technique used to thicken sauces, or to make the flavour stronger. English = reduce.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for REDUCE (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  

If you know a sign for REDUCE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

reduplication.description: (As a Noun) In linguistics, the repetition of all or part of a sign or word. This may be used to modify meaning or to create a new lexical item. English = reduplication; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English word REDUPLICATION. Though there is no specific dedicated sign in Auslan for ‘reduplication’, many signers would use one of the signs used for ‘repeat’ found in this dictionary accompanied by mouthing for ‘reduplication’ to specifiy this meaning.

refer.description: (As a Noun) [In medical situations] the directing of a patient to a medical specialist by a general practitioner (doctor or GP) for consultation, review, or further action. English = referral.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a task or problem, to formally tell a person or an organisation about it, so that they can deal with it. English = refer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person in need of assistance or information, to tell them about a source of information or an organisation which can help them; of a general practitioner (doctor or GP) to direct a patient to a medical specialist for consultation, review, or further action. English = refer.

referee.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job is to make sure that a game is played fairly and that the rules are not broken. English = referee, umpire.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To control a game and make sure that it is played fairly and that the rules are not broken. English = referee, umpire.

reference.description: (As a Noun) In education, the source of information used in an assignment or academic paper, usually shown as a list at the end of the work. English = reference, references.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In education, the act of talking or writing about something or someone. English = reference; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term REFERENCE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for REFERENCE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for REFERENCE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

reflection%20(light).description: (As a Noun) The bright or glassy appearance of an object because light bounces off it into your eyes. English = shine, shininess.; (As a Noun) The process by which light is sent back or bounces off a surface, particularly when it produces a clear image of the observer or another object. English = reflection.; (As a Noun) A hard, shiny silver-colored metal. English = chrome, chromium.

reflection%20(self-reflection).description: (As a Noun) Serious thought about one's character and actions. English = self-reflection.; (Note) Other suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) Other suggested sign #2×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

reflection%20(thinking).description: (As a Noun) The act of doing no physical or practical work and thinking  about something instead. English = reflection.; (As a Noun) The state of being bored. English = boredom.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do no practical or physical work because you are resting or bored while, at the same time, letting your mind wander and think about things generally. English = reflect, daydream.

reflect%20(light).description: (As a Noun) The bright or glassy appearance of an object because light bounces off it into your eyes. English = shine, shininess.; (As a Noun) The process by which light is sent back or bounces off a surface, particularly when it produces a clear image of the observer or another object. English = reflection.; (As a Noun) A hard, shiny silver-colored metal. English = chrome, chromium.

reflect%20(think).description: (As a Noun) The act of doing no physical or practical work and thinking  about something instead. English = reflection.; (As a Noun) The state of being bored. English = boredom.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do no practical or physical work because you are resting or bored while, at the same time, letting your mind wander and think about things generally. English = reflect, daydream.

refusal.description: (As a Noun) The action of someone who says firmly that they will not do or accept something. English = refusal.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say firmly that you will not do or accept something. English = refuse, decline.

regret.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of wishing that you had not done something. English = regret.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wish that you had not done something. English = (be) sorry, regret.; (Interactive) Used alone to express the feeling you have when you wish that you had not done something. English = 'I'm sorry', 'How could I have done that?'

rehabilitation.description: (As a Noun) REHABILITATION is the treatment given to someone after an illness or an injury, so that they can return to a normal healthy life.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term REHABILITATION. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for REHABILITATION (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for REHABILITATION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

rehearsal.description: (As a Noun) Of a play, dance, or a piece of music, a practice, in which it is prepared for a performance. English = rehearsal.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To practise a play, dance, or piece of music, in order to prepare for a performance. English = rehearse.

reimbursement.description: (As a Noun) REIMBURSEMENT is the money that is paid back to someone who has paid for something, for example because the money should have been paid by someone else.

relaxation.description: (As a Noun) Ways of spending time that are pleasant and restful. English = relaxation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel more calm, less worried or tense. English = relax, calm down.

relay.description: (As a Noun) A race between two or more teams, for example teams of runners. Each member of the team runs one section of the race and passes a baton to the next member of the team at the end of their section. English = relay, relay race.

relay%20race.description: (As a Noun) A race between two or more teams, for example teams of runners. Each member of the team runs one section of the race and passes a baton to the next member of the team at the end of their section. English = relay, relay race.

let go.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To let go of something.

surrender.description: (As a Noun) The end of fighting or resisting when one side agrees that it has been beaten. English = surrender.; (As a Noun) A robbery during which the victims are threatened with weapons and told to hold their hands up in the air. English = hold-up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) You stop fighting or resisting someone and agree that you have been beaten. Often this is done by raising your hands in the air. English = surrender.

reminder.description: (As a Noun) A thing that makes you think of another thing. English = reminder.; (As a Noun) A letter or message you receive that tells you that you have not done something you were supposed to do (eg, pay a bill). English = reminder.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately say something to someone to make them think of and remember something they already know about. English = remind.

remote%20control.description: (As a Noun) A device for controlling a television or other device from a distance by using radio or electronic signals. English = remote control, remote.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To operate a remote control.

removal.description: (As a Noun) The act of taking something away from a place, especially a person from a team or organisation. English = removal.; (As a Noun) The removal of someone from a job or position for a period of time, usually as a punishment. English = suspension.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take something away from a place, especially a person from a team or organisation. English = remove.

renal.description: (As Modifier) RENAL describes things that concern or are related to the kidneys. Your kidneys are the organs in your body that take waste matter from your blood and send it out of your body as urine.; (As Modifier) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RENAL. If you know a sign for RENAL used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

repairs.description: (As a Noun) Something you do to something such as a machine which is not working or an item of clothing which is damaged to make it better again. English = repairs.; (As a Noun) Activity that repairs or improves something, especially a house or a building. English = renovations.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something such as a machine which is not working or a piece of clothing which is damaged better again so that it works or is no longer damaged. English = repair, fix, mend.

repetition.description: (As a Noun) The act of doing something again and again. English = repetition.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do an action again. English = repeat.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an event or situation, to happen several times. English = (be) repeated.

repent.description: (As a Noun) Sorrow and regret that you feel for something bad that you have done in the past. English = repentance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel sorry for something bad that you have done in the past, especially if the motivation is religious. English = repent.

replace.description: (As a Noun) A person or thing that takes the place of someone or something else. English = replacement, substitute.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To add something to something.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To bring a person or thing into a situation to take the place of someone or something else. English = replace, substitute.

report.description: (As a Noun) A written, spoken, or signed account of an event or situation. English = report.; (As a Noun) An official written account of how well or how badly a student has done at school during the term that has just finished. English = report, school report.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell people about something that has happened, especially because it is your job or duty to do so. English = report.

volunteer.description: (As a Noun) A person who offers to do something without being obliged or forced to do so, especially socially useful work for which they are not paid. English = volunteer.; (As a Noun) Someone who chooses to join the army, navy, or air force, especially in wartime, as opposed to being forced to join by law. English = volunteer.; (As a Noun) Someone who has been chosen to talk or act on behalf of another person or a group of people and to express their views. English = representative.

withdrawal.description: (As a Noun) The removal of something from one place to another; the removal of troops from the place where there is fighting. English = withdrawal, retreat.; (As a Noun) The act of stopping participation in some activity. English = withdrawal.; (As a Noun) The act of taking back what was given, especially a remark or a statement. English = withdrawal, retraction.

reserve%20(book).description: (As a Noun) An arrangement that you make when you book something such as a theatre seat or a hotel room. English = reservation, booking.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To arrange to have or use something (such as a hotel room, or a ticket for something) at a particular time. English = reserve, book.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of things such as a hotel room, a seat at the theatre, or a table at a restaurant, to be taken or claimed by someone else for future use. English = (be) reserved, (be) booked.

reserved%20(booked).description: (As a Noun) An arrangement that you make when you book something such as a theatre seat or a hotel room. English = reservation, booking.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To arrange to have or use something (such as a hotel room, or a ticket for something) at a particular time. English = reserve, book.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of things such as a hotel room, a seat at the theatre, or a table at a restaurant, to be taken or claimed by someone else for future use. English = (be) reserved, (be) booked.

reserve%20(sport).description: (As a Noun) In sport, someone who is available to play as part of a team if one of the members cannot play on a particular occasion. English = reserve.; (As a Noun) A supply of something that is available for use when it is needed. English = reserve.

live (reside).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your home in a particular place. English = live. Formal English = reside.

residence.description: (As a Noun) The place where someone lives. English = residence.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your home in a particular place. English = live, reside.

retirement.description: (As a Noun) The time when a worker retires. English = retirement.; (As a Noun) The period in a person's life after they have retired. English = retirement.; (As a Noun) A formal statement of your intention to leave a job or position. English = resignation.

resign%20oneself%20to.description: (As a Noun) Extreme sadness, especially because someone has died. English = grief.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel very sad about something that has happened, especially if it involves the death of someone. Often you cannot talk to other people and struggle to control your emotions. English = grieve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To not complain about something, even though it may be painful; to suffer something in silence. Formal English = (be) stoic. Idiomatic English = put up with something.

resilience.description: (As a Noun) The ability a person has to recover quickly from a setback or misfortune, such as an illness. English = resilience.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able to recover quickly from unpleasant or damaging events. English = (be) resilient.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) Source of this recommended sign: DeafConnetED, Melbourne Polytechnic.

single-mindedness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of having your own attitudes and opinions and not being easily influenced by other people. English = single-mindedness, independence.; (As a Noun) The quality of persisting in doing things or behaving in a particular way especially against advice to the contrary. English = determination, resoluteness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your own attitudes and opinions and not to be easily influenced by other people. English = (be) strong-minded, (be) independent.

determined.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something because you have made a firm decision to do it and will not let anything stop you. English = (be) determined, (be) resolved.

resources.description: (As a Noun) Things you can have and use for a particular purpose, such as 'teaching resources' or 'mineral resources'. English = resources.; (As a Noun) A solid substance, especially one that you can make things from. English = material.; (As a Noun) A substance which is used especially for making clothes and is made by weaving, knitting, or some other similar process. English = fabric.

respirator.description: (As a Noun) A RESPIRATOR is a device worn over the mouth and nose to prevent harmful substances like fumes or dust from being breathed into the body.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term RESPIRATOR. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RESPIRATOR (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for RESPIRATOR used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

respite.description: (As a Noun) A short period of rest from something difficult, demanding or unpleasant. English = respite.; (As a Noun) A short period of time during which someone cares for someone who is sick, disabled or aged so that the person who usually cares for them can have a rest or a break. English = respite care.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RESPITE or RESPITE CARE. The signer in the video is explaining the meaning of this word using simple signs and fingerspelling. If you know a sign for RESPITE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you

respite%20care.description: (As a Noun) A short period of rest from something difficult, demanding or unpleasant. English = respite.; (As a Noun) A short period of time during which someone cares for someone who is sick, disabled or aged so that the person who usually cares for them can have a rest or a break. English = respite care.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RESPITE or RESPITE CARE. The signer in the video is explaining the meaning of this word using simple signs and fingerspelling. If you know a sign for RESPITE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "missing sign feedback" and supply details. Thank you

responsible%20(not%20responsible).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To not have the duty to deal with, make decision about, or accept the blame for something; (be) not responsible for; to have no responsibility.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say that you did not do something after others claim or assume that you did do it. English = deny responsibility.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean you have no interest or connection with what someone is talking about, especially because they mistakenly think you have done something or are someway involved in it. English = 'It's got nothing to do with me!', 'It's not my responsibility!', 'Damned if I know or care!', and so on.

restaurant.description: (As a Noun) A place where you can buy and eat a meal. English = restaurant.; (As a Noun) A formal meal, especially one eaten at a restaurant or one where you have invited people to your home.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To eat a meal in a restaurant. Idiomatic English = dine out.

resting.description: (As a Noun) RESTING is the process of allowing food, usually roasted meat, to sit for a period of time after removing from the oven and before serving.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of RESTING food after cooking.  If you know a specific sign for RESTING in this sense used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

resurrection.description: (As a Noun) In Christian belief, the event in which Jesus Christ came back to life three days after he had been killed. English = Resurrection.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In Christian belief, to live again after having died, used especially when referring to Jesus Christ coming to life again three days after being killed. English = rise, resurrect.

resuscitate.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To RESUSCITATE means to revive a person who has lost consciousness, for example by blowing air into their lungs or pressing on their chest to keep blood moving in their body.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term RESUSCITATE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RESUSCITATE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for RESUSCITATE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

return.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go back to somewhere after having been away or gone somewhere else. English = go back, return.

return%20journey.description: (As a Noun) A journey to and from a place; a person who does such a journey in a day; a person who does such a journey every day to work and back. English = round trip, return journey; day tripper; commuter.; (As a Noun) The movement to and fro between two locations (such as laps in a swimming pool).; (As a Noun) A ticket to travel somewhere and then to come back. English = return ticket.

return%20ticket.description: (As a Noun) A journey to and from a place; a person who does such a journey in a day; a person who does such a journey every day to work and back. English = round trip, return journey; day tripper; commuter.; (As a Noun) The movement to and fro between two locations (such as laps in a swimming pool).; (As a Noun) A ticket to travel somewhere and then to come back. English = return ticket.

reverse%20lights.description: (As a Noun) The lights at the back of a vehicle that come on when the vehicle is moving backwards. English = reverse lights.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign CAR, the depiction of an object moving backwards and the Auslan sign TAIL-LIGHTS. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

reverse%20park.description: (As a Noun) An area or a building where people can leave their cars. English = car park, parking lot.; (As a Noun) An individual space for a car on the side of a road or within a car park. English = park, parking space.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To drive a car into a parking space and leave it there. English = park.

reverse%20vehicle.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To drive a car backwards, especially after it has been parked somewhere. English = reverse.

disgusting.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of food, to taste, look or smell extremely unpleasant. English = (be) disgusting, (be) horrible, (be) revolting.

revolution%20(revolt).description: (As a Noun) A violent attempt by a group of people to change their country's political system. English = revolt, rebellion, insurrection, uprising.; (As a Noun) A successful attempt by a large group of people to change the political system of their country by force. English = revolution.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a violent attempt to change the political system of your country. English = revolt, rebel.

revolution%20(revolving).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics and physics, the movement of an object in a circular or elliptical course around another or about an axis or centre; a full 360° rotation of an object around a central point. English = revolution.

rewind.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To make the tape on a video cassette recorder or similar machine go backwards quickly so that you can play a different part of the tape, or play it again. English = rewind.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go back and repeat what has been said in order to make something clear, or because someone else has joined the conversation.; (Interactive) Used alone to go back and repeat what they have said because it is not clear, or because someone else has joined the conversation.

rhinoceros.description: (As a Noun) A large animal with one or two horns on its nose. It lives in Africa and Asia and eats plants. English = rhinoceros.

rhubarb.description: (As a Noun) A plant with long red stems which people eat after cooking them with sugar. English = rhubarb.

rhythm.description: (As a Noun) The pattern of regular changes in different kinds of movements and sounds, especially in music. English = rhythm, beat.; (As a Noun) The hitting of a surface with finger or a stick. English = tap.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hit a surface with your finger or a stick to get someone's attention or to show the rhythm of speech or music. English = tap, tap out; beat, beat out.

ribbon.description: (As a Noun) A long, narrow piece of cloth that you use for tying things together or as a decoration. English = ribbon.; (As a Noun) A knot with two loops and two loose ends that is used in tying shoelaces and ribbons. English = bow.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tie a ribbon into a bow.

rib%20cage.description: (As a Noun) The framework of bones which supports and protects your organs and muscles. English = skeleton.; (As a Noun) The curved bones that go from your backbone to your chest. English = ribs.; (As a Noun) The structure of ribs in your chest. English = rib cage.

skeleton.description: (As a Noun) The framework of bones which supports and protects your organs and muscles. English = skeleton.; (As a Noun) The curved bones that go from your backbone to your chest. English = ribs.; (As a Noun) The structure of ribs in your chest. English = rib cage.

rice.description: (As a Noun) Food consisting of white grains which you cook and eat, usually with meat and vegetables. English = rice.

ride%20(an%20animal).description: (As a Noun) A large animal which you can ride. They are often used for transport or for pulling ploughs and carts. English = horse.; (As a Noun) The activity of riding horses, or any large animal. English = horse riding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be sitting on a horse, or any large animal. English = straddle.

ride%20(horse).description: (As a Noun) The activity of riding horses, especially in the manner of a prince or knight. Used particularly to recount children's stories. English = horse riding.; (As a Noun) A large circular platform with wooden or plastic animals and vehicles on it which children ride on as it turns round. English = merry-go-round.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To ride a horse in the manner of a prince or knight. Used particularly to recount children's stories.

ridiculous%20(exclamation).description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean you are amazed and disbelieving of what you have been told. English = 'Incredible!', 'Amazing!', 'Well, I'll be damned!', and so on.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to your addressee's comments to mean you are amazed at what has been said or done and that you think it stupid or foolish. English = 'Ridiculous!', 'Stupid you!', 'How dare you!', and so on.

right%20angle.description: (As a Noun) An angle of 90°, as in a corner of a square, or formed by dividing a circle into quarters. English = right angle.

right%20arm.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = right.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is on the side of the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = right side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = right arm, right hand.

right%20(correct).description: (As a Noun) A written mark like a V with the right hand line extended upwards. You use it to show that something is correct or has been dealt with. English = tick.; (As a Noun) A point or a score for a correct answer in a test or examination. English = mark, result.; (As a Noun) An answer to a question in a test or examination which is correct.

right%20hand.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = right.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is on the side of the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = right side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = right arm, right hand.

right%20(legal).description: (As a Noun) A moral or legal entitlement to do something. English = right.; (As a Noun) The sum of the moral or legal entitlements people in a particular society regarding what they can do and their freedoms. English = rights.; (Note) Auslan signers have been observed using this sign, which is borrowed from ASL, for ‘right’ or ‘rights’ in the context of human or legal rights. Most signers would not be familiar with this sign, so check familiarity and/or add fingerspelling the first time you use it in a conversation.

right%20(not%20left).description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = right.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be one of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = (be) right.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in one of two opposite directions; namely, rightwards.

right%20side.description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = right.; (As a Noun) One of two opposite sides of the body; namely, the side of the body which is on the side of the hand that most people write, sign or do complicated things with. English = right side.; (As a Noun) One of two arms on the body; namely, the arm with the hand that most people use to write, sign or do complicated things with. English  = right arm, right hand.

rights%20(legal).description: (As a Noun) A moral or legal entitlement to do something. English = right.; (As a Noun) The sum of the moral or legal entitlements people in a particular society regarding what they can do and their freedoms. English = rights.; (Note) Auslan signers have been observed using this sign, which is borrowed from ASL, for ‘right’ or ‘rights’ in the context of human or legal rights. Most signers would not be familiar with this sign, so check familiarity and/or add fingerspelling the first time you use it in a conversation.

right (not left).description: (As a Noun) One of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = right.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be one of two opposite directions, sides or positions. If you are facing north, where the sun rises is in this relative position (in the east); facing south, sunset is in this position (in the west). English = (be) right.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move in one of two opposite directions; namely, rightwards.

rind.description: (As a Noun) The RIND is the tough outer layer of foods such as fruit, cheese or bacon.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword RIND. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for RIND (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a specific sign for RIND used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

ring%20(doorbell).description: (General Definition) A button like object which is located on a surface, such as a wall, which you press with your thumb, such as a call button for a lift etc., or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a doorbell.; (As a Noun) A button like object located next to the front door of houses which rings (or causes lights to flash) when pressed and lets the people inside know you are at the door. English = doorbell.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To press a button like object located at the front door of a house to let the people inside know you are at the door by ringing a bell or flashing lights. English = ring doorbell.

ring%20(telephone).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a phone, to be ringing.

rip%20(tear).description: (As a Noun) A hole or a break that has been made in a piece of clothing or a piece of cloth or paper. English = tear, rip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pull something made of cloth or paper into two pieces or pull it so that a hole appears in it. English = tear, rip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your driver's licence cancelled because you have broken the road rules in some serious way; to lose your licence.

road.description: (As a Noun) A long piece of hard ground which is built between two places so that people can drive or ride easily from one place to the other. English = road.; (Note) Some older signers may think of this sign as an invented sign (for Signed English in education) but for most younger signers it has now just become another Auslan sign.

robot.description: (As a Noun) A science fiction machine, shaped like a person, which is programmed to move and perform tasks automatically. English = robot.; (As a Noun) A machine which is programmed to move and perform certain tasks automatically. English = robot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move like a science fiction robot. English = (be) robotic.

rollie%20(cigarette).description: (As a Noun) A hand-rolled cigarette. English = roll-your-own, rollie.; (As a Noun) Loose-leaf tobacco used for making roll-your-own cigarettes or for putting in pipes.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To roll your own cigarette, to hand roll a cigarette.

(General Definition) The Auslan sign FIRE and action of something that is wide and rotates evenly, such as a rotisserie.; (As a Noun) A cooking appliance with a rotating central spit, used for cooking or barbequing meat. roundabout%20(traffic).description: (General Definition) Of any two things (real or imaginary, abstract or concrete), for one thing to go around the other thing, or any thing or activity that can be directly or metaphorically associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) The path or places around something.; (As a Noun) A journey around a circular path or course.
