trousers.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing that covers your body from the waist downwards, and covers each leg separately. English = trousers, pants.; (As a Noun) Casual trousers. English = slacks.; (As a Noun) Casual trousers made of denim. English = jeans.

sleep%20in.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To stay in bed longer than usual in the morning. English = sleep in.

toss and turn.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person trying to sleep, to be unable to sleep and to constantly change your position by turning and moving side to side. English = toss and turn.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person in bed, to be unable to keep still, to be restless, and to be unable to sleep because you are worried by something. English = (be) sleepless.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person on a flat surface, to roll about side to side for some reason. English = roll about.

sleep%20(soundly).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be sleeping deeply. Idiomatic English = (be) sound asleep, (be) dead to the world, sleep soundly; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fall asleep quickly and completely and then to sleep very deeply because you are very tired.

sleepy.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very tired and ready to go to sleep. English = (be) sleepy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be strongly affected by your feelings for something or someone you love or like very much. English = swoon.

sleeve.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing worn over your arms which is attached at the shoulders to the rest of a garment. English = sleeve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a shirt, to have sleeves.

sleeveless.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing worn over the top part of your body but which does not cover your arms. English = sleeveless shirt/blouse, sleeveless dress.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an item of clothing to be worn over the top of the body but without any part covering the arms. English = (be) sleeveless, to have no sleeves.

sliding-door.description: (General Definition) A flat surface the moves sideways in front of another flat surface or any thing or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, such as a sliding-door or a photographic slide.; (As a Noun) A door which opens by sliding sideways rather than by swinging open. English = sliding door.; (As a Noun) A small piece of photographic film which can be projected onto a screen so that you can see the picture. English = slide.

slip.description: (As a Noun) The act of accidentally sliding and losing your balance. English = slip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To accidentally slide and lose your balance. English = slip.

slip-ons%20(shoes).description: (General Definition) The action of sliding an object into a container or covering or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially slippers.; (As a Noun) Loose, soft shoes that you wear in the house, especially when it is cold. English = slipper, slippers.; (As a Noun) Loose fitting shoes that do not have laces or buckles which you simply slide your feet into. English = slip-ons.

slipper.description: (General Definition) The action of sliding an object into a container or covering or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially slippers.; (As a Noun) Loose, soft shoes that you wear in the house, especially when it is cold. English = slipper, slippers.; (As a Noun) Loose fitting shoes that do not have laces or buckles which you simply slide your feet into. English = slip-ons.

slippers.description: (As a Noun) Loose, soft shoes that you wear in the house. English = slippers.

slip%20(petticoat).description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing without sleeves that a woman wears under her dress. English = slip.

slit%20throat.description: (As a Noun) Behaviour that deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals. English = cruelty, abuse, harshness.; (As a Noun) The kind of attitude or action in which people all want the same thing and do not care if they harm each other in getting it. English = ruthlessness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To behave in a way that deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals. English = (be) cruel.

sloshed%20(drunk).description: (As a Noun) A person who often gets drunk. English = drunkard. Informal English = piss pot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have drunk so much alcohol that you cannot speak or sign clearly or behave sensibly. English = (be) drunk. Informal English = (be) pissed, (be) sloshed. Formal English = (be) inebriated.

slowness.description: (As a Noun) A lack of speed or haste so that something takes a long time to move, happen or be done. English = slowness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move or happen without much speed or in a way that takes a large amount of time. English = (be) slow, go slow.; (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb (action) sign to mean that the action happens without much speed or in a way that takes a large amount of time. English = slowly.

slow%20down.description: (As a Noun) Reduction in speed or rate. English = deceleration.; (As a Noun) In mathematics and physics, the rate at which the speed of an object is decreasing. English = deceleration.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take your foot off the accelerator in order to make a vehicle go slower. English = slow down, decelerate. Idiomatic English = ease up, take one's foot off the brake.

slow%20(too%20slow).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer possible or useful to do something because the right time for doing it has passed. English = too late.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do or make something happen without enough speed so that it cannot be done properly or within the period of time that it must happen or you want it to happen. English = too slow.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that someone's actions have happened so much after the arranged or expected time that it is no longer wanted, useful or relevant. English = 'Too late!', 'Forget it! It's too late!'

snail.description: (As a Noun) A small animal with a long, slimy body, a spiral shaped shell, and long eye stalks on the top of its head. It moves very slowly. English = snail.; (As a Noun) A person who is very low at doing something, for example at driving a car. English = snail, sluggard.

sign badly.description: (As a Noun) Signing which is very bad and unclear, either because you have not learned to sign well or perhaps because you are nervous, distracted or intoxicated.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To sign in an unclear and sloppy way, either because you have not learned to sign well or perhaps because you are nervous, distracted or intoxicated. English = slur, slur one's words.

slut.description: (As a Noun) A person, especially a woman, who is considered to be very immoral and promiscuous in their sexual behaviour. An offensive sign. English = slut

bright (smart).description: (As a Noun) The ability someone has to understand things easily or plan things well. English = smartness, intelligence.; (As a Noun) A person who is very smart, bright or intelligent.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able to understand things easily or plan things well. English = (be) smart, (be) bright, (be) intelligent.

smart%20phone.description: (As a Noun) An electronic message you send via a smart phone.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send someone a text message via a smart phone. English = text, sms.

smash%20(vehicle).description: (General Definition) Of an object, to move forward until it encounters a barrier of some sort which causes it to stop, or any thing, action or state which can be easily extrapolated from this given an appropriate context. Cited without context, most signers will think this sign means a car hitting an obstacle.; (As a Noun) An event in which a moving car or other vehicle hits a surface and is badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash (car), smash (car), accident (car), collision (car).; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a car or other moving vehicle, to hit something and be badly damaged or destroyed. English = crash, smash, have an accident.

smoke%20alarm.description: (As a Noun) A device fixed to the ceiling of a room which makes a loud noise (or causes lights to flash) if there is smoke in the air, to warn people. English = smoke alarm, smoke detector.

smoke%20(cigarette).description: (As a Noun) A small tube of paper containing tobacco which people smoke. English = cigarette.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smoke a cigarette. English = smoke, have a smoke.

smoke%20(marijuana).description: (As a Noun) A type of drug which is smoked in cigarettes and which is illegal in most countries. English = marijuana. Informal English = pot, grass, weed, dope.; (As a Noun) A cigarette made of marijuana. Informal English = joint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a marijuana cigarette in your mouth, suck the smoke into your lungs and blow it out again. English = smoke marijuana, smoke a marijuana cigarette. Informal English = smoke dope, smoke pot, smoke a joint.

smoke%20(pipe).description: (As a Noun) A object which is used for smoking tobacco. You put tobacco into the cup-shaped end, light it, and breathe in smoke through a narrow tube. English = pipe.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To smoke a pipe.

smooch.description: (As a Noun) A long and passionate kiss.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of two people, to kiss and hold each other closely; to kiss deeply and for a long time. Informal English = smooch.

snack%20food.description: (As a Noun) Small foods which you can eat between main meals. English = snack food. Informal English = nibbles, nibblies.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put something small into your mouth, chew it, and swallow it.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To eat something slowly by taking small bites out of it. English = nibble.

snapper.description: (As a Noun) In Australia and New Zealand, a pink-coloured sea fish that is good to eat. English = snapper.

sneeze.description: (As a Noun) The act of suddenly taking in your breath and then blowing it down your nose noisily. People do it a lot when they have a cold. English = sneeze.; (As a Noun) [Especially with a repeated movement], an illness similar to a cold, in which people sneeze a lot because they are allergic to some types of pollen. English = hay fever.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To suddenly take in your breath and then blow it down your nose noisily. People do it a lot when they have a cold. English = sneeze.

snob.description: (As a Noun) Someone who admires upper-class people and despises lower-class people; someone who believes that they are superior to other people because of their intelligence or taste. The sign is used to show disapproval of such a person. English = snob.; (As a Noun) The attitude of a snob. English = snobbery.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be too proud of your social status, intelligence, or taste. Used to show disapproval. English = (be) snobbish, (be) snobby.

snore.description: (As a Noun) The sound made when you make a loud noise every time you breath when you are asleep. English = snore.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a loud noise every time you breath when you are asleep. English = snore.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be so dull and uninteresting so that you feel tired and impatient. English = (be) boring.

snow.description: (As a Noun) A lot of soft white bits of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather. English = snow.; (As a Verb or Adjective) For snow to fall from the sky. English = snow.

snub.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately look at someone as if they are not there in order to avoid acknowledging them or talking to them. English = snub, ignore. Idiomatic English = look right through (someone).

so.description: (As Modifier) Used to introduce something that happens because of the situation you have just mentioned. English = so.; (As Modifier) Used to introduce the reason for doing the thing that you have just mentioned. English = so.

soccer.description: (As a Noun) A football game in which two teams of eleven players try to get the ball into their opponents' goal. Only the goalkeepers are allowed to touch the ball with their hands when the ball is on the pitch. English = soccer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To bounce the ball off your head in a game of soccer.

soccer%20club.description: (As a Noun) An organisation of people who are all interested in or supporters of a particular football club. English = club, football club, soccer club, rugby club.; (As a Noun) A special hat which is usually worn as part of a school or sports uniform. English = cap.

social%20distancing.description: (As a Noun) The practice of keeping a physical distance between people to avoid catching or transmitting an infectious disease. English = social distancing.

social%20studies.description: (As a Noun) The study of human societies. An academic discipline and a subject taught at universities. English = sociology.; (As a Noun) A subject taught in schools and colleges. It includes politics, economics and the study of culture. English = social studies.

social%20work.description: (As a Noun) Work which involves giving help and advice to people with serious financial problems or family problems. English = social work, welfare work.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to do social or welfare work. English = social worker, welfare worker.; (As a Noun) Someone whose job is to be in charge of something, especially an institution (such as a hospital, hostel, dormitory, welfare association etc.). He or she is also often a social or welfare worker. English = superintendent.

social%20worker.description: (As a Noun) Work which involves giving help and advice to people with serious financial problems or family problems. English = social work, welfare work.; (As a Noun) A person whose job is to do social or welfare work. English = social worker, welfare worker.; (As a Noun) Someone whose job is to be in charge of something, especially an institution (such as a hospital, hostel, dormitory, welfare association etc.). He or she is also often a social or welfare worker. English = superintendent.

society.description: (As a Noun) The people in a country or region and the particular way of life, economy, institutions and organisations they have. English = society.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To relate to society or the way that society is organised. English = social.

sociology.description: (As a Noun) The study of human societies. An academic discipline and a subject taught at universities. English = sociology.; (As a Noun) A subject taught in schools and colleges. It includes politics, economics and the study of culture. English = social studies.

sock.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing which covers your foot and ankle and is worn inside a shoe. English = sock.; (As a Noun) Shoes that cover your whole foot and the lower part of your leg; or strong, heavy shoes which cover your ankle and have thick soles. English = boots.; (As a Noun) Loose, soft shoes that you wear in the house. English = slippers.

softness.description: (As a Noun) The feeling of something that changes shape or bends easily and that is pleasant to touch. English = softness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that changes shape or bends easily when you press it; that is pleasant to touch, and not rough or hard; or that is very gentle and has no force. English = (be) soft.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be kind and care about other people's feelings. English = (be) soft.

soft%20drink.description: (As a Noun) A colourless sweet fizzy drink. English = lemonade.; (As a Noun) Any cold, non-alcoholic drink such as lemonade or fruit juice. English = soft drink.

soliciting.description: (As a Noun) Of a man or a woman, but especially of a female prostitute, the act of standing in a public place in order to attract men who are willing to pay money to have sex with you. English = soliciting.; (As a Noun) A place where men have, or arrange to have, casual sex with each other. These places are often located in parks or beaches. Gay (homosexual) deaf slang sign. Gay (homosexual) slang English = beat, cruising area.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a man or a woman, but especially of a female prostitute, to stand in a public place in order to attract men who are willing to pay money to have sex with you. English = solicit.

solid.description: (As a Noun) A substance which is hard and firm and remains the same shape whether it is in a container or not. English = solid.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a substance, to be hard and firm and to remain the same shape whether it is in a container or not. English = (be) solid.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a substance, to feel very firm when you touch it and not to be easily bent, cut, or broken. English = (be) hard, (be) rigid, (be) firm.

some.description: (As a Noun) Anything that is not a person, for example an object, action, or quality. English = something.; (As a Noun) A person in the most general sense (without saying who they are exactly). English = someone.; (As Modifier) A quantity of something or a number of people or things, without stating the number of people or things precisely. English = (be) some, (be) a bit.

who.description: (As a Noun) A person in the most general sense (without saying who they are exactly). English = someone.; (As a Noun) A person who does something whose identity does not matter or is not known. English = whoever.; (As a Noun) A person who has something  done to them whose identity does not matter or is not known. English = whomever.

temporary.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To last only a short period of time and not be permanent. English = (be) temporary.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean that the action happens on some occasions. English = sometimes.

son.description: (As a Noun) The male child of someone. English = son.; (Note) The fingerspelling is often reduced to simply S+N.

soon.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action finishes earlier than you want or expect. English = too soon, after only a short time.

sorrow.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of deep sadness or the wish that you had not done something. English = sorrow.; (As a Noun) The feeling and wish that you had not done something. English = regret.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel sadness, regret, or disappointment about a situation. English = (be) sorry.

sorry.description: (As a Noun) A feeling you have when you wish you had not done something. English = regret.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wish you had not done something, especially something which has caused someone pain or difficulties. English = regret, feel sorry.; (Interactive) Used alone as a way of apologising to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties. English = 'Sorry', 'I'm sorry' and so on.

sort.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To separate things into different classes, groups or places, usually so that you can arrange them in a more useful or sensible order. English = sort, sort out.

sort%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To separate things into different classes, groups or places, usually so that you can arrange them in a more useful or sensible order. English = sort, sort out.

spirit.description: (As a Noun) The part of you that is not physical and is connected with your deepest thoughts and feelings. English = spirit.; (As a Noun) The non-physical part of a dead person that is believed to remain alive after their death. English = spirit, soul.

sound%20asleep.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be sleeping deeply. Idiomatic English = (be) sound asleep, (be) dead to the world, sleep soundly; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fall asleep quickly and completely and then to sleep very deeply because you are very tired.

south.description: (As a Noun) The direction which is on your right side when you are looking towards the direction where the sun rises. English = south.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be at or relate to the south. English = (be) south, (be) southern.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a direction that something faces or the direction from which a wind blows, to be from or face the south. English = (be) southerly.

sowing.description: (General Definition) The act of repeatedly scattering handfuls of something piled up or held on your other hand, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially sowing seeds or feeding fowl.; (As a Noun) The act of spreading seeds across the ground in order to plant them there. English = sowing.; (As a Noun) Food that is given to an animal, particularly the seeds given to birds and poultry. English = feed, chicken feed.

sow%20(seeds).description: (General Definition) The act of repeatedly scattering handfuls of something piled up or held on your other hand, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially sowing seeds or feeding fowl.; (As a Noun) The act of spreading seeds across the ground in order to plant them there. English = sowing.; (As a Noun) Food that is given to an animal, particularly the seeds given to birds and poultry. English = feed, chicken feed.

spa.description: (As a Noun) An enclosed section of a swimming pool, or a bath, through which heated, aerated water is pumped at some pressure. English = spa, spa bath.

spa%20bath.description: (As a Noun) An enclosed section of a swimming pool, or a bath, through which heated, aerated water is pumped at some pressure. English = spa, spa bath.

spade.description: (As a Noun) A tool used for digging, with a flat metal blade and a long handle. English = spade, shovel.; (As a Noun) A small garden tool with a curved, pointed blade that you use for digging small holes or for removing weeds. English = trowel.; (As a Noun) The activity of using a spade or a trowel to make holes in the ground or to move dirt, especially when working in the garden. English = digging, gardening.

spark%20plugs.description: (As a Noun) In the electronics of engines, either of a pair of contacts tipped with tungsten or platinum that makes or breaks current flow. English = points.; (As a Noun) In a motor engine, a device, with points, which causes the electric sparks that ignite the fuel. English = spark plugs.

speech.description: (As a Noun) A person who is speaking or is able to speak.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your voice in order to say words which form part of a text or a conversation. English = speak.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To know a (spoken) language and to be able to have a conversation in it. English = speak.

speaker%20(loudspeaker).description: (General Definition) Any concentrated source of energy (light, heat, sound, etc.) which gives out rays or waves in all directions, like a pattern of lines drawn from the centre of a circle to various point on its edge, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in a given context.; (As a Noun) A source of sound energy. English = speaker.; (As a Noun) A source of light energy. English = light.

speaking.description: (As a Noun) A person who is able to use their voice to say words and communicate in speech; a person who is not mute or dumb; a person who is not mute or dumb and deaf; a speaking person; a speaking and hearing person.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be able to use your voice to say words and use speech to communicate; not to be mute or dumb; not to be deaf; to be a speaking (and hearing) person.

specific.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be precise and exact, or to refer to a particular fixed area of subject. English = (be) specific.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a clause or sentence, to mean that what follows deals in a particular and special way with what you are talking about. English = specifically.

specimen.description: (As a Noun) A SPECIMEN is a small quantity of someone's urine, blood, or other body fluid which is examined in a medical laboratory, in order to find out if they are ill or if they have been drinking alcohol or taking drugs.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for SPECIMEN. If you know a sign for SPECIMEN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

speech%20reading.description: (As a Noun) A deaf person who has been educated without the benefit of sign language and who has been taught using a method which encourages the use of speech alone.; (As a Noun) A deaf person who can use speech quite well and who probably does not use sign language.; (As a Noun) The technique of decoding the sounds of a spoken language by watching the lips. English = lip reading, speech reading.

speeding.description: (As a Noun) [Often made with puffed cheeks] the act of going very fast in a vehicle, especially a car. English = speeding.; (As a Verb or Adjective) [Often made with puffed cheeks] to drive very fast in a vehicle, especially a car. English = speed.

speed%20off.description: (As a Noun) The disappearance of something, especially into the distance.; (As a Noun) The disappearance of a person from a place which is quick, unnoticed by others, or made without saying goodbye.; (As a Noun) The movement of a vehicle at high speed away into the distance.

speedway.description: (General Definition) Of a car or other vehicle, to move sideways or to skid, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially speedway racing.; (As a Noun) A racing track for motor vehicles, especially motorcycles. English = speedway.; (As a Noun) The sport of racing cars and motorcycles on special racing tracks. English = speedway, speedway racing.

speedway%20racing.description: (General Definition) Of a car or other vehicle, to move sideways or to skid, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially speedway racing.; (As a Noun) A racing track for motor vehicles, especially motorcycles. English = speedway.; (As a Noun) The sport of racing cars and motorcycles on special racing tracks. English = speedway, speedway racing.

spell%20(magic).description: (As a Noun) A sequence of words or signs used to perform magic. English = spell.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say a sequence of words or signs as part of performing some magic. English = cast a spell.

spendthrift.description: (As a Noun) A person who spends money in a wasteful, careless or extravagant way. English = spendthrift.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To spend money in a wasteful, careless or extravagant way.

spin dryer.description: (As a Noun) A machine that is used to spin washing to get the water out. English = spin dryer, spin drier.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn quickly around a central point. English = spin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry something by spinning it in a spin dryer. English = spin dry.

spinach.description: (As a Noun) A plant with large green leaves that is eaten as a vegetable. English = spinach.

spin%20drier.description: (As a Noun) A machine that is used to spin washing to get the water out. English = spin dryer, spin drier.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn quickly around a central point. English = spin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry something by spinning it in a spin dryer. English = spin dry.

spin%20dry.description: (As a Noun) A machine that is used to spin washing to get the water out. English = spin dryer, spin drier.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn quickly around a central point. English = spin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry something by spinning it in a spin dryer. English = spin dry.

spin%20dryer.description: (As a Noun) A machine that is used to spin washing to get the water out. English = spin dryer, spin drier.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn quickly around a central point. English = spin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry something by spinning it in a spin dryer. English = spin dry.

spirit%20level.description: (General Definition) The action of holding something in your hand at eye level and moving it up and down at either end, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a spirit level.; (As a Noun) A device for testing a surface to see if it is level. It consists of a piece of wood or metal containing a tube of liquid with a bubble of air in it. When it is level the bubble is in the centre of the tube. English = spirit level.

spit%20out.description: (As a Noun) An amount of the watery liquid produced in your mouth which has been forced out deliberately, either to clear your mouth or as an aggressive gesture towards someone else (showing hatred or disgust). English = spit, spittle.; (As a Noun) One of the small hard seeds found in a fruit such as an apple which you often have to spit out when eating the fruit. English = pip, pips, seed, seeds.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To force out some spittle from your mouth, either to clear your mouth or as an aggressive gesture towards someone else (showing hatred or disgust). English = spit, spit out.

split%20up%20(relationship).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To end a relationship with someone, especially a casual sexual relationship or a defacto relationship. English = separate. Idiomatic English = break up, split up, dump, ditch, give someone the flick, tell someone it's over, (be) finished with.

spoil.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something less enjoyable, attractive, valuable, useful or interesting than it would otherwise have been. English = spoil, damage, ruin.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of food, to no longer be good enough to eat. English = spoil.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a child, to give them everything they want or ask for. By doing this, you make their behaviour and character worse than they would otherwise have been. take%20in.description: (As a Noun) Something that happens to you that you can feel physically but which has a particularly important psychological or intellectual impact. English = experience.; (As a Noun) Things that have happened to you or that you have done before in your life. English = experiences.; (As a Noun) The learning of a skill by watching and doing, especially  learning to speak or sign a language by being exposed and immersed in it as a child. English = acquisition.

take%20off%20(plane).description: (As a Noun) Of an aeroplane, the act of leaving a place. English = departure.; (As a Noun) Of an aeroplane, the act of leaving the ground. English = take-off.; (As a Noun) A place where aircraft land and take off, usually with a lot of buildings and facilities. English = airport.

take%20off%20(rocket).description: (As a Noun) A space vehicle that is shaped like a long tube; a missile containing explosive that drives itself through the air by sending out burning gas; a firework that quickly goes high into the air and then explodes. English = rocket.; (As a Noun) The launching of a rocket or missile. English = lift off.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send a rocket or missile into space. English = launch.

take%20place.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of events and happenings, to take place and unfold over a period of time in a particular place; for events to go on over time. English = do, take place, carry on, continue.

take%20tablet.description: (As a Noun) A small piece or mass of medicine which you swallow, with or without chewing. English = tablet, pill.; (As a Noun) Something used for the treatment of an illness, especially pills or tablets. English = medication.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a tablet or pill.

talcum%20powder.description: (As a Noun) A soft perfumed powder which people put on their bodies after they have had a bath or shower. English = talcum powder, talc, powder.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cover parts of your body with scented powder.

tall.description: (As a Noun) The measurement from the bottom to the top of a person or thing, especially when that distance is thought to be great or above the average. English = height, tallness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of people or things, to measure a great or above average distance from the bottom to the top. English = (be) tall, (be) high.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become higher or taller.

tambourine.description: (As a Noun) A musical instrument which you shake or hit with your hand. It consists of a drum skin on a circular frame and small round pieces of metal all around the edge. English = tambourine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play a tambourine.

tampon.description: (As a Noun) A firm, specially shaped piece of cotton wool that a woman puts inside her vagina to absorb the blood when she has a period. English = tampon.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To insert a firm, specially shaped piece of cotton wool (a tampon) into the vagina to absorb the blood of a period.

tangent.description: (As a Noun) In geometry, a straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a point, but if extended does not cross it at that point. English = tangent.

tan%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) An abbreviation for 'tangent' which means, in mathematics, the trigonometric function tht is equal to the ratio of the sides (other than the hypotenuse) opposite and adjacent to an angle in a right-angled triangle. English = tan, tangent.

tanned%20(suntanned).description: (As a Noun) The condition of having skin which has turned an attractive brown colour because you have been in the sun. English = tan, suntan.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used to describe someone whose skin is darker than usual because they have been in the sun. English = (be) brown, (be) tanned, (be) sun-tanned. Idiomatic English = have a tan, have a sun tan.

tan%20(suntan).description: (As a Noun) The condition of having skin which has turned an attractive brown colour because you have been in the sun. English = tan, suntan.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to have skin which is darker than usual because they have been in the sun. English = (be) brown, (be) tanned, (be) suntanned. Idiomatic English = have a tan, have a sun tan.

tap%20and%20pay.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use an electronic payment or identification systems in shops, on public transport or in places with security control with a card or other thin device which has a chip inside or a bar code, or uses wifi or bluetooth technology and which touches or is brought close to another device that reads it. English = tap on/off, touch on/off.

tape%20(adhesive).description: (As a Noun) Sticky strips of plastic which you use for sticking things together. English = tape, adhesive tape.; (As a Noun) A strip of sticky material used for covering small cuts or sores on your body. English = band-aid. British English = plaster.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use sticky strips of plastic to stick things together. English = apply adhesive tape.

tape%20measure.description: (As a Noun) A strip of plastic or cloth with centimetres or inches marked on it. You use it for measuring things. English = tape measure.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To find out how big, long, wide or high something is using a tape-measure or other measuring device. English = measure.; (Note) The variant sign was created for the Australasian Signed English in the 1980s. It uses the letter M in the one-handed fingerspelling alphabet. It has been accepted and used as an Auslan sign by some deaf people, especially in education by teachers of the deaf, their students, and interpreters. The main sign and another sign listed in this dictionary are more commonly used for ‘measure’ in Auslan.

tape%20record.description: (General Definition) Of any two things, to rotate simultaneously, such as the two reels of an old-fashioned audio tape recorder, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A machine that records and plays sounds on tape. English = tape recorder.; (As a Noun) Plastic tape made in long strips and covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information. English = magnetic tape (particularly computers); audio tape (sound only); video tape (pictures and sound).

tape%20recorder.description: (General Definition) Of any two things, to rotate simultaneously, such as the two reels of an old-fashioned audio tape recorder, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A machine that records and plays sounds on tape. English = tape recorder.; (As a Noun) Plastic tape made in long strips and covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information. English = magnetic tape (particularly computers); audio tape (sound only); video tape (pictures and sound).

tape%20(reel-to-reel).description: (General Definition) Of any two things, to rotate simultaneously, such as the two reels of an old-fashioned audio tape recorder, or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A machine that records and plays sounds on tape. English = tape recorder.; (As a Noun) Plastic tape made in long strips and covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information. English = magnetic tape (particularly computers); audio tape (sound only); video tape (pictures and sound).

tap%20(faucet).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn on a tap.

tap%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use an electronic payment or identification systems in shops, on public transport or in places with security control with a card or other thin device which has a chip inside or a bar code, or uses wifi or bluetooth technology and which touches or is brought close to another device that reads it. English = tap on/off, touch on/off.

tap%20on.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use an electronic payment or identification systems in shops, on public transport or in places with security control with a card or other thin device which has a chip inside or a bar code, or uses wifi or bluetooth technology and which touches or is brought close to another device that reads it. English = tap on/off, touch on/off.

tattoo.description: (As a Noun) A picture or design tattooed on someone's body. English = tattoo.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To draw a picture or design on to someone's skin by pricking little holes in it and filling them with coloured dye. English = tattoo.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a picture or design drawn on your skin. English = (be) tattooed.

taxi%20(plane).description: (As a Noun) A place where aircraft land and take off, usually with a lot of buildings and facilities. English = airport.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an aeroplane, to move slowly along the runway before taking off or after landing. English = taxi.

tb%20(tuberculosis).description: (As a Noun) TUBERCULOSIS, or "TB," is a serious infectious disease that affects the lungs.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TUBERCULOSIS. If you know a sign for TUBERCULOSIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

tea.description: (As a Noun) A drink made with hot water and the chopped, dried leaves of a particular bush. Milk and sugar are often added to the drink. English = tea.; (As a Noun) A cup of tea, or a cup of any other drinks made with hot water and leaves or flowers.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To drink tea.

tea%20bag.description: (As a Noun) A small paper bag with tea leaves in it. You put it into hot water to make tea and then throw it away. English = tea bag.; (As a Noun) A cup of tea made with a tea bag.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To hold a tea bag above a cup and dip it into hot water in order to make a cup of tea.

teacher.description: (As a Noun) Someone who gives instructions about something to people, especially children in a school, so that they know about it or know how to do it. English = teacher.

team.description: (As a Noun) A group of people who play together against another group in a sport or game. English = team.; (As a Noun) Any group of people who work together. English = team.

tear%20(rip).description: (As a Noun) A hole or a break that has been made in a piece of clothing or a piece of cloth or paper. English = tear, rip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pull something made of cloth or paper into two pieces or pull it so that a hole appears in it. English = tear, rip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have your driver's licence cancelled because you have broken the road rules in some serious way; to lose your licence.

teaspoon.description: (As a Noun) A small spoon that is used to put sugar into tea or coffee and then to stir it in. English = teaspoon.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stir tea or coffee with a teaspoon.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stir something inside a small container using a teaspoon.

technology.description: (As a Noun) The activity or study of using scientific knowledge for practical purposes in industry, farming, medicine, or business. English = technology.; (As a Noun) A particular method of doing something. English = technique.; (As a Noun) A person with expert technical or scientific knowledge, especially one who looks after and maintains equipment. English = technician.

teddy-bear.description: (As a Noun) A child's soft toy which looks like a friendly bear with big round ears. English = teddy-bear.

bore.description: (As a Noun) Someone who communicates in an uninteresting way, or something which is uninteresting. English = bore.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel tired and impatient because you have lost interest in something or because you have nothing to do. English = (be) bored.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make other people feel tired and impatient because they have lost interest in what you are saying or doing. English = (be) boring, (be) tedious; bore (someone).

youngster.description: (As a Noun) A person who is not old; a young person. English = youngster, youth (especially a male in the teenage years).; (As a Noun) A young person between the ages of thirteen and nineteen. English = teenager.; (As a Noun) The period in someone's life when they are a child or before they are fully mature. English = youth.

teeth.description: (As a Noun) The hard, white objects in your mouth that you use for biting and chewing food. English = teeth.

telebrailler.description: (As a Noun) A device for sending and receiving messages in braille over the telephone. Incoming braille messages can be felt on a keyboard. English = telebrailler.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use a telebrailler.

telecommunications.description: (As a Noun) The science and activity of sending signals and messages over long distances using electronic equipment, particularly telephones. English = telecommunications.

telephone%20call.description: (As a Noun) The act of telephoning someone. English = telephone call.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pick up the telephone when it rings or because you want to make a telephone call. English = answer the telephone.

telephone%20typewriter.description: (As a Noun) A device with a typewriter keyboard which sends and receives typed messages over the telephone. English = telephone typewriter, teletypewriter, teletype, TTY.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To answer a telephone typewriter.

tty.description: (As a Noun) A device with a typewriter keyboard which sends and receives typed messages over the telephone. English = telephone typewriter, teletypewriter, teletype, TTY.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To answer a telephone typewriter.

television.description: (As a Noun) A piece of electrical equipment consisting of a box with a glass screen. You use a it to watch programs with pictures and sounds. English = television.

tell%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To speak or sign to someone in an angry or serious way because they have done something wrong. Idiomatic English = tell off, blast.

tell%20tales.description: (As a Noun) A person who betrays the trust of others by telling people in authority about the goings on of their peers when they involve either secrets or wrong-doings such as the breaking of rules, regulations or laws. English = pimp, blabbermouth, informant.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell people in authority about the goings on of your peers when they involve either secrets or wrong-doings such as the breaking of rules, regulations or laws. English = pimp, blab, tell tales, inform on.

telstra.description: (As a Noun) A large telecommunications company in Australia, called Telstra.

temper.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of extreme anger and inability to control your behaviour. English = temper, fury, rage.; (As a Noun) The tendency someone has to become angry or to stay calm. English = temper.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person, to be extremely angry. English = (be) furious. Informal English = (be) pissed off.

temperature.description: (As a Noun) The measure of the amount of heat in something, the measure of how hot or cold it is. English = temperature.; (As a Noun) An instrument for measuring the temperature of a person's body. It usually consists of a narrow glass tube containing a thin column of mercury which rises and falls as the temperature rises and falls. English = thermometer.

temperature%20danger%20zone.description: (As a Noun) The temperature range for food between 5°C and 60°C in which food poisoning bacteria can grow to unsafe levels that can make people who eat the food sick. English = temperature danger zone.

temper%20tantrum.description: (As a Noun) A person who likes to throw temper tantrums.; (As a Noun) A noisy outburst of bad temper. English = tantrum, temper tantrum.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel or show strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting. English = (be) angry, (be) furious, (be) pissed off.

ten.description: (As a Noun) The number 10, between 9 and 11. English = ten.

tennis.description: (As a Noun) A game played by two or four players on a rectangular court. They use rackets to hit a ball over a net which is between them. English = tennis.; (As a Noun) The beginning of play in tennis when someone throws up the ball and hits it. English = serve.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play tennis.

tense%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be firm or hard and not easy to bend. English = (be) stiff, (be) rigid.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To stop moving and stand or sit with muscles that are suddenly tense, for example because you feel afraid or angry. English = stiffen, tense up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To prepare yourself for something unpleasant or difficult. English = brace oneself.

tent.description: (As a Noun) A shelter made of canvas or nylon, which you sleep in when you are camping. It is held up by poles and ropes. English = tent.; (As a Noun) The activity of travelling in the countryside and staying overnight in tents. English = camping.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To pitch a tent.

terminal.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) A TERMINAL illness or disease causes death, often slowly, and cannot be cured.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TERMINAL. If you know a sign for TERMINAL used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

terrace.description: (As a Noun) A row of similar houses joined together by their side walls. English = terrace, terrace houses.; (As a Noun) One of a row of similar houses joined together by their side walls. English = terrace house.

terror.description: (As a Noun) A very great fear or something that makes you very frightened. English = terror.; (As a Noun) The shaking of the body from fear. English = trembling.; (As a Noun) A feeling of worry and fear about something. English = nervousness.

third.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the thing, person, event or period of time that happens or comes after two others of the same kind. English = (be) third.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be the third in order, the third in importance, or in the third stage of development (especially in education). Formal English = (be) tertiary.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action is done after two others have done it. English = third.

testament.description: (As a Noun) Either of the two main divisions of the Bible, especially the second part dealing with Jesus Christ. English = testament; Old Testament (= first part only), New Testament (= second part only).

testicles.description: (As a Noun) The two sex glands of a man that produce sperm. They are egg shaped and hang in sacks under his penis. English = testicles. Informal slang English = balls.

thailand.description: (As a Noun) A country in south-east Asia, between Burma and Cambodia. English = Thailand.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be from or relate to Thailand. English = (be) Thai.

than.description: (As Modifier) Used to link two parts of a comparison. The person or thing and the quality being compared is signed first (preceded by MORE or LESS), then this sign, then the person or thing it is being compared to. English = than.

thank you.description: (As a Noun) The expression of your appreciation or gratitude to someone. English = thanks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell someone you appreciate what they have done for you. English = thank.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to someone having done something for you which makes you happy or which fulfils an earlier request you have made. The sign is a polite recognition of this fact. English = thank you, thanks.

thank%20you.description: (As a Noun) The expression of your appreciation or gratitude to someone. English = thanks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tell someone you appreciate what they have done for you. English = thank.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to someone having done something for you which makes you happy or which fulfils an earlier request you have made. The sign is a polite recognition of this fact. English = thank you, thanks.

what.description: (Interactive) Used alone to ask people what they are talking about, especially if you suspect it has something to do with you. English = 'What?', 'What was that?' and so on.; (As Modifier) Often used immediately after a noun and before a descriptive phrase or clause which gives further information about the first noun. English = that, which. Non-standard English = what.; (As Question) Used at the beginning, end, or at both the beginning and the end of sentences when you are asking for information about something. English = what.

that's%20all.description: (Interactive) Used alone in response to a question or the expectation in your addressee that you will say more or add more details to mean that you are finished and there is no more to say or no more explanation to be given. English = 'That's all!', 'That's it!',; (Interactive) 'That's the end of the story!', 'End of story!', 'And that's that!', and so on.; (As Modifier) Used at the end of a sign sentence to mean you are finished with adding details or giving explanations, especially if you have been brief and/or your partner is expecting more. English = 'And that's that!'

that's%20right.description: (As a Noun) The quality of being in accordance with the facts or having no mistakes. English = correctness, rightness, accuracy.; (As a Noun) The fixing of something to remove the mistakes or to make it in accordance with the facts. English = correction.; (As a Noun) The moral justification or legal permission to do something. English = right.

their.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used to mean something is owned or possessed by the people the sign is directed towards or sweeps past. It excludes the signer and the person being addressed. It is usually signed immediately next to the noun sign for the thing that is owned. English = their.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to mean something is owned or possessed by the people the sign is directed towards or sweeps past. It excludes the signer and the person being addressed. Used alone without saying what is  possessed if it is clear from context or someone has mentioned it before. English = theirs.

they.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to several locations that are not near either the signer or the person addressed, i.e., ‘those places there’.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to people or things separate and different from the signer and the person they are addressing. If the thing or other person is real and located in the situation, then you point to where they are located, otherwise you point to where you imagine they are located. When the pointing sign is made immediately before or after a verb sign, you usually mean that the thing or the other person does the action of the verb, or is affected by the action of the verb. English = they, them.; (As a Pointing Sign) When the pointing sign is made immediately before or after a noun sign and is made with stress (longer movement, more directed) the signer usually means particular or special things or persons which have already been talked about in the conversation or which contrasts with something else which as already been mentioned. English = those.

them%20(here).description: (General Definition) Used to refer to people or things which are near to, or closely associated with, the signer. Small close things can be easily pointed to in this way; however, people and large things first need to be visualised in a map-like space in which they are imagined to be located.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to several locations that are near either the signer or the person addressed, i.e., ‘these places here’.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used immediately before or after a noun sign to mean particular or special things or persons which have already been talked about in the conversation or which contrast with something else which as already been mentioned. English = these.

then.description: (As Modifier) Used to separate two stages in a story or narrative to clearly mark the transition from the one to the other. English = 'and then', 'after that happened.'

theory.description: (As a Noun) An idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something. English = theory.; (As a Noun) A set of ideas that relate to a particular subject. English = theory.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be based on or concerning the ideas and abstract principles of a subject, rather than the practical aspects of it. English = (be) theoretical.

therapy.description: (As a Noun) The treatment of someone with mental or physical illness without the use of drugs or operations. English = therapy.; (As a Noun) A person who treats someone with mental or physical illness without the use of drugs or operations. English = therapist.

therefore%20(symbol).description: (As a Noun) A symbol ( ∴ ) used in mathematics, logic, and shorthand, to mean ‘therefore’. It is written before the logical consequence of a logical argument or mathematical proof.

there%20(near%20you).description: (Interactive) Used to refer to one of several addressees. English = you there.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to the person the signer is addressing. English = you.; (As a Pointing Sign) Can be used to refer to the location of the addressee. English = there.

there%20(plural).description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to several locations that are not near either the signer or the person addressed, i.e., ‘those places there’.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to people or things separate and different from the signer and the person they are addressing. If the thing or other person is real and located in the situation, then you point to where they are located, otherwise you point to where you imagine they are located. When the pointing sign is made immediately before or after a verb sign, you usually mean that the thing or the other person does the action of the verb, or is affected by the action of the verb. English = they, them.; (As a Pointing Sign) When the pointing sign is made immediately before or after a noun sign and is made with stress (longer movement, more directed) the signer usually means particular or special things or persons which have already been talked about in the conversation or which contrasts with something else which as already been mentioned. English = those.

thermometer.description: (As a Noun) An instrument for measuring the temperature of a person's body. It usually consists of a narrow glass tube containing a thin column of mercury which rises and falls as the temperature rises and falls. English = thermometer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take someone's temperature using a thermometer.

here (plural).description: (General Definition) Used to refer to people or things which are near to, or closely associated with, the signer. Small close things can be easily pointed to in this way; however, people and large things first need to be visualised in a map-like space in which they are imagined to be located.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to several locations that are near either the signer or the person addressed, i.e., ‘these places here’.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used immediately before or after a noun sign to mean particular or special things or persons which have already been talked about in the conversation or which contrast with something else which as already been mentioned. English = these.

theta.description: (As a Noun) The eighth letter of the Greek alphabet, written as θ in lower case. It is used as a symbol in mathematics and scientific notation with many meanings. In mathematics, it is used especially for an unknown variable in trigonometry, and a plane angle in geometry. English = theta.

they%20(here).description: (General Definition) Used to refer to people or things which are near to, or closely associated with, the signer. Small close things can be easily pointed to in this way; however, people and large things first need to be visualised in a map-like space in which they are imagined to be located.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to several locations that are near either the signer or the person addressed, i.e., ‘these places here’.; (As a Pointing Sign) Used immediately before or after a noun sign to mean particular or special things or persons which have already been talked about in the conversation or which contrast with something else which as already been mentioned. English = these.

thing.description: (As a Noun) A sign used as a substitute for another sign when you do not want to be more precise, when you are referring to something that has already been mentioned, or when you are going to give more details. English = thing.; (As a Noun) A physical object, rather than plants, animals, or human beings. English = thing.; (As a Noun) Your clothes or your possessions. English = things.

think%20(contemplate).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To think something over carefully before saying something; to mull something over.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about doing something. English = contemplate.; (Interactive) Used alone to signal that you are thinking something over carefully and considering what you will say or what your answer to a question will be. English = 'Let me see...', 'Um..', and so on.

think%20(feel).description: (As a Noun) An emotion or attitude. English = feeling, sensation, emotion.; (As a Noun) The way that someone thinks and reacts to events. English = feelings.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To experience an emotion or a sensation. English = feel, sense.

think%20(mull%20over).description: (As a Noun) Activity in the mind. English = thinking.; (As a Noun) The study or creation of theories about basic things such as the nature of existence or how people should live; or a particular set of such ideas. English = philosophy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about something for a long time, often before deciding what to do. English = mull over.

think%20(suspect).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To think about something on and off for a long period of time. Idiomatic English = to have an idea or thought in the back of your mind.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To think that something is likely or is probably true. English = suspect.; (Interactive) Used alone in response to being told something that you already thought or suspected was the case to mean "Oh, I thought as much!", "Oh, I suspected as much!".

thirdly.description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a phrase to mean that what you are talking about is the third of three, or the third in a series. It is often used to relate siblings in a family to each other. English = thirdly, the third is, the third-born is.

third%20(every%20third).description: (As a Noun) Each and every week which is the third week in a cycle (usually of four weeks or a month), or each and every unit of time which is the third unit in a cycle.; (As Modifier) Used in a sentence (immediately next to a verb, or at the beginning or end of the sentence) to mean that the action happens every third week or every third unit of time which has already been established (day, month, semester, year, etc.).

third%20(fraction).description: (As a Noun) One of three equal parts of an amount of something or an object. English = third.

third%20(list).description: (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a phrase to mean that what you are talking about is the third of three, or the third in a series. It is often used to relate siblings in a family to each other. English = thirdly, the third is, the third-born is.

third%20of%20the%20month.description: (As a Noun) Each and every week which is the third week in a cycle (usually of four weeks or a month), or each and every unit of time which is the third unit in a cycle.; (As Modifier) Used in a sentence (immediately next to a verb, or at the beginning or end of the sentence) to mean that the action happens every third week or every third unit of time which has already been established (day, month, semester, year, etc.).

thirteen.description: (As a Noun) The number 13, between 12 and 15. English = thirteen.

traffic.description: (As a Noun) The movement of vehicles along a road. English = traffic, flow of traffic.; (As a Noun) Multiple lanes for cars on a wide road. English = traffic lanes.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a road, to be full of moving vehicles. English = (be) busy.

thou.description: (As a Pointing Sign) A sign used to represent an archaic form of the English word 'you'. It is only used in some Christian groups and then only when talking to God. English = thou.

thousand.description: (As a Noun) The number 1,000. English = one thousand, thousand.

thrash.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To defeat someone absolutely in a game, contest, or fight. English = thrash, trounce.

three.description: (As a Noun) The number 3, between 2 and 4. English = three.

three%20more.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a sequence of things or events, the number of additional occurrences that can be expected when that number is three. English = (be) three more.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean a question about how many more things are to be expected or how many more times something will happen to mean there will be three more instances. English = 'Three more.'

thrice.description: (As Modifier) Used next to a verb to mean the action of the verb is done three times. English = thrice.

throw%20away.description: (As a Noun) A place where rubbish is left. English = dump, rubbish dump, tip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put unwanted waste matter somewhere with the intention of leaving it there for ever. English = dump.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To carelessly and quickly put or throw something (usually something unwanted) somewhere. English = throw away, dump.

throw%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To get rid of something that you do not want; to throw something out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To send something large and bulky somewhere.

throw%20up%20(vomit).description: (As a Noun) Partly digested food and drink that has come back up from someone's stomach and out through their mouth. English = vomit, sick.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of food and drink, to come back up from your stomach and out through your mouth, usually because you are ill. English = vomit, (be) sick. Idiomatic English = throw up.

throw%20(upwards).description: (General Definition) The act of throwing something upwards, or the act of releasing something so that it moves quickly or violently upwards, or anything or any action related to this in context.; (As a Noun) A sudden violent burst of energy, for example one cause by a bomb. English = explosion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a bomb, to burst loudly and with great force, often causing a lot of damage. English = explode.

thumb.description: (As a Noun) The short, thick finger on the side of your hand. English = thumb.

thumb%20tacks.description: (As a Noun) A written announcement which is put in a place, usually a wall or vertical surface, where it can be read by everyone. English = notice.; (As a Noun) Short nails with broad, fat tops, which you use for attaching papers to a wall or vertical surface. English = drawing pins, thumb tacks.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put up a written announcement, usually on a wall or vertical surface, where it can be read by everyone.

thunder.description: (General Definition) A large and heavy vibration in the air, caused by a very loud or deep noise, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially thunder.; (As a Noun) A loud noise you hear in the sky and feel in the air or even on the ground after lightning. English = thunder.

thursday.description: (As a Noun) One of the days of the week, between Wednesday and Friday. English = Thursday.

thy.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used in religious contexts when the signer is addressing God. You put it before or after a noun sign to say what belongs to God. English = thy.

ticket.description: (General Definition) The action of outlining something which is small and rectangular, or any thing or any action which is directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a ticket or a card.; (As a Noun) An official piece of paper or card which shows that you have paid for a journey or have paid to enter a place of entertainment such as a sports ground or cinema. English = ticket.; (As a Noun) A small piece of stiff paper that you write information on. English = card.

tie%20(draw).description: (As a Noun) The condition of two things being exactly alike in all respects. English = identity.; (As a Noun) In a match or competition, an equal score between two people or two teams so that nobody wins. English = draw, tie; deuce (in tennis).; (As a Noun) The result when two competitors in a race both cross the finishing line at exactly the same time. English = dead heat.

tie%20(knot).description: (As a Noun) A place in a piece of string, rope, or cloth where one end has been passed through a loop and pulled tight. You do this in order to join two things together or to keep something firmly in place. English = knot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tie a knot in a piece of string, rope, or cloth; to fasten something using a knot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fasten one thing to another, often using string or rope. English = tie, tie up.

tie%20(necktie).description: (As a Noun) A long, narrow piece of cloth that is worn around someone's neck under their shirt collar and tied in a knot at the front. It is worn mainly by men. English = tie, necktie.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put on or wear a tie.

tier.description: (As a Noun) A row or more than one row of a structure (e.g., different types of tiers such as IDgloss, grammatical class etc, appear in the ELAN annotation files for Auslan Corpus).

tie%20up.description: (As a Noun) A place in a piece of string, rope, or cloth where one end has been passed through a loop and pulled tight. You do this in order to join two things together or to keep something firmly in place. English = knot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tie a knot in a piece of string, rope, or cloth; to fasten something using a knot.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To fasten one thing to another, often using string or rope. English = tie, tie up.

tightness.description: (As a Noun) The quality of clothes and shoes fitting very closely to your body. English = tightness.; (As a Noun) The quality of chains, ropes and fasteners being held firmly in place. English = tightness.; (As a Noun) The ability to bear a painful or difficult situation calmly and patiently. English = endurance.

till%20(cash%20register).description: (As a Noun) A machine in a shop, pub, or restaurant that is used to add up and record how much money people pay, and in which the money is kept. English = cash register, till.; (As a Noun) A person customers pay money to or get money from in a shop, bank, or garage. English = cashier.; (As a Noun) A machine that is used to withdraw and deposit money from one's bank account. English = automatic teller machine, ATM.

till%20(until).description: (As Modifier) Used with an expression of time to mean an action happens up to that time and then stops. English = until, till.; (As Modifier) Used to link or join two sign sentences to mean the first action happens before the second action and then stops. English = until, till.

time%20(between%20two%20clock%20times).description: (As a Noun) A time period described with reference to two clock times.; (As Modifier) Usually used immediately next to two time signs to mean precisely between these two times.

time%20flies.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an event, to happen and finish surprisingly quickly. English = (be) quick, (be) sudden.; (Interactive) Used alone as an expression of surprise that the time has passed unexpectedly quickly and that an event or experience is finished. English = 'Wow, that was quick!', 'Over already!?', 'Finished already?', 'Time flies!', 'The time has just flown!' and so on.; (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action happens and is finished with surprising and unexpected speed. English = quickly.

time-frame.description: (As a Noun) The size or amount of time that an activity takes; the amount of time from the beginning to the end of some activity; the timetable. English: time-frame, period of time.

time%20limit.description: (General Definition) Something going up close to or hitting a large flat object, such as a wall or obstacle, or any action or any object that can be directly or indirectly associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A physical object that a person or vehicle is unable to go over, go around or pass through; or a non-physical thing (such as a law, rule or policy) that stops someone doing something. English = barrier, obstacle.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) Something that prevents two people or groups of people from agreeing, communicating, or working with each other. English = barrier, obstacle.

time%20out.description: (As a Noun) A brief time of rest during a game or a meeting. English = time out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take a brief time of rest during a game or a meeting. English = take time out.

tin%20(can).description: (General Definition) Any kind of cylindrical container or object, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a bottle or a can.; (As a Noun) A container for keeping liquids in. It is usually made of glass or plastic and is shaped like a cylinder with a narrow top. English = bottle.; (As a Noun) A metal container in which something like food, drink or paint is put. English = can, tin.

tinnitus.description: (As a Noun) A sound in one ear or both ears (such as buzzing, ringing, or whistling) which is heard by a person when there is no such noise in their environment. English = tinnitus.

tip%20(end%20point).description: (General Definition) The end point or highest point of some tall thin object, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A specific item or a particular idea or subject.; (As a Noun) The end of something that is long and thin. English = tip.

tiptoe.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To walk very quietly on your toes. English = tiptoe, creep.

tissue.description: (As a Noun) A small, square piece of soft paper that you use as a handkerchief; or a box of them. English = tissue; box of tissues.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take tissues out of box of tissues.

tissue%20box.description: (As a Noun) A small, square piece of soft paper that you use as a handkerchief; or a box of them. English = tissue; box of tissues.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take tissues out of box of tissues.

tithe.description: (As a Noun) A fixed amount of money or goods, usually one tenth of income, that people give regularly in order to support churches, priests, charities, etc. English = tithe.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a church, to charge members a fixed amount of money or goods, usually one tenth of their income, in order to support the church, its priests and charities. English = tithe.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a church member, to pay a fixed amount of money or goods, usually one tenth of their income, in order to support the church, its priests and charities; to pay a tithe.

to.description: (As Modifier) Used before or after a verb to mean the action takes place before a particular time as measured by a clock, the clock hour is already known by you and your conversational partner.; (As Modifier) Used with a time sign (a number of minutes) to mean 'the given number of minutes before the hour'.

toad.description: (As a Noun) An animal that looks like a frog but has drier skin and spends less of its life in the water. English = toad.; (As a Noun) A type of toad found in Queensland, Australia. English = cane toad.

toast.description: (As a Noun) Bread which has been cut into slices and made brown and crisp by cooking at a high temperature. English = toast.; (As a Noun) A piece of electrical equipment which you use to toast bread. English = toaster.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To cook bread at a very high temperature so that it becomes brown and crisp. English = toast.

toaster.description: (General Definition) Of two things that are flat, to go up and down in parallel with each other, or any thing or any action that can be reasonably associated with this in a given context. Without context, most signers would assume it refers to toast in a toaster.; (As a Noun) A piece of electrical equipment which you use to toast bread, especially one in which the toast pops up automatically when cooked. English = toaster.

tobacco%20(loose-leaf).description: (As a Noun) A hand-rolled cigarette. English = roll-your-own, rollie.; (As a Noun) Loose-leaf tobacco used for making roll-your-own cigarettes or for putting in pipes.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To roll your own cigarette, to hand roll a cigarette.

toe.description: (As a Noun) The five movable parts at the end of each foot. English = toes.

with.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be in the company of another person or thing in one place. English = (be) with, (be) together.; (As Modifier) Used between a verb sign and a following noun sign to mean that the action was done in the company of or by the means of that thing or person. English = with, together with.; (As Modifier) Used after a verb sign to mean that the action was done by more than one person or thing in the company of each other. English = together.

tokyo.description: (As a Noun) The capital city of Japan, called Tokyo.

tomato.description: (As a Noun) A small, soft, red fruit that you can eat raw in salads, or cooked as a vegetable or in a sauce. English = tomato.

tomato%20sauce.description: (As a Noun) A thick, cold sauce made from tomatoes. English = tomato sauce. American English = ketchup.

tom-tom%20drum.description: (As a Noun) A musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tightly over a round frame. You play it by beating it rhythmically with your hands. English = drum, tom-tom drum.; (As a Noun) A person who plays a drum. English = drummer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play a drum with your hands, to beat a drum with your hands, to play a tom-tom drum. English = drum.

tongue.description: (As a Noun) The soft part inside your mouth that you can move and use for tasting, licking, and speaking. English = tongue.

tonsils.description: (As a Noun) The two small, soft lumps in your throat at the back of your mouth. English = tonsils.; (As a Noun) An operation which removes your tonsils. English = tonsillectomy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To remove someone's tonsils, or have your tonsils removed.

too%20late.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer possible or useful to do something because the right time for doing it has passed. English = too late.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do or make something happen without enough speed so that it cannot be done properly or within the period of time that it must happen or you want it to happen. English = too slow.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that someone's actions have happened so much after the arranged or expected time that it is no longer wanted, useful or relevant. English = 'Too late!', 'Forget it! It's too late!'

too%20slow.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer possible or useful to do something because the right time for doing it has passed. English = too late.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move, do or make something happen without enough speed so that it cannot be done properly or within the period of time that it must happen or you want it to happen. English = too slow.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that someone's actions have happened so much after the arranged or expected time that it is no longer wanted, useful or relevant. English = 'Too late!', 'Forget it! It's too late!'

tooth.description: (As a Noun) The hard white objects in your mouth that you use in biting and chewing food. English = tooth (singular), teeth (plural).

toothache.description: (As a Noun) A feeling of pain in one of your teeth. English = toothache.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a toothache.

toothbrush.description: (As a Noun) A small brush with a long handle which you use for cleaning your teeth. English = toothbrush.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To brush your teeth, to clean your teeth, to clean your teeth with a toothbrush.

toothpaste.description: (As a Noun) A thick substance which you put on your toothbrush and use to clean your teeth. English = toothpaste.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put toothpaste on your toothbrush.

topicalisation.description: (As a Noun) TOPICALISATION is the process of highlighting the topic in a sentence.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving a definition in Auslan for the English term TOPICALISATION. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TOPICALISATION (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for TOPICALISATION used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

topless.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a woman, not to be wearing anything that covers her breasts. English = (be) topless.

top%20(lid).description: (As a Noun) A flat round covering to a container. English = top, cap, lid.; (As a Noun) A glass container with a cap that is used for storing food such as jam. English = jar.
