topple%20over.description: (General Definition) The action of any long vertical object becoming less perpendicular, leaning over, toppling over or collapsing, or any particular object or action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (Interactive) Used alone to tell someone that something is about to fall over and to get out of the way. English = 'Watch out!', 'Timber!'

top%20(toy).description: (General Definition) Of any two things (real or imaginary, concrete or abstract), for both to go around or circle each other, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a child's top, a blender, a spin-drier, or a cyclone.; (As a Noun) The action of turning quickly around a central point. English = spinning.; (As a Noun) A cone-shaped child's toy that can spin on its pointed end. English = top.

tortoise.description: (As a Noun) A slow-moving animal with a large, hard shell over its body. It can pull its head and legs into the shell in order to protect them. English = tortoise.; (As a Noun) A large reptile which has a thick shell covering its body and which lives in the sea most of the time. English = turtle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a tortoise (or turtle), to move.

toss%20and%20turn.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person trying to sleep, to be unable to sleep and to constantly change your position by turning and moving side to side. English = toss and turn.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person in bed, to be unable to keep still, to be restless, and to be unable to sleep because you are worried by something. English = (be) sleepless.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person on a flat surface, to roll about side to side for some reason. English = roll about.

toss%20out.description: (As a Noun) Things that you no longer want and have thrown away or plan to throw away.; (As a Noun) Something which is not accepted, especially a product because something is wrong with it. English = reject.; (As a Noun) The act of expelling a member of a school or an organisation because of bad behaviour. English = expulsion.

toss%20(salad).description: (As a Noun) A mixture of uncooked vegetables. It is usually eaten with other foods as part of a meal. English = salad.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To gently shake pieces of a salad in a container with some liquid such as a dressing in order to cover all the pieces with the liquid. English = toss a salad.

touch%20finish%20(been-there-done-that).description: (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you have been to a place or know about or have experienced something already, especially when your addressee thinks you have not. English = 'Been there, done that!'

touch%20off.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use an electronic payment or identification systems in shops, on public transport or in places with security control with a card or other thin device which has a chip inside or a bar code, or uses wifi or bluetooth technology and which touches or is brought close to another device that reads it. English = tap on/off, touch on/off.

touch%20on.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To use an electronic payment or identification systems in shops, on public transport or in places with security control with a card or other thin device which has a chip inside or a bar code, or uses wifi or bluetooth technology and which touches or is brought close to another device that reads it. English = tap on/off, touch on/off.

touch%20up.description: (General Definition) Taking something out of a small container with a small implement, such as a brush, and applying it to something, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially liquid paper or painting a car body.; (As a Noun) An opaque, usually white, liquid which you paint on errors in written or typed work in order to cover them. English = liquid paper, correction fluid.; (As a Noun) The act of painting over scratches and imperfections on an object or picture, especially the paintwork on the body of a car. English = touch up.

trip (journey).description: (As a Noun) A journey in which you visit several places. English = trip.; (As a Noun) Journeys to many places often over a long distance and often for pleasure. English = travels.; (As a Noun) A trip in which you visit several places for interest and pleasure, often lead by a guide. English = tour.

tow bar.description: (General Definition) Any kind of wheeled unpowered vehicle which is towed by a powered vehicle (car, truck or tractor), like a tailer or caravan.; (As a Noun) A special bar found at the back of a vehicle to which another vehicle (eg, trailer or caravan) is attached when towed. English = tow bar.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a vehicle, to pull another vehicle behind it. English = tow.

toward.description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb to mean that the movement of something is in the direction that brings it closer and closer to something else. English = toward, towards.

tow%20bar.description: (General Definition) Any kind of wheeled unpowered vehicle which is towed by a powered vehicle (car, truck or tractor), like a tailer or caravan.; (As a Noun) A special bar found at the back of a vehicle to which another vehicle (eg, trailer or caravan) is attached when towed. English = tow bar.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a vehicle, to pull another vehicle behind it. English = tow.

towel.description: (As a Noun) A piece of thick, soft cloth that you use to dry yourself with after a wash, bath or shower. English = towel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry yourself with a towel.

tower%20block.description: (As a Noun) The large vertical distance from the bottom to the top of a usually upright object. English = height.; (As a Noun) A very tall building in a city which is divided into flats or offices. English = tower block, skyscraper.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a very large distance from top to bottom. English = (be) tall, (be) high.

town.description: (As a Noun) A place with many streets and buildings where people live and work. English = town, village.

toxic.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) A TOXIC substance is something that is poisonous and could hurt or kill someone.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term TOXIC. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TOXIC (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for TOXIC used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

toy.description: (As a Noun) An object children play with, for example a doll or a model car. English = toy.

tracing.description: (As a Noun) A drawing of something that has been made by covering another picture with a piece of transparent paper and drawing over the lines; a picture made by moving a pencil or pen around the edges of an object. English = tracing.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To draw something by copying a picture of it by covering it with a piece of transparent paper and drawing over the lines, to move a pencil or pen around the edges of an object. English = trace.

track.description: (As a Noun) A narrow road or path, especially one that has not been deliberately built and which meanders all over the place. English = track.

zipper.description: (As a Noun) A fastener used on clothes and bags. It consists of two rows of metal or plastic teeth that you pull together in order to fasten things. English = zipper.; (As a Noun) An item of clothing worn on the torso that has a zipper such as a jacket, a windcheater, or track suit top.

trade.description: (As a Noun) The kind of work that someone does, especially when it requires special training in practical skills (eg plumbing). English = trade.; (As a Noun) A young person who works with someone in order to learn their skill. English = apprentice.; (As a Noun) A fixed period of time in which someone works with a person who has a particular skill in order to learn the skill. English = apprenticeship.

traffic%20jam.description: (As a Noun) A long line of cars and other vehicles on a road that cannot move because the road is blocked or there is too many of them. English = traffic jam.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of traffic, to move very slowly or not at all because the road is blocked or because there are too many vehicles.

traffic%20lanes.description: (As a Noun) The movement of vehicles along a road. English = traffic, flow of traffic.; (As a Noun) Multiple lanes for cars on a wide road. English = traffic lanes.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a road, to be full of moving vehicles. English = (be) busy.

traffic%20lights.description: (As a Noun) A set of red, amber, and green lights at a road junction which control the flow of traffic. The red light means stop, amber means prepare to stop or to move off, and green means go. English = traffic lights.

trailer.description: (As a Noun) A vehicle like a cart which can be loaded with things and pulled behind a car. English = trailer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To tow a trailer.

train%20(electric).description: (As a Noun) A number of carriages or trucks which are pulled by an engine along a railway line, especially one powered by overhead wires. English = train, electric-train.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go or travel by train, especially an electric train.

train%20engine.description: (As a Noun) A number of carriages or trucks which are pulled by an engine (usually steam or diesel powered) along a railway line. English = train.; (As a Noun) The steam or diesel engine that pulls the carriages of a trail along. English = train engine, locomotive.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To go or travel by train (usually steam or diesel powered).

train%20(express).description: (As a Noun) A fast train or bus which stops at very few places. English = express, express bus, express train.

practice.description: (As a Noun) Regular exercise at doing something in order to do it better, especially something physical or associated with sport. English = practice, training.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To keep doing something regularly in order to do it better, especially something physical or associated with sport. English = practise, train.

train%20(of%20gown).description: (As a Noun) A woman or a girl who helps and accompanies a bride on her wedding day. English = bridesmaid.; (As a Noun) The long part at the back of a formal dress that rests on the ground. English = train.

train%20(practise).description: (As a Noun) Regular exercise at doing something in order to do it better, especially something physical or associated with sport. English = practice, training.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To keep doing something regularly in order to do it better, especially something physical or associated with sport. English = practise, train.

train's%20gone.description: (Interactive) Used in response to someone's request for you to clarify or to repeat something because they  have joined or rejoined a conversation you are having with someone else. It is too late for them to follow because they have missed something vital. Idiomatic English = "Miss the boat"; (Interactive) You are not really prepared to repeat yourself. It is used particularly when you have just given the punch-line to a joke and someone does not understand because they were not paying full attention.

train%20(steam%20train).description: (As a Noun) A building by a railway line where a train stops to pick up passengers and goods. English = station, railway station.; (As a Noun) A train whose engine is operated using steam as a means of power. English = steam train.; (As a Noun) Clouds of water vapour being emitted by an old fashioned steam train. English = steam.

train%20(travel%20by).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go somewhere and back by train, especially an electric train; a return trip in a train.

tram.description: (As a Noun) An electric vehicle for carrying people which travels on rails in the streets of a town. English = tram.

word.description: (As a Noun) A single unit of language that can be represented in writing, sign, fingerspelling, or speech. In English, a word has a space on either side of it when it is written. A word can usually have one or more meanings. English = word.; (As a Noun) Any document with writing or printing on it. English = text, lines of text.

transfer.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something from one place to another. English = transfer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move something from one person or group of people to another. English = transfer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move to a different place or job within an organisation. English = transfer.

transgender.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Use to describe someone whose sense of personal identity and gender does not correspond with their birth sex. English = transgender.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

translation.description: (As a Noun) A piece of text in one language (said, written or signed) which is constructed as the equivalent of another text in another language. English = translation.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Noun) To have or show one's understanding of what something means and to be able to express that understanding in your own words. English = interpretation.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take something said, written or signed in one language and say, write or sign it in another language. English = translate.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

transmission%20fluid.description: (As a Noun) The liquid, usually an oil, used in the gear transmission system of a vehicle. English = transmission fluid.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TRANSMISSION FLUID for most signers (but signers can represent this visually using depicting signs in context). Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

transparent.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an object or substance, to be able to see through it. English = (be) transparent.

trash%20can.description: (As a Noun) A container in which you put rubbish. English = rubbish bin, garbage bin. American English = trash can.; (As a Noun) A small container in an office for putting waste paper in. English = waste paper basket.

travel%20to.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go and see someone and to spend time with them. English = visit.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel some distance from one place to another, especially for the purposes of seeing someone and to spend time with them.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel some distance from one place to another.

travel%20with.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To go somewhere in the company of one or more other persons or things. English = go with, go together.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move together as a group, go as a party.

traverse%20engine.description: (As a Noun) An automobile engine in which the cylinders are lined up across the width of the car rather than parallel to its length. English = traverse engine.

waiter.description: (As a Noun) A person who serves in a restaurant, bar or cafe, serving people with food and drink. English = waiter, waitress.; (As a Noun) Service provided by a person in a restaurant, bar or cafe. English = service.; (As a Noun) A flat object with raised edges which is used for carrying food or drinks. English = tray.

tread%20pattern.description: (As a Noun) The arrangement of grooves on a rubber tyre. English = tread pattern.; (Note) The Auslan sign WHEEL and a depiction of a round wide object which is circular, such as the outside of the wheel with a representation of lines or shapes over the surface of the object. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

treasurer.description: (As a Noun) In an organisation, the person in charge of its finances and keeping its accounts. English = treasurer.

treatment.description: (As a Noun) TREATMENT is medical attention given to a sick or injured person.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TREATMENT. If you know a sign for TREATMENT used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

triples.description: (As a Noun) In various games, to have three people on one team play three other people on another team. English =  triples.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something three times greater in size or number than it was. English = treble, triple.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To consist of three things or three parts. English = (be) triple.

triangle.description: (As a Noun) A flat shape or area which has three straight sides and three angles. English = triangle.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be or have the shape of a triangle. English = (be) triangular.

tribulation.description: (As a Noun) Problems or suffering. Formal English = tribulation.

trick.description: (As a Noun) The action of deceiving someone, especially as a joke, often in order to make them do something. English = trick.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To deceive someone, especially as a joke, often in order to make them do something. English = trick.

trigonometry.description: (As a Noun) The branch of mathematics dealing with the relations of the sides and angles of triangles and with the relevant functions of any angles. English = trigonometry.; (As Modifier) Used to describe anything that is related to trigonometry. English = trigonometric.

trinity.description: (As a Noun) In the Christian religion, the union of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit in one God. English = trinity.

trinomial.description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, an algebraic expression of three terms. English = trinomial.; (As Modifier) In mathematics, used to describe an algebraic expression consisting of three terms. English = trinomial (expression).

tripe.description: (As a Noun) The stomach of a pig, cow, or ox, which is eaten as food. English = tripe.

trip%20(fall).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To knock your foot against something when you are walking, and you fall over or nearly fall over. English = trip, trip over, trip on.

trip%20(journey).description: (As a Noun) A journey in which you visit several places. English = trip.; (As a Noun) Journeys to many places often over a long distance and often for pleasure. English = travels.; (As a Noun) A trip in which you visit several places for interest and pleasure, often lead by a guide. English = tour.

triple.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To become three times greater in size or number. English = triple, treble.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In mathematics, to multiply by three. English = triple.

triple%20(mathematics).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To become three times greater in size or number. English = triple, treble.; (As a Verb or Adjective) In mathematics, to multiply by three. English = triple.

trombone.description: (As a Noun) A brass musical instrument which you play by blowing into it and sliding part of it backwards and forwards to make different notes. English = trombone.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play the trombone.

trophy.description: (As a Noun) A prize, for example a silver cup or shield, that is given to the winner of a competition or race. English = trophy.; (As a Noun) A prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well. English = award.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To give or present a trophy or award to someone. English = award.

trot.description: (As a Noun) Races for trotting or pacing horses. English = trots, trotting.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a horse, to move fairly fast, lifting its feet quite highly off the ground, in a gait between a walk and a run. English = trot.

truck%20driver.description: (As a Noun) A large vehicle, such as a bus, truck, lorry, or tractor which has a large, almost horizontal, steering wheel.; (As a Noun) A large motor vehicle that carries passengers from one place to another. English = bus.; (As a Noun) A large vehicle that is used to transport goods by road. English = truck, lorry.

trumpet.description: (As a Noun) A brass musical instrument that you play by blowing into it. It has three buttons that you press to get different notes. English = trumpet.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play a trumpet.

trunk%20(body).description: (As a Noun) All the main physical parts of a person, including the head, arms and legs. English = body.; (As a Noun) A person who is dead. English = body.; (As a Noun) The main central part of your body, but not your neck, head, legs, or arms. English = trunk.

trunk%20(car).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of the boot/trunk or hood/bonnet of a car, to open or be open.

trunk%20(container).description: (As a Noun) A large, strong case or box with a lid, used for storing things or for taking them on a journey. English = trunk.

trunk%20(elephant).description: (As a Noun) A very large animal with a long trunk. They are found in Africa and India. English = elephant.; (As a Noun) The very long nose of an elephant that it uses to lift food and water. English = trunk.

trussing.description: (Note) The following signs or sign expressions are recommended for ‘trussing’. Source: DeafConnectED, Melbourne Polytechnic.; (Note) Suggested sign #1×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) Suggested sign #2×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

try%20out.description: (As a Noun) The activity of making sure that something is satisfactory, safe, or correct. English = testing, trialing.; (As a Noun) An experiment in which you test something. English = trial.; (As a Noun) Assignments, presentations, examinations and the other tasks a student must undertake as part of a course of study. English = assessment.

try%20(rugby).description: (As a Noun) A instance in which a rugby league or rugby union player scores three points by making a touchdown. English = try.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To score a try.

short sleeve shirt.description: (General Definition) To trace a line across a limb or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this.; (As a Noun) A piece of clothing worn over your arms which is attached at the shoulders to the rest of a garment and which ends before the elbow. English = short sleeve shirt.; (As a Noun) A piece of clothing that you wear on the top half of your body. It has short sleeves, no collar, and no buttons down the front. English = T-shirt.

tubal%20ligation.description: (As a Noun) A medical operation that makes it impossible for a male or female to produce or have babies. English = sterilisation.; (As a Noun) A medical operation that makes it impossible for a female to have or produce babies, for example by cutting or tying the fallopian tubes. English = tubal ligation.; (As a Noun) A medical operation on a male in which the vas deferens in the testicles are excised so as to make it impossible for him to produce babies. English = vasectomy.

tuberculosis.description: (As a Noun) TUBERCULOSIS, or "TB," is a serious infectious disease that affects the lungs.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TUBERCULOSIS. If you know a sign for TUBERCULOSIS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

tuck.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To push the loose ends of a sheet or a blanket up under the mattress of a bed. English = tuck.

tuesday.description: (As a Noun) One of the seven days of the week, after Monday and before Wednesday, called Tuesday.

tumble%20drier.description: (As a Noun) An electric machine that dries washing quickly. You put the wet clothes inside it and it turns them over slowly while blowing hot air onto them. English = drier, dryer, tumble drier, tumble dryer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry clothes in a tumble drier.

tumble%20dryer.description: (As a Noun) An electric machine that dries washing quickly. You put the wet clothes inside it and it turns them over slowly while blowing hot air onto them. English = drier, dryer, tumble drier, tumble dryer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To dry clothes in a tumble drier.

tumour.description: (As a Noun) A TUMOUR is a mass of diseased or abnormal cells that has grown in a person's or animal's body.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TUMOUR. If you know a sign for TUMOUR used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

tunic.description: (General Definition) Any piece of clothing with a square neckline, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as a square shaped neck ornament and, especially, a tunic or a bib.; (As a Noun) A piece of clothing which covers the top part of your body and reaches to your hips, thighs, or knees. English = tunic.; (As a Noun) A piece of cloth or plastic which is worn by very young children while they are eating, to protect their clothes. English = bib.

tunnel.description: (As a Noun) A long passage which has been made under the ground, usually through a hill or under the sea. English = tunnel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To travel through a tunnel.

tunnel-vision.description: (General Definition) A box-like thing near the eyes or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially tunnel-vision.; (As a Noun) A medical condition in which peripheral vision is greatly reduced. English = tunnel-vision.

turkey%20(animal).description: (As a Noun) A large bird that is kept on a farm for its meat; the meat of such a bird. English = turkey.

turn%20(alloted%20time).description: (As a Noun) The time or opportunity to do something after other people have done it or before others will do it, especially as part of a game. English = turn.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have the right, chance, or duty to do something, when other people have done it before you or will do it after you, especially in a game. English = (be) one's turn.

turn%20down.description: (General Definition) A flat surface, a quantity of something, or the top of something which is and/or becomes lower, shorter or smaller, or any thing or any object that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) The height of something which is low or small.; (As a Noun) The state of getting worse and worse in condition (especially in illness), or to become more difficult or unpleasant. English = deterioration.

turn%20down%20(decrease).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to decrease the amount of sound, light or heat being produced. English = turn down.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to stop sound, light or heat being produced. English = turn off.

turn%20left.description: (As a Noun) A left turn.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn or go left at a certain place, especially at a corner; to turn or go left.

turn%20off%20(stop).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to decrease the amount of sound, light or heat being produced. English = turn down.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to stop sound, light or heat being produced. English = turn off.

turn%20on%20(start).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn on a tap.

turn%20over.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To make something, usually a flat object, reverse its orientation so that the side that was up is now down and vice versa. English = turn, turn over.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of flat objects, to reverse orientation so that the side that was up is now down and vice versa. English = turn, turn over.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning of a sign sentence to give further information (to your partner or to your own previous statements) which is at variance to what has been said before. English = on the other hand, anyhow, in any case.

turn%20page.description: (As a Noun) One side of one of the pieces of paper in a book, magazine, or newspaper. English = page.; (As a Noun) The pieces of paper that a book, magazine, or newspaper consist of. English = page.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn over a page or the pages of a book or magazine.

turn%20right.description: (As a Noun) A right turn.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn or go right at a certain place, especially at a corner; to turn or go right.

turn%20up%20(increase).description: (As a Noun) The control on something such as a radio or heater that controls the amount of sound or heat being produced.; (As a Noun) The amount of sound that a radio, TV, record player, CD player, etc., produces. English = volume.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to increase the amount of sound or heat being produced. English = turn up.

tusks.description: (As a Noun) The pair of very long, pointed teeth of an elephant, wild boar, or walrus. English = tusks.

one to one.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a teacher, to teach only one student at a time. English = tutor.; (As Modifier) Used to describe a situation in which one person teaches, instructs or advises another person about something without other people being present. English = one to one, one on one.

tutu.description: (As a Noun) A costume worn by female ballet dancers which has a very short stiff skirt that sticks out from the waist and is made from many layers of material. English = tutu.

tv%20journalist.description: (As a Noun) [Usually made with mouth movement] a device for making sounds louder, especially a person's voice, or to record them on a tape recorder. English = microphone.; (As a Noun) A person whose job involves using a microphone to announce things or to record news for radio or television. English = announcer, radio journalist, television journalist.; (As a Noun) An amplified message played at a public place, such as a railway station, airport, shopping centre. English = announcement.

twitter.description: (As a Noun) A website where people can post short messages about their current activities. English = twitter.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To post a message on Twitter. English = tweet.

twice.description: (As Modifier) Used to describe something which happens two times. English = twice.

twiddle%20thumbs.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move your thumbs around each other while your fingers are linked together because you are bored or because you have nothing else to do. Idiomatic English = twiddle your thumbs.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you are bored by something or tired of waiting and that you want this to end or that you want to be given something to do.

twin.description: (As a Noun) One of two people who have the same mother and were born at the same time. English = twin.; (As a Noun) Two people who have the same mother and were born at the same time. English = twins.

twins%20(identical).description: (As a Noun) One of two people who have the same mother and were born at the same time. English = twin.; (As a Noun) Two people who have the same mother and were born at the same time. English = twins.

two.description: (As a Noun) The number 2, between 1 and 3. English = two.

two%20more.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a sequence of things or events, the number of additional occurrences that can be expected when that number is two. English = (be) two more.

two-up.description: (As a Noun) A gambling game in which two coins are thrown into the air and people bet on whether they fall heads or tails. English = two-up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play two-up.

typewriter.description: (As a Noun) A machine that you use to write things in print. It has a series of keys that you press in order to write the letters, numbers, or other characters on the paper. English = typewriter.; (As a Noun) Someone whose job is typing, usually in an office. English = typist.; (As a Noun) A room or a part of a building where people work sitting at desks. English = office.

type%20(sort).description: (As a Noun) Your ability to recognise things when you touch them with your tongue. English = taste.; (As a Noun) The special sensation something has on your tongue when you eat it or when you simply touch it with you tongue, for example whether it is sweet or salty. English = taste,  flavour.; (As a Noun) A class of things which you find interesting, attractive or which you like better than others. English = taste, preference.

type%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To produce a typed form of your ideas, notes, or handwritten text. English = type up.

wheel.description: (General Definition) A single large round circular object (or a pair of large round circular objects) such as a wheel, or the outside surfaces of such objects, such as the rim of a wheel, or a tyre that goes around the outside of a wheel.; (As a Noun) A circular object which turns round on a rod attached to its centre. It is fixed underneath things such as cars, bicycles, and trains, so that they can move along. English = wheel.; (As a Noun) A thick ring of rubber which is fitted round each wheel of a vehicle such as a car or bicycle, and which is usually filled with air. English = tyre.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

tyre%20placard.description: (As a Noun) A label on a vehicle that provides information about the tyres including the size and recommended air pressure. English = tyre placard.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for TYRE PLACARD for most signers (but  signers can represent this visually using depicting signs in context). Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

tyre%20pressure.description: (As a Noun) A measure of the amount of air in a tyre and therefore of how firm the tyre is. English = tyre pressure.; (Note) The sign TYRE followed by a depiction of a two round objects and a connector, then the sign GAUGE. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

tyre%20profile.description: (As a Noun) Information about a tyre, such as the relative height of a tyre when compared to the width of the tyre. English = tyre profile.

u.description: (As a Noun) The letter U in the one-handed alphabets.

ufo.description: (As a Noun) An object seen in the sky or landing on earth which cannot be identified and which some people believe to be a spaceship from another planet. English = UFO, unidentified flying object.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a UFO, to move in the sky.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a flying object, to look like a UFO.

ugliness.description: (As a Noun) The state of being very unattractive and unpleasant to look at. English = ugliness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a person or thing, to be very unattractive and unpleasant to look at. English = (be) ugly.

ultimate%20(final).description: (As a Noun) The last part of a period of time, an event, or a text (such as a piece of writing, a film, etc.). English = end, conclusion, finish.; (As a Noun) The last thing in a series of things, especially the last in the order of siblings in a family.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To come to the last part of a period of time, an event, or a text (such as a piece of writing, a film, etc.). English = end, conclude, finish.

ultrasound%20scan.description: (As a Noun) A machine that emits ultra high frequency sounds that humans cannot hear. The machine uses an analysis of the echoes to form an image, picture, or scan, of the inside of your body, especially your stomach. English = ultrasound scan.

umbrella.description: (As a Noun) An object which you carry to protect yourself from the rain. It consists of a long stick with a folding frame covered in cloth. English = umbrella.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To open or use an umbrella.

well (palm up gesture).description: (Interactive) Used alone when you mean what you are about to say is easily understood or easy for anyone to agree with given the context, or that it is easy to understand or agree with what the person you have been talking to has said given the context. English = 'Well...', 'Well, there you are...', 'Well, there you go...', 'That's all there is to it...', 'That's it...', 'Yeah...', 'Yep...', 'Yep, of course...', and so on.; (Interactive) Used alone when you are hesitating, usually because you have not decided what to say next. It also means you don't mind if the person you are talking to interrupts or takes over. English = 'Well...', 'Umm...', 'Err...', and so on.; (As Question) Used alone as general question sign to suggest that one or more questions (who, what, where, why, how, or when) could be asked about what has just been said by either the signer or the addressee, depending on the context. For example, “Who would do such a thing...?”, “Why would anyone do that...?”, “Where’s that...?”, “How exactly did that happen...?’, and so on.

unbuckle.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To take off or unbuckle a belt.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take off or unbuckle a seat belt.

ongoing.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that lasts for ever or for a very long time, especially without changing. English = (be) permanent, (be) unchanging, (be) constant, (be) ongoing.

uncle.description: (As a Noun) The brother of your mother or father, or the husband of your aunt. English = uncle.

underside.description: (As a Noun) The part of something that normally faces towards the ground. English = underside.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be located directly below or beneath something. English = (be) under, (be) underneath.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move so that you are located directly below or beneath something. English = go under.

foundation.description: (General Definition) An area or a flat extended object located below a flat object or level area, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a foundation.; (As a Noun) The basic idea, attitude, or experience on which a belief or way of life is built. English = foundation.; (As a Noun) The layers of bricks or concrete below the ground that a building or other structure is built on. English = foundation.

underwear.description: (As a Noun) A piece of clothing you wear under your clothes. It has two holes to put your legs through and elastic around the top. English = briefs; underpants (usually men and boys); panties or knickers (usually women and girls).; (As a Noun) Clothing you wear under your clothes. English = underwear.

upset.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a slight illness in your stomach caused by an infection, or by something you have eaten. English = (be) upset, (be) queasy.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be unhappy or disappointed because something unpleasant has happened to you. English = (be) upset,  (be) uneasy.

unemployment.description: (As a Noun) A lack of jobs in a society or economy which means some people have no job at all. English = unemployment.; (As a Noun) The number of people in a society or economy who are out of work. English = unemployment.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be without a job, to have no job. English = (be) unemployed.

wait (long time).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To spend a long time, usually doing very little, before something happens. English = wait (a long time).; (As a Verb or Adjective) For nothing to happen for a long time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a period of time, to have nothing interesting happen. English = (be) uneventful.

show up.description: (As a Noun) Something that happens unexpectedly or without warning.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To happen suddenly or as a surprise. English = (be) unexpected.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To appear in a place unexpectedly or to attend an event unexpectedly or without having been invited. Idiomatic English = show up, pop up.

do (do not).description: (As Modifier) Used immediately next to a verb or adjective to mean the action or the quality does not happen or exist at the time specified or understood. English = not, don't, doesn't, didn't.

unfold.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To unbend a piece of paper or cloth so that it becomes flat again and with one part of it no longer covering another part. English = unfold.

unhappiness.description: (As a Noun) The expression you have when you are unhappy, displeased, or being unfriendly by turning down the corners of your mouth.; (As a Noun) The feeling of displeasure you have when something unwanted or unwelcome has happened. English = unhappiness.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To show that you are unhappy, displeased, or being unfriendly by turning down the corners of your mouth.

uniform.description: (As a Noun) A special set of clothes which some people, for example soldiers or the police, wear at work, and which some children wear at school. English = uniform.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be dressed up in or wearing a uniform.

unimportant.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be not very important, valuable or necessary. English = (be) unimportant, (be) trivial, (be) insignificant.

unit.description: (As a Noun) A number of people or things which are together in one place at one time; a set of people or things which have something in common. English = group.; (As a Noun) A group of pupils or students who are taught together. English = class.; (As a Noun) A set of people or things which have something in common or have similar characteristics. English = class, group.

united%20states%20of%20america%20(usa).description: (As a Noun) A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico. English = the United States of America (USA), America.; (As a Noun) A person who come from the United States of America. English = American.; (As a Verb or Adjective) 2. To belong, relate to or come from the United States of America. English = (be) American.

unit%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the digit before the decimal point in decimal notation, representing an integer less than ten. English = unit.

good (no good).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no good, or to be unsatisfactory.; (Interactive) Used alone to mean that you think something is not good at all and is unacceptable as it is. English = 'That's no good!', 'That's not good enough!'

until.description: (As Modifier) Used with an expression of time to mean an action happens up to that time and then stops. English = until, till.; (As Modifier) Used to link or join two sign sentences to mean the first action happens before the second action and then stops. English = until, till.

unzip.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To unfasten an item of clothing using a zipper. English = unzip.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To take off an item of clothing worn on the torso that has a zip up front such as a jacket, a windcheater, or a track suit top.

upholstery.description: (As a Noun) The soft covering on chairs and sofas that makes them more comfortable to sit on. English = upholstery.; (As a Noun) A person who makes, finishes, or repairs the soft coverings of chairs, couches, sofas, and so on. English = upholsterer.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make, finish or repair the soft covering of a chair, couch, or sofa. English = upholster.

upside%20down.description: (As a Noun) Something that is in a very untidy state. English = mess.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be untidy or disorganised. English = (be) messy, (be) in a mess.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be in a confused or disorganised state. Informal English = (be) topsy-turvy.

upward.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To move from a lower position to a higher position. English = go upward, go up, rise.

urethra.description: (As a Noun) The URETHRA is the thin tube that urine passes through to leave the body.  In men, both urine and semen pass through the URETHRA to leave the body.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for URETHRA. If you know a sign for URETHRA used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

urinate.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a woman, to get rid of urine from your body. Formal English = urinate. Vulgar English = piss.

we.description: (As a Pointing Sign) Used to refer to the signer and one or more other people as a group. English = we, us.; (Note) Used immediately next to a verb it means the signer and the others do the action or that the action happens to the signer and the others (i.e., some other person or thing does the action). The interpretation depends on a number of factors, such as the type of verb and the number of other people or things talked about in the sentence or which are relevant in the context.

use.description: (As a Noun) The purpose for which a thing is normally made, or the purpose to which a thing is normally put. English = use.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something with an object in order to do a job or to achieve something. English = use.

used%20to.description: (As a Noun) The condition of two things being exactly alike in all respects. English = identity.; (As a Noun) In a match or competition, an equal score between two people or two teams so that nobody wins. English = draw, tie; deuce (in tennis).; (As a Noun) The result when two competitors in a race both cross the finishing line at exactly the same time. English = dead heat.

useless.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no good for anything, not right for its supposed purpose, not successful. English = (be) useless, (be) hopeless.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be no longer good for its purpose because something is too old and broken, or used too much and no longer efficient or working. English = worn out.

use%20up.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To remove the contents from a container; of a container, to have nothing in it. English = empty; (be) empty.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an amount of something, especially money, to become less and less until there is none left. English = exhaust, use up, dispose of.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To completely remove the information and data on a computer disk. English = erase, reformat, initialise a computer disk.

usher's%20syndrome.description: (As a Noun) A congenital condition in which a person with deafness (which may get worse and worse) also loses their sight (which may lead to total blindness). English = Usher's Syndrome.

uterus.description: (As a Noun) The part inside a woman's body where a baby grows before it is born. English = uterus.; (Note) This sign was created in 1979 for use in Australasian Signed English and it does not appear to be a commonly accepted Auslan sign, nor is it widely used. However, some deaf people and interpreters do appear to use this sign. Please supply feedback on this site on your experience of the use of this sign.

v.description: (As a Noun) The letter V in the two-handed manual alphabet.

v8%20engine.description: (As a Noun) A reciprocating engine in which the eight cylinders are in a V formation. English = V8 engine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an engine, having a reciprocating engine whose eight cylinders are in a V formation. English = (be) V8.

vacant%20(available).description: (As a Noun) The state of being free to be used or obtained. English = availability.; (As a Noun) A job that is not being done by anyone and which people can apply for; a room at a hotel or guest house that is not occupied and is available for people to stay in. English = vacancy.; (As a Noun) Of a person, the state of not being busy so that you can do something or meet someone. English = availability.

vacant%20(empty).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To not be aware of something or conscious of what is happening around you. English = (be) oblivious, (be) unaware.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have no knowledge, understanding or ability. English = (be) clueless.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have a look or expression which suggests that you do not understand something or that you are not very intelligent. English = (be) vacant, have a vacant look.

valley.description: (As a Noun) A long, narrow area of land between hills, especially one that has a river flowing through it. English = valley.

worth.description: (As a Noun) The amount of importance or usefulness of some thing or action to people. The importance or usefulness may be personal, practical, spiritual, moral, material, or monetary. English = worth, value.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of an action or thing, to have an amount of importance or usefulness to people. English = (be) worthwhile, (be) valuable.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Used immediately before a noun or a sign for an amount of money to mean that what is being talked about can be thought of as equivalent or exchangeable for that thing or that amount of money. English = (be) worth, (be) valued at.

value%20(mathematics).description: (As a Noun) In mathematics, the numerical amount denoted by an algebraic term; a magnitude, quantity, or number. English = value.

vampire.description: (As a Noun) In legends and horror stories, people who come out of their graves at night and suck the blood of living people. English = vampire.

vanish%20(into%20distance).description: (As a Noun) The disappearance of something, especially into the distance.; (As a Noun) The disappearance of a person from a place which is quick, unnoticed by others, or made without saying goodbye.; (As a Noun) The movement of a vehicle at high speed away into the distance.

variation.description: (As a Noun) In linguistics, an feature or item of language which has various forms (variants). The different forms of the variable may be related to differences in sociolinguistic variation in signed vocabulary and grammar. English = variant.; (As a Noun) In mathematics, a quantity which during a calculation is assumed to vary or be capable of varying in value. English = variable.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be likely to change at any time. English = (be) variable.

vase.description: (As a Noun) A jar, usually made of glass or pottery which is used for holding cut flowers or as an ornament. English = vase.

vegan.description: (As a Noun) A VEGAN is a person who does not use animal products for food, clothing or any other purpose.; (As a Verb or Adjective) A food or other product that does not contain animal products such as eggs, honey or dairy is VEGAN.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English keyword VEGAN. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for VEGAN (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for VEGAN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

vegemite.description: (As a Noun) The trademark of a dark salty spread, usually eaten at breakfast on toast, which is made from yeast and which is very popular in Australia, especially with children, called Vegemite.

vegetables.description: (As a Noun) Plants such as cabbages, potatoes, and onions which you can cook and eat. English = vegetables. Informal English = veg, vegie.

vegetarian.description: (As a Noun) A person who does not eat meat or fish. English = vegetarian.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be a person who does not eat meat or fish. English = (be) vegetarian.

vehicle%20exterior.description: (As a Noun) The outside parts of a vehicle including the painted body, trim, windows and wheels. English = vehicle exterior.; (Note) A combination of the Auslan sign CAR, two hands depicting the outer cover of an object, and the sign BODY.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for VEHICLE EXTERIOR for most signers (but some signers represent this visually using these depicting signs, once they have established the topic).  If you know a sign for VEHICLE EXTERIOR used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf

veil.description: (General Definition) An obstruction in front of the face with space enough to peer through, such as a slit in a wall or the space between two planks, or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, especially Muslims or a veil.; (As a Noun) A piece of thin, soft material that women sometimes wear over their heads, especially in Muslim cultures. English = veil.; (As a Noun) A person who believes in Islam and lives according to its rules. English = Muslim, Moslem.

vein.description: (As a Noun) VEINS are the thin tubes in your body through which your blood flows towards your heart.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for VEIN. If you know a sign for VEIN used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

velocity.description: (As a Noun) The speed with which something moves in a particular direction. Technical English = velocity.

vending%20machine.description: (General Definition) The action of inserting something small into a space or slot, such as a coin into a pay phone or into  a machine in a laundromat, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, especially a vending machine.; (As a Noun) A machine from which you can get things such as cigarettes, chocolate, or coffee by putting in money and pressing a button. English = vending machine.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To insert a coin into a slot on a vending machine, pay phone, etc.

venetian%20blind.description: (As a Noun) A window covering made of thin horizontal strips of wood, plastic, or metal. The strips can be turned to a different angle in order to let in more or less light. English = Venetian blind.; (As a Noun) A door or window with flat, sloping pieces of wood or glass across its frame. English = louvred window, louvres, louvred door.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of louvres on a window, to be adjusted.

ventilate.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) VENTILATE means to allow fresh air to move around in a building, for example, by using fans to move air from one area to another.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English key word VENTILATE. There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for VENTILATE (but some signers represent this visually using depicting signs, once they have established the topic). If you know a sign for VENTILATE used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

verandah.description: (General Definition) Anything of this general shape (a tick or wide rectangular shape on a horizontal plane), or any thing or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, such as a barrier, wall or moat, and especially a verandah.; (As a Noun) A platform along the outside walls of a house with a roof supported by pillars. English = verandah.

verb.description: (As a Noun) In grammar, a type of word which is concerned with what people and things do, and what happens to them. English = verb.; (Note) The signer in the video is giving an Auslan explanation of the English term VERB as it is used in an educational or academic context, especially when talking or writing about language and grammar. If you know a sign for VERB used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "Report missing sign and supply details. Thank you.

verse.description: (As a Noun) One of the parts of which a poem, song, or a chapter of the Bible is divided into. English = verse.

vertical%20blinds.description: (As a Noun) A blind which is made up of numerous vertical strips and which is opened and closed by turning these strips. English = vertical blinds.

vet%20(vocational%20education%20and%20tr.description: (Note) In education, the Vocational Education and Training sector is responsible for developing skills and knowledge of people in the workplace. Training and development can happen in formal environments like schools and training organisations, or through less formal learning in the workplace. Formal training usually leads to the person receiving a qualification.

vibration.description: (As a Noun) A slight, quick shaking movement, especially one you can feel in the ground or with your entire body. English = vibration.; (As a Noun) An alarm clock that vibrates instead of or as well as ringing. It is used by deaf and hearing impaired people.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To shake with a slight, quick movement, especially one you can feel in the ground or with your entire body. English = vibrate, shake.

video.description: (As a Noun) A machine which can be used to play video tapes on a television set and to record television programs on videotape. English = video, video cassette recorder, video machine.; (As a Noun) A film or television program recorded on video tape for people to watch on a television set. English = video.; (As a Noun) A cassette containing a video tape. English = video, video cassette.

video%20call.description: (As a Noun) A way of communicating with people through the internet using on-line video as well as sound. The people talking or signing to each other can see each other on a computer screen. English = video call.; (As a Noun) A computer program that allows you to call someone and communicate via sound and video, or by video alone, through the internet. Brand name: Skype.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

video%20camera.description: (As a Noun) A camera that records onto video tape. English = video camera.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make a video recording using a video camera; to shoot a video using a video camera.

video%20conference.description: (As a Noun) A conference in which several people who are a long way from each other are able to talk to each other using audio and video equipment. English = video conference.

vietnam.description: (As a Noun) A country in South East Asia, between Thailand and China. English = Vietnam.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To come from or relate to Vietnam. English = Vietnamese.

vinegar.description: (As a Noun) A sharp-tasting liquid, usually made from sour wine or malt, which is used in making things such as salad dressing. English = vinegar.

virgin.description: (As a Noun) Someone who has never had sex. English = virgin.; (As a Noun) A constellation and a star sign of the Zodiac (the Virgin). English = Virgo.

virus.description: (As a Noun) A VIRUS is a kind of germ that can cause disease.; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for VIRUS. If you know a sign for VIRUS used by you or other Auslan users (deaf people or interpreters) please go to "report missing sign" and supply details. Thank you.

stamp (mark).description: (As a Noun) A small block of wood, metal or plastic with a handle, which has a pattern or a group of letters on one side. You press it into an inky pad and then onto a piece of paper in order to produce a mark. English = stamp.; (As a Noun) The mark left on a piece of paper by a stamp; an official mark left on a document to show that it is legal or genuine. English = stamp; seal.; (As a Noun) A stamp, usually made in wax, that marks and closes a container or a letter that must be broken before it can be opened. English = seal.

visual%20display%20unit%20(vdu).description: (As a Noun) The vertical surface of a computer on which information and pictures are displayed. English = visual display screen, display screen, visual display unit (VDU), computer screen, monitor.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To display information or pictures on a computer screen.

vital%20(important).description: (As a Noun) The quality of being important, necessary or significant in a particular situation. English = importance.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be very significant, valuable, or necessary. English = (be) important, (be) vital.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of something, to be more important or better than other things of its kind. English = (be) special, (be) exceptional, (be) outstanding.

v-neck.description: (As a Noun) The neck on a pullover, dress, shirt, etc.,  that is inn the shape of the letter V. English = V-neck.; (As a Noun) A piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body. It has a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front. English = shirt.

voice.description: (As a Noun) What you hear when someone speaks. English = voice.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To use your voice to make a sound, especially the sounds of a spoken language.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To say in the words of spoken English what someone who is signing is saying, especially when the style of signing is very close to English and requires little or no real translation. English = vocalize.

voiceless.description: (As a Noun) Communication in sign language which is not accompanied by any voicing at all.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To deliberately not use your voice at all when you are communicating to someone (ie, to use sign language only).; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have or use no voice at all, to be voiceless, to be mute.

volleyball.description: (As a Noun) A game played in which two teams hit a large ball with their hands, backwards and forwards over a high net. If you allow the ball to touch the ground within the court, your team loses a point. English = volleyball.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To play volleyball.

volume.description: (As a Noun) The amount of space that something occupies or that something contains. English = volume.

volume%20(sound).description: (As a Noun) The control on something such as a radio or heater that controls the amount of sound or heat being produced.; (As a Noun) The amount of sound that a radio, TV, record player, CD player, etc., produces. English = volume.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To adjust the controls on something such as a radio, lamp or heater so as to increase the amount of sound or heat being produced. English = turn up.

w.description: (As a Noun) The letter W in one-handed manual alphabets.

waardenburg-syndrome.description: (As a Noun) An inherited disorder often characterised by varying degrees of hearing loss and changes in skin and hair pigmentation, e.g.,  two differently coloured eyes and/or distinctive hair colouring, such as a patch of white hair or premature grey hair. English = Waardenburg-Syndrome.; (Note) This sign uses the letters W and S from the one-handed alphabet.

waffle-iron.description: (As a Noun) A metal device with two hinged parts which you can open and between which you can bake a waffle, or toast a sandwich. English = waffle-iron, waffle-maker.

wage%20(bet).description: (As a Noun) An offer to pay a particular amount of money for something, especially at an auction. English = bid.; (As a Noun) An amount of money you agree to give on the chance of a future event happening (like a horse winning a race). English = bet, wager; (As a Verb or Adjective) To offer to pay a particular amount of money for something, especially at an auction. English = bid.

wage%20cut.description: (General Definition) A quantity of something, or the top of something which is, and/or becomes, lower, shorter or smaller relative to the reference point of the other hand, or any thing or any object that can be associated with this in context.; (As a Noun) A lowering in the number, level, or amount of something. English = reduction, decrease, depletion.; (As a Noun) A decrease in the value of something over time. English = depreciation.

wage%20(income).description: (As a Noun) The money that you earn or that you get from other sources such as investments or pensions. English = income, earnings, interest.; (As a Noun) The money that is regularly paid to you for working, especially for manual or unskilled work. English = wage, pay.; (As a Noun) The money that you are paid each month for your job, especially when you have a professional job. English = salary.

wail%20(siren).description: (As a Noun) A warning device which consists of a rapidly rotating and flashing light (usually red) attached inside buildings onto ceilings or walls, or on the top of emergency vehicles (fire, police, etc). It lights and spins when there is an alarm. English = visual alarm.; (As a Noun) A warning device which consists of a rapidly rotating and flashing light (usually red) and a long, loud, wailing noise. It is usually located on the top of emergency vehicles (fire, police, etc). English = siren.; (As a Noun) A warning device that makes a long, loud, wailing noise when there is an alarm. English = siren.

waist.description: (As a Noun) The narrow part of your body above your hips. English = waist.

wait.description: (General Definition) To walk around in circles. or anything or any action directly or indirectly associated with this, e.g., wait.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To do something uninteresting or unimportant while you are waiting for something else to happen. English = wait, pace about. Idiomatic English = to mark time, to hang about, to kill time.

wait%20(long%20time).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To spend a long time, usually doing very little, before something happens. English = wait (a long time).; (As a Verb or Adjective) For nothing to happen for a long time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) Of a period of time, to have nothing interesting happen. English = (be) uneventful.

wales.description: (As a Noun) A country on the west coast of Great Britain. English = Wales.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To come from or relate to Wales. English = (be) Welsh.

walk%20(animal).description: (General Definition) The feet of an animal or the action of stepping forward using these feet, or any thing, any animal or any action that can be easily associated with this in a given context, especially a tiger.; (As a Noun) The foot or feet of an animal having claws and pads. English = paw, paws.; (As a Noun) A large, fierce animal that belongs to the cat family. They are orange-coloured with black stripes. English = tiger.

walk%20out.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place, especially a room, suddenly and quickly because you do not want to be there any longer. English = get out.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To leave a place where you are normally obliged to stay because of responsibilities (eg work or home) without regard to the consequences or without permission. You would do this because you are angry, irritated or irresponsible.; (As a Verb or Adjective) English = walk out. Informal English = nick off, bugger off.

wallet.description: (As a Noun) A small flat case made of leather or plastic, which is used for keeping paper money in and other small things such as credit cards. English = wallet.

wand.description: (As a Noun) A long thin rod that magicians wave when they are performing tricks and magic. In children's stories, fairies also use one when doing magic. English = wand.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wave a wand as part of performing magic.

want.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel a strong desire or need to have something. English = want.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To very strongly feel a desire to have something for yourself, especially something that currently belongs to someone else. Formal English = covet.

want%20(not%20want).description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To feel little or no desire to have something or feel little or no need for something. English = not want.

waratah.description: (As a Noun) A Roman Catholic school for the deaf at Waratah in the Australian state of New South Wales, called the Rosary Convent School.; (As a Noun) A town near Newcastle, in New South Wales, called Waratah.

wardrobe.description: (As a Noun) A tall cupboard in which you can hang your clothes. English = wardrobe.

warmth.description: (As a Noun) The moderate amount of heat that something has, for example enough heat to make you feel comfortable. English = warmth.; (As a Noun) The ability of clothes or blankets to protect you from the cold. English = warmth.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To have some heat, but not enough to be hot. English = (be) warm.

wash%20face.description: (As a Noun) A small cloth used for washing yourself. English = flannel, face flannel, face cloth, face washer.; (As a Noun) A small towel used for drying your hands and your face. English = hand towel.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wash your face, to freshen up.

wash%20hair.description: (As a Noun) The act of washing your hair.; (As a Noun) A soapy liquid you use for washing your hair. English = shampoo.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wash your hair.

wash%20hands.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To clean your hands by rubbing them together with water and soap; to wash your hands.

washing%20machine.description: (As a Noun) A machine which you can wash clothes in. English = washing machine.

washing%20up.description: (As a Noun) The washing of plates, knives, forks,  and other things after a meal. English = washing up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wash plates, knives, forks, and other things after a meal. English = wash up, do the dishes.

wash%20up.description: (As a Noun) The washing of plates, knives, forks,  and other things after a meal. English = washing up.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To wash plates, knives, forks, and other things after a meal. English = wash up, do the dishes.

wastepaper%20basket.description: (As a Noun) A container in which you put rubbish. English = rubbish bin, garbage bin. American English = trash can.; (As a Noun) A small container in an office for putting waste paper in. English = waste paper basket.

waste%20(rubbish).description: (As a Noun) Unwanted things. English = rubbish.; (As a Noun) Unwanted things, especially food from a kitchen. English = garbage, waste.

watch%20(look).description: (As a Noun) The act of turning your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, regard.; (As a Noun) A period of time during which you look at something and pay attention to what is happening. English = observation.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To turn your eyes in a particular direction so that you can see what is there. English = look, look at.

watch%20over.description: (As a Noun) A person whose job it is to watch and protect a place, person, or object. English = guard, bodyguard.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make sure a person or number of people behave correctly by watching them. English = supervise, guard, watch over. Idiomatic English = keep a close eye on.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video

watch-the-time.description: (As a Verb or Adjective) To keep an eye on the time, to keep an eye on the time.

watch%20(wristwatch).description: (As a Noun) A small clock that you wear on a strap on your wrist. English = watch, wristwatch.; (As a Noun) A specific point in time which can be stated in hours and minutes and is shown on clocks and watches. English = time.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To measure the amount of time that something takes to happen. English = time.

water%20(hose).description: (General Definition) The action of holding something of small size and moving it side-to-side or up-and-down, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, such as using a hose, or a cane.; (As a Noun) (When used for the first time in a conversation and you want or need to be more precise, this sign is usually preceded or followed by the sign for WATER.) A long, flexible pipe made of rubber or plastic, along which water is carried. English = hose.; (As a Noun) (When used for the first time in a conversation and you want or need to be more precise, this sign is usually preceded or followed by the sign for WATER or GARDEN.) The action of using a hose to spread water all over a garden or lawn. English = watering, hosing.

watering%20(garden).description: (General Definition) The action of holding something of small size and moving it side-to-side or up-and-down, or any action or any thing directly or indirectly associated with this, such as using a hose, or a cane.; (As a Noun) (When used for the first time in a conversation and you want or need to be more precise, this sign is usually preceded or followed by the sign for WATER.) A long, flexible pipe made of rubber or plastic, along which water is carried. English = hose.; (As a Noun) (When used for the first time in a conversation and you want or need to be more precise, this sign is usually preceded or followed by the sign for WATER or GARDEN.) The action of using a hose to spread water all over a garden or lawn. English = watering, hosing.

water-polo.description: (As a Noun) A water game played by two teams, each having seven members, in which the aim is to carry or pass the ball over the other team's goal line. English = water-polo.

water%20pump.description: (As a Noun) In a vehicle, the part that moves water around the engine in order to keep it at the right temperature. English = water pump.; (Note) The Auslan sign WATER and a depiction of something being pushed out from a circular object. Source of this recommended sign: Victorian College for the Deaf.

wave%20hand.description: (As a Noun) A movement of the hand up and down, or a closing and opening of the hand at the knuckles, as a gesture of greeting or leave-taking. English = wave.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To move your hand in acknowledgment of someone when you meet them, or as a parting gesture when they (or you) are leaving. English = wave.; (Interactive) Used alone as an acknowledgment when meeting someone or, more often, when leaving. English =  'Good bye', 'Bye.' Formal English = 'Farewell'.

wave%20(water).description: (General Definition) Any surface that moves up and down gently or is gently curving in one or more directions, particularly used to refer to water (waves, wavy) or land (hills, hilly), or any thing or any action that can be associated with this in a given context.; (As a Noun) The large area of salty water that covers about three-quarters of the earths surface. English = sea.; (As a Noun) A large area of salty water. English = sea, ocean.

way%20(either%20way).description: (Interactive) Used in response to a suggestion to do something in two different ways or a question about which of two ways of doing something to mean one is just as good as the other. English = either way.; (As Modifier) Used to modify a verb, especially a verb of movement, to say it could go in one of two possible directions or ways. English = either way, left or right, this way or that way.

way%20out%20(exit).description: (As a Noun) The act of leaving or going out of or from a confined space (such as a room or a building). English = exit, departure.; (As a Noun) A door in a public building through which you can leave; the path you follow to get out of a building or group of buildings. English = exit, way out.; (As a Noun) A person who has escaped from a prison. English = escapee.

wear%20off.description: (As a Noun) The damage that is caused to something during normal or prolonged use. English = wear and tear; (As a Noun) The state of being so tired that you have no energy left. English = exhaustion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become thinner or weaker because something is constantly being used over a long period of time. English = wear out.

wear%20out.description: (As a Noun) The damage that is caused to something during normal or prolonged use. English = wear and tear; (As a Noun) The state of being so tired that you have no energy left. English = exhaustion.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To become thinner or weaker because something is constantly being used over a long period of time. English = wear out.

weather%20strip.description: (As a Noun) A support for the glass in a window that goes around the edge of the window. English = window frame.; (As a Noun) In a vehicle, a strip of rubber that seals the edge of a door or window against the rain and wind . English = weather strip.×To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser thatsupports HTML5 video; (Note) There appears to be no commonly used Auslan sign for WEATHER STRIP for most signers (but signers can represent this visually using depicting signs in context). This recommended expression is a compound of the signs WINDOW + FRAME. Source: Victorian College for the Deaf.

weave.description: (As a Noun) The way in which the threads are arranged in a cloth and the pattern they form. English = weave.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To make cloth by crossing threads over and under each other using a machine called a loom. English = weave.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To be something that is made by weaving threads over and under each other. English = (be) woven.

wedding.description: (As a Noun) A marriage ceremony. English = wedding.

wedding%20ring.description: (As a Noun) A hard, bright, precious stone that consists of pure carbon. It is used especially in jewellery and rings. English = diamond.; (As a Noun) A small circle of metal that you wear on your finger as an ornament or to show that you are engaged or married. It often has a diamond in it. English = ring, diamond ring, engagement ring, wedding ring.

week.description: (As a Noun) A period of seven days, beginning on a Sunday and ending on a Saturday. English = week.; (As a Noun) The day of the working week which is after Tuesday and before Thursday. English = Wednesday.

weed%20(marijuana).description: (As a Noun) A type of drug which is smoked in cigarettes and which is illegal in most countries. English = marijuana. Informal English = pot, grass, weed, dope.; (As a Noun) A cigarette made of marijuana. Informal English = joint.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To put a marijuana cigarette in your mouth, suck the smoke into your lungs and blow it out again. English = smoke marijuana, smoke a marijuana cigarette. Informal English = smoke dope, smoke pot, smoke a joint.

weekend.description: (As a Noun) A period of two days that includes Saturday and Sunday, when most people do not work. English = weekend.; (As a Verb or Adjective) To spend the weekend somewhere. English = weekend.

week%20(last%20week).description: (As a Noun) The calendar week before the week of speaking. English = last week, one week ago.; (As a Noun) The calendar week before an already specified week in the past. English = the week before that, the previous week.; (As Modifier) Used at the beginning or end of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean the action took place the week before the week of speaking. English = last week, one week ago.

week%20(next%20week).description: (As a Noun) The next calendar week after the week of speaking.
